Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Night Before Flight”
Reviews.Author: travelingwithmike
Reviews.Content: I spent the night at the citizenM before jumping on an 8:00 am international flight. I would choose the citizenM over the nearby Sheraton because it's far cheaper, more modern and has a better vibe for what that's worth. Pros - Very clean - Fun interior design - Nice bed and linens - 158 mostly covered steps to Schipol - Well stocked bar and pantry - US power outlet - Highly attentive staff (even though you check yourself in) Cons - The room is my American standards quite small - extremely functional - but small

Reviews.Title: “M-tastic”
Reviews.Author: AndrewStewart
Reviews.Content: The M brand is unique, friendly staff,funky rooms and showers and moderate pricing - love it!

Reviews.Title: “A Fun Place for Couples”
Reviews.Author: KeoKai
Reviews.Content: This place is so cool! The lobby is well-decorated--modern and fun, and the staff if pretty friendly and helpful. Before choosing this hotel when I went, I looked at google maps and it said that it was an hour's walking time from the inner city and so I almost didn't chose the hotel, but the hotel is literally just around the corner from a train station and the tram runs right next to the hotel, so it is really about 10 minutes away from the innermost part of the city. The area around the hotel is very nice and comfortable. Not to mention the price is quite nice! The bed was so big and cozy (I was sick while I was in Amsterdam, so I *definitely* appreciated that!). The crazy lights were really cool and it was fun playing with the different settings. They have a great selection of music, movies, etc to choose from--all free of charge! The one thing that I did not like about this place, though, was that the water in the shower did not get hot.

Reviews.Title: “Give this designer hotel a go in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: Cricketnut44
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in Amsterdam. Situated in the rapidly growing business district, it has EXCELLENT public transport links both to the centre of Amsterdam (tram outside) and Schipol Airport (train 3 minutes walk). The young staff are very friendly and knowledgable about this technologically advanced hotel. The rooms are bright and ultra modern. The public space has a small cafe, well stocked, and there are computers for general use. All films, to every taste are free on demand in the rooms. I gather that this change is spreading into the UK and we would definatly stay at Citizen M again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it !!!”
Reviews.Author: Vyara L Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Really nice place to stay, the members of staff always greeting with smile. The rooms are unique!!! There is plenty of place to relax. The tram stop to the centre is just around the corner. I would definitely visit CitizenM again and I recommend it to everyone who is looking for a really nice and unique place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: Vyara L
Reviews.Content: Really nice place to stay, the members of staff always greeting with smile. The rooms are unique!!! There is plenty of place to relax. The tram stop to the centre is just around the corner. I would definitely visit CitizenM again and I recommend it to everyone who is looking for a really nice and unique place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Truely Amazing”
Reviews.Author: clare l Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel really does what it says on the tin. It is immaculately clean, ultra modern and the bedrooms are amazing. One of the best ever break away without the kids we've had. Very easy to get into the centre of Amsterdam, 10 mins on the tram. I will definately be using the CitizenM Hotel Group in the future. 1ST CLASS!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Distinguish!”
Reviews.Author: Kevina0105
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pretty close to the Airport by direct train. We arrived and quickly we checked-in, then we went out and took the Tram ( it's just around the corner) and went to the City Centre. The breakfast was good, like a continental breakfast, with good coffee. The room was absolutely clean and the light system and roll-up windows are fantastic. I'm not surprised if we go back and stay again. A very modern hotel indeed!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel team members were very helpful”
Reviews.Author: marsolh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pretty, the rooms are really comfortable. The hotel members were very kind, they help us with directions, train tickets information, and banks location. Very very nice.

Reviews.Title: “A super hotel which is trendy, funky and fun. Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: MonsterBabes
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at citizenM in April 2012, and our stay was superb. We loved the funky modern design of the hotel, and the staff were amazing. The rooms are small, but the space is very well utilised, and you don't feel cramped in the rooms. The rooms come equipped with a "mood pad" which allows you to choose lighting, temperature, window blinds, tv programmes, music etc from one control. The bathroom is not formally separate from the bedroom, but the loo and shower are encapsulated in cylindrical glass opaque doors which offer privacy. There is also a curtain which you can close the bathroom off from the bedroom with. The bed is nice and big, and very comfortable. We found ourselves oversleeping every morning (which is not a bad thing while on holiday!) The room is also very very quiet (the windows are thick), so you don't hear any outside noise. Bliss! The hotel staff are all extremely helpful, friendly and fun. They also come from all over the world, so you're very likely to find someone who can communicate with you in most languages. The hotel has free use of an internet / computer station with 4 apple computers. This was extremely useful for travellers wishing to look up a map, restaurant, activity etc. And they let you print! The food available at the hotel is also of a very high standard, and they make excellent coffees. The food style is kind of a pret-a-manger style, so you choose what you want (ready made) from a shelf/fridge and then eat it around a colourful bar area. Everything is run on computers, so you check yourself in and out, and it's very easy to do. Proximity to the public transport systems is also very convenient. It's 5 minutes from the Amsterdam Zuid train station, and 1 minute from the nearest Tram stop. We found it very easy getting around from there. I would highly recommend staying at citizenM!!

Reviews.Title: “Fab and funky!”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeandBuffy
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here and thoroughly enjoyed it. Yes, rooms are small but there is a handy under bed drawer to store all your stuff in. And yes, you do need to get on well with your room mate! Love the mood lighting, purple a definite favourite (it would be great if whole room was bathed in the coloured lighting). Bed comfortable and huge, toiletries smelling lovely, very dinky units. Shower great - beam me up scotty - do you think they could pipe hot air into it to dry you??? Staff lovely, cheerful and helpful - top marks. Decor brill, loved the style, also the Macs. Enjoyed one hot meal, they cook a fresh dish at tea time, and veggie curry box was fine. Breakfast plentiful but bit limited. Rooms very quiet, which kind of surprised us! Only suggestion to hotel is it would be great to have some sort of window to let in fresh air - the air conditioning is great, but I'm not a great fan and like a bit of fresh air! Make sure you get off at right stop on tram 5 from central station (the hotel is just across the road and bike lane, and to the left) as we got off the next one and got a bit lost.... It was quite nice to be a tram ride from the city, and the service was very regular, going right through the centre of Amsterdam, making everywhere easy to get to. Will definitely recommend to friends

Reviews.Title: “A great place in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Adam W
Reviews.Content: While I am not sure if this hotel is for everyone (families with young children), it is definitely for the rest of us to enjoy. Everything about the room was unique (yes, I had to close the toilet cubicle as I couldn't quite get my head around the toilet being open) and comfortable. The staff were most helpful and the availability of different foods, snacks, and drinks were refreshing. Getting there from Central Station do not take a taxi unless you have a crazy amount luggage. I did, not knowing the area, and paid an arm and a leg and know that I was basically robbed. The number 5 tram is simple from Central Station and it stops right next to the hotel. Enjoy : )

Reviews.Title: “Every aspect was well thought out, very impressed.”
Reviews.Author: starblossom
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at citizenM the last night of our vacation before flying in the morning out of Schiphol. Because the price was so reasonable (compared to other hotels in the area), we each got our own room. The hotel is very convenient to the airport, we rolled our luggage over with no hassle. We had just come in via train from Brussels (which arrived at the airport. Also convenient!). After checking in and getting settled, we went back to the airport and took a quick tram ride to Amsterdam. We walked around, enjoyed a nice dinner, then hopped back on the tram to the airport, and walked back to the hotel. Very easy (in part because we were in Amsterdam prior to Brussels, so we knew our way around... but still, easy enough!). I would describe this hotel as 'high tech modern', but without feeling sterile or cold. The room itself was perfectly engineered and designed. Every inch of the space was put to good use, so that the feel of the room was bigger than the actual size. Every aspect was well thought out. The bed! So comfortable, with excellent quality linens and generous in size. My room overlooked the runway, so I enjoyed looking out my window throughout the night. When it was time for lights out, the blinds blocked the light so not a blink or flash was seen. The quality of the soundproofing was better than most hotels. I could not hear my son in the next room, who had the TV volume up. I loved the gadgets for mood lights, shades, etc. The shower itself was a fun novelty. If I had to say one negative thing, I would say that check-in was a bit bumpy, but we were able to check-in within minutes so that isn't really a fair complaint. I would definitely stay here again, and I would recommend to anyone staying by themselves, or for 2 people who don't mind a little 'coziness'. We did not use the common areas, but we saw other people enjoying them. Nice work, citizenM!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the value”
Reviews.Author: Chanelgrlnum5
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at this hotel April 5th-9th, 2012. We loved the lobby and the staff. Our room was very different from what we are used to in the US but, was great for Amsterdam. It was modern and clean, the bed was comfortable (little firm). We enjoyed the free movies and the modern amenities. The lobby had Apple computers that were free for guest to use, a wonderful bar, and great choices of meals in their kitchen area. It is on the outskirts of the city center but, right by the tram that takes you in. We would defiantly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: cabalaza
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the citizenM for 2 nights at eastern, it was a GREAT choice, maybe it's not the best located hotel, but it's definetely worth it, you just take bus number 5 and in ten minutes you are in the van gogh museum. The place is really nice and clean, the staff is very friendly and the whole hotel follows this same idea about not the typical tourist, but a tourist that wants to get more involve in the place. The design is amazing, overall I loveed this hotel, if I go back to Amsterdam there's no doubt I'm going back again to citizenM

Reviews.Title: “The future!”
Reviews.Author: jord_kemp
Reviews.Content: It's the kind of room you would expect to find on a spaceship cruise liner. Using the remote from the huge bed you can adjust the lighting colour of the room, the blinds and shutters, the music (urban block, lounge, pop cafe etc), the temperature, and choose what TV show or film (about 40 movies on demand) you want to watch. It really is the perfect room to spend some quality time, the bed was extremely comfy, the waterfall shower was fantastic, and the toilet was quirky. The reception/lounge/diner/internet cafe was really relaxed and had a great atmosphere, and the staff were extremely polite and helpful. I wish we stayed for more then one night.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Vesna M
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and myself decided to spend Easter holidays in Amsterdam and choosing CitizenM accomodation was definitely worth it! We loved it all the way through and would definitely recommend it ti our friends and all others! The design is so cool and it gives an impression of entering a lovely space ship and entering a new time dimension. It was an excellent experience and would like to come back one day.

Reviews.Title: “Different but worked out very well....”
Reviews.Author: JustMeKaren
Reviews.Content: How close are you? Do you not mind pooping in front of your partner or friend? These are issues to consider when booking a room. As the bathroom and shower are within the room, the bathroom is created by closing a lightly frosted glass tube around you and the shower is created by a clear glass tube sliding around you in a very space age...Jetsonish way. Your partner and in my case, friend, watched me pee and shower but I did go downstairs when I needed to poop. I was fine but my friend was a bit uncomfortable. I loved the hotel and would stay again provided I was alone or with the right person. I was told an older father/daughter decided not to stay in the hotel when they realized the privacy issue and there was no other available room. Though, I focused on the shower/bathroom situation I completely enjoyed the international staff and experience. Fun and different and cheaper! Not for the conventional.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: LeilaJoanna
Reviews.Content: We loved returning to our room at the end of a long day exploring the city, the bed was perfect and one of the most comfortable I have ever slept on! The room has a great lighting system and the shower is very good too with a nice duo of shower gels/shampoo. It has a great friendly atmosphere and the staff make you feel very welcome and at home. Some previous reviewers have criticized how coming back to the hotel after midnight is difficult or expensive....there are frequent night buses which are included if you GVB travel card! The only thing to improve on the room would be perhaps to have a mini fridge as we liked to buy local food. Also an in room tea/coffee making facility, as there was often a queue in the cafe for their coffee in the morning! Overall though we loved our stay and we will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Derekbr
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel for business trips or couples. A 5 minute walk from Amsterdam South railway station + metro and trams take you to the city center in 10 minutes. But staying in this hotel is an experience. The lobby feels as if you're staying in a Vitra showroom with all the classics there to relax in, lots of space and a couple of Macs if you need to check your mail or get some work done. Friendly and helpful staff. The room was almost heaven. The bed perfect. And the first half hour I spent playing with the remote to try out all different moods (music + light). Free wifi, free vod,... Loved it and will stay at Citizen M again. Can't wait for the hotel in London.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, nothing great”
Reviews.Author: gauravm03
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times due to its closeness to WTC. I dont enjoy the self service experience as the rates are as high as a full service hotel. The rooms are a bit weird if you have not stayed here before and the box like structure and also the hallways can be a bit claustrophobic. The personnel are kind and respectiful but a lot of them are not very experienced in hospitality. The breakfast is poor, most super market bought stuff in a bag and a coffee. They have grabbed a niche market i.e. people who can afford a good vacation but want to stay like backpackers, people working in WTC nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, design-orientated, different”
Reviews.Author: sb1London
Reviews.Content: CitizenM is a very efficient operation with emphasis on self-service and value. The hotel is very design focused - the lobby is cool, well designed and huge, with plenty of space to work or relax. The cafe is a great touch - making it easy to get a drink or something to eat. Staff are friendly and efficient - and the check in/out process is very smooth with the self service terminals. The rooms are compact but well thought out - although it is not a hotel suitable for long stays (unless you travel light). The bed is huge and comfortable and the bathroom, which is in your room, functional if a little quirky. As well as some nice design touches, the high tech mood pad controlled pretty much everything in the room including lighting, sound, TV... I really liked it here and would absolutely stay again - it is excellent value, although situated in the business district, so possibly not such a good location if you are on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: tamaringa
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect, we almost forgot we came to see the city and not the hotel... I felt even better than at home. The atmosphere, the huge bed, the design shower, the helpful staff, the 24 hour cafeteria service...Best hotel experience ever... And only 10 minutes away by bike to the Rijksmuseum.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Rasha33
Reviews.Content: Citizen M is my favourite chain of hotels. The staff are overall amazing, always willing to help. The room we stayed in is perfect for a couple, except the bathroom being split makes it a little small.

Reviews.Title: “Unsual”
Reviews.Author: Jean-Auguste
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the south of Amsterdam. Tram 5 that leads to city center at 200M. It takes 25' to reach the central station. It's a quiet area as the room. Staff is joung, very friendly & helpful. Lobby is rich of colours, spacious with trendy decoration. Up to 6 MAC for internet and for free. Room is amazing. Only 2M50 wide. WC and shower in transparent tubes that you can change the coloured light following your mood. Flat screen with VOD also free. Room cleanliness as the whole hotel. The downside : Duvet size not adapted to very king size bed. Remote control not working very well. Not a lot of space to leave things, everything is tiny. Take care to shower drops noise during the night. Tap not easy to close with wet hands. In general, good quality/price ratio (wait special offer on booking.com). Real experience of unsual hotel. Would recommand but not for a long period.

Reviews.Title: “the hotel for a truly close people”
Reviews.Author: Asya-Sargsyan
Reviews.Content: The fact that we have stayed in this hotel not once is the best recommendation, isnâ€™t it? In this modern lobby full of curious and original furniture you can: -lie on the couch or sunbeds with the company. -conduct business negotiations -arrange sporting bar if there is a decent game -spend hours looking through the photo album of famous photographers which are a lot of there -work or entertain yourself at Apple computers Certainly it is a hotel for a truly close people, because small rooms and originally designed bathrooms can bring some inconvenience to conservatives. But not for us. Enjoying a huge comfortable bed, music and lighting, every day we added a good dose of positive emotions to stay in our beloved Amsterdam. And weâ€™ll be back definitely!

Reviews.Title: “Quirky and fabulous”
Reviews.Author: OperationZoe
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for 4 days. We got an early flight from Manchester and were worried that we couldn't check in until 2pm when we would actually be at the hotel by 11am. We needn't have been. We found the hotel easily, it has good transport links from the airport (1 stop) and there is a tram stop literally outside of the hotel (Prinses Irenestraase I think) or a short walk away near the train station is another (Station Zuid). Once we reached the hotel we were greeted immediately by a member of staff who in perfect English told us we could either pay for an early check in or we could leave our suitcases securely in the hotel whilst we went and explored - we chose the latter. He was very helpful as we outlined potential plans for the week, he advised us to buy a travel card - a very good idea if you plan on getting public transport anywhere as it is 7.50 euros for 24 hours and 16.50 euros for 3 so no comparison really. He also printed out maps for us and let us know about the free iMacs and printers should we need any more info. After exploring for the afternoon we returned to the hotel and were greeted by another member of staff, I think her name was Sara. She helped us check in and we made our way to the room. The rooms are amazing. They are compact, however I think a lot of this is due to the fact that the bed is huge. So big in fact myself and my travel partner actually comfortably slept in a "L" shape one evening!! There are free movies on demand which are recent releases and should you so wish BBC 1, 2 and 3 are all available. Yes, the shower is..quirky and the toilet is in the middle of the room, however as long as you arent travelling with someone who you dont know that well it isnt too much of a problem - there is a curtain for some privacy and realistically it didnt bother us as we werent planning on spending too much time in the room anyway. The hotel is in a quiet residential area with the World Trade Centre around the corner. The tram line that services it goes through the Museumplein and Leidseplein which was useful as we felt if we were staying closer to the centre we wouldn't have explored these parts of the city. The best part of our experience staying at the hotel was coming back one evening and deciding to have a quiet drink at the bar. This turned into several and we ended up staying there until rather later than planned. Thank you to Dominic and Altin for putting up with us - we're sorry for probably being those annoying girls who stopped you doing any work during what I'm guessing is normally a peaceful shift!! All in all I would highly recommend the hotel, it was very clean and the staff were courteous at all times - a trait we were hard pressed to find in the rest of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful - all concept and no service”
Reviews.Author: glensmeaton
Reviews.Content: No parking facilities, no check-in staff, additional cost for using a credit card with no option to pay cash, staff who looked down their noses disdainfully claiming that we "clearly didn't read the website, so don't understand your concept", small cramped room designed by someone with great skills in architectural design but has never stayed in a hotel, in-room electrical system kept giving a "please wait" message, and no option to selectively turn off lights. The price point would suggest a luxury hotel, but I got a bargain-basement level of service. Truly the RyanAir of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Citizen at M”
Reviews.Author: kmadhia
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, off beat designs and interiors.....i mean where else will u find a potty bang in the middle of your room ??? In citizenM one can ! Don't forget to close youself inside the tube when u do sit on the "throne" !! But overall a very very good experience ! The hotel is located not too far from Amsterdam Sud Station...(not very close either, so if u have lotsa luggage, perhaps u wanna take a tram, as it stops just outside the hotel. Would reccommend this hotel heartily ! If the weather is good, walk to the city center and wander around, its very enjoyable. Have fun, exploring the unique spots of this great city..the "Coffee" shops, the Cafeterias, the unique tourist spots with their rows of "show cases" along the canals...and lots more !

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: jlarse02
Reviews.Content: From check-in to check-out, this was truly a positive experience. The hotel standard is high and the staff was very service-minded and helpful at all times. The "lobby-area" had a very relaxed atmosphere and the style is to my liking. Rooms are small, but you still get a very high value for money when staying at this hotel. Quiet surroundings but short distance by tram to the busy city-centre. This was a "different" but truly positive experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Not A Great Location”
Reviews.Author: carly_bowles17
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights, it is a quirky hotel, there is a self check in computer, 24 hour bar and japenese food is also available 24 hours, this ranges from sushi, salad and noodles. There is free internet access on apple computers and free wifi and the staff are friendly. The rooms are small and simple with large comfortable bed under the window, a shower cubicle with frosted glass in centre of room and a toilet cubicle also with frosted glass, so there is not a great deal of privacy, but very quirky. The lighting, blinds, heating/air con and tv are all comtrolled by a single remote which is next to the bed. There is a wide range of free movies and music on the tv which is a nice touch. The only down side to this hotel is the location, which is a 15 minute ride on the tramp, we found the tramp to be crowded and uncomfortable throughout the day and it stops running in the evening. A taxi from the red light district to this hotel cost us 38euros also the food in hotel Was overpriced and there was not a great selection For breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Dulciemay
Reviews.Content: We were very comfortable.......toilet space rather small and not private!!!! However all facilities were good........the staff were very very attentive and pleasant. It was a good experience and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “strange but apealing rooms”
Reviews.Author: dominictru
Reviews.Content: My stay at the CitizenM was quite enjoyable. The room layout is very unique. they are small, but it does not feel small (at least to me it doesn't). the beds are big and very comfortable, the down comforter is very nice. what i did not like was the location, which is a ways out of the town center, and if you plan on staying out till much past midnight you will need to get a cab back since the tram does stop running at night. The other thing to be aware of is that when you deadbolt your door it does still open with the card, so make sure you put the "do not disturb" sign out if you do not want the maid walking in on you. All in all it was a very nice stay and i will stay here again if I come back to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, fresh, economical and conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: Krystav
Reviews.Content: The CitizenM hotel Amsterdam is located very conveniently close to the Amsterdam Zuid/WTC trainstation. It takes just a few minutes to get downtown by either bus/train or bike. Big park across the road. Despite proximity to road/railway NO problems with sound, rooms are extremely well isolated. Self check-in/check-out using the computers located in the lobby or with assistance of an employee is quick and effortless. Rooms are something else! Superior use of space and efficiency, wonderful modern minimalistic design. Upon entry the room has a toilet unit and a rainshower both in a circular cubicle, a washstand and a chair. The second half of the room up to the full width window is taken up by the oversized king bed with excellent bedding and pillows. Storage available underneath the bed. Large flat screen TV with moviechannels, moodlighting and remote control blinds all ad to the luxury. The hotel has self-service breakfast and dinner items available as well as a bar and coffee service. Quality is good, selection is adequate although the price is rather high. Lobby also sells an array of toiletries and other "stay" related items. Small note though, if traveling with a companion you are not "close" with, this will not be for you, as the bathroom area of the rooms is not really private. Overall a wonderful stay and would most definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Low cost as Ryan Air”
Reviews.Author: Hubert R Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fun, but nobody speaks Dutch, strange in the main Capital city....then if you are interested by the internet price per night you have to know that you will have to pay for every breath your take: if you pay with credit card, the city taxes, ...and if you are luck they will give you an already occupied room and you will see your future nice, naked neighbour, nice to know that anybody can get your room key card.... Design is nice, rooms are smalls, TV internet is free : positive point.

Reviews.Title: “Quality in every way”
Reviews.Author: An J
Reviews.Content: Just like its sister hotel at schiphol airport, this one is great in every way. Not really suitable if youre shy, because the shower is see through. Although they tell you that the glass becomes foggy if you turn the hot water on......it doesnt! But if you're a single or business traveller this checks all the boxes on convenience, location, staff, comfort, cleanliness and accessibility. And more. Great hotel chain for overnight stays for mobile young professionals. I wouldnt choose any other place in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Quite an experience”
Reviews.Author: AmbsCBeck
Reviews.Content: We stayed here our last night after a week between Amsterdam and Brussels. We were welcomed with champagne and raspberries and a nice note from the staff as it was the last night of our honeymoon...very nice touch from the staff! The room was clean and we were blown away by how different, yet efficient it was. The bed was very comfortable!! I wish we could have stayed longer. I would highly suggest the breakfast - fresh breads, fruit, cheese, juice, coffee/tea...lots of choices and very filling. It is a little distant from city center, no more than a short metro ride though and totally worth it! I can't compliment the staff and the overall experience enough. The room had mood settings, definitely more for couples or solo travelers as it is fairly close quarters. We will definitely stay in CitizenM hotels again, if available for our travels.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Urssie
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Amsterdam Aiport (Schiphol) Citizen M hotel twince. I has been such a good stay that we aiagin, choose to stay at Citizen M, this time in Amsterdam city. Actally it is just outside the citycentre, which is good, we thought. Tram 5 takes you to Central station and all along the places to be in no-time. The hotel formula is a great for us, everything you need in a funky room with a bed just like the one at home. Staff are friendly, rooms are clean. What more do you want...well...for Citizen M to open more hotels all over the world!

Reviews.Title: “Strange... in a good way”
Reviews.Author: kbsamuel
Reviews.Content: Once you get over the red light in the entrance AND the (basically open) bathrooms in your bedroom AND the pictures of people doing 'unspeakable' acts by the lift, this is actually a lovely hotel. Well located (not in the centre of town but right by a tram stop), good value, friendly and relaxed I would definitely stay here again. The whole TV, lights, etc philosophy is fun and its definitely memorable!

Reviews.Title: “What a nice experience”
Reviews.Author: Nutternet
Reviews.Content: Very intresting hotel, after a fantasic nights sleep I almost feel too relaxed. Ultra modern hotel, need to go there again to explore all its offerings.

Reviews.Title: “super modern and cool”
Reviews.Author: Roberto M Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I loved the CitizenM; it's almost like an industrial design exhibition, and at the same time cozy enough so that people really inhabit it's public spaces and enjoy it. I appreciated the free-for-use iMacs and printer, and loved the room's remote-controlled lighting, blinds, blackout... and for my purpose (exhibition at RAI) it was perfect (two blocks away walking) while at the same time one single tram takes you to Amsterdam's busy center.

Reviews.Title: “All you need, effective.”
Reviews.Author: Patrick V
Reviews.Content: A great bed, a great shower and great service. What else do you need? The hotel is located near public transportation. I used this hotel for business before but now also spend time with my wife. For 2 nights it is ok, there is not much room for clothes etc so I dont know if a longer stay is comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Drag0nMe
Reviews.Content: A unique hotel. The rooms are amazing and fun. You can control everything (TV, blinds, lights, room temperature etc) with an easy to use remote control. I've read reviews saying that there is no guide or detailed information about how to use it, honestly you don't need it - everything is obvious. The bed was very comfortable. Can't remember when was last time I enjoyed my sleep that much. The staff...can't praise them enough: very friendly and helpful. I forgot my laptop charger at home and I asked for one. The hotel manager was there as well and offered to look for one, unfortunately they did not have one that I could use. anyways, two days later the manager brought me one from the other CitizenM hotel. I thought that was brilliant. The check-in check-out system amazed me as well, you do it yourself using their computers, though there's always someone there in case you need assistance. It's very quick and efficient. You can't pay cash for your room or any additional charges to your room. I leave in London so to avoid any extra charges to my account (transaction fees and currency excange), at the airport, I put the money on a VISA travel card (you can withdraw money from ATM machines, use it in shops etc, without any extra charge) The location of the hotel is very good, 10 min to the airport (the train station si 5 min away) 15 min to the city centre with tram no 5 (2 min away). I recommend to get a travel card that you can use on busses, trams and metro: I had one for 5 days (120 hours...they don't do days, they do hours) and cost me 25 euro. You can get the Metro as well to go to the city, but I would recommend the tram. you can do what they call hop on hop off and see major attractions as the tram 5 passes by Museumplein where you cand visit Van Gogh, Rijksmuseum, Diamonds Museum etc. you jump on the same tram and go further to Spui where is the Amsterdam Historich Museum, few stops further is Leidsestraat where you can shop and from where you can go and walk the city. At the same stop you can find the theatre where Boom Chicago performs (Leidseplein 12) stand up comedy and improvisation - go and see one of their shows..very good laughs. jump on the tram again and you will finally hit the centre of the city! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Mega bed”
Reviews.Author: 4sure86
Reviews.Content: You check yourself in at a computer but if you have any difficulties there are staff to assist. There are futuristic features to the room, you can change the colours of the room for instance with one super control which also controls other things such as the TV. The room has easily the biggest hotel bed I have seen. I stayed there for one night before my flight with a friend of the same gender, we are both straight and it was not too awkward because of the huge bed, albeit an offering of twin beds would have been preferable. There is a curtain through which shadow outlines can be seen, which blocks the view from the shower/toilet from the bed. But the shower/toilet are all in the one room with the bed, so this is in no way ideal in terms of privacy but i'm sure it saves space. The price of 79 euros was pretty good. Perfectly clean and no signs of wear and tear in any part of the hotel because it is so new. The hotel is a short walk to the airport. I would recommend staying here over other airport hotels if for no other reason than the novelty of the experience. On the downside, they were sending me newsletter emails after my stay.

Reviews.Title: “just loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen F
Reviews.Content: I arrived at citizenM after a really bad day and was really exhausted and in a bad mood. The staff of the hotel was VERY friendly so when I went up to my room my mood was already a lot better and the room was really heaven! so quite and peacefull, all the stress of the day was very soon washed a way! The following days the staff (ALL of them), kept beeing extremely friendly so I left my hotel every morning with a smile! Thanks guys! The rooms are very light, the safe is handy, the colored lighting are fun, breakfast is fine (really good thee), but, the sheets were washed and fresh, but had stains and the bed was to hard for me.

Reviews.Title: “Out of the box”
Reviews.Author: mr18
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel if you have an early flight out of AMS as it is easy walking distance (even dragging luggage) and great access to the train station that is located inside the airport. However, please know that this isn't a "standard" style hotel and a quick check of their website could easily explain what I'm talking about. The room is very modern and very small but it is exactly everything you need and nothing you don't. If you're looking for a hotel room that is completely out of the box...this is your place. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: jocypri
Reviews.Content: I don't know how anyone can find fault with this hotel. It's very well designed, and everything within it has been meticulously thought about to give you a boutique feel without a boutique price. The lobby is great with several seating areas all with TV's, and a cafe/bar so you can hang out with friends and relax if you want. I liked the designer furnishings, and quirky wall signage - all really nice little touches. The room was really fun. It's small, but definitely not too small for two - you can slide the pod doors fully open to have a total open plan flooring area to get ready in. The mood pad was a little bit unpredictable, but i never got bored of changing the room colour! Movies on demand is a nice touch too. There's a giant drawer under the bed to store all your stuff, and a desk and shelving. The shower and toilet pods are an experience - the rain shower was absolutely amazing - boiling hot - i literally stayed in there for about 30 mins! The bed was the best nights sleep i've had (probably ever) and allowed both of us to stretch and starfish as much as we wanted without being in each others way! I was a bit worried about the location maybe being a bit far out but it definitely wasn't - about a ten minute tram ride from directly opposite the hotel took you to the shopping streets and main centre, and trams were about every 5 mins. Would definitely stay here again and recommend for couples (it'd be a bit weird with a friend i think!) - hope they build many more!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and groovy hotel.”
Reviews.Author: vivinthekids
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful experience we all had. Bit of a shock when we first arrived it being so high tech but the staff were fantastic and talked us through everything. Sipping cocktails in very comfy designer furniture whilst munching bags of salty snacks. Kids reclining upstairs in the bedroom watching DVDs with handfuls of assorted sweets blagged from downstairs. All rather perfect. Would recommend it highly. Very near to the trams and train from the Airport. Breakfast limited but delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: hutchbeast
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel this is. A nice surprise. Excellent clean room with comfortable bed. Nice power shower in the room. Philips lighting system in the room means you can change the lighting colours to suit the 'mood'. Hotel is around 5 minutes walk to the metro station. Very good for connections to Central Amsterdam. Only downside is the hotel reception food & drink prices...a little expensive. But on the whole, great hotel. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very trendy, very different”
Reviews.Author: punitworld
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this Hotel last week and found it to be very trendy, exceptionally clean and quite different from other Hotels. Hotel is about 5 minute walk from Amsterdam Zuid and offers free WiFi, free movies /videos and has a very different room layout that is very immressive. Breakfast has limited assortment but is okay for the price. Overall, a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “magnificent”
Reviews.Author: nastish
Reviews.Content: This is the place to where you'd like to return again and again. It is something in the service, decoration, furniture, bar staff that makes you feel special. The room has Smart House system inside, you can manage the light, the wallcurtains, the TV, etc from the remote control. The hotel is extremelly modern and stylish, especially in the lobby, reception and bar, where it is so-o-o nice to pass the time. if you come to Amsterdam by car, please, note, that he parking near the hotel is extremelly expensive, you'd better park your car at Olympisch Stadion P+R, which cost approx.8euro per day and they give you a ticket for tram/bus.

Reviews.Title: “Unique & Cozy. Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: nnicoleee
Reviews.Content: I LOVED this hotel. I hardly wanted to leave at the end of my trip!! My boyfriend and I, both in our twenties, stayed at CitizenM for three nights this February. I really liked its trendy, futuristic design. The staff was really helpful while I was checking in and if I needed directions. The rooms were clean, first and foremost, and also incredibly unique and fun. I can understand some petty complaints about the rooms. The king-size (very comfortable) bed is only accessible on one side, and surrounded on three sides by the room walls. I found it quite cozy. One full wall was a window, which allowed for a lot of light in the room. The toilet and shower were just as interesting, though the shower didnâ€™t allow for a lot of privacy. In addition, the movie that you usually pay $15 to watch at other hotels are free at CitizenM, and there is a 24-hour bar and snack shop in the lobby. Best of all, it was incredibly affordable! The value for the price, in my opinion, is exceptional. The hotel is two miles from the city center, but the tram can be caught just across the street for a quick ride to the center. The location allowed for some peace and quiet after all day in the city center, and itâ€™s only a 10-minute train ride to the airport. Not only would I absolutely recommend this hotel, I look forward to returning to Amsterdam and staying at CitizenM in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “I'll stop making reservations when I become bored”
Reviews.Author: Druopera
Reviews.Content: I love the overall informality of the CitizenM franchise.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gary B
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Amsterdam and booked the citizenM on the strength of the reviews we had read. The self check in was very easy, there were a lot of very helpful, friendly staff about anyway. The rooms were spotless and really quirky. The Bar staff were great and really knew their stuff, the best tasting Cocktails ever. It was really easy to get in to town as the tram stop was just around the corner. This was by far the most enjoyable Hotel experience we have ever had, mostly due to the excellent staff, other Hotels would do well to aim for the same standards. We would certainly stay here again, the perfect Hotel for couples.

Reviews.Title: “You have to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Jadzia1970
Reviews.Content: From the moment you enter this hotel, you know you are somewhere special. Check is self service, although there are plenty of friendly staff around to help. The unique design and citizenM motif is eyecatching. The rooms are small and have the shower and toilet in the room itself.............but this just makes it all the more unique. The beds are huge and very comfortable. the shower is amazing. Everything is controlled by a "mood pad". there is an extensive range of free movies and music on the tv. The location is perfect, just a few minutes to the train station and to the tram which takes you into the heart of Amsterdam. I cannot say enough positive things about this hotel, you'll just have to check it out for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Very Modern, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: joseykitson
Reviews.Content: I really loved staying in this hotel. It's just so cool! It's outside of the main city of Amsterdam but the number 5 tram stops right in front of the hotel and goes direclty through the city center to the Central Station so it's very convenient. The room is quite small but the amazing king size bed and free movies make up for it. There is 24-7 food, drinks and alcohol in the main lobby and for an extra 20 euro you can get a late check out (to 3PM). It's not really suited for kids (which I love) so there weren't a lot of families around. Mostly younger couples and business people.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: DundeeSonoftherock
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel. Ultra modern and great staff, in fact the best I've ever come across in any hotel. I can see that the room design might not suit some people due to the lack of privacy but I was on my own so still have to test that. It's hard to find fault with Citizen M. My only minor gripe is the size of the washand basin. It's very shallow and the water was spilling out when I was shaving. Getting into town is easy and the trip from the airport is only one stop. I really liked the lounge and bar area which is huge and great to relax in in the evening. I even liked the piped music. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Even Better Second Time Around”
Reviews.Author: harry180702
Reviews.Content: Second visit to this hotel. First time in October 2011 and we are just back from a further 3 night stay. This is an excellent hotel. Great rooms, excellent staff and located close enough to all the main sites of Amsterdam. Tram 5 stops just across from the hotel so makes it easy to get in and out of the city. 15 minutes or so to Dam Square. After a long day exploring this beautiful city its great to have a cosy room and comfortable bed to go back to. Can't wait for my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: mars27
Reviews.Content: What can is say that has already been said? This hotel is ahead in many ways. From the convenience of automated self check in to the slick surroundings and the level of customer service that was outstanding. We spent a brief 8 hours at citizen m and found the hotel incredibly relaxing and welcoming as soon as we walked in the door, over the mat that complemented our shoes :). Brilliant use of space in the rooms and the food at the kiosk is really good quality which was unexpected as it was offered in a "off the shelf" way. Highly innovative and well humoured, even quirky, we would have loved to have stayed longer just to experience it a bit more. Cannot wait for them to be in other cities. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel great.Amsterdam v.good. Avoid brownies.”
Reviews.Author: formal6
Reviews.Content: We would definitely stay in this hotel again and enjoyed our stay in Amsterdam. Hotel good points: Genuinely friendly staff, impressive contemporary hotel design, close to train & tram stops, flatscreen tv in room & free movies on demand, clean, very comfortable bed Not so good: 15-20mins to city on tram but hotel close to tram. Impressively efficient use of space in bedrooms but it is a bit cramped with not a lot of room for bags or clothes - fine for short break The hotel is located less than 5mins walk from Zuid train station which is great for access to schipol airport and to other towns in holland.(e.g. We travelled 20mins on train to Utrecht which is a lovely town and worth a visit for a few hours) Prinses irenestraat tram stop is even closer. The tram infrastructure in Amsterdam makes the whole city very accessible. Amsterdam highlights for my wife and I would be 1) Anne frank house (30mins queue on a quiet day if tickets not bought online), 2) Utrecht, 3) heineken experience (very enjoyable) 4) huge selection of restaurants with flavors from all over the world! Naturally we had a look at the red light district also! Amsterdam lowlight would be our decision to visit a coffee house on our second day. We gave into our curiosity and decided to try a brownie (space-cake). We fooloishly thought that brownies were a safer way to try this experience. 1.5hrs later, we still had felt no effects. Then it hit us. Words cannot describe what a horrendous experience it was. Panic, nausea, paranoia, fear and a heavily drunk feeling give a idea of how we felt. We returned to our hotel. We feared we were having heart attacks and confided to hotel staff. They were absolutely fantastic and looked after us for a few hours until we felt somewhat ok again.When it was over we were embarrassed but they never made us feel bad about it. We subsequently learned that brownies are a lot more dangerous because the effects are so delayed, that you cannot tell if you've had too much. So if, like us, you are inexperienced and do give into temptation when in Amsterdam, our advice is a) do not use brownies, b) do not do it until familiar with Amsterdam as you may not find your way back and c) it may be safer during the day for the same reasons as point b.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay..Would recommend”
Reviews.Author: boydy
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay here from fri 10th until sun 12th feb! Walk to the world trade center at station amsterdam zuid to get the metro into central station, costs 3euro for two i think! Hotel is really funky and staff are extremely friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Citizen M Amsterdam - great stay”
Reviews.Author: fidders
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here with my wife in February. The hotel is easy and cheap to get to by train from the airport. It is about 3 miles from the centre of Amsterdam but only a minute's walk from a tram-stop which takes you into the centre in about 15 minutes. The room was right up our street - very modern and stylish with a huge, comfy bed and excellent shower. There is free wifi throughout the hotel and Apple computers on the ground floor which are free to use. We didn't eat at the hotel - there is a selection of food which can be microwaved - not really our thing. The coffee is excellent and the bar is well stocked with a good cocktail list and 2 draught beers. The staff were all young, smiley, enthusiastic and helpful. I have no hesitation in recommending Citizen M for a short break in Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Chic boutique hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: janeycam8
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this hotel twice I have got to recommend it .... What can I say Fantastic !! the best beds the most amazing shower the only reason I didn't give 5 is because it would be great to have tea/coffee making facilities in the room and a mini fridge .. Free use of apple macs downstairs , free tv in rooms 5 mins to train/tram station & buses we have stayed in traditional b&b in Amsterdam but no where near the best experience than when we have stayed in Citizen M .... Ps we don't have a problem with the toilet pod but it may not be for everyone ...enjoy the experience

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: munton89
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, fast wifi, nice rooms. Good location, some comments on the distance from the city, but it was nice to be out of the madness and the tram is so easy to use. one comments about the bedrooms though, quite small and if sharing with someone, its a bit too close!! (toilet, and shower in the same room!) friendly staff and nice food and drink. overall a great stay and would definately book again!

Reviews.Title: “best hotel so far”
Reviews.Author: Revviewer
Reviews.Content: The bed is to die for - probably the most comfortable mattress I've ever slept on, want it for my bedroom. The rooms are small, stayed on my own and opening up the suitcase didn't leave much room for walking around but hey I didn't come to Amsterdam to walk around the hotel room did I. Everything worked except the WiFi was spotty at times. The staff is very friendly and the little map they give out was super helpful for traveling around.

Reviews.Title: “Citizen M is a winner!”
Reviews.Author: Michael L
Reviews.Content: Service and atmosphere was exceptional, especially with respect to the inexpensive room rates. Design of the hotel is comfortable and fashionable. The room was a little chilly even with the thermostat all the way up. Not in the city center, but it is very close to the Amsterdam Zuid station and a quick tram (#5) away from the Museumplein and P.C. Hoofdstraat.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: chrystalkerr
Reviews.Content: Stay one night last weekend, super room, no problems, helpful staff, good location, everyone should have a citizenM experience!

Reviews.Title: “A fab place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Sarah A
Reviews.Content: Although it isn't particularly near the city centre of Amsterdam, this hotel more than makes up for that in terms of service and ambience. As a lone female traveller that has stayed in some very high end hotels during my travels, this really does have to rank as one of my favourite. The common space is lovely and informal, where you can get a drink from the central bar, watch tv, and just generally lounge. It also creates an atmosphere where you can speak to other guests without feeling like the sad loner, and somehow the hotel and its staff seem to put everyone in a good mood. I also struggle to sleep in hotel beds, but these beds are amazing, resulting in a solid 8 hour sleep - something unheard of for me. The rooms are fairly compact, but again, as someone who stays in suites or large rooms, I much prefer these rooms and wonder if they are sound proof as even when the hotel is near to full I never hear a peep out of my 'neighbours'. As for the staff, they are a credit to the hotel. The portugese barman created a cocktail just for me, the foyer staff (I think he was south african) wanted to ensure the room would be to my liking, and last time I stayed, I ate a take out pizza in the foyer lounge with a friend, drank wine and watched the football. If you want room service, spas, and a footman to take care of your luggage then this place might not be for you. However if you want friendly staff, a brilliant bed and room, and a feeling that you are getting vaue for money then I would highly recommend this hotel. (And I never write hotel reviews).

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Murad K
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel for weekend getaway. Rooms are very small and compact. You should travel very light. There is no wardrobe or something else only three hangers to put on coat. It was freezing outside and heater can be set maximum 23 degrees, I felt cold in the room. Reception and lounge area is very warm, welcoming. You feel very comfotable. It is 15 mins to downtown with tram and only 5 mins to airport. Hav fun!!

Reviews.Title: “The best place where to spend a different weekend”
Reviews.Author: Magjias
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel where to spend a different sojourn and an unforgettable experience. But I wouldnâ€™t suggest staying longer than a weekend. The best thing in the hotel is the common space, so modern and comfortable where you can relax, watch TV or read a book. The room is so incredible and you really must see it to understand the difference with the rooms of any other hotel. The bed is huge and comfortable, itâ€™s funny to play with the remote control changing TV channel, the lights and the temperature in the room. The strangest thing is, of course, the toiiet and the shower and as many other reviewers wrote, you should visit the hotel with someone very close to you. We didnâ€™t have breakfast in the hotel as we thing itâ€™s too expensive but there is a nice Bagels&Beans just few minutes far front the hotel where itâ€™s possible to have a full breakfast spending 50% less than in the hotel. The hotel is located in a strategic position, just 10 minutes far from the airport (by train) and 10 min far from the Center (Dam) by tram (n.5), which stop is 200 meters from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: W0rldTraveller09
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the Blackberry DevCon Europe event at the nearby RAI Conference Centre. The hotel is very conveniently located a short walk across the park to the RAI, and is about 15 minutes into the city centre on the number 5 tram which stops just across the street. The hotel was perfect! Check in process was easy and quick via the computer terminal. The ground floor lounge and bar area is attractive and cozy with a relaxing atmosphere. All the staff were extremely friendly and attentive. The room, while small, is brilliantly designed, with a very comfortable bed and one of the best showers I've ever used! The moodpad and ability to control the colour of the lights, the blinds, the room temperature and the TV; which had a huge selection of channels and free movies to watch on demand was a fantastic touch. Unfortunately during my stay there was a power cut affecting the whole area on the first night which lasted almost an hour. The staff did a great job ensuring everyone was comfortable, and I received both an email and a letter of apology the following day offering complimentary refreshments and a free pair of travel socks! This was just one of those things and does not lower my opinion of the hotel. Would definitely recommend and stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Best service, amazing rooms, great ambiance!”
Reviews.Author: Zouko777
Reviews.Content: Fantastic stay! Already two times there! Very eaay to get to hotel - from airport take train (only EUR2.50 and 7 minutes - it's one stop) to Amsterdam Zuid station and from there it is 5 minutes walk. And after you checkin - which is all super easy - almost automatic - then going to city attractions is easy as well - just take Tram 5 to center - the stop is at the Hotel too - excellent! Rooms! Amazing! Wooow! People - you will really become friends with all personnel I think!!! Have a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fun,fun.”
Reviews.Author: BathMary
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It was a pleasant 15 minute walk to the museum quarter and the Heineken museum or the no 5 tram dropped off there before heading into the centre, which was only a half hours walk from the hotel. Highlights were the huge comfy bed, the free on demand movies, the great shower with changeable coloured lighting and the really friendly, really helpful staff. Buffet breakfast was good value and has a good choice. Free computers were in the lobby area to use too. We only stayed one night but this would have been perfect for a few nights stay, the room was great for relaxing, watching movies, sleeping and showering. We arrived in the snow but the room was warm, after we changed the setting. We will definately be staying in a citizenM again, we loved what it had to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable for 1, but for 2?”
Reviews.Author: Hemagen
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. It is a great value. I will be here for almost a week (first week of Feb 2012). The bed is big and comfy, and the hotel lobby has lots of areas to hang out, good snacks and breakfast. Free wifi. Nice helpful staff, but if you have trouble printing on the lobby computers, they aren't tech savvy enough to help. The rooms are cozy. Actually small if you are going to be more than one, as there is a bit of lack of privacy with the toilet and shower. And if your bathroom visit is a bit smelly, there is no separation between the toilet and the rest of the room (and I haven't found a fan above the toilet which would be handy). Stay here when visiting Amsterdam, I will again in March and probably April when I come back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the RAI”
Reviews.Author: Deeliteful
Reviews.Content: We stayed here whilst exhibiting at the RAI and it was perfect. The walk to the RAI through the park takes about 15 minutes. The hotel staff are superb especially the bar staff at night - their smiles are genuine and I applaud their staff hirer. Rooms are clean, comfortable and chic. Bed is really comfortable, shower is awesome. Will definitely be staying next year.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel version of lowfare airlines”
Reviews.Author: andrejens
Reviews.Content: I simply don't like the idea of everything being self-service, including check-in and check-out. I don't like that the room is in fact a bathroom/toilet with a bed in it. For the lone business traveller, a one or two night stay can work. For longer stays, and if you're sharing a room, forget it. Negatives: - small room, no room for suitcase - no ironing board - boring food, not even a descent breakfast. Microwave food. - toilet in the bedroom (check out pictures from their website) - rooms are cold (february) - changing a booking was literally impossible, and staff not very helpful - multifunction remote control (controls everything in the room, TV, radio, blinds, lights etc.) does not work properly, which is extremely annoying. Positives: + free WiFi + comfortable bed + free movies on-demand

Reviews.Title: “Happy Citizen”
Reviews.Author: Picalbcn
Reviews.Content: Have just spent the weekend at this cool hotel. Liked pretty much everything about it, the lobby, the room, the moodpad and its helpful staff, who could not have been nicer and more customer oriented. The distance from the city centre was not a problem, as it took us 10min by tram or taxi. We will definitely stay at this place again.

Reviews.Title: “A REALLY FUNKY HOTEL AND HELPFUL STAFF”
Reviews.Author: marialong19
Reviews.Content: I booked this as a stopover while waiting for a connecting flight which was some 9 hours later as we were on out way back from New York so was thankful for the rest. Dominic booked me in and I found him extremely helpful and his customer service was exceptional which is a nice change these days. The hotel is very modern and you can change the lighting in your room to different colours depending on your preference. Had a really comfortable sleep which was well needed. The only thing is the shower doesn't have much privacy as it is within the bedroom area with glass doors but I would still return to the hotel as everything else was excellent, even down to the communication facility they give you to keep in touch with your family while you are away. The hotel cannot be faulted on customer care, friendly staff, phonecall facility, wifi, and comfortable beds, although next to the airport we found our room very quiet and wouldn't hesitate to stay again. Hope Dominic continues working there as he is really excellent!!

Reviews.Title: “great experience on a budget, stay if you don't mind walking or Cabs”
Reviews.Author: t0ne00
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a Stag weekend last week. Yeah, I know what you're thinking, but our average age was mid 40's :) The hotel is a great experience and well worth checking out. As someone mentions below, only share a room with someone you know really well! The ground floor of the hotel looks a little like an Ikea showroom, all quirky furniture & open plan. It's very useable though & free Internet is a definate plus (we checked-in for our return flight and printed off boarding passes). There's a cool cafe, especially good for snacking at 3 in the morning **cough** and early morning coffee. The rooms are just damn funky. Make sure you close the shower door solidly before using, otherwise it doesnt work and you get very confused and hungover* (* not directly related to the shower). The toilet also is in a semi-circular pod, which closes to give privacy. This is the biggest drawback of the whole place although in reality, I used the very clean lobby toilets for "longer visits" and for a weekend trip, it really isnt an issue. I didn't even know about the mood lighting until I saw it on here! The Bed by the way is large and very comfy with a big flatshreen on a wall above, with a couple of free films. Staff were excellent, extremely keen to help & always smiling. The hotel is out a bit by Amsterdam Zuid station. It does make it extremely quick to the airport, but a cab, a long walk, a Metro or a tram into the town centre. We ended up doing 3 of these. When walking, if you plan your route well, you can go via parks or the Museums and it's an event in itself. The cab, even late night was â‚¬20-25, which considering how much you save on the room, is worth it. The tram was kinda slow, but only a 5 min walk from the hotel. We caught the "5". I think it was â‚¬3.50 for an hour ticked or â‚¬7 for 24 hours, we accidentally bunked when it became clear that the driver didn't want to talk to us! All in all it's a great adventure staing here and really worth it if you want to try something funky and different

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: mince963
Reviews.Content: This hotel is everything the website promises. Simple, stylish, clean, comfortable and great value for money. The bed is enormous and very comfortable.The drench shower is a dream.The mood pad to operate the lighting, heating, blinds and tv worked great. The check in was quick and easy and the staff were friendly, helpful and informative. The bar/breakfast area is good and has a wide selection of drinks and meals. The hotel is easy to find. From the airport take the train for 1 stop to Zuid station. Exit the station and walk across the square between the two WTC buildings.Walk through the underpass beneath the highway and then turn right when you pass the office/apartment block ( you will see the sign) There is ample space in the room for 2 people. The only downside was a lack of space for hanging clothes and no coffee making facilities ( essential 1st thing in the morning) The tram stop (no 5) is 5 mins from the front door( turn left and left again) and takes about 20 mins to the central station. We paid an extra 19â‚¬ for a 3 pm check out which was worth every cent. Our only regret is that we couldn't find a copy print of the "Saturday Night" artwork in the foyer near the lifts Can't wait to return again or for the London hotel to open.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: ewibholm
Reviews.Content: Loved staying here. Prompt service, modern, very clean and modern rooms and the price is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “So Trendy... Maybe at the expense of comfort?”
Reviews.Author: laoisgirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in January. Absolutely worthy of it's 'trendiest hotel in the world' status, some of the thinking is revolutionary to our current service industry... E.g. The sense that the staff weren't working, the were just hanging out having fun but would help if you needed it... Kind of worked. Sort of felt like the cool kids had built their own hotel. I'm glad to have seen it but not sure I'd choose to stay again (unless budget insisted). For me the deal breaker is having the toilet in the bedroom - which effectively left me with the confused sense that I was sleeping in my bathroom... While its not for me because I like my comforts too much, it is clever, clean, Ã¼ber-trendy, and a friendly place for anyone travelling alone.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, quirky and unique!”
Reviews.Author: lilgreeny
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights on a short trip to Amsterdam, it was located about 10 minutes from the train station by foot and a 2 minute walk to the tram stop to get into town. The trip into town took about 15 mins - so itâ€™s located slightly out of the centre but trams are frequent so no problems what so ever! The rooms are very quiet, as the hotel is located in a quiet suburb as opposed to the noisy town. The rooms are quite small but very quirky, with a large bed and glass walled toilets and showers! The lobby has lots of sofa seating with Apple macs (free wireless) and plenty of books. The cafÃ©/bar is quite expensive, but Amsterdam is generally expensive so it was nothing new. The self check in facilities were also quick and convenient. We wanted to do a few trips whilst in Amsterdam â€“ the Kuekenhof flower garden being one of them, so we got the train and then a bus which cost us about Â£20 each. When we arrived we paid the full entrance fee of Â£10 to find absolutely no flowers in there! The tulip fields were one of the things we went to Amsterdam for. Although it was the end of April, there were a few tubs of tulips but no carpeted floor of or tulips to be seen anywhere (which were pictured so heavily over all the leaflets) This was very disappointing as they must know when itâ€™s the cutting season, yet still charge full price and neglect to tell people! Bear this in mind if going in April! Overall we had a great stay at the Citizen M and thought this was a great hotel for exploring Amsterdam. If you stayed right in the centre youâ€™d pay more for somewhere that wasnâ€™t half as nice so it was worth the tram ride.

Reviews.Title: “Modern design, friendly staff but just a little too out of centre for short breaks”
Reviews.Author: UncleOswald
Reviews.Content: I spent most of my time in Amsterdam with a cold and arrived late one evening ready for a hot tea and my bed. The staff members were friendly and greeted me with enthusiasm - and were very helpful when helping me to use the self check-in terminals. You can choose from a room with a city-view, or a garden-view - unless you're on one of the higher floors (I was on the first floor), it doesn't really matter. The lobby is stylish and it's been designed to feel like you're sat in your fashionable friend's lounge. Books concerning art and design adorn the shelves and the TVs show various European channels. There's a real hostel feel to it and nearly all of the employees are in their twenties - yet there are many older guests staying too. The rooms are designed either for singles or couples. They're small and compact, but the space is used brilliantly - two cylinders form the toilet and shower - the toilet is covered in matte glass, but the shower is transparent (it's not really the place I'd choose if holidaying with friends), but it was a fun touch. The entire room's functions are controlled with a remote control - you can turn off or dim the lights with it, change channel on the TV, change the temperature etc. And the bed was wonderful - it's a huge king-sized, very comfy bed. And everything is very clean! The hotel is in the heart of the business quarter - it's around 20 minutes by tram (tram number 5, which leaves from outside the hotel) to the centre, but the tram was packed every time I rode it (I was being grumpy with my cold, but I'd have appreciated a seat). Alternatively you can take the metro to the central station - the metro is around a 5 minute walk from the hotel next to the World Trade Center. I was only in Amsterdam for a few days, so the 20-30 minute journeys weren't ideal and being in the heart of the city would have been easier - but it was a minor issue. I really wanted to visit Restaurant Greetje while in Amsterdam, I have heard many wonderful things - but due to my cold (shall I mention that one more time?!) I ended up eating noodle soup in nearby Wagamama's. Breakfast at CitizenM was perfectly ok, but for 10 â‚¬ (if you book the night before, otherwise it's something like 13 â‚¬ if you pay on the day) was a little steep for what there was - croissants, bread rolls, pain au chocolats, cheeses, fruit and muesli with yogurt, plus a juice and a hot drink. The bar is open 24 hours for food, but it was also expensive for what there was - I paid around 8 Euros for a lasagne that I had to heat in the microwave myself.

Reviews.Title: “very exciting, hip place to stay”
Reviews.Author: creativity2001
Reviews.Content: The hotel has some of the best amenities that I've seen in a while, especially for a budget place. Small but very attractive functional room. Free movies, comfortable bed. Good food at reasonable prices. Friendly people. At the airport. This is going to be the hot new chain.

Reviews.Title: “Minimalistic, futuristic, great service, rooms a bit small”
Reviews.Author: LucisInFundus
Reviews.Content: This place definitely takes modern to a whole new level. I liked all the energy efficient steps they've taken to give you comfort while minimizing waste. The shower, which looks like a capsule from space, works only when the doors are shut, most everything in the room works via a remote control. The rooms are super modern and the bed, I have to say, is the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in, even better than my own, it was a king size and the sheets also super-soft. It does offer very good value for the money, especially knowing the average cost of similar hotels in Amsterdam. The only thing is, it's not really in the middle of it all and you have to walk 10 minutes or so to get to the nearest cafe' or restaurant. However they do compensate by offering a whole range of foods and beverages, that are actually pretty good and inexpensive, as well as several common areas to enjoy your dinner, watch TV or just hang out. They even have Mac computers available for free and working all the time. If you pre-pay for breakfast do keep in mind that they do not have scrambled or fried eggs, just boiled eggs, but other than that you can get pretty much all you want and coffee is really good. The staff was very friendly, very young but very pleasant and helpful and also seemed to be happy to be working there, which is not something you often see in the hotel industry. Tram #5 will take you to Hotel Citizen from downtown in abut 10-15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Very good price - quality ratio”
Reviews.Author: Ceciel81
Reviews.Content: Great location near station zuid. Friendly staff who are there to help at anytime. Perfect (very small) room, with all the facilities you need. Personnaly i like the lobby to hang out. Beautifull designer furniture, a lot of space, but also quiet corners to relax. In the morning there's no traditional breakfast. They do sell croissants, yoghurt etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good value b”
Reviews.Author: TravellerfromTO
Reviews.Content: Okay, it's my fault I got chocolate on the bed sheets. It is Amsterdam, home of milk chocolate, after all. But you'd think the cleaning staff might have changed the sheets. I spent my last of three nights at the hotel sleeping on my shame. That detail aside, Citizen M represents good value for Amsterdam. Central Station is about 20 minutes away on the tram. Use of space in the room is really commendable and the beds are quite comfortable. I didn't pre-pay the breakfast -- which I understand is about 9 Euros for all you can out. I chose a la carte and my choices amounted to about 7 Euros a day, which seemed reasonable to me. Free WiFi, nice common spaces and free movies are a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Good.... But I understand why it's so cheap!”
Reviews.Author: Keyz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very conveniently located if you are coming from the airport. It's very close and easy to get to with the interlink train. Once at the station take your left and walk straight across the square, wtc building is on the right and side. As soon as I got there, one of the stewards welcomes me and helped with the checkin. Within seconds, I was asked to insert my card and pay the full amount. It is an additional â‚¬19.95 for early check in which I did as I got there early morning and check in is not until 2pm. There is also an additional cost id paying by card that is not maestro. Once all had been done I went up to my room. This was a lot smaller than I expected. The bed is huge but I would say that is the only main advantage. The tv is also of decent size but the screen is so close that you can't really get the full benefit of it. I was able to work the moodpad within minutes and started flicking through the channels (no MTV). The stewards in general are very helpful day and night. They always greet you with a smile and are nice (maybe a bit too nice at times). The 24hr kitchen/ bar area is very convenient if not overpriced. The food on offer is decent but I'd advise getting food before returning to the hotel as in 2 days there I did not see a restaurant close by. The n5 tram goes very frequently from centraal station (which you have to wait for at point 4 near the food area across the road from the station) and it is a good 20-25 minutes ride to the hotel. There is a very short walk from the tram stop to the hotel. I did not take the night bus but it stops at the same place. I enjoyed the location of the hotel a little bit outside of the city centre as it gave us a break from the noisy touristy city. There seemed to always be people travelling back to the hotel on the tram (especially at night) so we felt relatively safe. The free wifi and mac computers downstairs are a great feature for travellers as it allowed us to plan our itineraries. I would only recommend staying here if you are very good friends with the person you are sharing with or are in an established relationship. Do not stay here if it is your first romantic trip away as the separation between bed toilet and shower is non existent! I would ho back to the hotel but this time would get a room by myself. If you are only over for 1 night and a short weekend you are probably better off staying closer to the city so you enjoy Amsterdam to the max and do not spend time comuting.

Reviews.Title: “Real Low-Cost Luxury”
Reviews.Author: lawrence T
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful place to stay when in Amsterdam. It's easy to reach. The service is great. The staff is friendly. The room concept is thrilling. And the price is right!

Reviews.Title: “Has Potential.”
Reviews.Author: canislupus1
Reviews.Content: We read the many glowing reviews of this hotel and were really looking forward to our stay (2 rooms for one night on 30th Dec 2011). The hotel is in a really nice area of Amsterdam, just a few minutes walk from Amsterdam Zuid station and right beside the number 5 Tram halt. There are a good selection of shops/cafes/restaurants on Beethovenstraat which runs along the side of the hotel (we recommend the Gaucho steak house). It takes less than 10 minutes to get to Dam Square by tram. The hotel itself is ultra modern, really impressive, spacious lobby area with a well stocked bar/cafe/shop. Also iMac computers for free use by guests. There is no "check-in desk" as such - just a few self check-in terminals. Unfortunately we were presented with a reserved and not very enthusiastic member of staff who was standing beside these terminals. We had booked 2 rooms which meant that we had to complete two separate check-ins (AND PAY 2 x 2.50 EURO CHARGES FOR PAYING BY CREDIT CARD). So I was annoyed at having to pay this extra 5 Euro which had not been made clear at the time of booking.
