The female member of staff was muttering something about City Tax (I am aware about City Tax and have no problem with it). My problem was the 2 separate credit card charges for one single booking. When my sister asked the female staff member whether we should choose the City View or Garden View rooms, she was greeted with a smirk and raised eyes. Later when we had visited our rooms and returned to the bar for a drink, the same female member of staff was eating her dinner and gawking at us from across the room. I don't think this is very professional behaviour. This was the exception as every other member of staff we encountered was friendly and helpful. I just shows how one person can really change your perception of a place. So on to the rooms - VERY clean, compact, has everything you need. The Phillips Mood Pad is a great idea, but mine was faulty. I could not choose the free movies, games and music and my window blinds kept closing by themselves, also on 2 occasions all power in my room totally shut down. You have to make your own bed (although the mattress is comfortable). There is very little space for hanging clothes. I would be willing to give it another chance and hope that the management can address these issues.

Reviews.Title: “stylish, modern, hip”
Reviews.Author: SkÃ¥ningen
Reviews.Content: Fast check in, small room, very nice lobby area! Friendly staff, great coffe, need improvements on food. A cool hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic decor with tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: jsjj88
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in this hotel, first impressions were excellent. The lobby was ultra modern with decor that exudes style and exuberance. Hotel staff were also incredibly friendly. The room itself is puny though, there's hardly space to stow the luggages and walk around without hitting something. The concept is great, but there has to be a balance between space and style. The mood pad didn't always work the way it should. Window blinds did not fold or move in the right direction, room lights sometimes take at least five presses on the remote control to turn off, TV controls are unresponsive, and the list goes on. I'm not sure if it boils down to bad luck, but I did change the room once due to faulty air conditioning, and the problems persisted. Travellers staying in this hotel should take note of these niggling problems just in case they happen to you. But otherwise, stay in this hotel and enjoy what it has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute of it!”
Reviews.Author: crazydogs
Reviews.Content: What a fun, energetic hotel. We loved the usable lobby spaces, free use of the computers and the 24-hour canteen. The bed was SO comfortable and of course, the mood pad was fun to play with. As someone else stated, the staff really helped make the experience fantastic. Gregg was a very attentive ambassador who really took care of our needs. Another ambassador recommended a really great Indonesian restaurant where we could get the whole rice table experience. We would love to revisit Amsterdam since we were only there for 2 nights. When we do, we will definitely stay at citizenM. Sure it wasn't right in the heart of the city, but I don't know that I'd want to stay there. The tram stop was so close it really didn't matter.

Reviews.Title: “Neat (in all senses) place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jia-daddy
Reviews.Content: Very cool and quirky design, well thought out, space-efficient fascinating little rooms with big comfy beds, very well maintained and didn't seem at all cramped. Great coffee (everywhere in Amsterdam), staff enthusiastic and helpful. Wonderful transit system, easy to get anywhere you want in Amsterdam in little time. A unique restaurant within 5 minutes walk (organic, based on Dutch historical cooking traditions but innovative). Would definitely stay at CitizenM again - my kids would get a kick out of the rooms. Would love to eat at that restaurant again - wish I could remember the name, but they can tell you about it at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing. Best Hotel In Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: Lisi_rosebud
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply amazing and the staff are great! I stayed for 3nights with my boyfriend and we loved it so much. About a 15/20 tram journey into the central station of Amsterdam. But tram 5 and bus stops literally outside the hotel door. The rooms are small(ish) but they are full of brilliant gadgets and fun quirky suprises.The bed is SO BIG and really comfy. The shower dome is transparent and the toilet cubicle is frosted, but there is also a curtain seperating the bed from the rest of the room. Both shower & toilet have cool changing mood lighting inside which you can control from your "MOOD PAD" which is a remote which controls pretty much everything inside your room. There is a safe in the room. A small hanging space for clothes but a huge draw under the bed. Bin, Sink, Mirror, UK Plug sockets, bedside tables, chair and a cuddly toy also included. Massive lobby with mac laptops, printers, free Internet. 24/7 Bar and Food counter which stocks so much and is pretty cheap.You can also order food & drinks to your room. Hotel is non smoking. Seriously, the best hotel in Amsterdam. So cheap considering how awesome the hotel is. We've already booked to go again we loved it that much.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: nella87
Reviews.Content: Ok the rooms were small, but how much time do you spend in your room when you are in such a beautiful country for only a few days? Even so, they were great, the mood pad was so much fun, having a shower was interesting and they had complimentary movies!. Their lobby was so relaxing, very big, books everywhere and the furniture was amazing. There is a tram stop right outside that takes you right into the city. Very convenient and cheap. Would definately stay again! Miss that king size bed so so much!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect 5 night stay”
Reviews.Author: JC72Houston
Reviews.Content: As soon as we arrived the great staff made us feel welcomed.The hotel does not have a regular restaurant, mostly snacks, drinks, and light self serve meals.The hotel is about 100 yards from the #5 tram stop and a number of restaurants are two stops away.First, the room is somewhat small, but well laid out. It has mood lighting and music. The circular shower was great and the bed was comfortable. The great part of of our stay was the staff, friendly helpfull and fun. They are generally younger, but with good knowledge of how to make you feel special. To name a few special one's: Jess from Jamaica, Gregory from Poland, Marcos from Portugal, and Amy from Norway. They work all areas of the front, help with check-in, as bartenders (Jess mixes a mean Cucumber Martini), and cashiers. Multi-talented. Since we were traveling by train the #5 tram goes directly to the Centrale Station.

Reviews.Title: “A great place 2 B, nice people, comfi bed(room)!”
Reviews.Author: Tibajo
Reviews.Content: I come from Holland, so always very critical about the Dutch Hotels/Restaurants:-)) This one is just a very chill, nice, clean, designed, great ambassadors, good food, place-to-B! The room; WOW factor! You just need to experience it! It made me smile:-D Also real ok to be there by yourself, friends or as a couple. Everyone is so welcome. The bed is very comfi, the room is amazingly designed, very practical and nice. The room views are not great but the area is a real good one, easy to walk or go by tram to the city center. great shopping area also...The only thing they need to think about; where can I hang my clothes? But thats a not-that-important-thingy:-) Also good to have a private or business date/appointment in the lounge. Or just to be by yourself to read a book:-) Many different choices to sit or hang around, quiet or in a crowd. Ok nice food you need to get yourself, also very relax, not a restaurant to sit on tables. A bar where people are very willing to help and serve. The prices are also very ok. For sure I'll come around again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for room only stay”
Reviews.Author: Mslemonkisses
Reviews.Content: I'll start by pointing out the location of CitizenM; it is across the road from a tram stop which is about 15/20 minutes from the city centre. I found this to be ideal because seeing everything outside of the centre on the tram helped us find a few more places to explore. The only thing I would really fault about this hotel is the food. We decided to stay in one night to have dinner in the small lounge downstairs but were very surprised when we were expected to microwave our own meal. When paying Â£8 for a very small portion of spaghetti bolognese I would have thought the least they could have done was prepare it for us. It was especially frustrating that the staff were sat around the bar reading magazines while we cleared our own ready meal remnants away. Having said that, the staff were very friendly and if it isn't their job to deal with food then I suppose they aren't at fault. As for the room, it was very impressive and although the moodpad didn't always do as it was told it was a fun experience to use it, and the free movies were great. I would stay in this hotel again but definitely find food and drink elsewhere as both are extremely overpriced in the hotel apart from anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Emma L
Reviews.Content: Before we were even shown our room we fell in love with this place due to the staff - so friendly and happy to answer any questions or go out of their way to help you. This place is the perfect welcome to the trendsetting city of Amsterdam. A contemporary, welcoming and comfortable hotel that's great for a short stay. Another note - having the shower and toilet cubicles in the room is a great use of space, however, very initimate - I would only recommend sharing a room with someone you are very close to, ie. willing to share toilet noises with.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value-for-money hotel!”
Reviews.Author: unpolished_gem
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited 8 cities in UK and Europe on our recent trip and citizenM was definitely the best we stayed at. It had left a very good impression on us, and we will surely recommend it to our friends. The self-service check-in kiosk was fuss-free. The room was not very big, but it was very clean and well-thought-through. It is conveniently located near the train station from the airport and tram stop to the city. The staff were friendly and helpful. However, choose citizenM only if you would be comfortable with a clear glass bathroom and an opaque-glass toilet.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: Carmel87
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the second time and we will be comming back next year too. The hotel is perfect. Not far from the city center. They have a "canteen" where you can get breakfast or a drink in the evening. I find it funny people complain about the small rooms my boyfriend is 6ft 7 and we have plenty of room. The bed and shower are huge and the room is cleaned/towels changed daily. Cant say I have any negatives about this hotel. The best bit about this hotel is the staff. Always willing to help they feel like they have been your friends for years. Cant wait for next year!

Reviews.Title: “Not for Business Travelers”
Reviews.Author: Helen711
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a total of 8 days on two visits. This hotel has been renovated to appeal to the younger crowd. This is no traditional front desk; check in-check out is through self-service computer kiosks. The room style is very modern. The shower is a glass tube that reminds me of Woody Allen's orgazmatron in the movie "Sleeper." The work space is a very, very small desk. Most importantly, anyone interested in connecting to the internet should seek other accommodations. Internet pages take an average of 5 to 20 seconds to render. One evening the internet did not work at all. I will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Robert E
Reviews.Content: CitizenM has been a very nice experience to us twice is three weeks. We slept at Amsterdam Schiphol Airport as well as in the city. Rooms are a big surprise. A third of maybe half the size of an ordinary hotelroom, yet efficiently stuffed with comfortable, thoughtful, nicely designed items. And witty copy lines to be found everywhere, from the walls to the packaging of the complimentary shower gel. Nice staff. A lounge filled with eye catching design furniture and apple computers. Last but not least: great value for money! Please CitizenM people, open hotels around the globe quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Unique and compact”
Reviews.Author: jjstives
Reviews.Content: This is the third â€œcompactâ€� modern style hotel I have found in Europe, the others being Hotel Concorde in Frankfurt and the Motel One chain in Berlin and other cities in Germany. Each of these new age hotels offers compact living space suitable for one traveler who does not require the add-on and costly features of stereotype hotels. Put a different way, this means: if you are accustomed to Hilton, Sheraton or Marriott, want room service, large rooms suitable to hold private meetings in and dozens of other things we often take for granted, then this style property is probably not for you. Citizen M has taken the concept of cramming many good things into a small space very much to heart. Approximately 25-30% of the total floor space in the room is taken up with the monster bed, which goes from wall to wall to window. The beds are remarkable with firm support and good linens that fitâ€¦a point that a few supposedly up-scale hotels might consider. Everything I saw was spotless and cleaning was an on-going process. My towels and sheets were changed every day and my room was the cleanest I have seen in any hotel, ever. There is no bathroom per se. Circular glass cylinder enclosures, reaching from floor to ceiling and which open like a clam shell, house a full size toilet and a separate shower. This is a fully enclosed shower, not the kind where the drain is in the floor and when you use it everything gets wet. The wash stand is separate, so in theory, three people could share a room with one being in the totally enclosed shower with telephone hand set type shower, plus a wonderfully full rain shower, one could be in the frosted glass toilet cylinder and one could be at the basin or in bed. But I would not recommend these accommodations for more than two people and this should be two who are VERY comfortable with each other and donâ€™t expect ANY privacy in the room, because there isnâ€™t any. True, a filmy gauze curtain can be pulled between the bed and the rest of the room, but thereâ€™s not much wiggle room, so any personal matters will be shared unless someone leaves. If you have a ton of clothing that needs to be hung up, forget it. My room had three hangers and space for no more. A shirt that I hung up to get out the wrinkles constantly got caught when I opened and closed the door. The room offers remote control for everything: door locks, TV, blinds, night shutters, music, lighting and temperature. The remote was sometimes pokey and sometimes had to reset itself, leaving me with TV blaring and no way to shut it off. This can be annoying and I suspect the software is constantly being upgraded. Everything that the remote operates has limits. I found no way to get really adequate light to read in bed and the room temperature control only had six settings. If you wanted warmer or colder, it is not going to happen. Some of these pre-set parameters need to be revised. I stayed in the â€œcityâ€� CitizenM for four nights and then transferred to the Schiphol Airport version for the last night so that Iâ€™d be close to the terminal for an early morning flight. More on that in a separate review. The city hotel is a 20 minute train, tram or Metro ride into the Central Station. This is fine in good weather, but the trials of walking to the tram or Metro stops in rain, wind and cold were making me wish for a nice in-city room where everything was nearby. If you arrive from the airport, the train stops at the nearby south station, but the directions I got were confusing and instead of a ten minute walk in the rain, it took me nearly three hours to get to the hotel after getting on the wrong train, taking many wrong turns and getting wrong directions. By the way, everyone I met spoke perfect English. The hotel has a well stocked buffet canteen with full bar, plenty of snacks and breakfast in the morning at an additional 9.95Euro. For traveling Americans, this $15, self-service, continental breakfast is probably a good deal, but they donâ€™t offer a lot of choice other than coffee/tea, juice, yogurt, excellent rolls and croissants and fruit. Itâ€™s still a fair price because there is nothing else nearby. The staff was very helpful and the internet area had good free access with large flat screens and comfortable seating. Internet access throughout the hotel is also free. This is the way it should be. I felt safe coming and going day and night, but the area, even though residential, seems to share the unfortunate Dutch reputation for giving one an eerie feeling. Two expensive cars were broken into on one night while I was there and I saw evidence of homeless camping just across the street. For most people, this would not be an issue, but it is also worth noting that there was no evidence of police or security personnel anywhere except in the downtown Central Station. The hotel was very quiet. There was a small safe that just fit my mini laptop, phone and wallet. The twin lifts worked well and quietly. The large lobby was friendly and accommodating. So hereâ€™s the split: are you willing to stay outside the city, in a clean, comfortable, safe environment for about half (or less) of what in-city hotels will charge and for which you may get less value? If you donâ€™t want to ride public transport, your decision is made for you. If you want to try what is perhaps the coming wave of hospitality, try this one. If you bring a friend, be prepared to do a lot together: shower, sleep, etc, etc. One other note: I arrived early in the morning and although they had a room for me, there was an additional charge of about $25 for early access. When you add this fee into the base rate, plus the optional breakfast charge, you are getting up in the same range as in-city properties, so what may look like a deal may not end up being so. I liked this concept despite its drawbacks and may well book a CitizenM again if I have the time and inclination to stay outside the five canal rings of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: bear000
Reviews.Content: I have spent many years travelling internationally for work so I know something about hotels and what to expect. I went to Amsterdam for a few days' break on my own and I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Citizen M hotel. The highlight for me was the open plan modern and very tastefully furnished lobby / "living area". It was the perfect place to unwind with a book in the evening. The rooms were clean and the bed was one of the most comfortable I have slept in. The shower in the room has completely see through walls so if you are sharing, you would want to be pretty good friends. The staff were extremely helpful and very genuine. They are all quite young so the place has the feeling of an upmarket youth hostel. The tram stops outside the hotel so it's very easy to get into the centre of Amsterdam. Well done to Citizen M, keep up the good work, and many thanks for your hospitality!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous312
Reviews.Content: Amazing experience! Self-service check-in/check-out but ambassadors always on hand to help and make sure everything is ok. Helped with local info about trams etc. Fresh towels every day. Mood pad controlled everything in the room, novelty quickly wears off. Luxurious rooms with an amazing bed. Quick walk from train station and just round the corner from tram so no difficulty reaching city centre. Located on a lovely, quiet street. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Citizen as always!”
Reviews.Author: Em_Jack_11
Reviews.Content: Conveniently priced, clean, Ãºber contemporary - but it's no surprise, as that just comes as standard with the CitizenM chain! I've now stayed at both the CitizenM in Glasgow Centre & Amsterdam Centre, and would use any excuse to try the one at Schipol airport now too! I can honestly say my only complaints are that there was no cooked breakfast at the Amsterdam hotel which we paid 20 euros for.. (full english in Glasgow, and I know, we're not in England when we're in Amsterdam - but there were plenty of cafe's providing a meaty bratwurst to satisfy my carnivorous needs) ....and finally, my second complaint is that there aren't more CitizenM hotels around the world, 3 just isn't enough!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: Ziapa
Reviews.Content: Come here only if for you a bunk bed or a luxury hotel are the same thing!! The room has no wardrobe and is basically a bathroom with a bed. I chose this hotel since i had to fly early in the morning and wanted to be close to the airport without spending a fortune. I arrived at 11am and i had to pay 20 extra euros to check in without waiting 2pm. No minibar in the room, no space, toilet in the middle. No privacy but position of toilett versua bed embarassing even if one is on his/her own. I am surprised the hotel has good reviews and i was mislead by them and the pictures. The hotel is walking distance, but the road is windy and cold and by what seems a high road!! 10 mins from airport. I never write reviews, but i felt i had to, if out there there are people who might wonder which hotel to choose near schiphol airport. I could have spent a bit more, but have a decent room elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Hip, comfortable, convenient, well priced, clean”
Reviews.Author: Harry K
Reviews.Content: What else could you ask for? I stay here almost every time I come to Amsterdam for work. It's about 15 min to schiphol by train. It's clean and modern and totally unique. It has a self serve kitchen open 24/7. It has a great look and the rooms, while small, totally feel functional and cozy. My only complaints? Last trip I had slow and spotty internet service; something i hadn't seen there before so maybe someone was going crazy downloading movies. And, when I first start running water into the sink it sometimes pushes up some smelly odors as I'm washing my face; something I've noticed in multiple rooms. I just hold my breath for a second until the smell clears. That's it. On the plus side, the staff is wonderfully polite and helpful. The open lobby space is inviting to just hang out and relax or to work. The artwork and decor is lively and fresh. There are a few good restaurants within 10 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable place close to Lawyer's Row”
Reviews.Author: Linda G
Reviews.Content: I am an old lady and still enjoyed my stay here! It is trendy but very comfortable and the staff are all great. Very reasonable price and terrific location.

Reviews.Title: “Very Cool”
Reviews.Author: world1201
Reviews.Content: Well this was very different from any hotel I have ever stayed in but that was in no way a bad thing! It is easy to get to by the tram from the train station, and there are lots of very helpful employees at the train station to help you. The hotel looks like a large glass rectangular because all of the rooms face out I guess. It has a very modern feel to it that some may not be crazy about but I really enjoyed it. The rooms have remote control shades, the shower and toilet each have their own sort of tube/tank things (its like a a big tube that has a sliding door and has mood lighting in it) which are right in the middle of the room, so there isn;t really a separate bathroom. And they have the COMFIEST BEDS EVER!!! sersiously this thing is amazing. There are nice sitting areas in the lobby with books and tvs. There is also a cafe where you can get juice, sandwiches, fruit, etc. Also free computers with internet access. The rooms are kinda of tight for two people but if you want a reasonably priced hotel with some style then this is a good choice. It is on the outer edge of the city but you can walk in which is actually a pretty nice walk. Or you can easily take the tram back in. Amsterdam is a great city. It is so vibrant and people are very friendly. The Van Gogh museum is AMAZING!!!! I really liked this hotel and recommended it to some friends for their trip and they enjoyed it as well.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome bed”
Reviews.Author: Amiralij
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this really trendy property for 2 nights. beautiful building and luxurious rooms with Awesome bed! Room amenities are great, everything you need is there. The hotel is located in a very nice street and is accessible by Tram, Train, Metro, bus. No difficulty at all to reach the city center when Tram 13 station is just in a walking distance. On top of this you should add free TV channels that makes your life even better ;) It's a total value for the money and the experience is unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Are you a Citizen?”
Reviews.Author: TheFunk
Reviews.Content: Very quick to get to from the airport which was convenient. Arriving early there was no problem with storing our bags until later and all the staff I encountered throughout our stay were exceptionally helpful and extremely pleasant. There's a nice vibe on the ground floor and it's relaxed and all very stylish with the fun and clever branding keeping it just the right side of smug. 14 hours later we returned to the hotel and headed to our room completely exhausted. This is probably not the Ideal way to first encounter a CitizenM hotel room as the all controlling remote takes a little getting used to (I still have yet to work out why one of the lighting presets changed the channel on the tv...?) The coloured lighting is cool but to get the full effect you need to dim the main lights something I only worked out how to do the next morning (hold down the wall switch). On entering the room, and once having weaved between the glass cylindrical tube containing toilet and the other tube containing the shower, you're presented with the bed. The bed itself is massive and runs wall to wall in front of an equally wide window. The actual room is pretty small though. We got a room with a view over the offices in the distance which fitted with the look of the room. As others have said given the toilet is in the middle of the room it is perhaps not suited to couples in the early stages of a relationship. Room soundproofing seemed fairly average and I was aware of general noise from the corridor during the night and morning. Free Wi-Fi was useful and getting in to town is very straight forward as the tram stop is almost opposite the hotel and takes you right in to the centre of Amsterdam. Great for a weekend but I'm not sure if the novelty could possibly wear a little thin over the course of a week (chance would be a fine thing). For one weekend at least though I was a fully fledged citizen.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: LHTravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a few months ago and already I want to go back! What an amazing hotel, placed a little down from the city centre, it is still very accessible and convenient with a straight tram stop outside the hotel. The rooms are great. Really cool! Totally different decor with really comfy beds and big tv's. It's a little small AND the shower and toilet are kind of on view - so make sure you know the person your staying with well - but don't let this put you off. The lounge area and bar etc are fabulous, great just to sit in a have a coffee. The staff are also top notch. Very helpful and accomodating. Everytime I am in Amsterdam, this is where I will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Let me tell you about THE BED!”
Reviews.Author: DonProvolone
Reviews.Content: It didn't take me long to decide where to start from! It's definitely the bed! Wall to wall, 2.5x2.5 metres (well, approximately), it's the best bed experience you can get in an affordable hotel! Luckily, it doesn't end there. I mean, a photo of the bed was enough to convince me the first time, but the overall quality of my stay made me return again and again. If you're looking for cheap & chic accommodation, don't look any further. The room is small, but comfortable and sooo trendy it... hurts! You can even choose the colour of lighting! The shower and the toilet are in glass booths and if you're not really close to the person you're travelling with, it may get a little awkward. But then again, there's a curtain! You can draw it and stay in bed... or you can go to the lobby. Yes, that is the next best thing at CitizenM. You can have 'breakfast' any time during the day, or coffee, or tea, or just relax and enjoy one of the coffee table books. It's all there! Oh, and computers too. For free! Don't let the distance from the city centre put you off. The tram stop is right outside, though you can actually walk to the centre. Last but not least, they have the hippiest, friendliest staff there is! You don't just enjoy your stay. You make friends! Don't think twice, just make sure you make your reservation well in advance. Room rates change depending on the demand and the hotel is really popular. Hurry up!

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel with a cool design”
Reviews.Author: szabcsee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great value for money. For it's reasonable price you get a clean and very cool room with it's capsule shower and claustrophobic toilette. The bed is super comfortable and everything is neat and tidy. The staff is friendly and helpful and you can get a lot of things in the cafeteria for a very decent price. The Wi-Fi is free and you can use the iMacs in the lounge for free. It is a bit outside of the city but the tram 5 and the night bus brings you anywhere within 15 minutes and it has a great connection to the airport. Better than Central Station. I can recommend to anyone who wants to stay in Amsterdam for a decent price and don't mind being a bit outside of the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay & value for money”
Reviews.Author: snowrache29
Reviews.Content: This is a fab hotel! The check in/out process is effortless and fast, the staff are friendly & helpful but are not in your face. They let you do as you please but are always at hand if you need help. The rooms are amazing! Space age & different and not to everyones taste, but we loved it! The mood pad is genius and the Rain shower is one of the best showers i have ever had, and usually i am a bath girl but this was great. The bed was lovely and we had one the best night sleeps in a long time! I am very tempted to buy the sheets they use online as they were so nice! We had the breakfast and it was around 9 euros each and was worth it. We ate at Wagamamas which is just around the corner from the hotel and this was a pleasant experience as the staff there were very good. We used the trains & trams whilst in Amsterdam and found them to be very good & easy to use, as are the machines which we used to buy tickets. The hotel is about 5 mins away from Amsterdam Zuid station. Only niggle about the hotel is the lack of storage space, as by the morning our room seemed to be very untidy with all our baggage etc everywhere. But we only stayed one night as we were travelling onto Zandvoort so it wasn't too much of an issue. All in all a great stay & can't wait to return to the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Funky and fun!”
Reviews.Author: Stuart93A
Reviews.Content: A repeat visit and an even stronger impression than the first time. Striking, modern decor. Friendly and helpful staff. Modern and comfortable rooms. Comfortable public spaces to relax in. Free wi-fi throughout. All-you-can-eat continental breakfast (extra charge). Direct train ride from the airport (though not the city centre line!). Short tram ride to the city centre. A memorable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Top class”
Reviews.Author: Denise C
Reviews.Content: I am just back from a trip from Amsterdam with my boyfriend and we stayed in Citizen M Amsterdam City and from the moment we walked through the doors, we felt so welcome by all the staff and immediately felt at home. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, and had perfect English - booking taxis for us and giving us advice on places to go and things to see - and the check in and check out service was very simple and efficient. The rooms are compact but have everything you need and are so clean too. The bed - well we nearly didn't leave the room at all because it was so big and comfortable with free movies, free Skype phone and mood lighting. Downstairs, you've a 24 hour bar and food service should you get peckish or thirsty during the night. It's a perfect location too - less than 5 min walk from Zuid station which is only a 5 min train journey from Schipol airport, and the tram stop to the city centre - Museum Quarter, Entertainment Quarter, Dam Square etc - is just around the corner and takes only 10 mins. We loved every minute of our stay and were very impressed with Afonso and the rest of the staff. We wouldn't hesitate in recommending it to our family and friends and would go back ourselves in a heartbeat. We're already planning our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel :-)”
Reviews.Author: Zoe6631
Reviews.Content: Visited this hotel in early October 2011 me and my boyfriend had a very pleasant stay, straight forward walk from the train station to the hotel (the public transport is excellent in Amsterdam), checked straight into our room no problem, great facilities in room, mood pad, shower etc and the bed is AMAZING. The reception staff were very helpful providing maps and even a plaster for a blister!!!!! The only thing that would have added to our stay would have been better breakfast facilities (they do a small selection & a breakfast bag). This hotel is easy to reach on a the tram line, we did not use any other forms of public transport when we were there. Brilliant hotel would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Totally different but cool! A must try!”
Reviews.Author: diEseLcHick4
Reviews.Content: Bit pricey but then again its a good price when comparing to other places to stay in Amsterdam. Rooms are small but totally cool! The rooms are called moodpads and you can set the mood for the room via the remote which changes the lights colors all over. An experience you must try!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel Staff”
Reviews.Author: mummyger
Reviews.Content: I have just returned home from my stay at the hotel and i travelled with my 9 year old and thought i would share my experience: Firstly on arrival to schipol we simply hopped on the train to Amsterdam Zuid which was the 1st stop from the airport. Unfortunately the station on arrival is not well signed and i wasnt sure which exit to leave (bearing in mind it was 9pm at night!) and didnt want to hang around with my young son. Thankfully a very helpful lady assisted us and told us to walk down by cycle path then follow round corner and there it would be. Albeit the path looked very dimly light i was a bit apprehendous but it only took us a 5 min walk and then we entered the hotel. We were greeted straightaway and it was a very easy and smooth check in experience via a computer and the girl assisted us all the way, ensuring a smooth check in and effortless process enabling my son and i to got to our room quite quickly and for his mum to get a well earned glass of wine from the bar!! Alfonso was brilliant and my son loved him as he kept given him little treats dcuring our stay and made such a difference to my sons stay as well as the other girl (sorry couldnt remember her name) who kept checking on us during our stay. The hotel room was fab and my son loved playing with ther mood pad and having different colours in the room along with lying in bed on sat night watching movie after movie which he loved. All movies are free and also the wifi access is very good as well as being free also. My son and i will def return next year probably as a family with my husband and younger son and would have no hesitations in recommending this hotel. p.s The tram 5 stops right outside of the hotel and takes you in the centre in a matter of 10-15 minutes and run very frequently if you dont want to stay in the heart of the city but still have accessible access.

Reviews.Title: “Funky, friendly & great value. What more do you want?”
Reviews.Author: doddyksw
Reviews.Content: We've literally just got back from a weekend break in Amsterdam staying at the CitizenM and it was awesome. Really easy to get to from the Central Station (#5 tram all the way taking about 20 minutes). Super friendly staff, very cool surroundings, free WiFi (plus 4 x iMacs if you don't have a computer) plus very cool rooms. The bed is huge & very comfy. The only thing to be aware of is that the toilet (and shower) is all part of one room. You basically close a glass door for some privacy. So unless you know each other really well it could be a bit awkward. This hotel is such good value. For what you get i don't think it can be beaten. Yes it is a little bit out of the centre but the #5 tram makes it so easy to get everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience, Interesting concept”
Reviews.Author: BobNAlix
Reviews.Content: We are a mature couple who just wanted to spend a few days in Amstaerdam. We enjoyed our stay at Citizen M, with all the wonderful common areas, books and places to lounge. The bank of computers was rarely filled so there was always one available for keeping in touch with friends and relatives....wish I hadn't lugged my laptop with me, though free wifi throughout hotel was definitely a plus. The rooms are just big enough for two, as long as you don't bring too much luiggage. You can easily store two 22" bags under the bed in the convenient drawer space, but you'll need to plan on taking turns in getting dfressed etc. All in all, it was a great expereience and we will be checking for Citizen M's in other cities we visit. We loved the concept, but would like just a little more space for luggage, and hanging clothes.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome set up, but definitely not for friends traveling”
Reviews.Author: Kippie111
Reviews.Content: We were here for two of a three day stay in Amsterdam and though I saw the reviews and pictures before, I was still surprised at how small the room was. It wasn't bad because we were able to get all our belongings somewhere without feeling like we were cramped, but the toilet and shower still threw us for a loop. We had a great time with this room, especially with the Mood Pad, which we spent like an hour a day fiddling with. Because it was our first time in Amsterdam together, we decided to sample local cuisine, which made the affects of the room quite enjoyable! We also noticed that this is the first hotel we had ever been to that actually has not one, but TWO pornographic channels playing almost twenty-fours a day. Interesting, to say the least! However, this place lost star because we did ask for clean up, but I travel with a cup where ever I go and we found it missing after house keeping came through. Never did find that cup and I know I didn't misplace it, so... It's inexpensive, just kind of disappointing that my belongings were taken. Otherwise, a great, fun little hotel that had an amazing bed, an extra large blanket, an entertaining selection of tv/movie/music assortments, funky bathroom set up, and friendly service. Decent location, but a wide variety of transportation available, even late at night.

Reviews.Title: “abundance of designer furniture”
Reviews.Author: allhailwesttexas
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 7 days. Really enjoyed the variety of classic designer furniture found throughout the hotel. The setup of different chairs and tables to create a sort of communal living room space was very good and made it easy and pleasant to do work or just hang out at the hotel. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “WOW hotel with awesome concepts & desing”
Reviews.Author: Matthas L
Reviews.Content: If you like to experience hotels which are un-traditional then check CitizenM. I though booking online was fun, you can basically during the reservations process choose the lighting in your rooms , temperature and other feature before you arrive. A cool feature that hotel should try learning from. First of all no front desk counter, no queing at the front desk for like 30 minutes, it's all on a automated electronic desk, which i find rather maybe un-personal but extremely efficient. Your keycard does basically everything, charge your consumption on it, open your door, no need to sign bills anymore. Internet is free, in-room movies are free. I really enjoy the twisted and humerous side of the amenties. The bed are extremely wide and confortable. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone seeking efficiency, design and plug and play experience.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing - made me smile”
Reviews.Author: JaneandSharon
Reviews.Content: What a refreshing alternative to the blandness of budget hotels and sameness of the big chains. This hotel made me smile; the staff were friendly and helpful; the public spaces stimulating but comfortable; the overall design colourful and quirky; the bedrooms small but interesting; and the price competitive. The beds are incredibly comfortable - we had the best night's sleep in ages. Even though there was a public transport strike while we were there, we walked to the museum district in less than half an hour. And its a bonus being so close to amsterdam zuid, and schipol. There's a bar in the flats nearby called Lucia (or something like that). Very friendly host; music so incredibly kitch it was fabulous. Worth dropping into for a drink.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jkingart
Reviews.Content: Hotel is new, clean, good design, we found very good atmosphere, a lot of couples -probably due to the fact that there are only rooms for two and it is a huge double bed, but we also find families with grown up children. The staff working here were very friendly, very young and managed to talk a considerable number of languages (Italian, French, Spanish, English and French of course....) We appreciated free wifi and the apple computers in the entrance, 2m*2m bed, nice rain-shower, free movies on demand. The room is small as you can see from their website, but has everything. To gain control of the remote control which controls TV, lights, curtains and temperature could take some time if you are not good friends with technology The only minor problem was the heating, definitively in our room we did not have the 23 degrees indicated in the display, but wasn-'t cold either.

Reviews.Title: “You'll love it or hate it - very stylised”
Reviews.Author: craiglegrice
Reviews.Content: There are some bad reviews of this place but I do think they're unjustified. It's an extremely stylised / designed / contrived look and this won't be for everyone. From the open 'social' feel of the public spaces to the small and pod / capsule style rooms, this is a striking - but subjective - hotel in terms of design. But everything else that matters - location, service, people, value, warmth, amenities etc - should all tick your boxes. They did mine! Highly recommended :-)

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Well Designed Hotel Near The Centre Of Amsterdam (Tram 5)”
Reviews.Author: Anthony G
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Hotels all around the world and can say with confidence that this is one of the best. There is an easy check in system in the foyer, easy to navigate floor plan and funky rooms with comfy bed to get your head down. It is situated a little outside the centre of town but not too far. You can jump on the No 5 tram from Amsterdam Central which takes about 15 mins and stops right outside the hotel. If you wanted to walk to take in the sites first hand then it would take about an hour. There is plenty of lounge space if you want to chill with a beer or coffee and reasonably stocked shop for snacks (i recommend picking up a bottle of the Aloe Vera water 0 it will change your life!). Every part of the hotel is packed with nice replica designer furniture - i hope that this chain opens up hotels all around the world - will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff but poor accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Errigalclimber
Reviews.Content: This is a kind of 'pod' hotel where the rooms consist of the bed, shower and toilet all in the same one-room space. The lighting, blinds, temperature and TV are all controlled from the same 'TV' remote control. It's fun but not very comfortable and it does not come cheap - I paid 160 Euros per night for this arrangement which was simply too expensive. The staff are friendly but the emphasis is on do-it-yourself as the guest, from checking in and out to helping yourself to breakfast - it's a bit of a cheek to charge top dollar then expect the guest to serve themselves! This hotel does offer something different from the norm but I found the experience distinctly underwhelming.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and Chic. Could be cleaner.”
Reviews.Author: Dean L
Reviews.Content: Very trendy hotel with great technology. Small rooms but very cool. Expensive for what you get, but something worth experiencing. Location is somewhat out of the way of the city centre so everything will be at least a tramride away - ie would be considered not walkable. Generally a positive experience though the place could be cleaner - the minimalistic design meant that there was a lot of clean white space which accentuated the visible mould around the shower/toilet areas as well as the also clearly visible black foreign material (??) on the bedsheets. Other than the cleanliness issue, we had a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Unique hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: pia a
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at Citizen M, it was perfect! Though the room is quite small, but if you're a single traveller, it is more than enough! Super modern and high tech room, super clean! You are supposed to help yourself with check in and check out, but staff are always present and very friendly! Tram is very close but pay attention to when you get out of tram, I felt it was a different direction from where i took it, i was lost, alone at night , it was a bit frightening...Everything else was just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Quirky hotel a real experience, we didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: VickyChristinaBCN
Reviews.Content: I cannot recommend this hotel enough. Full stop. If you like boring, homogenised hotels like the Sofitel, Novotel, Boringtel, then please do not stay here. This hotel is so much of a visceral experience, we almost never wanted to leave to explore Amsterdam! From the moment you arrive, check in staff are ready and waiting to give you their full and friendly attention. There is a lot of break out space in the lobby with unique furniture, TV's etc, and feels like a giant living room. Wifi connection is strong here too, which is wonderful. The rooms are an Alice in Wonderland adventure: the bed is king size and super duper comfortable. There is a "mood pod" which changes the lighting and music of the room according to themes, a lot of fun was had with this. There are movies (of all kinds, ahem!) on demand. The bathroom "tubes" were a true trip, please see my attached photos. There is one for the toilet and one for the shower. This is a truly unique feature of the hotel. The included hotel shampoo and soap are the best I have experienced, and I have stayed in a lot of different hotels, great quality. The only "negative" points of the hotel is that breakfast is not included, but they do have a selection of food for purchase: sandwiches, sushi, fruit etc. This area also has a bar, so that was a nice way to wind down after a long day of sightseeing. Also note that the hotel is about a 10 minute tram ride out of the city centre, but the public transport system is easy to use and very regular. I would recommend buying an all day travel card, or a card to cover the length of your stay, as opposed to single tickets. I truly hope you enjoy this hotel as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Daniel C
Reviews.Content: I stayed at CitizenM for 6 nights part work part holiday. The rooms were extremely different and a breath of fresh air but they are very very small. The mood lighting and efficiency of the room is brilliant though. The staff were easily the best I'd ever come across, all very friendly and enjoyed making conversation. Whilst working from my laptop in the lounge area they frequently checked up on me to see if I required any drink or food, might I add that the lounge area was perfect for work or relaxation. The food is quite expensive from the cafe area but it's all decent. I can't quite give this place 5 stars even though I had a great time simply because I was here too long! That's right, this hotel is designed for couples on a weekend away. You only have enough room to hang 3 items of clothing so it's not ideal for a long business trip. I TOTALLY recommend this hotel but I probably won't be making a return if that makes sense. P.S The picture as you come out of the lift on the ground floor is priceless, made me giggle every time.

Reviews.Title: “Designer chic”
Reviews.Author: Rob S
Reviews.Content: This unusual hotel was an excellent base for exploring Amsterdam. Located in the Oud Zuid part of the city, it's a little way from the centre, but on a direct tram route. The area is very pleasant, with a good range of shops and restaurants. The Museumplein,w here the major museums are located is a 20 minute stroll. The hotel itself is a monument to modern design. The rooms will doubtless be thought small by US visitors, but they contain everything you need. Shower and toilet are in pod-like enclosures, and the room is dominated by a huge bed. Everything is controlled by the Moodpad, a big remote control that you use to open the blinds, adjust the lighting, control the TV, etc. Free wifi everywhere, free use of iMacs in the foyer,nice relaxing bar, food and drink available 24/7.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Heneretta B
Reviews.Content: It was a bit small and dated but overall good. Staff were very friendly and made the place a nice place to stay and could do with a little updating.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, but different”
Reviews.Author: TrishLive
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay, but definitely a little different. The tram stops right outside the door, so it's easy to get anywhere. The rooms are nice, but the shower is kind of annoying to use. Also, there is very little privacy in the rooms, so don't stay there with anyone you are not completely comfortable with. Overall, good value in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great Concept - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tommytao
Reviews.Content: Just had a lovely 3 night stay in this cool hotel. I couldnt find any faults with it. Its perfect for a short break. Its a 2 minute walk from Zuid train station which is only 5 minutes from airport. ( 1st stop) . The tram ( line 5 ) stops outside the door . Its only 10 or 15 minutes into Dam Square. Ideal. Checking in and out was quick and easy. Staff in the hotel were friendly and helpful. The room maybe small but its very cool and well designed. The bed is massive and so comfortable. I dont see why people complain about the toilet and shower . there is a massive curtain you can draw across the room which seperates them from the bed and chair. There are loads of free movies on the tv and free wi-fi. You cant ask for more really. Il be back for sure and il check them out in other citys aswell. The bar serves 24 hours. Great hotel. Perfect for 3 or 4 day breaks . Ideal for couples

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with luxury in the right places”
Reviews.Author: Mevrouw v
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very innovative because it offers a no nonsense approach to traveling. It is the perfect hotel to visit Amsterdam because tram 5 ( that goes straight to the town center) is just steps away from the entrance. The staff is always very friendly and helpful and the rooms are clean. The big bed is heavenly and the shower is illuminated. It made me look forward to returning to the hotel every night. What more can you ask for ?

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary European Hotel - Not Central!”
Reviews.Author: ereg11
Reviews.Content: If you like modern and contemporary than this hotel is right for you. I stayed here with my boyfriend for a 3 night stay. Our first impressions were that the hotel was indeed very 'trendy' but also so much so that its not a very 'homely' hotel. Dont get me wrong the bed is amazing (2 metres x 2 metres) but features such as a roller door for your toilet leaves little to the imagination for your roommate! As does the shower as the room is completely open...and actually quite small! Its features such as these that give it a European feel. This is not a hotel I would usually chose but for a 3 night stay it was fine, somewhere to rest your head thats clean. The location is a little OFF the beaten track as you need to take a tram to the centre of Amsterdam which costs E2.10 each one way. A taxi will set you back 25 euros from the hotel to Central Station/Dam Square. The hotels free movies and wifi is fantastic - big plus. I think what this hotel has given me is a sense of the type of hotel that I like. I now know that modern and contemporary is not for me.

Reviews.Title: “Citizen M amsterdam Central!! FABBB”
Reviews.Author: Lanca08
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Citzen M in Glasgow Scotland before and knew that this would be just as ideal as the glasgow hotel. The staff are polite and is very near to train station Zuid which is six minutes from Schipol airport . The rooms are lovely and very clean everything you need except a kettle..if you like a regular brew get yourself a mini kettle before you go as they cost an arm and a leg in the canteen! Great space in the lobby to chill out..watch tele and just kick back! computers there but poor connection. The tele in the room is fab...so many up to date films for all! The COMFIEST BED EVER! in my own right now after 5 nights in Citizen M amsterdam and truly saddened! The rooms are small but everything you need is there...very modern and clean! To get to the city centre is a bit ANOYING its about 15-20 minutes and costs 2.50 euros for an hour pass and 7 euros for a 24 hour pass. I MUST WORN ABOUT THE PICK POCKETS!!! i got my purse stolen on the second day whilst being on the number 5 tram(which is the connection from the hotel to the city centre)..i was completely oblivious! and the next day we saw some guy scanning everyone to see who would be an easy target! BE WORNED! I would recommend this hotel to anyone, would go back without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “A shoebox”
Reviews.Author: speedyjoe
Reviews.Content: trying to be uber trendy, shoebox rooms, all looking a bit tired now. No bin in the room, no privacy either, and the room can be chilly. Staff are really nice though and the bed is comfy.

Reviews.Title: “What can I say that hasn't already been said?”
Reviews.Author: globalwanderer2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent two days in Amsterdam during our European whirlwind tour via the rails. We booked in at the CitizenM as it seemed to really catch our eye based on the Trip Advisor reviews to experience something a little different. That said, here's a summary of our CitizenM experience: Rooms - Felt like I was entering a space capsule! Pictures describe the rooms far better than words, so I've attached a few. "Trendy" and "different" are truly understatements, you have to see it to believe it! Its no secret the rooms are on the smaller side (as is the standard of many European hotels), but what the rooms lack in size they make up for 10-fold i character and visual appeal! From the capsule-like shower and bathroom stalls, to the remote control blinds, music and funky lighting, the CitizenM thought of everything when coming of with the design of this place. My only wish is that our stay could have been longer! That said, If you're travelling top heavy with luggage, this room may not be conducive nor practical for you, but ideal for backpackers or those traveling with one suitcase. Front desk/staff: Friendly and helpful and with no hassles checking in or out. Your check in/out process is completely automated and done electronically rather than through a "front desk", but always someone around to assist you if there's any confusion (there won't be, its super easy!) Location - As asset or a drawback, depending which way you view it. Via tram, its a good 20-25 minute journey to and from downtown Amsterdam proper, but very easy to catch as it runs continuously throughout the day. As an asset, its off the beaten path and away from the madness and crush of the crowds, so could be viewed as somewhat of a personal escape with transit at your fingertips depending on your point of view. Value - One of the best deals going in Amsterdam, period! Sure its a little off the track, the the price coupled with everything else makes this place feel like a steal! The bottom line - The CitizenM most definitely deserves its title as Trip Advisor's trendiest hotel . From the truly one of a kind rooms, unique decor and futuristic theme, I can only hope I'm afforded the opportunity to stay here again. One thing remains certain above everything else: The CitizenM is more than a hotel, its an experience the likes of which I have no other hotel to compare it to. Five out of five, no question.

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: Gary1285
Reviews.Content: Well where do I begin? Me and my partner have just got back from this fantastic hotel! Before we went we read a few of the reviews on trip advisor and was slightly worried at what to expect! But on our arrival we feel in love with the place straight away! The hotel lobby is stylish and up to date and the staff are on hand to help with check in as this is all self service! The rooms are modern, although not big, but who needs a big room when you should be out exploring the city of Amsterdam? The control pad in the room is great and the mood lights just add to the feel of a great hotel! The staff are brilliant, nothing is too much for them! On our first night there one of the staff sat with us for a good 20 minutes and explained loads of stuff to us! The hotel lobby and bar is made to feel like its your lounge and they sure do give it that feel! Please ignore any bad comments on this hotel as I am one of the first to complain about something and with all honesty I can't with this hotel! We are already booking to go back in February and we can't wait for the London one to open in June 2012!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Hutchins-2011
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel such a friendly bunch of staff, nothing is to much. Rooms are outstanding would recommend this hotel to anyone, feels like home away from home. Would definitely stay again, the technology is outstandy and the beds are just Devine!!!

Reviews.Title: “Different and refreshing”
Reviews.Author: Steve W
Reviews.Content: Booked it through late rooms, so a little insure what to expect , however on arrival pleasantly surprised, very modern, very helpful and polite staff, some nice unique touches, easy access to the city tram No 5, No restaurant but the self service food bar is excellent as is the coffee. The rooms are a little on the small side, bed is amazingly comfortable and large. Give it a try, I would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “The concept is fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: ggandklstravels
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay! From the moment you walk through the spot you are greeted by smiles and excellent attentiveness from the staff,or ambassadors as they are called. The lobby is spotlessly clean and very chic and hip. The room was great and very novel with the shower in the middle of the room,the mood pad was a good laugh trying to work it out,and tons of free films and music on the tv were a nice touch also. Back in the bar area we had a few drinks and soaked up the chilled atmisphere for a bit before a nice ambassador booked us a taxi into town for a meal. Good location as out of the hustle and bustle of town but not too far out and right next to tram stop anyway. There's so much more I can't think of everything, great comfy bed,lovely snacky food,good selection of drinks at the bar,nice art on the walls,funky furniture,can't say enough,perfect for a short haul trip,already looking at trying citizenm Glasgow next month!

Reviews.Title: “Very Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anthony C
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located if you arrive by train as its within 10 mins walk. The hotel is very modern and comfortable. A tram ride is required to get the the heart of Amsterdam these are very regular.The room on arrival was very clean and well presented, however when unpacking I found my 1st fault with the room only 3 coat hangers and no space to have any more if they were available. My 2nd fault was no tea/coffee facilities in the room, this is as standard if you ask me!!! My overall impression of the hotel was very good!

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Asenster
Reviews.Content: The hotel is excellent, the bed is nice, nice bathroom and champoos. The room is a bit little for two persons. The location is good.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky but Great”
Reviews.Author: MehranX
Reviews.Content: What an absolutely strange place to stay. It is a very comfortable and hip place. Staff: All friendly and helpful. No stuffy grumps. Looks like they enjoyed working there Lobby: It is self-service and high tech, but there is staff to help you. The area was well designed and comfortable. Nice place to relax and have coffee or beer. Food: Breakfast was enjoyable with plenty of food Rooms: really comfortable. Beds and sheets are clean with a great window view. The bathroom and showers are "weird" with colorful lights to put you in a romantic mood. The design of the shower and toilet are just wonderful. What a concept. Really enjoyed my stay. Location: I don't know why people keep writing the hotel is close to everything. It really is NOT. If you work at WTC, then it is in good location. For tourists, you have to take a tram to the central location. The tram is right around the corner from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly good!”
Reviews.Author: kBloke
Reviews.Content: Visited Amsterdam on business and the accomodation was booked by a colleague, when told of the type of hotel citizen m was, I must confess I was a little worried! I should not have been. Citizen M is different to what I am used to but as it turned out it was excellent. The rooms are not huge by any means but well laid out with all you need, very clean and comfortable. Free movies and broadband are a nice touch. Staff are a little hip but very polite and helpful especially when booking in and out (you do this yourself on computer terminals - this may not be ideal after a long trip?). The hotel is very close to the airport, walking distance so transport into the city or beyond is very easy with trains, planes and taxi outside the door. Lots of options for eating locally with a Hilton and Sheraton close by as well as a cafe in the hotel itself. I would stay here again but probably only on my own as I don't think the room is ideal for a couple (not for me anyway)

Reviews.Title: “Difficult”
Reviews.Author: Liilin_11
Reviews.Content: Breakfast was poor. No minbar. Wines sold in the hotel shop were awfull. In the double room privacy in the toilet is nice. Here it was not possible. Not good.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: harry180702
Reviews.Content: My girfriend and I are just back from a three night stay at the CitizenM Amsterdam City and to sum this hotel up in one word.....superb. From the ease of check in and the attentiveness of the staff this would be one of the finest hotels we have ever stayed in. The hotel is a 5 minte walk from Amsterdam Zuid Station and a tram stop across the road from the hotel makes it a perfect location to explore the beautiful city of Amsterdam. The number 5 tram takes you from the hotel to Leidseplein in about 7 minutes or Dam Square in 15 minutes. If you're there for a few days I would recommend a 72 hour public transport pass that can be bought from the big silver machines at Zuid station for â‚¬15.50. Check in and check out was a breeze and is all self service with staff members there to help. The bedroom was beautiful and had a huge wall to wall bed. We really enjoyed the uniqueness of the rooms with the shower and toliet contained in seperate pod's within the room. The free on demand movies were a great feature as well. Superb wi-fi as well. The staff at the hotel couldn't have been more polite or helpful. Service always with a smile which is sadly lacking from many other hotels. We never had breakfast in the hotel. Instead we went to Bagels & Beans which was a five minute walk from the hotel. When you leave the main exit of the hotel turn right and walk to the end of the road and you will find it across the road. Two hot BTL bagels and 2 bottles of pure apple juice for â‚¬14.60. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel. Looking forward to visiting again soon. Thanks to CitizenM and their wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Much hype for limited value”
Reviews.Author: Henri K
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for two nights in October. Our stay went as planned, and the staff was very friendly, although the coolness of their every single remark sometimes went overboard, but you can forgive that considering that's the name of the game at CitizenM. The hotel is conveniently located if you need to access the Schiphol airport, as the Amsterdam Zuid train station is just a stop from there, and a short walk from the hotel. The restaurant Fidelio a few blocks away serves delicious food, although many of the "citizens" seem to have found the place based on two dinners there. The bed is just huge and pillows and blankets are top class. Transport to the City, Pijp or other parts of town is easy and quick. Going into our personal experience (and hopefully allowing for a little bit of heresy among all the loyal praise previously written here), the hotel left us fairly cold. This despite the fact that the lobby is furnished with design classics (and geniune, expensive ones they are) and although they have some advanced tech tricks installed everywhere. What caused most irritation right from the start was that they position themselves above normal hotels that cater for "ordinary tourists", being a home for a global tribe of travellers who are somehow smarter in their travels and especially hotel selections than your average Joe. For us, this soon started to feel as calculated as it probably is. It did not take away the fact that their rooms are plain tiny and have very little warmth or coziness of any sort. Controlling everything with an RC does not add any comfort, either, after a few minutes of fooling around with the device. Quite the contrary, finding optimal lighting for various situations turned out to be difficult (going in the toilet during night while sleeping with a partner was a mess as you had to light up the entire room). Another thing was that their breakfast deal could be more flexible: you cannot get the cheaper pre-book option for just one morning, but either take it or leave it for the entire stay, since the "system" has been programmed so according to a staff "ambassador". But to be fair, if you ditch the hype it is an ok hotel as long as you don't expect the comfort of a four-star hotel - or pay for one.

Reviews.Title: “Top Ten Hotel in Amsterdam? No way...”
Reviews.Author: mericet
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night in the CitizenM Amsterdam City Centre in March 2011. We had to pay 90 â‚¬ for the room without breakfast, The hotel is definitely not in the City of Amsterdam. Even though you have a tram station next to the hotel it takes you about 20 minutes to get to the city centre. And... in the night the tram stops its service. The hotel might be good for buisiness travellers as the World Trade Centre is near by, for sightseeing I would definitely not recommend staying there. Now for the room: Before booking the hotel I read in the reviews and in some travel magazines that the rooms are well designed and that you get so much comfort for your money. Well... I could definitely not agree. The rooms are tiny (which is okay in Amsterdam) but they aren't well designed at all. The bed is okay even though it's a little uncommon to have only one side to enter it. The shower is really good, the bath products are not. The real problem in the room is that you have first nearly no space to store your luggage and your wardrobe and second that the toilet is really impossible. I stayed with my husband but really don't need him to be virtually in the toilet with me. The toilet (and also the shower) is in kind of a glass cylinder, its frosted glass but you can easily see through. And you can hear through it...Very inconvenient... Last not so good thing about the hotel is the bar. The drinks there are very expensive, a small bottle of still water at 2,50 or 3 â‚¬ is really annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Design hotel, amazing bed and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Paponidas_78
Reviews.Content: Well connected with Tram number 5, almost a metro line but in surface in the south, Although not in the center, the 15 minute trip to the center is relaxing and allows you to have a nice view of the southern part of the city. It is in a residential are very calm, so forget if you want a hotel walking distance from the center.Close to RAI train station as well. which is handful if you come from the airport as you don't need to go to CS. Hotel is new, clean, good design, we found very good atmosphere, a lot of couples -probably due to the fact that there are only rooms for two and it is a huge double bed, but we also find families with grown up children. The staff working here were very friendly, very young and managed to talk a considerable number of languages (Italian, French, Spanish, English and French of course....) We appreciated free wifi and the apple computers in the entrance, 2m*2m bed, nice rain-shower, free movies on demand. The room is small as you can see from their website, but has everything. To gain control of the remote control which controls TV, lights, curtains and temperature could take some time if you are not good friends with technology The only minor problem was the heating, definitively in our room we did not have the 23 degrees indicated in the display, but wasn-'t cold either. A littel bit overprice, but I think Amsterdam has no great deals and it was before a long weekend. Either we did not have neighbours or it is extremely well isolated from inside and outside noise.

Reviews.Title: “nice!”
Reviews.Author: Stefan T
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at Citizen M. Small but trendy rooms. Great relaxing after doing a shopping marathon, lying in the huge bed, controlling the lights, tv and the blinds with the moodpad. Located outside the city centre, but only 1 minute from tram 5. Had some problems with my room key, and i thought the breakfast wasn't the greatest, but then again.... Amsterdam has 45652 places to have breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Great, for the price”
Reviews.Author: traffjudd
Reviews.Content: Citizen M is a very clever concept of hotels that are aimed at a design-conscious, but also budget-savvy, international travellers. The rooms are very small and to be honest, probably best suited to solo travellers. I was staying with my partner and we found it to be a little cozy for our tastes, particularly because the bathroom is in the main living area. But we were only there for one night so it was fine - any longer may have tested our relationship a little! Free wi-fi is welcomed, the hotel says "because charging for internet makes about as much sense as a giraffe on a bicycle". This is an indication of their cheeky attitude. Really clever self-serve kiosks make check-in/out a breeze. The staff are great and obviously love their jobs, and the food at the cafeteria is well-priced and tasty. Location is really convenient for access to Schipol airport and a 10 minute tram ride from the centre of Amsterdam. Overall, I highly recommend, especially for this price, and would happily stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Cool stopover in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Hreinn
Reviews.Content: The Citizen M City, not to be confused with the airport one, is a great place to stay at. Hip and cool rooms and surroundings topped off with great service and convenient amenities. The rooms are like in a space station, with capsules for a shower and WC. The check in and out are self-service, if you donâ€™t have any funny letters in your name it is very convenient and easy to use. The location is a bit out of the city center but just around the corner, is the number 5 tram that takes you directly to the museum district, bar district and down town. Access to the airport is also very convenient as its only one stop away from Schipol Airport on the metro. If in Amsterdam you must try out this hotel, itâ€™s a bit of adifferent hotel experience then usual but very nice.

Reviews.Title: “One night in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Julie M
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is good, it's not located in the direct city center of Amsterdam. This is no problem at all because tram 5 stops just in front of the hotel. There is no noise and you can have a good night rest. The check in goes very smoothly, 6pc's available and there is always somebody to help you. Friendly staff, very open comunication with the guests. The room is very basic but nice looking with a huge bed (I wish we could have taken it home ;)). Domotic in the room was working good, lovely wake up call on the tv with a nice "birdy sound". Also very nice that the bar is open 24hours. Breakfast was good! We had a lovely stay and would definitely return to a Citizen hotel, we loved the concept!

Reviews.Title: “What a cool place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: CASmith23
Reviews.Content: My Husband organised this short break as a surprise for our Wedding Anniversary and it was fantastic! I've got to say I was a bit aprehensive after realising how small the room would be and I wasn't sure about having the ameneties stuck in the middle of the room but it was AWESOME! Yes, the rooms are small but the space is used in a very efficient and effective way which made the place all the more special. Once we were out and about in Amsterdam I looked forward to getting back to our quirky room to enjoy the things it had to offer! It had an enormous bed which was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in! The shower was great and there was plenty of clean fresh towels for us to use. There is a chiffon style curtain that can be drawn between the bed and the rest of the room if you'd like a bit more privacy. My husband thoroughly enjoyed the Mood Pad... it's a gadget that controls loads of things in the room from the lighting to the television to the blinds. Even though we only stayed for two nights the room was serviced and the bedding/towels changed after one night. There was loads of helpful staff available to sort any problems/queries if required and the whole buzz of this hotel was just lovely. The Hotel location was fab, one train stop from the airport near the World Trade Centre, it was very quiet which made for an excellent nights sleep. We used the trams to go back and forth all weekend which proved to be very easy as they are so frequent, again with helpful staff. The hotel was approx. 15 mins from The Central Station in Amsterdam, the journey to get there was great as we spotted loads of places and things we wanted to see and do on the way in. Overall it was an extreemly enjoyable weekend to remember and CitizenM had a lot to do with that!! When we managed to grab another weekend in Amsterdam we will definately be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “You are going to love it or hate it.....”
Reviews.Author: timmac_10
Reviews.Content: We came in from Schiphol by train, which takes about 10 mins to Zuid station. Literally a 5 min walk from Zuid station to hotel -and signposted, so really easy to find. self service check in was efficient, had no problems at all, but if you do run into trouble, one of the many friendly staff are on hand to help. Rooms are like many have said before - Bijou and intimate. I would say this definitely not for people that struggle with small spaces or that are planning a long trip. There isn't a great deal of space for luggage. Amsterdam city centre is approx 20 mins on number 5 tram - really easy and pleasant journey. We bought 24 hour tickets at 7 euro pp. The food and drink is a little pricey but it's a nice space and lots of chill out space/internet access.The staff here are excellent, really friendly. Being the types we are, we shouldn't have liked this hotel, but we did - but would probably only use it in a city break capacity ie: when you shouldn't be in your room much anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for business visit”
Reviews.Author: bosco111
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Cit M to attend meeting at RAI Center -- perfect location and amenities for such a visit. Other positives: good WiFi service, the key system, the plentiful lobby seating. Negatives: room is small even for one person; not really enough space to hang clothes for a 5-day stay; desk is small; hard to avoid cold water when you start the shower. I consider the negatives very minor.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: buznbro15
Reviews.Content: What can I say but only that we had a wonderful stay (2 nights) at this hotel. Everything you've read about, in terms of it's creativity, was spot on! The room was very comfortable and functional...we had no issues with the room controls. Only minor flaw was it got a little dry in the room on the 1st night so it would have been nice to have had the option of opening a window...no worries, we got through it!! Although there's not much in the immediate area for food (trust me, we walked all over the place), the options available on site were pretty good. Some may view it as a bit pricey, however, we accepted the fact that we were in Europe and some things can get expensive. As you may have already read, simply hop on the #5 tram to the left of the hotel and your in the city center 10-12 minutes later. I believe it cost about 2.60 euros each and you can pay right on the tram (they even have change, if you require it). All in all, a great stay was had by my wife and I...certainly the most creative hotel we've stayed at...oh, I must add that the staff were awesome, always willing to help out!! Would definitely stay again and recommend to our friends!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy bed but not worth all the hype”
Reviews.Author: verybusybee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night with my husband after wanting to stay somewhere different than the traditional dutch B&B's.
