Good points - Right next to the no 5 tram stop, 10 mins into the city centre Comfy bed and big enough for 2 Shower was good Free on demand movies Bad points - There is nothing in the local vicinity apart from the tram stop The on site cafeteria is quite expensive The remote control was quite difficult to use and you had to remember to put it back in its cradle or it ran out The room was cold, thermostat only went up to 23' and it was late October Apart from that we enjoyed our stay because it is quirky but 1 night was enough

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: ChristieWF
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at citizenM Amsterdam City hotel for 2 nights and we'd definitely recommend it to other couples. The staff is really friendly and helpful, the hotel's bar is very nice and modern, and the transport to the centre is excelent (outside the hotel is a tram station-very often). Concerning the room, it was very clean and fancy, very different from other hotels, with a huge bed and really modern facilities. If I 'd been to Amsredam again, I would chosse again the citizenM Amsterdam City hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Trendiest hotel I've ever known”
Reviews.Author: Fernanda V
Reviews.Content: Easy access, few blocks from Train Station Zuid. Very confortable, great staff and excellent wi-fi conection free. No room service, but at the lobby you'll find snacks and other packed food.

Reviews.Title: “Not for everyone, but I loved the place!”
Reviews.Author: BobbyPH
Reviews.Content: It's not your typical hotel since it's "art moderne" with bathrooms which have transparent partitions so you're room companion can see you, but I totally loved it! It was like being in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Just the ticket”
Reviews.Author: BaselTiger
Reviews.Content: Close to the airport, clean, comfortable and funky design. Free Wi-Fi too :-) I really travel a lot, and found this hotel to fit the needs of a business traveller perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: anilegna
Reviews.Content: Was here for only one night after a two week holiday. Â We got in eleven pm after a super stressful what should have taken only ten hour trip (from Rwanda thru Nairobi to Amsterdam ) that ended up being a 2 day trip with an unwanted overnight of 17 hr in Nairobi due to the below par Kenya Air ( codeshare KLM and Delta). Â  Booked Citizen M hotel using Amsterdam airport's free wifi as soon as we landed, a quick 5 min walk out of terminal three & we were lounging comfortably at the hip funky lobby over a few drinks. Â  Was worried about a kiosk check in but it was super easy and fast, literally typed in my last name and got my room key (but they did have staff around to help). Â  The clean room was small but perfect for one night before my flight home the next day, simple and chic, with free movies, rain shower, bigger bed than what I had vs the 5 nights at Sofitel the Grand (also in Amsterdam.) Â Just this hotel alone makes Amsterdam airport one of my top transit choices. Â

Reviews.Title: “Great comfortable clean hotel within walking distance of Dam Square”
Reviews.Author: grapefruitGlasgow
Reviews.Content: This hotel is 1 stop from the Airport and 10-12 min walk into Dam square, the number 5 tram stops outside which also takes you into centre of Amsterdam. Fantastic location, extremely clean and the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. Room is funky layout with seperate shower and toilet cubicles within the one room, not ideal for sharing with new partner or friend but ideal for folk comfortable sharing these facilities with a partner. Window blinds, black out blind, lighting, heating and TV all controlled remotely with 1 remote - fab. Staff friendly and I would highly recommend this hotel if you are OK with the walk into centre, Good cafes and restaurants nearby. Great!

Reviews.Title: “If you appreciate design and like something a bit different, you will love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sam_and_alex
Reviews.Content: Loved it! We stayed 2 nights at the start of our European trip and returned for another 2 nights at the end. The rooms are tiny, but you only sleep and shower in them so what else do you need! The bed is huge and comfortable, the toilet & shower with the mood lighting is hilarious & the free WIFI is excellent (almost unheard of in Europe). Love the lounge and there is a large selection of nice snack type food on offer 24hrs. Great location, 5 minute walk to the train station that gets you to/from the airport and a 2 minute walk to the tram stop that takes you into the city centre. Overall great experience and will definately be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic beds, cool design”
Reviews.Author: SarahFrancis
Reviews.Content: When my husband and I travel we tend to go for boutique hotels or B&Bs. The most important aspects for us are a comfortable bed, good shower, great location and general ambience. This hotel ticked all the boxes. They scrimp on some things (no tea/coffee in bedrooms, limited hanging space for clothes, no bath) but in exchange you get a massive, super comfortable bed, films on demand, mood lighting, floor to ceiling windows and a fantastic rain shower. It's really well-located, the tram stops right outside and will take you into the city centre, and it's a short walk from Zuid which is about 8 mins from the airport. In other words a perfect location. The food is available all night for when you get the inevitable muchies, and the communal areas are clean, slightly quirky, and really comfortable and light. The staff were helpful without being intrusive - i.e. only there when you needed them, and other guests were friendly enough. One thing I'd suggest though is if you're a girl, take a decent hair dryer (the ones they provide are the rubbish travel ones) and take an additional adaptor plug (they only provide one). I'd also suggest limiting your clothing to stuff you can fold and put away in the underbed storage (you get about 3 coat hangers).

Reviews.Title: “Unique concept that is likely to spread”
Reviews.Author: aversetospam
Reviews.Content: The Citizen M fills a niche well. It caters to tech savvy short term guests with mid-level budgets The core concept is to use technology to cut personnel costs to the rock bottom without unduly compromising service, to use architectural and interior design to cut room size to the bare minimum without unduly compromising comfort, to locate the properties near transport hubs in outlying areas to cut costs without unduly compromising convenience, and to wrap this all in a sleek stylishly designed package with free internet. Technology/personnel costs: Self-checkin and checkout at touchscreens in the lobby eliminatedall but one front desk person; fully automated room controls covering temperature, shades, television and wakeup calls reduced the need for front desk and floor staff. Comment: This worked well. The staff member on duty in the lobby could explain things to the non tech saavy guests. Most guests did not require assistance. Architecture and interior design: The rooms were a bit smaller than the European norm, but far larger than the Japanese norm. A huge bed filled one end of the room, wall to wall with storage bins underneath. There was no sofa/divan, no bureau for clothing. The shower and the toilet stood in the middle of the room, with movable plastic enclosures, with a sink and rotating mirror. There was no conventional bathroom. The windows were wall to wall with very effective blinds encased by interior and exterior glass. There were no conventional curtains. There was a small desk and hard chair, not quite large enough for work. Comment: A colleague noted that the design limited privacy for toilet and shower, and might be an issue for some couples. Location: the hotel was adjacent to the Amsterdam Zuid station with great access to Schiphol and on the number 5 tram line eight minutes from the Museum area and fifteen minutes from old parts of Amsterdam. The hotel distributes a very clear map with tram routings to help guests find their way around. Comment: This works â€“ just get a day card for transit and enjoy. The rates at the hotel were far lower than at properties located in the museum area and old parts of Amsterdam. Bottom Line: As the many favorable reviews here suggest, the concept works well and is likely to spread to San Francisco, Boston, Stockholm, Copenhagen and other fairly high cost destinations that appeal to younger travelers with some money. Of course, the tech saavy who are most likely to post on-line reviews are also the most likely to like the Citizen M concept.

Reviews.Title: “Brings a smile to the face of the most seasoned traveller”
Reviews.Author: Simon2036
Reviews.Content: Very unusual but superbly equipped and incredibly friendly hotel. Although tired from travelling I had a smile on my face from the moment I arrived. The staff are smiling all the time as though they are waiting for you to notice how brilliant their hotel is. Bed was the most confortable I have ever slept in. Small things like free wi-fi and movies are very welcome. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel, wished it were in every city”
Reviews.Author: corndog09
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great. We arrived via tram #5 from Centraal station. While the hotel is slightly on the edge of the main part of Amsterdam, the tram service directly outside (Prinses Irenestrat) and the daily rate make this hotel phenomenal. The lobby concessions were perfect for our needs, with friendly staff. The room was very kitschy, which we liked. Big, comfortable bed, plenty of TV and (free) movie options, shower and toilet. Not too much room, but we were exploring Amsterdam while we were traveling. All in all, we loved this hotel and recommend it highly. It could be awkward if you aren't staying with a romantic partner as the toilet and shower are open.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Deep in the heart of Texas
Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, unusal room”
Reviews.Author: coyotedude
Reviews.Content: Rooms, hotel as others haved described. Tram 5 close for easy travel within city. But also close (4 blocks?) was the metro, bus stop and local train to airport. Walked to train station, and for three euros got to airport with no stops. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “More than a hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheCocoNut
Reviews.Content: CitizenM is more than a hotel. It is an experience by its own. You will find yourself telling about it as if it was one of the tour sites in Amsterdam. Every inch of this hotel is decorated and branded in some way. As if nothing was put in place without a thought. Yes the rooms are small. But if you ordered a room here you probably knew that. On the other hand this what makes this hotel so unique. How they managed to squeeze everything into it and still give you enough space and a unique feeling that you have exactly what you need. The bed is huge and most comfortable, so don't be worried about your night sleep. The room is clean, and obviously the most interesting things are the shower and toilets. You will either love it or hate it but will not be indifferent. We liked the concept. I can understand why someone can feel uncomfortable having the shower fully transparent. Anyway it was very comfortable with full control of water temperature and great water pressure. The lobby and public area of the hotel are beutifully decorated. There is an area with Macs and printers where you can conenct to your email or surf and print whatever you need without the need to ask the staff to do it for you (very handful when you need to print your borading pass/ car rental confirmation/ a map to the restaurant). You do not even need the receptionist in order to check-in or out. You are doing it online using a special workstations located at the entrance of the hotel. (Of course, the staff will help you if you are technologically challened). The cafeteria is very convenient. They serve good cofee, good fresh pastries and generally a good selection of packed salads and light meals that you can get at any hour. The staff is generally young and helpful. I must say that I tried several times to get their help in getting a recommendation for a restaurant or some information regarding the transportation and got inaccurate information. The hotel is located near the "south" train station of Amsterdam, what makes it very close to the airport by train (6-10 minutes) , but quite far from the city center (20 minutes by tram). But the tram stop (number 5) is just on the opposing side of the street what makes it very convenient. To summarize, if you are planning to spend most of your days touring the city, then it is a perfect place to start and end your days in Amsterdam, giving great value for money, while adding something more to your city experience.

Reviews.Title: “The coolest hotel ive ever been to, ever.”
Reviews.Author: GemAndOl
Reviews.Content: This place was absolutely awesome... It was modern, funky, stylish... expensive but worth every penny in my opinion. I loved their humour with things including the funny rude (very tasteful/subtle and occasional) pictures on the walls to the wording on the "do not disturb" signs. The rooms were epic! Quite small, but perfect for us to both just chill after walking round Amsterdam. Loads of movies all free to watch on the tv, the remote controlled everything in the room from the lighting to the blinds... toilet and shower were so much fun :) haha never thought i'd say that about a toilet! Beds were comfy, and everything was always spotless. Downstairs was funky, with loads of TV's, loads of random shaped chairs you can sprawl all over.. and a cool self service style food area that was on the pricey side, but we went for my birthday so didnt mind paying and everything was always very nice. Staff were all great too. Was a short tram journey from the centre, but we didnt mind that as it meant it was peaceful at night. There is a shop and a coffee bar round the corner, and if you go a bit further past the shops into the large building at the back of that complex there is a fast food restaurant that we didnt find until the last day! All in all the hotel was the perfect icing on the cake to the best birthday and one of the best holiday experiences of our lives so far! :) When we go to Amsterdam again, we will stay here again or maybe try their other one, but we will go citizenM every time!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, modern, friendly place to stay - like no other!”
Reviews.Author: SCITUATED
Reviews.Content: Plenty of reviewers have already (eloquently) told you all you need to know about how cool and modern this hotel is. We stayed one night. The rooms are wonderful but only if you are on your own or comfortable with the person you are rooming with. Yes, it is a little out of town but that adds to the experience in my view. A #5 tram through the Leidsplein and Museumplein from Central Station is a 15 or 20 minute ride. You can walk to town in half an hour and it is a very pleasant walk. The hotel is very handy for trains to Schipol from the Amersterdam Zuid NS rail station about a 5 minute walk away. Trains to/from the airport are frequent and take less than 10 minutes journey time. This is a very competitively-priced hotel borrowing something from the Club Quarters model, but much much cooler. I hope that they are making money and will expand to other markets.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel - Just what we were looking for.”
Reviews.Author: iwillm
Reviews.Content: Firstly, although this is not bang in the centre of Amsterdam, it is only 5 minutes on a tram. Which is actually ideal. When we were at the hotel, we wanted to be away from all the craziness of Amsterdam and this hotel provided just that. The room is amazing. Google 'CitizenM Amsterdam Bathroom' It's basically two floor to ceiling tubes! One is the toilet and the other the shower. We thought this was very cool but some people might be a little put off! Although it is Amsterdam so get onboard with the unusual! The bed is MASSIVE! Far larger than a king size bed, really really comfy and ideal for lounging about on an sleeping in. We loved that the TV package in the room was great and had free movies. Even adult ones - Not that we were watching them. The hotel has a self service check in and check out which is brilliant, no need to wait in any long q to do either. The only time we saw any staff was at the 24hr bar! And to be honest, we didn't need them any other time anyone. Our rooms were cleaned and linen refreshed during the day. Although the room is by no means large. It is more than spacious with the way it is designed. Sounds weird, but it's true! We had emailed the hotel before hand to ask that us and our friends have rooms next to each other. On our arrival, at the self service desk, this had all been updated and we got rooms right across from each other. This truly is the best and most unusual hotel we've ever stayed in! More then a 5 star in our eyes :-)

Reviews.Title: “awesome hotel :)”
Reviews.Author: ayubdosani
Reviews.Content: fantastic hotel, everything absolutely ace apart from the fact taht it is 20mins away from the centre of town, but you know that before you go anyway :) couldn't fault the staff too, very friendly and always helpful free movies were awesome free internet even better and free imac use even even better! those that complain, seriously, maybe read what you're booking before you do?

Reviews.Title: “Totally exceeded my expectations! AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: RH7777777
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a 2 night stay at CitizenM with my husband for his surprise birthday trip and I have already recommended it to everyone!!! The staff were very welcoming & full of useful info on arrival. When we returned at 1700 to check in, I was pleasantly surprised at how great our room was. The bed was sooooo comfortable & huge, the movies on demand were such a nice touch & the shower was FAB. We both loved the mood lighting and the gadget around the room. Plenty of space for a couple who travel light. We didn't want to leave the room so ended up watching movied till lunchtime before catching the tram straight to the centre to explore. 1st night there, we walked to a nearby restaurant recommended by friends which was near the museums, not too far and a nice distance to walk after a great meal. We will DEFINITELY be using CitizenM again & are already planning our trip to Glasgow. Loved the attention to details, the relaxed & cool atmosphere and the fantastic value for money put the icing on the cake - well done CitizenM! You ticked all the boxes - see you again soon!

Reviews.Title: “very special”
Reviews.Author: rSohraby
Reviews.Content: this is a hotel like no other hotel that we have stayed in.the design of the hotel unique,there was a bar open 24 hours a day,you can buy fresh food by night and day.the lobby had several chairs and cauches(all very comtortable and unusual design), three or four tv's, several interesting books, a children's corner. The room had a big bed from wall to wall. A cabin for the shower and a cabin for the toilet. With the remote control you can control tv, lights, colour of the lights, mood of the room, blinds, blackoutscreen, alarmclock. It was all very nice of design. The only negative point was that it was too expensive but for the rest it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and loved it”
Reviews.Author: Travelur
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night, and I wished we would have stayed longer and I am looking forward to staying there again. The lobby was ultra hip and modern, yet inviting and comfortable at the same time. The staff was very attentive and friendly. The room was VERY cool. It was small, but it was just right. You basically control everything for the room via a control pad ("theme" for the room, light colors (we are talking orange, blue, purple, green), TV, alarm, music). It is hard to express how cool this hotel was. I had a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Keep the groovy lights, where do I hang my shirt??”
Reviews.Author: Paul B
Reviews.Content: This might be the hotel for you if you value contemporary design, always wished for ambient lighting in the bathroom and travel with only a toothbrush and a change of underwear. Only three clothes hangers are provided, because there's no room for more. Be prepared to climb over your bed partner to leave the admittedly comfortable bed, but don't bring up a drink from the bar - only one of you can reach the only bedside table. Checking yourself in (and out) avoids human contact, if that's what you're after. There's no restaurant, but you can purchase pre-packed dishes. And re-heat them in the microwave. Yourself. The lounge is lovely with comfortable seating and atmosphere, but balance that against difficulty entering your room if both the shower and toilet doors are closed.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Citizen M Amsterdam City”
Reviews.Author: Victor013
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. I did not like the room - too small, no bathtub (only shower), no closet to hand cloth (only a rack with 2 or 3 hangers). I did not like the "bathroom and the toilet" - there were no "...room" - just a toilet at one wall of the room enclosed in a transparent galss cylinder, and a shower at the opposite wall also enclosed in a glass cylinder. The sink was tiny and pretty much useless. The only redeeming feature was the bed - large and very comfortable. It was blocking the window, so that you could not open or close the shutter. there was no thermostat in the room to control temperature. What I really hated is the hotel attitude to checking in. Their official time was 2:00 pm. I came in at 12:00. They said that if I want to "check in early" - I had to pay extra 20.00 Euro. I think this is outrageous. They also said that there was no room for me to check in "early", but once I agreed to pay the 20.00 Euros - the room matierialzied withhin a 5-10 minutes. Will NEVER STAY THERE AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “"Not for everyone but perfect for some"”
Reviews.Author: krpalace
Reviews.Content: Not everyone will enjoy this hotel but I loved it. It is comfortable without being stuffy, modern without being cold and friendly without being intrusive. It feels like a neighborhood more than a hotel. Minimalism is my favorite theme. If you like traditional hotels, you will not like this. But the staff was extremely helpful and being in the room was an adventure itself. I felt like I spent too much time in the room with all the great movie channels and the comfort of the bed. The hotel (garden side) was extremely quiet. The food was delicious and, based on what I saw elsewhere in the city, not exhorbitantly expensive. The beer was a fine deal. I understand there will be a hotel in NY soon and that the rooms will have a separate bath. I think that's a pity because the modular style is what made it so unique. But I did travel alone and if you do not want to engage in personal functions in front of your companion you will want your own room.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, fancy and efficient”
Reviews.Author: jfd_groningen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really a different style. Its design is very modern. Checkin and Checkout is self-service, which is very efficient and fast. The room itself is fancy and efficiently organized with showers and toilet integrated in the room. Not suitable for two persons if each want some privacy. For one or two nights the room is nice and if you are on the way to the airport or otherwise need an efficient hotel for a night, this will do. But if you plan to stay some time in the room itself (except sleeping), I would choose for something else.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky and different”
Reviews.Author: Malcolm C
Reviews.Content: I think they have the marketing right! A great bed, fluffy towels, internet access and a different approach. We used the loo and shower thinking "beam me up Scotty" with the wrap around acrylic screens and coloured lighting! We spent two nights in August 2011. Everything worked, the price was reasonable and the tram transport just outside the door. Breakfast was different, a paper bag! Fresh croissant, yogurt with nuts, an apple and freshly ground coffee. Different to what is usually provided but it was all fresh and service was almost instant. Communal dining/lounge areas have 5 or 6 different "nooks" to relax in while sharing papers, magazines etc. Do it yourself check in was a bit confusing but friendly staff were on hand to help. Overall a pleasant change that we both enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “different but nice”
Reviews.Author: Beedoo_10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at citizenm for our first anniversary for 4 nights and had an enjoyable time there. We were a bit dissapointed in the food choices as it was all prepared and you microwaved it yourself. Apart from this the service was excellent, the rooms clean and comfortable and nice places to relax downstairs. The trams run frequently although the last one from the city back was round midnightish. There was a line of shops and chinese and nice bar restaurant 5 minutes walk down the road . Overall a nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Donstallione
Reviews.Content: Absolutely amazing experience, my favourite Hotel in the world right now, the decor is funky throughout, the best beds in the world, proper showers, amazing staff, and great value for the quality of the place, everything about the place is just great. Probably one of the best hotels in the world. Let's hope they keep the standard up and expand quickly into other cities in the world, we need more CitizenM!!! Stay here and you will not be disappointed!! Definitely deserving of the title 'Worlds trendiest hotel' Absolutely superb hotel in a fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam City Hotel Citizen M”
Reviews.Author: Ana K
Reviews.Content: Such an amazing concept, soooo surprisingly comfortable, very convenient in location. When my boyfriend booked this hotel I was a little upset as the pictures looked like it maybe just a concept hotel, when we finally got to the hotel, front desk man Andy, just was soo friendly and sweet, and we got to our room, came back down for the 24hr bar and food, and it was just getting better and better, the food and all staff are excellent, they actually love their jobs and it shows. We were near Station AMS ZUID which is a short 2minute walk to the hotel, we went to the station and bought a full unlimited access pass to get around for 72hrs within the city. I was not bored, we had full days packed full of sightseeing and enjoying ourselves. Food and restaurant dining is very pricey, however, very well worth it. I fell in love with Amsterdam, the people and just sooo charming.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but small rooms with toilet at entrance”
Reviews.Author: Pra_vem
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel but small rooms with toilet at entrance.Other the size of the room everything is good.Free wifi,if you dont carry a laptop you can use free internet in the lobby along with free printouts.

Reviews.Title: “Funky and Fun!”
Reviews.Author: whovian10
Reviews.Content: I don't know about having to share this room with a partner, but for a solo traveler such as myself, the room was a treat! The room feels a bit cramped at first as you have to walk around the toilet and shower pods to get to the bed/chair area, but you quickly get used to it and the room seems bigger the longer you are in it. It was very clean and the bed was one of the most insanely comfortable beds I've ever had in a hotel. It was very fun to play with the remote and change the room lighting colors and it was also nice to have such a wide range of channels - especially English lang - after having been travelling awhile making up my own stories to the tv I watched. The hotel is just a block away from the train station and across the street from the tram making it very easy to get to and from the sights of Amsterdam. Everyone I encountered at the hotel was very nice, spoke amazing English and was full of smiles and helpful hints. I thoroughly enjoyed my two nights at Citizen M and I'm thrilled that they are expanding into other cities.

Reviews.Title: “Great for me but not right for everyone.”
Reviews.Author: Ellis2
Reviews.Content: Perfect place for 1 person or a couple. Imposible for a family or with kids (unless getting multiple rroms). Every rooom is the same and all have just 1 bed.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be everyone's cup of tea and wasn't mine”
Reviews.Author: deccrv
Reviews.Content: This is the second concept hotel I've stayed at in Amsterdam recently the first being the truly awful Concious Hotel at Vondel Park. Anyway this comes down to personal preference. On the plus side, it's clean, good wifi, good TV and a comfortable bed but there in my view too many downsides. Breakfast was 9.95 euros in a paper bag which consisted of a very average croissant, a yoghurt, an apple and a small coffee - not great choice or valley for money. The rooms are like prison cells more than rooms, all very square with the loo and shower in the middle of the room and the auto check in/check out is very unwelcoming. The hotel is also full of really tedious quirky notes about it operates, it's rules etc and they are just so boring and condecending. The staff were ok from what I saw but overall the experience just doesn't work for me, it might for you but that's your choice. As for next time in Amsterdam I'll go for something a little more traditional with seperate toilet etc.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Fun”
Reviews.Author: Sian001
Reviews.Content: For those of you looking for somewhere unique to experience in this fantastic city - look no further. Here you can set your mood in your room with your own mood pad. Experience a rain water shower with exhilirating shower gels, and best of all sleep in a huge bed with puffy duvets and comfy pillows. Two choices avalble for those who need to be close to the airport or those who want to be near the city. Hope you enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Cool”
Reviews.Author: Gusse
Reviews.Content: Very modern and chill hotel. Easy to find near Amsterdam Zuid Station. Hyper modern solutions, that fit a young spirit:) Rooms very smart built, with the most you need (without a refrigator) for a city break if you are a solo traveller or a couple. Wifi worked well. Clean and nice. Maids did their job satisfactory. Comfortable big bed. Helpful staff. Nice lobby and design. A little tram trip (15 min) out of the city centre(Leidseplein t.ex.) but it's just pleasant to come back to a peaceful area after a day in the hustle and bustle of the city, I think. Reasonable prices. Canteen/shop in the lobby, but noone near outside the hotel. Will go back next time in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable Business Trip Hotel as Long as 1 in Room”
Reviews.Author: Reda E
Reviews.Content: Reasonable hotel for business trips. Quite a friendly crew. Very small rooms and limited privacy; very difficult for sharing

Reviews.Title: “the best bed i have ever slept in”
Reviews.Author: markhusted
Reviews.Content: This is a really cool concept hotel. The rooms are small but very well designed and as a business traveller they are equipped with everything that you need for a short stay. Free movies and Wi Fi and the biggest firmest bed i have ever slept in. the only downside is that the hotel is in the financial district and that gives you a problem finding restaurants nearby. i stayed on a weekend and nothing was open. hoever its only ten minutes in a cab to the city center so its not a real problem. Cool little place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very good and a few annoyances”
Reviews.Author: bgolinvaux
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during my visit at the IBC show. What I liked : - Clean rooms, nice design. I loved the Vitra furniture :) - Friendly staff - Quiet - Easy to pay for food and drinks (swipe the room card) What I disliked - THE ROOM WAS COLD even though temp was set to 24Â°C ! This is unacceptable. - There is no fridge in the room (maybe the room WAS the fridge :)) - There are not enough storage in the room

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: fima m
Reviews.Content: a real funky different hotel. it doesnt have a pool and the normal faciliies a hotel ideally would have but it has a great little room where you can change the colours and mood of your room. it also has free inroom movies so at times when it was raining, it was great to kick back and enjoy a flick. the hotel also offered free interent use. the only downfall is the rooms are very small and the shower is see through so if your not comfortable with who your sharing a room with, this might not be the place for you. but overall, a great hotel, about 5 stops away from the happening part of town.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: aucdoha
Reviews.Content: I like pretty much everything about the hotel. The bed was very big and comfy. I also really liked that they had reasonably priced foodstuffs in the lobby at all hours and you just had to swipe your room key to pay for it. Nice tv with free movies. And I also liked the design of how they incorporated the toilet and shower into those cylinder things in the room. And everything was really clean. The location is quite a ways outside the city center but the #5 tram stops right in front of hotel. Its also very very quiet and peaceful, and its like an 8 minute train ride to and from Sciphol Airport. A couple of problems were the remote control which controls everything (tv, lighting, blinds, temp...) sometimes took awhile to connect to the network. Also even when u turn the temp all the way up (23 Celsius) it remains cold in room. Also I was staying here solo so if your traveling with somebody else the design of the room might make some people uncomfortable. There's also no fridge in the room. I loved this hotel and I am planning another trip to Amsterdam and I will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good & clean hotel, not an ordinary hotel”
Reviews.Author: FiratB
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in CitizenM this summer for 3 nights. The hotel is located very close to tram station where you can reach the city center in nearly 15 minutes. When you walk into the building, you can recognize that this is not a routine hotel. The rooms are mid size with very modern design. You can use a remote control for controlling the curtain, room temperature TV and even color of the lighting. Cons: Rooms are very clean and staff is very kind. The bed is very large and nearly 1/3 size of the room. Pros: There are no place to put the luggage, and other stuff. And also there may be a refrigrator in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent , very quirky!!”
Reviews.Author: rawshack
Reviews.Content: Me & my girlfriend stayed at this hotel a few weeks ago. Its a little out the way but a simple tram ride will take you there. The hotel is very clean & smart. very modern with lots of apple macs & tv's. the room is pretty small but i liked that as every thing was really cosy. If you want some thing different , somewhere that will leave you alone then this is the place for you. oh, the funky lights was fun too. you will defo enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great people, fantastic time”
Reviews.Author: stanton525
Reviews.Content: arrived at citizen m Amsterdam city on Sept. 1. as soon as I walked in the door Marko checked me in and served me my first beer. check in and check out very easy! 24 hour food and drink fantastic! Rooms very nice for a single guy. Also got free phone calls to the U.S.! Recommend this place to everyone. It was GREAT!!

Reviews.Title: “Still pretty good - prefer it in non tourist season though :)”
Reviews.Author: DoonLoomden
Reviews.Content: Stayed 11 days in August after a positive stay in May. Room was good as expected, and clothing fit in drawer under the bed quite easily for all those moaners/whingers. Noticed cleaning staff was quicker than last time...missed around the shower on the first day but other days were all fine. Staff were generally helpful and friendly... except I did end up getting screwed over by a amsterdam cabbie (the one time out of 10 i didnt negotiate the price before hand... he charged 70 euro for a 12-15 euro trip....) The night staff showed no interest or desire to assist me in dealing with the situation... this seems to be common in Dutch Tourism industry.and where the customer service and helpulness stops - as long as its trivial they will help.. but when theres a situation or something potentially negative they become very hands off. Noticed alot more smokers outside this time than in May... most have the habit to literally stand outside the door and others have to walk through their smoke tips - -better food in canteen (sushi and light sandwiches are ok..but need more variety).. the breakfast sadwiches being tested in the AM were a great idea -a latch or even rubber band to keep shower doors closed (sometimes if the shower door doesnt seal right than the shower will not start) still one of my favorite hotels

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and may be we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: SmartElza
Reviews.Content: Breakfast should be more friendly. From our vacation we have the experience from four other hotels.So, for 10 euros we had full table in Poland, Germany, Italy and Swiss. The room is clean and bed is very good. Cool idea with all from features of SmartHouse!

Reviews.Title: “George Jetson would be jealous”
Reviews.Author: IMATourista
Reviews.Content: By no means your average place to stay. Service, cleanlines and cost are exceptional in this wonderfully modern hotel (great electronic controls for lights, TV and shades to create just the right ambiance in your room, ultra modern lobby) 24 hour food and beverage availability and convenient access to the train station and Schipol airport. For a first or last nite in Amsterdam, this is the place to stay. We arrived late and the restaurant staff were efficient, friendly and helpful. We hope to try other citizenM hotels around the world.

Reviews.Title: “we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: naomi c
Reviews.Content: me and my friends came for a long weekend, absolutely loved it. near enough to the leidespie; only a few stops on the tram and taxis were only 11 euros back at night. hotel was amazing, so comfortable, bright and clean. service was amazing, clean sheets and towels every day, unlimited movies and all staff were friendly and helpful. price was extremely reasonable but the bar prices were slightly expensive. LOVED IT!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated, Overpriced and seemed like a hostel. Ideal for 1 night.”
Reviews.Author: armedwithamind
Reviews.Content: I spent a long weekend here with my girlfriend and my experience here was ok but I wouldn't return. The location from the airport is good. A quick train ride from Schnipol to Zuid station is cheap and takes a few minutes but the city it too far away. In the space of 3 days I spent over 100 euro on transport. On a Saturday night after 12pm we paid 29 euro! The number 5 tram beside the hotel is pretty reliable and only 7 euro for a 24 hour pass but its a pity is stops at 12. The hotel is about 5 minutes walk from Zuid station and there is a signpost directing you to the hotel but when I seen the hotel it just looked like a university building. We were greeted by a lovely member of staff on arrival who showed us how to check in which I was grateful for. On check in I asked for a 'city view' room and ended up with a nice of the car park :/ The room was 'cool' but at the same time it was cramped. The room is controlled by a remote control which has options such as turn lights on / off, or turn on the tv etc. The mood lights on the tube like shower / toilet was pretty cool on the other hand when my girlfriend was getting ready using the mirror and I needed to use the toilet there was no room. The shower was awkward to use at the start but I soon got onto the hang of it. The room had no iron which caused a little nuisance (not for me since easyjet lost my baggage) but we had the choice to use an iron downstairs. I didn't like the fact there was no restaurant in the hotel. Ready made sushi and the choice of rice etc isn't a satisfying meal, after a long day of walking around the city I would like a more exciting choice of food. A 500 metre walk down the street and I found a pretty good restaurant. I paid 400 Euro to stay in the CitizenM for 3 days and spent over 100 Euro on transport to and from the city. Having reading all the good reviews I was disappointed. I could've stayed somewhere like the Marriot for the same price and been a lot closer to the city. On my next visit to Amsterdam I would not return to the CitizenM

Reviews.Title: “Different and fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: MashedOnFashion
Reviews.Content: Booked citizenM after reading reviews on tripadvisor. We weren't disappointed. From the minute we arrived and someone was immediately on hand to take our bags to the safe left luggage area it was fantastic. The rooms are not as poky as they look in photos - the huge windows mean they feel very airy. The MASSIVE bed is also great for chilling out on as well as sleeping. Little touches, like the coloured mood pad, being able to pick our room on check in (floor/view depending on availability), two shower gels (one "day" one "night", and also how quiet it was but still on a tram route to town just made it a really enjoyable stay. Definitely reccommend to anyone. Food was a bit expensive, but we found it expensive everywhere in Amsterdam to be honest.

Reviews.Title: “Great and fun place, very convenient”
Reviews.Author: Monika75017
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying at this hotel, the location is convenient as very easy to go to the center of Amsterdam by tram. The rooms are fitted for short stays, with a wonderful big bed and very easy to use amenities. Internet everywhere and free of charge, free movies and a nice cantine where you can have all kind of snacks and drinks all around the clock. Friendly staff and fun athmosphere top it all! Great concept for any kind of frequent traveller!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the concept, execution needs work”
Reviews.Author: evanrud
Reviews.Content: We loved the room and the whole vibe of the hotel. The bed was big enough to share with our two kids which was a big plus. However, the room is so dependent on technology that it can be a liability. The remote handset controls everything. And when it stops working, as ours did . . . well, let's say this is the first time our hotel room ever had to be rebooted. Sort of like when they need to reboot your in-flight entertainment system on the plane -- except in this case you're sitting around hoping to take a shower after a long day sightseeing, and CitizenM Ambassadors are coming in and out of your small room to try to fix it. The hotel is minimally staffed, so we also found it was hard to help -- calls down to the staff often went unanswered. They are doing anything from rebooting rooms to calling taxis to tending bar all at once. They are friendly though. Finally, the room is really dusty. Mybe from the linens? Not sure why, but anything left out at night (laptop, shoes, anything) wa coated with a visible layer of dust in the morning. Dust we must have been breathing all night too. The hotel is not in the centre of town but is very close to the airport, and it's 15 minutes into town on the number 5 tram -- so not a problem at all.

Reviews.Title: “Please open similar places all over Europe!!”
Reviews.Author: FRETZHO
Reviews.Content: It's true that rooms are small and that some may lack intimacy but i find this hotel the perfect place in city like Amsterdam where you are most of the time out of your room and mainly go back for sleep or rest. The hotel is conveniently located, staff is helpful and i appreciated the large bed and available movies to watch. We had a very comfortable stay and would definetly come back!

Reviews.Title: “Small but wonderfully efficient and affordable”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysTraveled
Reviews.Content: European hotel prices are on the high side if you are coming form the U.S. This little gem of a hotel keeps the pricing down and is a smart choice for the budget conscious traveler. Location is very good, not to far from the center of town and tram stop is right outside of hotel. In case you are traveling through Europe, the train station is alos just a 3 minute walk. The rooms are EFFICIENT. Meaning small, but very modern. if you are newly dating your partner..this room might nt give the privacy you're used too, as the bathroom is practically on top of your bed. Overall very very good value for the price paid. Really like the "vibe" of this "concept hotel. would for sure returm.

Reviews.Title: “Practical & comfortable with everything at your fingertips!! Unbiased Review”
Reviews.Author: Good2go
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 21st - 24 August 2011, we had two rooms and 4 guests. The hotels closest station is Zuid which you can get from Schnipol Airport with a transfer time of approx 25 minutes with a 3 euro fare. From Zuid station it is about a 5 minute walk to the hotel, there is a little park beside the hotel. The area is great for business and with excellent transport links with the tram stop a 2 minute walk from the hotel which takes you to the museum district or dam square so very easy to get around however bear in mind that the tram service ends at 12 midnight. Tram fare is 1.60 euros. The hotel was very easy to check in with ambassadors always available if you require any help. Check in is at 2pm so if you want to check in straight away on arrival it is a 20 euro charge or they are happy to keep your suitcase locked away if you want to go out and check in later. The appearance of the hotel is well kept with outstanding detail and dÃ©cor, very contemporary, even the designer portfolios on display such as Gucci and dior etc. They have a small canteen area, with a lounge area and a work station to use the macs or further down a study area etc. The rooms: Rooms are compact, clean and stylish with everything you need. Beds are comfortable with extra pillows located beneath the bed. shower and toilet pods with mood lights. The windows in the hotel rooms cannot be opened so there is aircon on 24/7 however you can adjust the temperature to a maximum of 23c which it can still be a bit cold so I would suggest bringing pyjama's or something if you will feel cold during the night. All features of the room are controlled with a computerised remote which can adjust the temperature, blinds and shades, the tv and mood lighting very practical so you do not have to get out of bed to do this. There is not much privacy in the room if you are sharing so bear this in mind, you can pull a shower curtain across the room which separates the bed from the bathroom area however it can be a little see through if you have the blinds and shades open so you have to be comfortable with whoever you may share with. The TV is satellite so you do get English channels and movies on demand if you want to watch TV. The room also has European and English 3 pin plugs also so adapter is not needed. Rooms are cleaned daily and very well, however they do not have a dry cleaning service if you may require that. Wi-Fi is free throughout the hotel and free access to the macs as well with a printer. Canteen: Can get a range of food from fruit priced at 1 euros, pastry, confectionery and deli priced from 0.70 - 5 euros, drinks priced from 2 - 3 euros, I would not say overpriced as these seem to be standard prices unless you go to a supermarket. Checkout: Is easy and simple. Checkout is at 11am or for a later checkout of 3pm is 20 euros. We had no issues at all with this hotel, it is quiet so out of the hustle and bustle of dam square. We would stay here again however the hotel is not very child friendly, I would say from 10 year olds and up.

Reviews.Title: “Love it! LOVE IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kvitochka
Reviews.Content: I loved it! It was really amazing hotel, great concept! Budget luxury: the rooms are very small but well equipped. Everything is very modern, creative, user-friendly. You feel yourself like in some gallery or the museum of modern art. Downstairs they have many different lounges with TVs and books and Apple computers, where you can read, play, have a drink etc. The food kiosk / lounge is opened 24 hours. Prices are absolutely decent. Staff is very friendly and helpful! Internet and movies on demand - free of charge. The services are limited, but good quality and nice contemporary design and decor everywhere! I would strongly recommend to see this hotel at least once. Absolutely new and great concept, I have never seen anything similar. LOVE IT!

Reviews.Title: “perfect for business”
Reviews.Author: DavidSzeinuk
Reviews.Content: I arrived in Amsterdam on business and the Citizen was one of the successful. The sleeping room very functional, the bed very comfortable. The automated reception is very modern. The meeting corners are very nice and practical. Location was perfect for me, close to airport, train and tram on the corner, no so far from downtown and very quite surroundings. This Hotel is perfect for singles or couples, not for families.

Reviews.Title: “Like a good 4*!”
Reviews.Author: Jitse
Reviews.Content: Great value! Practical and efficient airport like check-in system. Welcoming lounge area. Rooms are 4* fitted, compact, but stylish and comfortable. Breakfast could be improved - I would skip the "lunch bag" offer - the croissant wasn't fresh plus using the plastic cutlery could be avoided by offering prepackaged day fresh "pret-a-manger" style sandwiches.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, brilliant concept, will definately return!”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Coleslaw
Reviews.Content: 1. This hotel has a unique concept and this was one of the reasons why we chose it....and we were certainly not disappointed! 2. Although the check in is 'self serve', (seems odd at first- but it's simple, sensible and it works!) there are staff members on hand to help 3. Staff were friendly, welcoming and genuinely appeared to be happy (and proud) to be at work 4. Decor is unique, funky, individual and practical! I particuarly enjoyed reading the facts about different countries and fopund inspiration from some of the quotes! 5. I loved the idea of the toilet and shower pods and I was not disappointed! 6. Large, comfy bed! 7. Mood lighting was a unique and fun experience! 9. 'Canteen' area- just what we you want and need, with a touch of class! Brilliantly done! 8. Hotel is in a great location (5 minute walks from World Trade Centre district), Zuid Train Station. Tram stops are more or less on the hotel's door step. 9.Tram ride to Vondel Park takes about 10 minutes. (Walking would take 45 minutes and be lovely to stroll along past the boutiques, patisseries, delis and cafes on Beathovenstraat). 10. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, innovative, would stay again. Shame about the dripping shower and air con!”
Reviews.Author: Angelika H
Reviews.Content: Finding the hotel was easy from Amterdam Zuid station, with a handy food area which serves the local business district (closed at the weekend). The check-in was all on computer interfaces upon arrival. You make your own room key (it's a magnetic swipe card which acts like a key fob if you buy anything in the hotel's cafe to charge items to your room bill, very clever design!). There are always plenty Citizen M staff about if you have problem with checking-in or to serve you in the cafe. The decor and design of the hotel is very swanky; try to think IKEA with tongue-in-cheek instructions/jokes dotted about the place. The food and drinks in the food area were lovely. It's self-service from the fridge, with a microwave if you want to warm up stuff like noodle soup. I had a mozzarella/basil/tomato sandwich one day with green tea and jasmine; yummy! Apart from weird things in the room, and the dripping shower (I assume it was just our room) I would stay here again. I'm even tempted to try the Glasgow version of the chain! The room itself was tiny, but compact, so it's not really a bad thing. Just like the hotel's website's pictures suggest, there is cylinder-type construction around the toilet and another around the shower. The mood light rings were a novelty and you get to change the colours using the computerises remote. The remote can also be used to change the blinds, the light shade, the TV, the air. We had a lot of fun playing with it all. The bed is huge, despite the size of the room, with extra pillows provided in the drawer beneath. The only downside is that the duvet is a bit thin, and there isn't a way to shut down the aircon at night, so even at 23C (according to the remote) it can get a bit cold. There is a small clothes

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Lesley_JacobsStewart
Reviews.Content: We had booked into the CitizenM for affordability and fun, (kinda like a one-night-stand). Well this hotel might just be the one-that-got-away! We had a great time at the CitizenM. It was a little bit remote from central Amsterdam, but a great way to ease you into the culture. The shops in that area are beautiful and the art that you stumble across in your tour of the park is incredible. It's a must-stay! The staff were friendly, the food was great, (albeit pricey) and the atmosphere was buzzing with excitement. The room was surprisingly spaceous (once we stowed the luggage under the bed), the shower and toilet were novel, and the bed luxuriously big. The movies on demand was a real bonus.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time at hotel not as good as the first”
Reviews.Author: kittyjanlee
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel in Jan and loved every min of it the staff where helpful fun and all ways had a smile for us, we loved it so much we have chosen to go back this time, however we had one problem and trying to get a member of staff to discuss it with was a nightmare the person I did talk to did not log my complaint when I told him to log it he said I have when I said well you don't no my room number or my name tells me you have not lodged my personal complaint he just walked of and served another customer very rude!! we had booked out 5 rooms at the hotel and spent a lot of money the least we expect is full working service if not an alternative.. Very disappointing and did but a little dam on or weekend away because we loved it first time round.

Reviews.Title: “love it, love it, love it”
Reviews.Author: angela t
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I recently stayed at the Citizen M Hotel, Amsterdam City. What a fantastic hotel, Two years old and s relatively new chain, with two new hotels due to open shortly in London. Only 6 minutes from the Airport by train. Get off at Zuid Irenestraat station and it's literally a five minute walk to the hotel. Lovely Hotel, immaculate, fantastic rooms with mood change lighting. Fantastic wall to wall beds with linen changed daily. The staff are fantastic and go out of their way to inform you of local tram routes etc, which by the way, is outside the hotel. It only takes 7 minutes by tram to amsterdam centre. Get off at either the Dam or Central Station. Fantastic decor, 24 hour cafe, free films, free safe, what more can I say. We have been to Amsterdam several times but this Hotel far outweighs any we have stayed at. Don't look any further, you won't better this hotel for location, price, rooms and location.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: Phoebe_Scott
Reviews.Content: This place is definitely great value for money, located at the quiet side of the city but not too far at all. It only takes about 5 minute on the tram, then you arrive at the city centre! Stylish furnishing and comfortable setting at lobby and bedroom also. Very friendly, helpful and approchable staff, actually they're more like your friends then people who work there. Most of all... they have the most comfortable hotel bed that I've ever slept on, and the awesome-est rainforest shower, wakes me up in the morning also calms me down before bed time!

Reviews.Title: “we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Inaie
Reviews.Content: it was fun and funky to stay at Citizen M.

Reviews.Title: “This Place is fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Louche1864
Reviews.Content: The directions on how to get here from the airport are very clear and it is very easy but when we got out of the train station at 6.30 in the morning, I thought i would play it safe and ask. I knew this was going to be a great place to stay when the first person who walked by on the street happily stopped to give directions when asked ,and actually happened to work at citizenM. He happily picked up my partners bag and carried for it for her to the hotel around the corner. The staff here are great and the set up is so original and really cool. You can`t help but feel at home here and staff go out of their way to help in anyway they can. it is located in a nice spot only a few minutes by tram from town and only a 5 - 10 minutes walking will bring you to some nice local cafes and restaurants. The room is not massive but is the perfect size for a couple and is really all you need to be comfortable and also cosy. I think this place is brilliant and i hope that the concept spreads its wings into the Southern Hemisphere soon as I would love to stay in a citizenM hotel again. Young or old this hotel doesn`t discriminate and what stood out to me was the wide variety of people staying there - there were older couples, younger couples, singles professionals and people on holidays - a really great vibe at all hours of the day or night.

Reviews.Title: “Eclectic setting, affordable and great location.”
Reviews.Author: Cars2001
Reviews.Content: After a long flight we just wanted to rest, arriving at citizen M we were welcomed by smiling friendly staff. The rooms were awesome, even though we were tired the room caught me by surprise, just couldnt help but play with the remote control that controlled everything in the room. Mood lighting was awesome, shower and toilet in a weird capsule! This place is great value for money, close to the airport and only 10mins by tram to the central district. Highly recommended, we will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “It was more interesting (and better) than we expected”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: The hotel is trying a number of "new" ways of running a hotel, that takes some understanding, but ALL the staff make EVERY effort to help, including trying to sort out the Amsterdam parking system (for which you need a "Chipnik" card - non-Dutch credit and debit cards will not work). A previous review gave an unfair picture of the hotel. It is only noisy at the bar, at some times of the day, when a lot of people are gathered in an open area with a low ceiling. It is NEVER noisy in the rooms, and there is no awareness of people moving around.

Reviews.Title: “Funny details and cool setting”
Reviews.Author: funlovingfoodie
Reviews.Content: Good use of space, the room didn't feel cramped at all, although this is no place to actually stay and unpack for a week (no closetspace at all, the hotel clearly aimes fot the citytrippers and that is okay of course)..As stated by other travellers, this is no hotel for people who are not used to seeing each other naked. Couples or really really good friends or close family only! The shower is completely transparant, the toilet does not leave much to anyone's imagination either. We found this hotel really cool though.. free on demand movies, best bed and pillows ever, the changing roomcolours and rainshower are great and the cute details (the 'entrancecarpet' reads: Citizen M says: Nice shoes!' and there are witsy signs and remarks and stuff everywhere) make it worth it. Staff is helpfull although fairly optional since everything is automated (lot's of people are still getting used to that so you will get assistance when checking in/out if needed). Most of them only speak English, which gives it an international feel.. I still do not see the point in that, but it didn't bother me either. The rooms are not totally soundproof.. but we had 13 guys on our floor who where getting ready for a bachelor party.. only isolation cel can fully block that kind of noise! :) Only thing not working was the room music, which was unfortunate but we didn't mention it to front desk since we only used the room for an hour in the morning and half an hour at night before going to sleep, so it didn't matter to us anyway. Public transport is literally around the corner. Parking is indeed hell, lots of available spaces but mastercard was not accepted.. bring coins, really! It's the only thing that works for foreigners! We did not have breakfast in the hotel but did not find it overly expensive.. 2â‚¬ for a bottle of water in a hotel is not really outrageous, is it? This really is a fun hotel for a short stay and for people who are looking for something different!

Reviews.Title: “Everything what you need for short city trip”
Reviews.Author: PANDAFrankfurtAmMain
Reviews.Content: Good things 1. Free DVD at hotel room 2. Clean 3. Small but unique plus designer furniture. 4. Price was good compare other hotel in Amsterdam and.. The location was convenient but not great. not much privacy when you using the WC View from room is feel like outside of city but not in nice way ...so I closed the window all the time. overall It is good if you have a short trip in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families with teenagers”
Reviews.Author: Olinga
Reviews.Content: Nice modern place. Very big beds in Ã  small room. Especially the lobby is beautyfull. Free internet everywhere and also computers that can be used. Easy way to the city center. All day breakfast. Simpel but allright for us. Great coffee. For us THE best place to stay while in Amsterdam with our teenagers. They also like THE technics in THE rooms.

Reviews.Title: “This is a quirky hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Suzy-an
Reviews.Content: This hotel will appeal to certain peole so lease read previous reviews to get a good idea. I loved this hotel - the location is so handy for both airport and central Amsterdam - brilliant if you are unfamiliar with the city. It is kept very clean and all the communal areas are modern, inviting, visually brilliant! The room is small - you need to be prepared for this! I would say due to size this hotel could only be used for short trips as there is very little clothes hanging space so you find yourself living out your suitcase. The technology in the room is just cool. Remote control, mood lighting, electronic blinds, tv, radio, aircon - it controls it all! Loo and shower - I loved the quirkiness, my boyfriend however was not keen as he prefers more privacy. I love the way this hotel sticks it fingers up to other hotels and says I'm going to break the convention. My boyfriend however likes the comfort of familiarity so it really depends what you're after!

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best hotel in the world :)”
Reviews.Author: Katjuska_82
Reviews.Content: So, it all started on the 6th of August, when we arrived in CitizenM. The girl at reception desk was extremely kind and helpful, so procedure of check-in was easy and fast. As we arrived on the day, when gay parade was, the receptionist said they offered welcome drinks that day because of this event. As there was only 1 drink ready, and we were a couple, they asked us to come back later to enjoy our drinks. The welcome drink was very delicious -fruity, sweet and light. Next morning we went to the canteen. We were really surprised by wide range of coffee offered (capuccino, espresso, etc. They had even hot chocolate milk, and range of tea was also impressive.). As in our country we usually drink black coffee adding a bit milk to it, we offered two Americano coffees and asked if we may get a bit of milk. Barista asked, if we wanted hot or cold milk! I have never experienced such a care for customer in other hotels! Canteen works 24/7; although we didn't choose breakfast (we don't like continental breakfast very much), there was wide range of sandwiches to buy in the morning, and if you want, they can warm it up. Hot ham and cheese sandwiches were great for breakfast. Room was nice, and room-service was made every day. Minus is that they didn't have wardrobe in the room, but hangers near the door was enough for us. Idea of having personal safe in the room to lock your valuables in, while you are away, is perfect! The staff was extremely friendly, asking in the evening how our day was, and what we've seen. It was possible to get Heineken extra cold in the canteen, and cocktails (Mojito was very delicious, and cocktails with Martini as well). The style of hotel-modern and interesting. Although the hotel is located in South Amsterdam, it is possible to reach the centre of the city in 10-15 minutes by train Nr. 5, as tram stop is located just round the corner. 1-hour ticket costs 2.60EUR, but we bought city card (I amsterdam), and it included public transport card for 72 hours. In total, we really enjoyed staying in CitizenM, and on the way home we decided - if we come to Amsterdam again, we will definitely stay at CitizenM.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Caessy1
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, very modern and trendy. Very friendlly staff. The bed is a king size bed, from a wall to wall, with a big window. Very clean and confortable. It is located on the business part of amsterdam, but just around the corner there is a tram directley to the city center (about 10 mins ride).

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: minnieSydney2010
Reviews.Content: Close to transport. Museumplein 5' tram ride. Downton 10-15' tram ride. Amsterdam is a small city, so you can also walk. Train station in a walking distance. Located in a business area, seemed a safe area to move around. The hotel was modern, cosy and clean. Comfy bed, nice shower. Small room, but has all we need for a 3 night stay. Attention was correct. We didn't try breakfast cause we consider it expensive (10euros), you can find cheaper breakfasts in outside caffÃ©s. Not cheap, but it worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, decent location, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne119
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Citizen M Amsterdam City for two nights on a scheduled layover between the U.S. and India. It suited my needs perfectly: relatively inexpensive (by European standards), fairly well located, with friendly and helpful staff. As many other reviewers have mentioned, the design of the place is modern and cool, and the rooms have a "mood pad" gadget, which allows you to set the lighting and temperature of the room, along with mechanized blinds and light-blocking screen. The toilet and shower are basically in the center of the room, each surrounded by a glass pod with sliding doors. The room is literally the width of a king-sized bed (the square bed reaches wall to wall, so you just need to climb up on the end of the bed). The beds are comfortable and the duvets are lovely. The room doesn't feel overly cramped, however, because it is so cleverly designed and unfussy. The layout and size of the room were absolutely fine for me, a solo traveler, who was staying a short time. Had I been planning a longer stay, or traveling with a friend or partner, I would not have considered this a good option. But then everyone has a different comfort level with privacy or lack thereof! The hotel is not central to all the action in town, but the tram stop is steps away and it's an easy, short ride to all the major attractions. The hotel doesn't have a restaurant per se, but it does have some snacks, fruit, baked goods, and prepared food you can purchase--either things meant to be eaten cold, or meals that can be heated in their microwave. There is also a nice bar, and coffee drinks are available 24 hours a day. The lobbies are homey (in a mod sort of way), with couches, lounge chairs, coffee tables, and TVs, and they are meant to be used by hotel guests as places to meet and relax. This makes up for lack of sitting room in the rooms themselves. When I first saw pictures of the place, before I booked a reservation, I was worried I would be made to feel too old and uncool to stay there! (I'm in my 40s.) But that turned out not to be the case. Well, I might be old and uncool, but I was never made to feel that way! All of the staff were friendly and accommodating. They walk you through the self-check-in process and offer recommendations on sites and restaurants. In conclusion, I would especially recommend Citizen M for solo travelers or VERY close couples who are looking for an affordable, fun place to stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not great for holiday”
Reviews.Author: rednanor
Reviews.Content: Myself and my girlfriend stayed here for three nights in Aug '11. We had high hopes for the hotel after reading all the positive reviews but were disappointed in the end. The hotel is very convenient from the airport and is situated in a lovely part of Amsterdam right beside Beatrix Park, unfortunately it was a tram ride in to the city which was a bit of an inconvenience for us as whenever we set off we had to plan our day well in advance as it wasn't going to be possible to call back in which we could have done if we'd stayed closer to the centre. The hotel itself was more like a hostel. There was no life about it, the bar was always empty and the food was all pre packaged and overpriced, more like a poorly stocked canteen. The decor was fine if you like that sort of thing but we found it a bit tacky and too much time was spent on the little details and not enough on the major faults. The room was tiny with no storage space worth talking about and the much talked about mood pad was infuriatingly inconsistent to use, we ended up doing most things manually. We stayed in three other cheaper hotel on our holidays and felt they were all superior to this one. In short it would be fine for one night on business but not really for holiday makers.

Reviews.Title: “Simply amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: Orkaem
Reviews.Content: There's nothing wrong with this hotel. Seriously though. Design, ambiance, even luxury in a customize-able room! Loved every minute of it! I've been at this hotel last May when I attended a conference in RAI center (which by the way is in a 5 minute walking distance through a serene park) with colleagues, who thought that it was the highlight of our Amsterdam trip! Right outside the hotel you can find a tram station (Tram No 5) ready to take you to the most famous Amsterdam locations. Plus, the Amsterdam Zuid trainstation is about 5 minutes away on foot. Plus again, if you plan to stay out a bit more, the night bus stops right outside it! We loved the lunch bar and cocktails, and even bought souvenirs when we checked-out. I would definitely book again and I totally recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience.”
Reviews.Author: emmabob86
Reviews.Content: A friendly, trendy, affordable, comfortable, beautifully designed hotel with the most amazing staff - only 8-12 mins on the #5 tram to the city centre. The rooms are every bit as well-designed and fun as you see in every other review. We traveled with our three 'kids', 18, 21 and 22. Three rooms cost us considerably less than two rooms in a downtown hotel, even factoring in the $15.50 each for 3-day tram cards. Bagged breakfast was efficient and a good start to the day. The only negative for us was having to walk through the clouds of cigarette smoke right outside the hotel front door, but it's Europe so what can you do? If you're taking a vehicle, consider parking at the Olympische P&R, 2 kms away, but be sure to check it has spaces avail. before you go. We parked on the street outside the hotel as the Park and Ride was full. Thanks to Jeff for his advice about parking and for making the temperamental ticket machine work!

Reviews.Title: “Very Cool !!!”
Reviews.Author: Joao1
Reviews.Content: Nice location, 10 minutes from town center, cool staff. Very sophisticated look with lots of nice spots to talk, watch TV, eat or simply rest or read. Very stylish. Few space in the room to accommodate your belongings, so... travel light. Nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Small niggles may drive you mad”
Reviews.Author: ChorltonDragon
Reviews.Content: There are some good things about this hotel. The location is convenient for travel to the airport - it's just one stop from Schiphol by train and a short walk from Zuid station. The standard of cleanliness is good and the staff, when approached, are happy to help. However, there are an awful lot of things with this hotel which are not quite right and which prevent it being anything more than average. The rooms are "quirky", to say the least. It's not the Star Trek toilet and shower combo in the room. Actually they're OK provided you're comfortable with the limited privacy they offer (and there's a curtain which can be drawn across the room for the truly shy). No, the room is an exercise in how to design things which are just not quite right. Some examples: The bed is large and comfortable but only has space on one side. Two people occupying this bed have the option of lying "lengthways" and crawling down the bed to get out, or "sideways" where one person will have to clamber over the other. Inconvenient, especially in the middle of the night! The shower only works when the doors are shut. Fine. However, the doors must be shut and positioned into exactly the right place for the shower to start running. It took me fifteen minutes of fiddling the first time to work this out. There is a safe in the room and it's free to use - and it will even fit an iPad or netbook. It is, unfortunately the narrowest safe I've ever seen and whatever you put in there WILL fall out as you close the door and when you open it again. There's a general lack of storage space in the room and what space there is isn't always used effectively. There are too few hangers, for example. There's a tiny shelf to the side of the sink which will hold a few items at the risk of knocking them off with the aforementioned privacy curtain which brushes up against it. There is some more shelf space under the only mirror in the room but one of the two shelves is occupied by the hair dryer (which doesn't fit very well and has a tendency to fall off). I liked the concept of the "mood pad" which can control the television, the lighting, the aircon and the blinds but I found it a bit unresponsive and, especially where the lights are concerned, rather random. Also: One of the lifts has two parallel vertical rows of identical buttons. If you press the buttons on the right hand side, the doors open to the rooms. If you press the left hand side buttons, the doors open to some sort of housekeeping store. The other door will not then open unless you press the floor number on the right hand side. There are no signs or notices which explain this. OK, you only need to make this mistake a couple of times but that's two times more than necessary. There are toilets on the ground floor for the convenience of people using the expensively-priced canteen area. Rather than having the usual symbols on the doors to indicate whether they are gents or ladies, there are instead tiny, tiny pictures of people - one of whom is a woman and the other appears to be a man in drag - or, at least, I hope it's a man in drag or I've just been to the ladies loo! If all the above sounds like nitpicking then maybe you'll be perfectly happy at this hotel. It is, after all, clean and reasonably priced compared to many hotels in Amsterdam. Lots of people seem to like it, as evidenced by the Trip Advisor rating. If, however, the above sounds like IT WOULD REALLY WIND YOU UP... (remain calm)... then find somewhere else or the place will surely drive you bonkers - like the people who designed it!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is out of this world!”
Reviews.Author: Breukleen
Reviews.Content: First of all, I loved the location: steps away from the #5 tram which takes you to all the attractions in a matter of a few stops, and only one train stop away from the airport. The hotel is set in the background of the Amsterdam World Trade Center. Yet, the area is very quiet and residential. Not much happening in a direct vicinity of the hotel, but it's a nice setting to come back to after a day of sightseeing. We ate at the Thai restaurant, Foodzee, down the block - nice atmosphere, and good food (small portions though). The hotel: a unique experience of a high end luxury, at a budget price. Self check in/out, fresh food for purchase in the lobby, Mac computers and printer, plus free wi-fi throughout the hotel. The lobby is very welcoming, and comfy. The room: was small, as noted in other reviews, but the way it was arranged made it functional. I wished it had a closet to hang the clothes though. With two luggages, and carry-on's we found ourselves with little room to put away our baggage. The bed: super comfy and clean, with a European style duvet sheets. There were even extra pillows in the drawer under the bed. The cool factor: the shower cabin and the toilet are built into capsules, that look like something from the future. The wash basin is small, but it okay. The TV remote is actually a master controller of many things: lighting (including mood lighting), wake up alarm, A/C, window shades, and of course, the TV. Over all, I liked this place a lot, and would recommend it to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Futuristic decor, small but comfy rooms and a perfect location just out of the tourist throngs.”
Reviews.Author: JessDre
Reviews.Content: Loved the CitizenM. Not sure how comfy it would be for much more than the two nights we were there, but it's perfect for a short stay. Helpful multilingual staff, 24-hour bar/snack shop, located across from a tram stop, it's a perfect place to stay for a few days in Amsterdam. The location was one of the best features for us, but may disappoint those looking to stay in the middle of the city. One can hop on the 5 tram at the Prinses Irenestraat station directly across from the hotel and be in the middle of the city in about 5 minutes. Even better, when you get tired of bumbling through crowds in the city center, you can be back on the hotel's quiet street in the same 10 minutes. The only potential complaint we could have about the hotel is that the standard room is a bit too small for any kind of an extended stay, but the hotel seems more geared towered weekend visitors or short term business travelers. The only problem we had personally was that the "mood pad" the hotel proudly touts on their website wasn't working. We asked the front desk staff about it on our way out to see some sites, and it was fixed by the time we got back. So: not a problem at all! All in all, a perfect hotel for a weekend exploration of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “All style, little substance”
Reviews.Author: more_jello_please
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three nights in June 2011. Perhaps my expectations were too high due to the many fine TA reviews of CitizenM, but we were somewhat disappointed. The room is what it is (tiny and quirky but functional) and you probably know that in advance if you've done any amount of research, so I won't spend much time on it. The bed is indeed huge but very firm, and the "tubes" for the shower and toilet are novel if nothing else. But for a hotel that presents itself as an ultra-connected haven for techies, many of their offerings were subpar.
