The moonpad in each room is designed to control all aspects of the ambience - temp, lighting, TV, music, etc. - but at least in our room it couldn't be off its charging pad for more than a couple of minutes before the battery died. Also, the wireless internet was truly worthless. We could not connect at all most of the day, and during off-peak hours when we could connect it was painfully slow. There are several computers in the lobby for guest use, but again they were tough to get on except at odd hours. The canteen is convenient if you need a quick bite to eat, although it's egregiously overpriced and even the selection of food seems to lean toward trendiness (sushi, spring rolls, etc.). Unfortunately there are few other nearby choices. The location is nice if you don't want to overload your senses by staying in cental Amsterdam. It's easily reachable by rail from the airport and then it's a quick and easy tram ride into the city. Be aware if you're a night owl that the trams do stop running fairly early and the options for returning after that are quite limited. To sum up, it's probably worth staying here a night or two just to say you've done so because it's truly unlike any other place I've seen, but after the novelty wears off you'll probably want to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Fr0ggi3
Reviews.Content: The room is tiny yes, everything is amazingly sorted out in the tiny space in the room. Brilliant. The shower and the round cubical with the remote controlled ambient and lighting and almost everything. The best part of it is the Bed! so so comfy. Definitely gonna miss the bed when u are back

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: snackerjacker
Reviews.Content: Very clean. Lovely hotel. Bed was amazing as was power shower. No 5 tram is 1 minute from hotel. This takes you to all locations , Dam Square etc. We got travel card from the information tourist office for 7 euros each. 356 night bus brings you back after 12.30a.m. No 5 tram also takes you to Central Station for train to airport.

Reviews.Title: “What a find .... great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LC702
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel it was really quirky and fun. Rooms are as cool as they look on the website and bed is soooo comfortable. The staff could not have been more helpful and nothing was too much trouble. The hotel is a little far out but the tram stop is literally outside the front door and it is only about 15 mins into the madness.

Reviews.Title: “great location, quirky and exciting hotel”
Reviews.Author: LadyTheodoraDarling
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really special, and interesting. The rooms are perfect and the beds are huge, and you control most things in your room with a remote control. We were doing a five week InterRail trip around Europe and this was one of the highlights of our trip. The hotel is about ten minutes outside Amsterdam city, however right outside the hotel is a tram stop and their is a train station beside it also so there is no problem getting into Amsterdam. The staff for the most part were really helpful and friendly, except for one lady who served us in the bar. The hotel is quirky and maybe not to everyone's taste but I loved the free movies and the mood control lighting and self check in. There was also mac computers for all the guests to use in the lobby which was a definite plus. The tubes in the bedroom of glass may put some people off, as they are placed in the middle of the room and are quite seathrough. The location was perfect for us and we liked the location a lot. Other reviews which state there is no public transport around are incorrect as the tram is literally outside the door.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: fussymom
Reviews.Content: Just a few steps from the Amsterdam Zuid station, just one stop away from the airport. Quiet neighborhood location. Had breakfast at the Bagels and Beans cafe~a terrific recommendation from a prior reviewer. The BEST breakfast ever. We picked up sandwiches and drinks from the Albert Heijn mini grocery store, which is on the left as you head out the train station on your way to the hotel. There is also a full-size grocery about 4 blocks past the hotel. After receiving permission on our first day to use their microwave, we brought in some take-away from the grocery and were scolded wildly by one of the citizenM staff members; she was rude and mean and told us we could do it this ONE time, but would have to eat in our rooms. After I told her we had permission from someone the prior day, she said "well, I guess I am a little crazier about this, as someone had their food explode on my shift". Anyhow, on a happier note, do go visit nearby Haarlem--beautiful, clean and a wonderful historic city. We would of skipped downtown Amsterdam altogether in favor of Haarlem. This hotel is so great.....but, you better be open to an alternative experience :)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: alexjamesbrown
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my girlfriend in October Our room was very small, but functional, and comfortable. The one thing I would say, is that it may not be suitable for a "new relationship" couple - The toilet is actually a glass "tube" in the room! While this is quite novel, it could be pretty embarrassing... The shower is of the same configuration. The LED lighting (you can change the colours etc...) was very cool! One thing I would say is I thought the food was rather expensive. But this is normal I guess. I went out for an evening in Amsterdam clubs, and drunkenly left my phone in a taxi. After calling home on my girlfriends phone, my dad called the hotel, who contacted the taxi company to try and locate it. The morning after, they tried to help me again, having been passed details of my predicament by the night-staff. While the phone was never found, I truly appreciated all the help the hotel staff gave me. Really made a good impression! The tram stop was right outside the station, which made it nice and easy to pop into the centre (about 10-15 mins away) I would definitely return to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is out of this world...”
Reviews.Author: Adi_Pica
Reviews.Content: This hotel was simply wonderful. Gorgeous rooms and lovely lighting system. Huge and comfy bed. Yes, the room is small, but it's enough to make you feel good. Downstairs you have many relax, lounge and business areas where you can hang out. Mac's available for clients and a printer which was a great thing to have. WI-FI all over the hotel. The stuff - just great. Excellent attitude and very helpful. Very easy to get to from the airport. Just 1 train station away (2.5 euros) From the station you just need to walk for 5 minute and you're there. For transportation within Amsterdam, tram number five is just outside the door. Food and drinks are a bit expensive in the hotel, but then, everything in Amsterdam in insanely expensive. There is a "to go" supermarket 2 minutes away with decent prices. Way better than any other crappy hotel in the city center at the same price. You'll need a tram ticket anyway if you plan to see the city (7 euro/1 day) so you only have to go an extra 10 minutes in the tram to get to the city center. Oh, and don't forget to check in with foursquare. You'll get a free coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryRussian
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay for 1-2 nights. 5 min on foot from airport building. Contemporary style. Room is like a gadget to play with. The rooms are small, however, good organized, so you have enough space. The staffs are very helpful and friendly. Fast and automatic check in. Flat screen TV, safe in the room, free Wi-Fi. Super comfortable bed! Very good price for Amsterdam. Drinks and food are quite expensive but you can buy it much cheaper at Supermarket into airport (5min on foot). Public transport: train - 7Euro 10min to Amsterdam Central. Would 100% recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great, relaxed and very trendy”
Reviews.Author: JulzDXB
Reviews.Content: We were only here for 2 nights but wish it was longer. The rooms are all the same and you can choose garden or city view. The rooms are faily small but so are all rooms in amsterdam, and at least these ones look great!! the hotel is very trendy, you check yourself in, there is a canteen/bar open 24/7 so you can come back and have cocktails or beer after a night out. We didnt try the breakfast, more because we wanted to eat in the city. Would have loved to spend more time in the hotel had the trip not been so short. Only drawback was that its not eithin walkeing distance to the city centre. but there is a tramstop right outside, and is a 5 minute ride to the museums, and 10 minutes to most other things.

Reviews.Title: “So many people cannot be wrong...... a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: System38
Reviews.Content: Having always previously elected to stay in central Amsterdam I was a little apprehensive about staying some distance out of town, I need not have been. What citizenM misses out on with regard to a central location centre it more than compensates with every other aspect of its slick and stylish operation. No real need for me to go into detail about check-in, rooms, eating, where to catch the tram, etc, etc as these aspects are fully covered in all of the other positive Tripadvisor reviews. All I can say is that the rooms are indeed fantastic (what a marvellous bed!!), the tram into the city centre is no barrier to making it to the centre although the last tram back is perhaps a little early for some. I must mention the staff, all of whom were discreet but always there when required with great advice and above all fantastic professional service. I am converted, as great as the city centre hotels are (although now somewhat overpriced to a poor Brit!) my first choice for my next visit to Dam will be as a 'citizen', what a great concept. Thanks very much to all at citizenM for a quality stay.

Reviews.Title: “So interesting. Missing few things.”
Reviews.Author: EstebanBelgrado
Reviews.Content: This is definitely very interesting hotel that you should visit at least once. I will not describe it since you have many descriptions of other guests. Just a few remarks from my (business) prospective: if you should stay more then one or two nights pick something else. Don't expect any amenities or services. It's totally do it yourself. Public transport is not close. There is almost nothing near by. Taxi to the city center is cca 15 EUR. Good things - fast and automatic check in. Comfortable bed. Room is like a gadget to play with. Very good price for Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel at a great price that we'll definitely return to”
Reviews.Author: Paddi110
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. I chose this hotel as I was in the city for a concert at the Amsterdam ArenA. A great location both for the airport, ArenA and getting into the city (number 5 tram into the city from next to the hotel). The hotel is modern and unique with great facilities (free wi-fi & movies). You definitely have to be comfortable with whoever you're staying with as the toilet and shower don't afford much privacy but the rainfall shower is amazing! Huge comfortable bed as well and the 24hr cafe has a good selection of food and drinks. I will definitely be back and would recommend to anyone. It might be out of the city but it only takes 15 mins on the tram.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - but please, more hooks to hang clothes on”
Reviews.Author: B0ll0x2U
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights when visiting Amsterdam for Take That / RW concert. Good access to train from Schipol, Metro and the Tram line (No 5) Hotel was cool, rooms and the common areas. Having kitchen in the centre does as they say make the common areas feel a bit like a big living room. Staff were helpful, breakfast was ok, though fruit went quickly on 2 mornings. Great that WiFi is free every where, and a plus for the Macs instead of PCs

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, couldn't be better.”
Reviews.Author: Ashers2009
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for a weekend break and were not disappointed with any detail of the hotel. Firstly its location is very easy to get to with the Amsterdam South train station a few minutes walk away and then the tram (no.5) right outside the hotel to take you into the city centre (48 hours travel ticket on any public transport only 11 euros.) I've visited Amsterdam several times before and have always stayed in the centre but never again! We discovered a whole other city staying further south! It was quiet but only ten minutes away from any part of the city you want to visit - AND AWAY FROM TRACKSUIT WEARING, FOUL MOUTHED BRITS! The reception area and several lounges are very relaxing and the 24 hour food, drink and reception staff available is a very welcome novelty in a hotel. It also has to be said that the reception staff were very helpful indeed, especially Deara. I travel quite a bit and cannot remember someone being as pleasant and genuinely helpful as she was and is a real credit to the hotel. The rooms are very original and have an oriental style to them (the ethos of the whole hotel in fact) and the toilet and shower with their multicoloured lighting was an interesting touch. Also if you can, get a room on the higher levels with a city view of the World Trade Center, which looks fantastic at night. The bed is another talking point and would probably sleep four people if you were that way inclined; very comfortable and right next to the window which gave it an authentic big city feel when you looked out at night. To sum up - brilliant hotel in a perfect location with some of the friendliest staff I've encountered. Would highly recommend this hotel and will definitely be looking into others in the chain in other cities as a result of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could want from a city hotel - excellent!”
Reviews.Author: littlemomorris
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from a 3-night stay at Citizenm. My husband and I were very impressed. They've really thought about what today's traveller needs and they've provided it in a very cool and quirky way which adds to the enjoyment of your stay. We loved the moodpad, free on-demand movies, free WiFi, cheap phone calls, the huge comfy bed, UK socket in the room and the fab lobby area with Macs and a printer for use. We also thought the location of the hotel was great for sightseeing as its so easy to hop on and off tram 5 plus Zuid station is only a few minutes walk. We really liked the fact that the hotel's slightly away from all the hustle and bustle of the old centre whilst still being close to everything. If we visit Amsterdam again we won't hesitate to book and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice!”
Reviews.Author: Truter
Reviews.Content: Convenient to airport - friendly staff at reception - room very different but modern and clean. Breakfast different from the usual and makes one realise the world is a changing! Enjoyed our stay for one evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: Joseatoro
Reviews.Content: I went with my wife for a weekend trip to Amsterdam and we choose Citizen M based on the price and the premises. We were a little bit worried because it looked a little far from A. downtown and attractions. However to our surprise the hotel has a very convenient location, close to Schipol and at the same time with an easy connection to downtown. the tram is just in front of the hotel and it is just a short ride to get to Amsterdam centre. No more than 15 minutes. On the other hand the hotel is amazing, with great design and wonderful and warm staff. The rooms are tiny but with great design. Bathrooms are unique and not for every one, but for us were OK. We ate breakfast there and it is a good option, not cheap, not expensive and it had a very good choice and the lobby is comfortable and with nice furniture and books. I would recommend this hotel strongly a superb relation price-quality, nice design and close to downtown without the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Simply wonderful”
Reviews.Author: mariannes
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at Citizen M Amsterdam and loved it all. Brilliant room, mood lighting, free wifi, very helpful staff (even printing out a train itinerary) for our visit to a concert venue. Most of all, the bed and furnishings were delightful. Design was very luxurious and modern. The food is of exceptional quality and I personally do not feel it was too pricey bearing that and the 24 hour accessibility in mind. I enjoyed a late night udon noodle soup and a blinding Australian homemade ice cream. Would love to visit again and look forward to seeing more hotels open up worldwide.

Reviews.Title: “Great Funky Hotel”
Reviews.Author: smiler1974
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed here for 2 nights in July whilst we went to see Take That. I can honestly say it is the most fun hotel i have stayed in. The rooms are 21st Century with the biggest bed i have ever slept in whilst staying in europe, the comfiest mattress, fluffy pillows and excellent duvet. The shower is a rainfall shower and is superb, around 40 movies on demand and all free of charge,great selection of tv channels and music playlists. I agree the rooms are probably not suited for travellers staying for longer than a few days as space is limited,but if you are travelling with hand luggage and only staying a few days then it is excellent. tram 5 stops pretty much outside the hotel and you can be in central amsterdam in around 10-12 minutes. The hotel is excellent value at 79 euros per night, some hostels in amsterdam charge around this. my only complaint is Amsterdam is so expensive you pay around 5 and a half euros for a pint of beer, thats even more expensive than London,Barcelona and New York. But the hotel is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great option, but pricy”
Reviews.Author: dianem11
Reviews.Content: We loved Citizen M in Glasgow, so when we decided to go to Amsterdam, we automatically booked here. Again, a great experience, right on the number 5 tram with easy access to Amsterdam Central, museums, entertainment district. The room was exactly as expected, clean, modern, smoke free and a little bit tight! Still loved the free movies and wireless. They have good breakfast options, including to-go bags! The only downside was how much more expensive this hotel was than the CitizenM in Glasgow, including a 20 euro charge for early check in. Not sure we would stay here again on our next visit to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Budget luxury at its best”
Reviews.Author: c2h5ethan
Reviews.Content: I came across this hotel some time back when I was researching on where to stay in Amsterdam. The first thing that interest me was the shower cubicle. It's a tubular column with large overhead shower and color-changing LED lighting. Made me want to have something simliar at home. The shower comes with thoughtful details, like AM and PM shower gels so you can start and end the day on the right note. The bed was one of the best I've slept on in a hotel. The bedsheets were from Frette. Felt so nice you wouldn't want to get out of bed. Under the bed, there's a large luggage storage compartment which allows you to store your suitcase "opened up" (if you are using a typical clamshell design suitcase). The moodpad in the room is the thing you need to control every controllable device in the room, from the TV to the lights, to the blinds and A/C. The only downside of stay here would be that it is not situated near to the museums and shopping areas, but this place has good access to trains and trams which can get you to these places in no time. For 69 euros a night, this was a good deal. However prices have been going up, presumably due to the fact that more and more people are aware of this great place. Last check the prices have more than double to 149 euros a night. Would stay here if I go back to Amsterdam, and definitely looking forward to the opening of CitizenM in locations such as London and New York (happening really soon).

Reviews.Title: “Very comfy and functional”
Reviews.Author: aadjazz
Reviews.Content: We have spent three nights on this hotel and we are very pleased. Good value for money, very functional, no waste of space, perfect for technology lovers, very comfy and big bed and the staff is very helpful. I personally liked the power-rain shower and the lightning of the room. Also the movies on demand and free WiFi is always a plus. If you are a hotel traditional sort of people and not open to new experiences please stay away of this hotel. For those who love new experiences and ways to do tourism this is your place. Although there are some downfalls i.e. the canteen was too expensive vs. what is offering. The temperature of the room couldn't be warmer than 23Âºc meaning that if it is cold for you there is no other option, not even been able to switch it off! There a light streaming of air coming from the window which is quite unpleasant. But overall I have to say this is a great hotel, modern, cool, functional and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: tlereya
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a walking distance from the museum quarter. And there is a tram (#5) just outside the hotel which can take you to museum quarter and the city center. The tram is very frequent and runs until midnight. The rooms are superb!! The bed!! Oww the bed!!! It is huge and super comfortable. The lights etc. is super super cute! There is a nice TV and a lot of free movie options (if you ever need). The reception of the hotel is super chic! And the staff is very very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, would definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: kimmok88
Reviews.Content: I spent the weekend with 10 girls at Citizen M and we loved the hotel! First of all the location may seem a bit random but it's within easy reach of the centre (10 mins on the tram which is round the corner from the hotel) and 5 mins from the train station (World Trade Centre) which takes you to the airport for EUR 3 in 10 minutes! You might want to take a taxi to get to the airport though if you don't want to go around trying to find the hotel from the train station (although it's not hard). The first impression is really good, you come in and use the machines to check in, someone will help you with that. The ground floor area has lots of seating and modern facilities. The canteen is open 24 hours and sells snacks more than actual meals. It's a bit pricey but if you want something it's there. They also do cocktails at the bar which is a plus! I bought breakfast from a supermarket we found in town but it's not that pricey to get something small in the morning. I wouldn't recommend paying EUR 10 for their breakfast special though as it's only juice, a croissant and yoghurt. The hotel room is the fun part, it's got a remote control that controls the whole room. You can change the temperature, the colour of the lighting to suit your mood, control the blinds... there's playlists on the TV for when you're getting ready to go out, loads of movies to choose from and normal tv. The shower and toilet are two separate pods, the toilet having frosted windows. The showers are completely transparent so you might feel a bit awkward taking a shower stark naked in front of your roommate (if they're not your partner!) but don't worry there's a white mesh curtain you can draw which although you can still see the outline, makes you not so exposed and it's not too bad really! The room is small though and can be difficult to manoeuvre, it's best for hand luggage sized suitcases and you'll need to be tidy otherwise you'll trip over your stuff! The bed is really comfortable and the tv is on the wall so you can watch tv and fall asleep. Overall it's a really good hotel, and really cheap so it's worth staying there and taking the tram into the centre since hotels there are more expensive and a lot older!

Reviews.Title: “Very innovative concept - very, very innovative”
Reviews.Author: vcchicago
Reviews.Content: This is a very unique concept hotel. Focus on modern, to-the-point, tech-savvy, utilitarian and low cost. Rooms are like containers, almost pre-fabricated but to fairly good standard. Some where in between a super luxury dorm room to an artist's loft house! Seeing is believing. Service was very friendly, location was perfect to the Amsterdam World Trade Center and Amsterdam Zuid Station (15 mins to Schipol airport). Loved all the signs which kind of go as "Citizen M says.....". Drawback: Tight on space (30 sqm); no storage area in room. Positives: XL size king bed, funky (good) bathroom; electronic controls for blinds, temp, lights, alarm and TV. Enjoyed it more on day 2 and 3 versus day 1. Better if visiting single or as a couple - not for visits with kids!! Too tight! Ideal for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “What an experience!”
Reviews.Author: Alejoenlondres
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel for tech freaks like me. Everything is trendy, cool, interactive and fast. This is no place for old people who likes afternoon tea with biscuits as the most excitment that they get in a day... this is for people who lives fast! Great place, great people and great overall experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great if you are travelling light and looking for a cheap option”
Reviews.Author: Wongmseiter
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel once on business and once for a cheap weekend. The latter was far more suited to the rooms here but I had a nice stay both times. A big suitcase will take up the entire floor and if you want an iron or anything printed it might be a mission. There are some great common areas, awesome art and the staff are all upbeat, efficient and friendly. Good tram connection to the city and airport line close by. Nice "help yourself" food and drink (not great value but good selection), free hardcore porn on at all times (to help you reinforce your dutch stereotypes), and a very well considered layout, decor and finishing details that make this the best hotel I have every stayed in for the money. The Glasgow one is good as well and the rooms are slightly bigger...

Reviews.Title: “Felt a bit like a space ship....but loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ayjay-7
Reviews.Content: The photos are exactly as you'll find the citizenM. From the moment you arrive, it's a little different! Check-in was super fast and efficient and we were in our room in no time....and what a room! I would recommend that you do not stay in this Hotel if you don't know your room-mate very well as there's really no privacy....glass shower....see through loo walls....but I really loved the experience and I like to try something new. The location is good. The tram stop is right there and the reception staff were very helpful in giving us directions into the city. Too easy! If you're after something with an edge then give this a go...why not?! Oh, there is some rather graphic erotic art around too, so you may need to blindfold the kiddies!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: estage
Reviews.Content: Food was somewhat expensive, wasn't much nearby and was slightly far from the city center but still close to the metro/transportation. Loved the room and tv, lighting and music options.

Reviews.Title: “Another vote for CitizenM”
Reviews.Author: edamrina
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of positive reviews for this hotel, and those reviews are well deserved. Like the MotelOne chain in Germany, CitizenM does the basics well - huge comfortable bed, good location, internet - but with a twist - love the moodpad! I wouldn't necessarily pay extra for the trendy stuff, but at this price, it's a bit of fun to tell your friends about when you get home! Amsterdam is a compact, walkable city. We bought a 10 ride ticket from the central station on arrival, and then used the tram outside the front door to get into the city centre. I recommend a leisurely stroll through the Jordaan district - this is a picturesque residential neighbourhood with a great atmosphere, and less touristy than the centre of town. PS - when we stayed in October 2010, in front of the lifts on the ground floor, there was a very, ahem, interesting photomontage showing the side view of a series of hotel rooms - check it out (not for the faint hearted, lol!) Love this city!

Reviews.Title: “It didn't fulfill my expectations...”
Reviews.Author: famC60
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights in this hotel, but I would not recommend it for several reasons: 1. The ambassadors at the reception were smiling and friendly, indeed, but they were not listening properly, meaning that they were trying to solve/answer any type of demand/question very fast without paying attention to the guest needs. At check-in/check-out they were clicking soo fast on the computer, that we barely had time to read the instruction/information on the screen (the system of registering and finding your reservation is super efficient, but the personnel who was using it had a lack of proper customer orientation). 2. The room was as described, in terms of size, amenities etc....but, if you are allergic to dust, you'd better avoid this hotel. After unpacking and not more than an hour spent in the room everything was covered with dust and combined with the dry atmosphere from the air-system you can imagine how "nice" we felt. 3. The internet corner looked interesting with several mac desktops, but no proper connectivity and 2 out of 5 keyboards were not working. A nice ambassador came saying that he had no clue why those keyboards were out of order and there might be somebody downloading heavily regarding the connectivity (no follow up, we were left there with no solution)...the rest was ok...

Reviews.Title: “Best stop in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Sub_Marina
Reviews.Content: We stayed in citizenM with my husband on our way to Aruba. We wanted to have a good rest before a long flight., but got much more than just that!)) we absolutely loved this place, with all that small details! The place where technologies meet quality and very personal service. Definately will stay here next time!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent lounge and bartenders”
Reviews.Author: galapperi
Reviews.Content: I have been here twice already, and I truly recommend this hotel for both business and holidays purposes. The hotel lounge is truly spectacular and bartenders Katerina, with her finest cocktails, Angela, with her finest ways, and Gregory, with his finest talks, are as astonishing as the whole surroundings of rich design set and best-in-class furniture around. You really need to stay here a couple of nights at the least and enjoy the cozier and most familiar yet professional atmosphere you can breathe in northern Europe. A Must Have Seen place for anybody.

Reviews.Title: “would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: toby40
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 days in June 2011. We where told on the phone before we arrived that we could park our car outside the hotel. That was true, but they didnt tell us that it would cost us 3 Euros per hour. We where however able to park in a different location, so where given a map of how to get there. That would then cost us 6 Euros a day. The only problem was that we then had to get there using the map, which was very confusing, and quite far away. When we did find it, it turned out that it was not 6 Euros a day, but 8 Euros. At that time we where very tired, as we had driven all the way from Denmark. The last thing we wanted to do was walking around Amsterdam using a map getting back to the hotel. The hotel room was clean and bright, but that where it stops. No space anywhere to hang your clothes, a tiny shelf for toilettries, the smallest bin ive ever seen, and the bed was very hard and uncomfortable. And to get into bed, one person had to climb over the other( not easy at night if you had a drink) Ive been with my husband for a long time, but we both still prefer to go to the toilet in privat, and thats not possible in the room. We tried the food a few times, but there was a poor selection, and the bread rolls and sandwiches was dry. Simply not worth eating. And to top it all, we had our car scratched when parked outside the hotel the last evening. We will however say, that the staff where very helpful, but we will never stay here again. Its not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: MCAT00
Reviews.Content: My stay at Citizen M was great. Loved the â€œFunkyâ€� dÃ©cor, common spaces and modular room. The staff was knowledgeable and helpful. They were very welcoming. The food was fresh with good variety. I would recommend a stay. Be aware that the rooms are open concept.

Reviews.Title: “The place is good for a short stay for 1-2 days”
Reviews.Author: nidheeshbalan
Reviews.Content: The place is not too far from the city centre. We (me & my wife) chose this hotel , as we have to rearrange our trip on the last minute and we couldn't get reservations on the previous hotel. The place is little congested compared to the hotels in USA. Hardly enough space to fit in your luggages. The beds were good, the staff were friendly and helpful. The technologies used in the hotel make it more preferable for business visitors. I love that VOIP telefone call service.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, loved it. Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: conky123
Reviews.Content: Everybody needs to experience a hotel like this. We loved it here, very modern and everything just works seamlessly. Helpful staff, and 24 hour bar/ food area which came in very handy. Wonderful communal areas to lounge around in. Great room, huge bed. Very funky all round. Can't wait until there are more CitizenM hotels opened up around the world. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “The other CitizenM”
Reviews.Author: MCMember
Reviews.Content: Stayed two night on business, following a positive experience with the CitizenM Schiphol Airport. Rooms are strictly identical, space is highly optimised thanks to original design concepts. Free wireless (reliable), vertical safe which can still accomodate a moderate-size laptop, no minibar but 24-hour bar in the lobby (also with takeaway food mostly sushi and sandwiches). Good value for money although less impressive than its airport twin (was 120â‚¬+ whilst some offers at CitizenM Schiphol can be as low as 89â‚¬). Note that electric power is switched off when you leave the room so don't leave computers plugged if you want to avoid a surge when you come back. Efficient check-in and check-out through dedicated terminals, still with staff assistance if necessary. The Hotel has an affiliated taxi, whose prices are however competitive (35â‚¬ to the airport). Overall convenient and good value especially if you're into design.

Reviews.Title: “Different and cool”
Reviews.Author: Frederico60
Reviews.Content: Different concept. Easy and comfortable. Quick and functional. Excelent service. Room is small, without enough space for luggage, but bed is biiiig and comfortable, and shower is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “This place has the wow factor!”
Reviews.Author: Magiclamb
Reviews.Content: I had a one night stay here in April and throughly enjoyed it-despite struggling to get to grips with some of the technology! Maybe more instructions in the room would be helpful. However, the bed was one of the comfiest I have ever stayed in, and the space was very well utilised. The shower and toilet in the room may not be ideal if you like privacy!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel, a great find!”
Reviews.Author: UnicoTrebbiano
Reviews.Content: This hotel absolutely delivers, a warm welcome and inviting stay. Pros *New, proper, clean, modern and fresh hotel *Great public areas with contemporary furniture, up to date books, public art and the best cocktails *Great (but small) room - feels like you are inside of an iPad *Best bed ever *Imacs available for free in public areas - also free wi fi and free movies *Lovely staff Cons * Area is a bit out of the centre of amsterdam * Shower is modern, but no privacy

Reviews.Title: “Cool experience, very different hotel concept”
Reviews.Author: sulliclm
Reviews.Content: As others have noted, this is not your typical hotel. High concept for sure, quirky design, but it works. This is a perfect spot if you're on a city break for the weekend to Amsterdam as my wife and I were. Easy to get to the hotel from the airport, its a quick ride from Schipol to Amsterdam Zuid. Be warned the ticket machines don't take notes or non-dutch credit cards, so make sure you have coins, or use the ticket windows. Check-in was easy with the self service kiosks, and the rooms are quite comfortable despite the design. The bed and pillows were great, and there's a really great media selection, free wi-fi, tv, radio, and a ton of free on demand movies, wish we had more time to watch them! There's enough room for two suitcases, but not a lot more, and the bathroom set up is a bit weird with the tubes for the shower and toilet, but ultimately its fine. Food downstairs is good for what you need, selection of breakfast items, snacks and drinks, there's also a comfy spacious lobby with tvs and computers for killing time if you need to. Access to the city is via the number 5 tram, its around the corner from the hotel and is a quick ride into the main parts of the city. Area around the hotel is pretty residential, no clubs, bars etc. but its safe and quiet, if you're looking for some place thats in the middle of it all, this isn't it, but on the bright side, you won't have stag parties running up and down the halls either. We'll probably return here next time we're in amsterdam, the value is good and it worked out well for us.

Reviews.Title: “Unusual, but comfortable hotel, with very good location”
Reviews.Author: peti1950
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not really usual, regarding that the shower and toilet are right in the middle of the room with transparent walls, which can be uncomfortable for those not being in close personal connection. Otherwise comfortable rooms, everything can be adjusted by the guest, except, that the temperature of air conditioning seems to be the same. There is an easy-to-use safe in the room. There is only a small place to put your cloths, so you have to keep almost everything in your luggage for the whole time. The bed is extremely big and comfortable, but might be high for small travelers. The location is really excellent, 200 ms from the stop of tram No 5, which takes you to the city center in 15 min, very near to South Rail Station, which is 1 stop from Schiphol airport.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good stay”
Reviews.Author: red1988
Reviews.Content: Myself and my fiance visited the citizenM hotel for 3 nights in June. It is only 10 minutes from Schipol Airport on the train and is the first stop. Tickets are only â‚¬2.50 to Zuid Station which is the stop closest to the hotel and is only a 5 minute walk away from the station if even that. We were greeted immediately when we went in and were checked in very quickly even though we had arrived earlier than the check-in time. The room itself is small but not at all claustrophobic. There's a small area to hang some clothes just in side the door and there is a safe underneath that, which is quite small you could probably only get one laptop in it. Beside that is your toilet and across from that is the rain fall shower.Then there is the fabulous bed which is as wide as the room and square so you can sleep facing which ever way you want. There is also a little desk and a chair and additional storage under the bed which would fit maybe 2 large suitcases so we had no issues with storage. Getting to and from the city is a breeze, you just catch the number 5 tram across the road from the hotel which runs maybe every 10 minutes. From there it only takes 5 minutes to get to the Rijksmuseum, The House of Bols, The Van Gogh museum and a few more I can't recall. It takes maybe another 5 minutes to get to Dam Square which is very central. The only problems I encountered were that on the first night we stayed we came back to the hotel in hopes that we could get something to eat nearby. It wasn't too late maybe 9pm and we asked if there was anywhere around and we were told to walk up the street along the tram line and there would be loads of places, which there was but they were all closed. I would have thought the people working in the hotel would have to have a good knowledge of the local area but it didn't seem they did as we asked about getting a train another day and they told us to go to the wrong platform, thankfully we asked in the station and they sent us in the right direction. Also one of the days our room wasn't cleaned but they have apologized profusely for that so I am not going to hold that against them. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel though, it's location is ideal, the beds are comfortable and the staff are really friendly. And best of all it's great value for money. One tip though don't fork out â‚¬10 for the breakfast there is a coffee shop called Bagel's and Beans just 5 mins up the road if you walk to the right when you leave the hotel. There we got a BLT bagel, a toasted bagel with cream cheese, a Cappucino, a Smoothie, and 2 water's for only â‚¬12.70 much better value!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option when you have an early fligth”
Reviews.Author: Andreia_MGS
Reviews.Content: Steps away from Schipol Airport. Small but confortable room,it is incredible how the is organized to fit everything. Very good options for 1 nigth before an early fligth.

Reviews.Title: “Very different concept”
Reviews.Author: lerato3
Reviews.Content: A minimalistic approach that works. Probably not suited to everyone's taste but we liked it. Breakfast was a bit overpriced, but the room was well thought out and clean. Service was friendly and discreet.

Reviews.Title: “Great for solo travellers without much luggage”
Reviews.Author: Schnetzfink
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a couple of days while attending a conference at the nearby RAI conference center. For a trip like this, the hotel was a good choice. However, this hotel is clearly not for everyone, so I recommend caution before booking it. I liked: * The concept of the hotel (check out their web site for details) * Proximity to RAI conference center and airport Didn't like: * Couldn't connect to my company network (via VPN) and there was no on-site support. Front-desk staff was clueless. I travel frequently and this is the first hotel where I couldn't use my VPN. I expect a hotel advertising itself to mobile people to do better in this regard. Caution: * Rooms are too small for parties of two in my opinion. Fine for solo travelers. * Virtually no place to store luggage in room - just two/three hangers. Maybe acceptable for the stuff that fits into a carry-on, but if you have more luggage than that, you will run out of space. * The hotel is in a quiet neighborhood about 20 min (by tram) from downtown Amsterdam. Within easy walking distance to RAI and WTC.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Yorkshire Dales National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Interesting.”
Reviews.Author: liam45
Reviews.Content: What an interesting hotel. The rooms are small but have all you need to get a good nights sleep, (which in my book is a good comfy bed). The bathrooms are also small but with great toiletries. The whole hotel has a very happening vibe about it and is definitely aimed at the younger customer. decent food in the canteen style restaurant and very helpful staff. The location could be better, but you can't have everything! I think this is what hotels of the future will be more like....clean, stylish and functional.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but trendy!”
Reviews.Author: dclement04
Reviews.Content: CitizenM is definitely a trendy hotel. I was traveling with a male friend and although I am not a prude it was a shock to me to find out that the hotel did not have any double beds so we made do. The first thing I noticed about the room was that the shower was encased in all glass in the middle of the room (a little strange I must say). I got used to it and it turned out to be quite fun. I did however make my "guy" friend leave the room when I wanted to shower though haha. Check out the pics I've attached. The staff I must say was phenomenal!! They were sooo helpful and knew a lot of about transportation and help arrange so tours for us. Thanks guys! This hotel is in the southern part of the city ( I preferred to stay away from "downtown" this time and very glad I did). Staying here allows you to explore new and exciting parts of Amsterdam as well as still be "in touch" with the goings on at Dam Square. There is a tram and bus stop right outside of the hotel which makes it very convenient. You can get to just about anything from the tram stop; Museumplein, Leidseplein and Dam Square. The Amsterdam Zuid WTC station is right behind the hotel and is how we got there from the airport. The Amsterdam Olympic Stadium is only a bus ride away too! I could go on and on but I won't. Happy traveling!

Reviews.Title: “More than a hidden gem, definetely a winner!”
Reviews.Author: linuxtech09
Reviews.Content: Before staying at the CitizenM Amsterdam City, I previously stayed in the more 'busy' downtown / red-light district at the Sofitel Grand. While it was a nice hotel, it wasn't worth 250 euros per night (which was a deal in that area) - 10 minutes away via a tram across from the hotel, the CitizenM is an amazing value, and delivers everything it promises and more. The one problem I had? The rooms cater more to European outlets, and after mentioning US plugs in the room, I didn't bring my adapters. Turns out there's only (1) 110V AC US based plug-in, which is by the sink, pretty hard to charge / use a laptop. Besides that tiny design flaw, it was amazing. Yes there isn't a desk for writing or getting expense reports done, but you're in a chic modern hotel in Amsterdam. You shouldn't be doing that, and quite honestly I found it quite hard to get get into any type of proper 'work' mindset with such an amazing city. The room I was in was spotless, I honestly looked for even 1 fingerprint, smudge, or anything on the glass shower capsule.. nothing - That was very welcome. After a day in the city of Amsterdam, not being up for going back out to the bar / red-light district for a drink, I chose the 'Canteen' which is centralized in the very 'chic-modern' living room motif lobby they have. The bartenders were amazingly friendly and even offered me advice on local attractions and places to go and experience (better than the tourist guides you can get) The croissants I found were very good, I'd personally scout them out around 5-6AM when made on site (or delivered from a bakery) because the aroma filled the lobby floor, I found them to be amazing. After a week of having their 'breakfast basket' which includes a croissant, I went back to NJ, had a croissant, and threw it away. Trust me, the food is great at the Canteen, and even includes Sushi / Teriyaki sticks in addition to ice-cream and a full bar. I never had one problem with the control, but then again I'm an IT consultant. I found it amazingly easy to use, and never had to contact the front desk to due to 'a buggy remote' - Sometimes it took 2-3 seconds to respond upon wake up, but think of the technology that's inside, and give it a second to load. At 99 euros, this place is better than a hidden gem, I'll be back (with my CitizenM card still on my luggage, so no need for a new one, apparently they save your preferences and settings as well) on June 12th in a few weeks, looking forward to it Thanks again guys!

Reviews.Title: “trendy hotel - best bed ever...”
Reviews.Author: SuperSigne
Reviews.Content: A very small but functional hotel room. You can always sit in the large lobby and pick the most stylish table and chair for you to work at or just relax in - wonderful furniture all over. I couldn't get the shower to budge, however when I slammed the doors in despair the water started pouring out of the rainshower showerhead. Fantastic. The bed was wonderful - huge 2x2 meters at least with soft double duvet. Best hotel bed ever. Breakfast was ok - coffee was excellent and freshly made and the croissant too but not a lot as a healthy starter for a long day at work. More options would be preferable. I will highly recommend CitizenM - very conveniently located and helpfull staf.

Reviews.Title: “Small box for big money”
Reviews.Author: odessa_st
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel with very small box-like room.Price too high even for Amsterdam. Room is very stylish but not really practical if you close both WC and shower windows you almost cannot get out of the room.Very good connection to te city, I recomend Metro and not Tram.Metro close to WTC.Buy a dayticket for 7 euro and travel 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Very hip and trendy! Most comfortable bed I have EVER slept in!”
Reviews.Author: BKSweetheart
Reviews.Content: CitizenM is definitely not your traditional hotel by any means. The bathroom and shower are in little pods which definitely can make for some.....awkwardness lol. Wasn't too bad though. But the beds.... OMG OMG the most AMAZING bed I have ever slept in, in my entire life!! Also a very nice touch was having the Canteen which is open 24 hours a day. Why doesn't every hotel have this? They have all kinds of food and snacks, drinks, coffee, anything you could possibly want. They also have computers and printers there complimentary for guests (great for printing out your boarding pass!). They also have free Wifi throughout entire hotel. This place is a little outside the city center but not too bad. Cab ride was about 15 euro. But there is also the subway and tram nearby if you don't want to spring for the cab. We were only here for 2 nights but we had a great time. Thanks CitizenM!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good!!! Best boutique hotel Evah!”
Reviews.Author: Ckbeauty
Reviews.Content: The best bed I've ever tried!!! Very good sound system in the rooms, Mac computers for internet, and the most modern shower with light effects! The hotel's design is just Amazing!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely,quirky hotel”
Reviews.Author: moyles123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for a weekend stay. Rooms are very different! Staff are great. Even the canteen style restaurant has good quality food/snacks. The rooms are only good if you are quite close/intimate with friend/partner as the toilet is see thru and not sound proofed!! The hotel lobby is very cosy and makes you feel like you are in your own living room. Wow, the beds are massive and very comfortable and clean. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “fun, trendy, technologically advanced - a hotel for the future! awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: craig93
Reviews.Content: as we walked in to the hotel we were taken away with the courtesy of the staff - they guided us through the check in process with precision and answered all questions we had quickly and simply. The rooms are funky and cutting edge. Tastefully decorated and technologically way ahead of any other i've ever stayed in - with ur TV remote you control the entire room - aircon, blindes, TV, room moods/colours, lights etc. Amazing place, amazing room and although not an ideal location its close enough to a tram line that will get u into town...go stay there you'll love it...

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, modern but quirky hotel”
Reviews.Author: WankyDonkey
Reviews.Content: Fantastic place. Easy walking distance from the RAI exhibition centre and a short tram ride from the city centre. Smallish rooms with space-age technology and layout. The staff are all charming and professional. More fun than many hotels costing twice the price.

Reviews.Title: “One of the most interesting and fun hotels I've ever been to”
Reviews.Author: alep1985
Reviews.Content: Although it was located a little bit away from the heart of the tourist spots in Amsterdam, the whole experience at the hotel was amazing. Loved the quirky rooms. Also, the shower gels and soaps were AWESOME (loved the P.M. shower gel). Can't wait to return! Also excited that's you're opening hotels in the United States soon!

Reviews.Title: “Fun stay at Citizen M but farther from tourist sites than expected.”
Reviews.Author: EagletteTennessee
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the Citizen M with my husband and couple of friends. Loved the trendy room, but the hotel was farther away from central Amsterdam than we expected from reading the hotel's website. However, public transportation was a snap! So many choices: trams, buses, metros, trains - all convenient to the hotel. We bought a 48 hour pass and used it a bunch, even though the train required a separate ticket.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job!”
Reviews.Author: DJWinter
Reviews.Content: I stayed at CitizenM for 2 nights during a long weekend break to Amsterdam. We realised that the time we'd be spending at the hotel would be limited, however, we still wanted somewhere comfortable to come back to after a day's exploration of the city. I'm happy to say that CitizenM did not disappoint. On arrival, your introduction to CitizenM quickly confirms that this isn't your typical hotel. There's a great deal of open space within the lobby area, with TVs, artwork, comfortable chairs, tables, workstations and a large 24hr refreshments area, selling food and hot and cold drinks. There are guests milling around, chatting and relaxing and I have to say that I liked it. It felt informal, friendly and laid-back. The check-in process was largely automated, but there were plenty of staff on hand to help out if needed. The rooms were like no other that I've stayed in before. Everything is contained within a single space, with the powerful shower and WC enclosed within opening 'capsules'. The bed was incredible - huge and very comfortable. The entertainment provision is excellent, with a large flat-screen TV and a wide selection of channels (including free movies). The one possible drawback is the hotel's location. It's a 3 minute walk from the WTC square, which would clearly make it ideal if you were visiting those offices on business, but it's a reasonable distance from the city centre. However, you very quickly learn what your options are in terms of transport into the various areas of the capital. There's a tram stop minutes from the hotel that will take you to the museums and galleries (and then allow you to connect to the centre), or you can catch a metro train from the WTC square straight into the heart of the city. Not having the hotel within walking distance of the centre simply means that you need to plan your day a bit more wisely and know how you're going to get back in the evening...and there are always cabs. I would also add that the hotel is very easy to get to from the airport - only 3 or 4 stops on the train - it's really not worth paying for a taxi. Check the location details on the hotel's website for more info. The area around CitizenM doesn't have much in the way of entertainment, particularly on the weekend when the nearby offices are shut. Again, this didn't really cause a problem, as the hotel 'lobby' is perfect for sitting in and relaxing and refreshments are available from the 24hr cafe. Furthermore, I'd imagine that most guests will be heading into the centre for their entertainment. CitizenM met our requirements perfectly and did it with style, comfort and convenience. It would be perfect for those who intend to spend most of their time in the city and only really need to come back to the hotel to sleep. Overall, highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Caca12
Reviews.Content: It was so beyond any expectations, I couldn't even start describing... Small room with 2x2 meters bed and two glass towers with crazy lights-one is a toilet, another one is a shower!! I must admit, big bed was my favourite part of the room, and lovely big pillows!! A remote control lights, curtains, wake up call.. Checking in and out involves no staff, free pc's in the lobby, also free wifi and no surcharge for movies. Trust me, just go there, and experience it yourself!! Next time when I'm in Amsterdam, I know where I'll be staying for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun, funky hotel a bit out of the city center”
Reviews.Author: FullerFamily
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the CitizenM for a conference at RAI. The proximity to the conference was great, though the hotel is a little out of the city center (access via tram is great, as long as you catch the return before 00:30). The hotel itself is fun, lively and modern, with a very helpful staff and a bar/cafe area that always has a decent crowd. Enjoyed the stay and will be back next time I'm in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Modern trendy quirky”
Reviews.Author: aakhyani
Reviews.Content: Most unique hotel I've stayed at. Loved the fun design-lead style . Not so far from the city center. Quirky with a sense of luxury.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: edmundchristian
Reviews.Content: first thing, this hotel is nice on the eyes but terrible on functionality. room has 2 giant cylinders; one for the WC, the other for the shower but really, it does not facilitate any ease of movement within the room at all. Also, there are great lack ofs; no proper dressing table, a tiny chair that does nothing for you. no coffee/tea making facilities at all - every time you need anything you have to go downstairs to pick up a tea/coffee at the CANTEEN (awful range of foods). the breakfast is terrible; the croissant tastes rubbery. also, they forgot to ring us one morning despite our arrangement for one, which is a strict NO NO. I particularly dislike the staff working there; they are aloof, and lack sincerity, although they're supposed to be a top-end hotel. they seriously need some retraining on manners; they behave like they're at MACDONALDS, the way they speak to you. very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “It does the job and it does it well!”
Reviews.Author: K-Man62
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel and by choice. It took no time to get from the airport, 30 minutes max after leaving customs and only at a cost of â‚¬2.60. It's the first stop on the traion Amsterdam Zuid WTC and a 5 - 10 minute walk max. The check-in is self service, although help is always at hand and is simple. The rooms are brilliant, massive bed, very clean, perfect shower and toilet. All in all it serves its purpose. To get into the centre of Amsterdam there is a number 5 tram stop across the road which takes approximately 15 - 20 minutes. It is in a quiet area, unlike many Amsterdam hotels that tend to have noise all night long. There is a 24 hour cafe in the lobby serving drinks such as soft and beer, food that covers sushi, curry (microwave provided for heating up), sandwiches fruit, crioussants etc. A bit like a UK Costa coffee shop. Very good. It also has free internet which for the business user is great. By free I mean via the use of your own laptop. All in all, a worthwhile stay. I would certainly use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Chic, Modern & Trendy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AsranRozain
Reviews.Content: citizen M is a short walk from Amsterdam Zuid station which is 1 train stop away from Schiphol Airport. Hence, public transportation is very accessible as Zuid connects to other train stations across the Netherlands, as well as Metro and Tram services. Alternatively, to go to Amsterdam Centraal, you may opt for the tram station next to the hotel. The hotel is chic, modern and trendy. The room is suitable for couples or any other person you are very comfortable with (as the shower and toilet is visible from inside the room). TV has lots of channels as well as on demand movies which is free (WiFi is free as well). All in all, the hotel is suitable for those who are on the go and do not expect luxurious services. Truly an experience!

Reviews.Title: “Still nice but service slipping”
Reviews.Author: Marcinbrussels
Reviews.Content: Stayed again during Art Amsterdam -11-15 May- and was reassured by the nice, if small room and comfy bed. Quiet as one expects in that location. Check in was chaotic as the creditcards could not be read at the machines. Room was ready but cleaning was below par. Worse was the unreliable technology with blinds moving automatically during the night and a remote control that repeatly malfunctioned. The reception was notified but no change was noted. Its a busy place with good breakfast and inviting bar. I stayed in room 324.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and chic hotel”
Reviews.Author: genie_jun
Reviews.Content: CitizenM is a very trendy and chic hotel suitable for the younger people, couple or solo traveller. Self serviced check-in, touchpad for all the room settings was a nice change from the usual services that a hotel provides. I like how the colour of the lights in the room can be changed and the big bed and also the unlimited tv channels and free movies. I didn't like that there was not much space to hang up clothes and there wasn't a hot kettle in the room. But I fully understand that this is a budget style hotel so I'm letting this 2 points go. The free wi-fi in every room and the free use of iMac at the lobby was a great bonus for those who cant live without internet. Will recommend this hotel to only couples or solo travellers because of the see-through shower and translucent shower and toilet pods.

Reviews.Title: “Really cool hotel in a really cool city!”
Reviews.Author: Jillstar73
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a long weekend and loved this hotel and loved Amsterdam. It's in a really good location just 5 minutes walk from Amsterdam South station which is only 6 mins from the airport - non of the stress of arriving in Central station! Lobby is really stylish but with non of the stuffyness of more conventional hotels - really relaxed vibe and friendly staff. Rooms small but really cleverly designed making use of all the space - the bed is huge and really comfy - missing it already! Easy tram journey into the centre of the city!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: ebbosse
Reviews.Content: If you are into trendy and modern this is the hotel for you. The bed was so big and comfortable! The bathroom pods were like nothing I've ever experienced. They make the most of the space in the rooms. The food offered in the hotel lobby was really good and affordable. The location was a little outside of the city but only a short tram ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to stay”
Reviews.Author: funtimes1122
Reviews.Content: Just a 5 min train ride from the airport and a 5 min walk to the hotel. Around the corner is the tram stop which takes you directly to most of the museums, city centre, red light district, and more. The hotel is a modern and funky place, but was comfortable and quiet.The staff was very nice and helpful with directions. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very trendy hotel, really affordable luxury”
Reviews.Author: doug_fernando
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fantastic! The whole concept is great, including the rooms (bed, lights, tv, etc.), bar and the lobby. The staff is very helpful! The location is not very close to the centre of the city, however, by tram is very easy to get there, so not a problem at all. Probably the coolest hotel (but not the fanciest) I've ever been...

Reviews.Title: “LOVED CitizenM!!!”
Reviews.Author: KellyMulligan
Reviews.Content: Although itâ€™s a bit out of the city center, we found the location to be excellent. There is a tram stop within walking distance (1-2 min walk). The hotel is funky and fun! The rooms are small but comfy. Itâ€™s like nothing weâ€™ve ever stayed in. The roomâ€™s settings are on a customized (welcome screen with YOUR name on it) hand-held pad that allows you to play with the lighting, tv, and blinds. Very clean - and comfy beds!! Iâ€™d recommend CitizenM to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, affordable and great fun!”
Reviews.Author: dmgoodwin
Reviews.Content: I read about citizenM hotels in the New York Times a few years back and booked it for our trip to Amsterdam. From the outside, the hotel is rather nondescript, however, inside, it proves to be one of the cutest hotels around. The canteen, staff and free WIFI are perfect for people who like to travel to interesting cities. The rooms are certainly small, but we travel with a small footprint and appreciated the thoughtful design of the rooms. The beds were the most comfortable since my stay at a W hotel years ago. Really a great place to stay when you in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, far-out rooms”
Reviews.Author: Rod & Vicky
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very convenient for Schiphol airport and the train system. We took the train from Rotterdam and checked-in after a very short walk. The rate was good and access to Amsterdam via train in the basement of Schiphol was easy. The room freaked my wife however and with three pieces of luggage it was a bit of a mess. Lots of people to help you and very friendly. However, my wife has blackballed the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Zorlutuna
Reviews.Content: Really appreciated. Such a different ambiance, great and very comfortable bed. You have exactly what you need. Very nice small touches, i.e. free wi-fi, free films etc. Great staff...

Reviews.Title: “Easy access to airport; Modern; Doesn't give Amsterdam vibe”
Reviews.Author: xx1xx
Reviews.Content: If you like modern hotels then this one will probably suit you. For me, I wouldn't choose to stay here again. Amsterdam was hot yet in the room I was cool. The room temp can be set but perhaps the "sterility" of the room contributes to keeping from feeling comfortably warm. The pillows were big. There were plenty of spare pillows but all were the same size. Water from the shower apparatus drained away during the night, loud enough to wake me. There was enough space for three hangers worth of clothes. This was sufficient for me (solo for three nights) but might be a problem if you don't like living out of the suitcase for which there is no place to stow. Sink - think design centre but totally hopeless for practical purposes. On the plus side, it was clean, quiet, good bed, good transport links, staff were helpful and friendly. Wifi also free. Pleasant residentual area and able to choose which side of the hotel to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Funky and Fun”
Reviews.Author: Vixster722
Reviews.Content: The hotel was exactly what I expected and more. Easy travel from the airport and easy travel into and out of the city centre. The trams can take ages getting stuck passing through the centre, but the stop is right outside the hotel, handy. If you want to stay out past 11.30 ish at night your taxi is about 17 euro... The bed, OUTSTANDING. So big and comfy, perfect. The free films on demand were great too. Brilliant shower, lovely shower gels too. The frosting around the toilet leaves little to the imagination, which is a bit cringe/funny. Small rooms but perfectly formed, I would definitely stay in a citizenM again, I hope they build them in every city!! Bar area all looked good, but we didn't eat there. The wifi was free and there are free computers to use. A bit far out of the centre, but a very reasonable, cool hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern concept hotel that works well”
Reviews.Author: guineverent
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights whilst attending a conference at the RAI in Amsterdam. This hotel was well situated to the conference centre and an easy tram ride into the main city. We were very impressed by the style of this hotel it is modern and incorporates great ideas for travelers such as free wifi, in-house movies-, huge beds and a funky futuristic room layout. The staff were excellent in service skills and looked happy to be working there. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra stylish, great for couples, fully reccomended!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mary76_9
Reviews.Content: CitizenM really made a difference to our trip in Amsterdam. Very big confy bed, trendy interior with light changing shower and toilette caspules, contemporary common areas. Young very helpful staff, free wifi, free movies(and there are lots of them!!!) free use of apple computers at the lobby. Even video games in the room to keep my boyfriend busy while I was getting ready for our night escapes! Yes, rooms are small but who cares!! you dont spend your day walking around it! there is plenty of space in a drawer underneath the bed for your clothes, not enought hangers though for the little black dresses...but i could live with that! Loved the location as well. Away from the noisy centre but just 10min by tram and 20min from the airport. Trams stop at around 12 but we didnt pay more than 13.5 euros for the taxis to bring us back at the early hours. We will definately go back! fully reccomended!

Reviews.Title: “Couldnt ask for more”
Reviews.Author: msangelwijaya
Reviews.Content: I went to amsterdam on high season date (easter). I searched for hostels at first, but they ended up with high prices (mostly about 65 euros per person per nite with minimum 4 nights stay) and the worst part is, most of these hostels were fully booked. So, i decided to turn to hotels and found this one, it cost about 158 euros per room per nite (we are 2 person, so it ended up 79 euros per person), but for the quality, i have to give a big smile =D to them! Good job! everything were just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great modern budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: VenturaJoe035
Reviews.Content: Just a really great hotel. Very modern, ultra sleek, the shower is very cool, a capsule that closes and then the water turns on. Bed was very comfortable, room was silent and pitch black. Easy access to Schiphol and trains to Amsterdam. No real food service but the items they do have, pre packaged sushi and assorted Japanesy food was actually quite tasty. Efficient, clean, very comfortable, I "got" this hotel. Price was fantastic also.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitly be returning!”
Reviews.Author: maggie-moo-moo
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 11am and presumed we wouldn't be allowed to check in, however we were told we could put our luggage in the room straight away. Friendly staff. Located around 10mins from the city centre and it is easy to get to on the number 5 tram which runs very frequently. The rooms are really funky. The toilet and shower are just inside the door, huge bed and the free movies were excellent. Free wifi throughout the hotel was excellent and the furniture in the lobby was really modern! Would recommend this hotel to anyone who is going to Amsterdam and if I ever return I will be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Very tiny room, only good if you travel alone, flooding in The room”
Reviews.Author: Tmlkbr43
Reviews.Content: Wifi free at last !!! Sometimes very very slow. Flooding in room, though it was corrected next day. But The 3rd day flooding again, we pais 140 Euros, not acceptable A/C just too cold even at The warmest setting. Staff very good. Very interesting for overnight stay, cool common area but rooms...

Reviews.Title: “Awesome property”
Reviews.Author: PattyBeeLondon
Reviews.Content: The property is absolutely amazing. Love the room, facilities and open areas. I appreciate the free internet, great selling point. Rooms are airy and very very light.. Very clean. Love the black ut curtain, very neccessary. There is lack of storage area if there are two people sharing a room for a few days. Only down side are the staff at reception - they seem to lack specific local knowledge which as a visitor to Amsterdam is vital. Their reference point for most queries is "look at the map". It a Ciotizen M map provided at reception..

Reviews.Title: “Like Marmite, you either love it or hate it”
Reviews.Author: Lesedi22
Reviews.Content: Good: It is close to the tram stop, and Zuid station. So easy access to the airport. The rooms are clean and staff are helpful. Free movies in the room. Bad: No space for your clothes. Nowhere to even store your case. Rooms are too small and cold. There is only one tiny chair with a rag doll on. Ugly: It looks like a prison on the outside. You can easily miss it. I arrived late at night and although was only a short walk from the station it is in a not so well lit road. They do not even have tea and coffee facility in the rooms. I had a feeling like I was in a spaceship. I hated it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel for the over night business traveller”
Reviews.Author: j0ndu8
Reviews.Content: Although the room was small, the use of space was exceptional, they even managed to squeeze in one of the biggest beds i have encountered. Touches such as the room remote (TV, lights, temperature, blinds) act as a good distraction to the fact there are no in room drink making facilities, or an iron. The foyer area is very well appointed, with banks of macs, a 24 hour bar serving snacks, and some very interesting artwork (especially opposite the lifts!). CitizenM is a comparative bargain for the quality and style delivered, but it is at the cost of location; the hotel is comfortably outside the city centre, so research the public transport well, or put the Central Taxi number in your phone (020 777 7777 for reference) I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot for the business traveler”
Reviews.Author: GottaGoVancouver
Reviews.Content: I could not have found a better place to stay for my business trip in Amsterdam. Everything is neat, efficient and functional. Particularly enjoyed the multiple work areas, with power plugs, free WIFI, and Mac stations. The ambiance is also very modern and posh, without being excessive. Entering the hotel, one gets the impression of entering a select private club. The room size was actually quite adequate. Having visited my colleagues who booked downtown (Hotel Amsterdam De Roode Leeuw: old, tiny, dorm like) for quite a bit more expensive, my room appeared like a palace. The bed was nice and wide (real king size, not 2 twins put together), the entertainment system was easy to use, and the shower and bathroom pods were very functional. The only thing that wasn't great is the food selection. They are forthcoming, however in letting you know that they offer "canteen" food on their website. Not a huge selection of warm food, but the coffee is good. I appreciated the location, in a nice quite neighborhood, walking distance to the train station, the tram station and quaint little shops. It's 20 minutes by tram to downtown Amsterdam, and ~10 minutes from the museums. Very convenient, but without the loudness of the tourists and party goers. Overall had a most enjoyable time at the Citizen M. Would definitely book back there if I ever have the pleasure of going back to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Slick Hotel”
Reviews.Author: winnieigster
Reviews.Content: Contemporary furnishings, big comfy bed, laid back yet helpful staff and great coffee makes this a great hotel. It's a 20 minute tram journey to the centre, but the stop is only round the corner from the hotel and it's only one train stop form the airport, so that's also convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Truely awesome... trendy, ambience lighting, modern”
Reviews.Author: Norisdayanti
Reviews.Content: Room setting and lighting set the mood for couple lovemaking... transparent shower glass...good for honeymooner.

Reviews.Title: “Just what you need for a short break away”
Reviews.Author: Sea_shells28
Reviews.Content: I brought my boyfriend to Amsterdam as a birthday surprise, i booked this hotel based on reviews from Tripadvisor and the reasonable price. I was not disappointed. We arrived at Zuid transtation and were surprised at how close we were to the hotel. As other travellers have mentioned there is self service check-in but the staff available to help you are probably the friendlist and most helpful we have ever come across. The room is small, but contains everything you need in a funky atmosphere, the bed is AMAZING so huge and comfy and the free movies are a nice touch. There is also free Wifi throughout the hotel and free access to MAC Computers in the lobby. The hotel is stylishly designed with different areas to sit depending on your mood. The cafe bar is open 24/7! Not a great selection on food but enough for a snack. After the hotel being such train journey from the airport and sort walk from the train station I wasn't holding out much hope that travel to the centre would be as quick or easy...I was very wrong. The number 5 tram leaves from literally outside the hotel, they are unbelieveably frequent and will have you at the museum / entertainment district in 10 mins and into central station in about 20. We got a 4 day tram pass for â‚¬19. There is a one, two and three day option on this as well and I would highly recommend them as you can get anywhere in the city by tram. The only negative I would have (and it's not a huge thing) is that the room could be a little warmer. The temperature only goes up to 23 degrees and sometimes it just didn't seem that the air coming out was that warm and there is no option to turn it off! All in all if your looking for something funky and different with amazing staff and easy transport to airport and centre of town I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “Fab!”
Reviews.Author: Ashpartout
Reviews.Content: Was slightly concerned to look at a map of the centre the night before we went and to find out was not on it. But actually was perfect, close to the airport, close to the train st when getting train from airport and right next to tram station to take you to museums in a few stops and the centre in a few more. Saw the lobby from outside and thought it was lovely then realised it was our hotel. The lobby is designed in a cool, relaxed way and we used it to relax and read and have a beer rather than dress up and pose like some more stuffy places we've stayed. The furniture and style was beyond the price of the rooms I would say. 24 hrdrinks and food available, healthy interesting options not just junk food. Free Internet in lobby but was very slow. Computer check in with friendly staff standing by. No problem to check in very early and were fine when we accidentally checked out a bit late. I liked the rooms but it was always really chilly in it and a banging noise started early morning on 2 days, hopefully just one off noise and not factory next door. Despite this am a convert, it's not 5 star but it's not 5 star prices and the compromise is only size not cleanliness or style. Would stay here again and have recommended it to others. Don't come with someone you're not really comfortable with though, the loo is in a pod but it's just frosted glass and it's in front of the bed, same applies to the shower!

Reviews.Title: “You have to go and try this hotel, it is the best business hotel I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: KitchenMan52
Reviews.Content: All the things that are extra like wi-fi etc are free. Bedrooms are as good as it gets in a business hotel. The staff are better than some 5 star hotels I have stayed in

Reviews.Title: “Business trip”
Reviews.Author: rickgg37
Reviews.Content: A truly fantastic hotel. Possibly the best I've ever stayed in of it's type. It is only about 10 minutes by train from the airport - not convenenient for the city centre. Although in an up-coming are, with the WTC, RAI etc. And the tram and Metro get you easily to the centre.
