The whole ambience of the place - the friendly staff, the 24 hour food/drink/internet and the super cool rooms were amazing. I've stayed in hotels in more stunning locations, but none as good as this. 5 stars from me.

Reviews.Title: “Good cost-benefit”
Reviews.Author: evaldorossi
Reviews.Content: Staying in CitizenM is much better than ordinary hotels. You have luxury, but you will use all things available. In other hotels, you are paying for spa, swimming pool, thousands of unuseful employees, etc. Moreover, the price is very decent! I would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “If Apple designed prisons this would be it. Overhyped, under spec'd”
Reviews.Author: Aeonweir
Reviews.Content: Hip, cool, trendy, modern, clean, neat - yea, yea. But overhyped and overpriced, minimal spec'd rooms. The iCrowd may like it, but I want a room I can walk around in, that has a wastebasket, a glass to drink from, more than three hangers, a proper space to work at (bedside tables are tiny),ability to lay the luggage out and somewhere where I don't have to be lying in bed to watch TV. And if you get a room near the elevators, there seems to be a constant sound of machinery during the night - not loud but enough to notice. Free Wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Citizen M.. Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: blucube
Reviews.Content: It did just as it said on the tin, but better.. From the very attentive staff, to the buzz of the lobby and cafe/bar..the rooms were exceptionally clean, funky and with a huge bed... plenty of room for 4! Only 20 minutes from the centre of Amsterdam, which was no problem at all.. the tram service was fantastic... Before you go go on line and get the Iamsterdam card... which is very good value for money... travel, enterence into museums, boat trips all included, so if your on a budget I would seriously recommend it... I will be back to Citizen M... and would recommed others give it a try, hopefully like me you wont be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Everything just works!”
Reviews.Author: nelleby
Reviews.Content: What can I say? Everything about this hotel just works. From the moment we walked in we felt acknowledged and taken care of. We were blown away by the hotel's amazing design and functional shared spaces before we even headed to our room. There's a bar/cafe just as you walk in that is always buzzing with other travellers working or relaxing - a lot of young couples on the weekend, and business types on weekdays. Nothing was too much trouble for the young, funky and friendly staff who went out of their way to get to you know you. Our room was incredible - the bed was the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever slept on, not to mention the biggest! The room has plenty of gimmicks to keep you entertained (tonnes of TV channels, movies, the rain shower) and was also quiet and cosy. Our room was cleaned and made-up daily. Fantastic free wi-fi access was also really appreciated! I would love to return!

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: claudje
Reviews.Content: Funny way to enter your room: step in to find yourself standing in de shower, with a huge bed in front of you. Great desigs, excellent bed, friendly staff. A bit noisy, but I slept great. Very close to Rai, wtc, tram to centre

Reviews.Title: “wow”
Reviews.Author: janknaep
Reviews.Content: Superb hotel, the whole package feels good..the room, the staff and the atmosphere. Public transport is just outside yer door so no problems there. Amsterdam is great but the bed-shower-tv-combo almost made me stay inside all day! "aanrader"

Reviews.Title: “CITIZENM BAM!”
Reviews.Author: lucas12
Reviews.Content: This hotel is among the best that I've ever stayed at, with possibly the best bed and shower I've ever used! It's not in the centre of all the action but very close to the tram line which is very easy to use and convenient. It was actually nice to escape the noise to our hotel and see a slightly different part of the city. The lighting was a very nice touch, as was the free wifi, as were the free movies. If I ever go back to Amsterdam I'm checking into citizenm yo!

Reviews.Title: “awesome boutique experience”
Reviews.Author: lisasusan25
Reviews.Content: This place was great, super trendy, chic, loved how it was decorated. While the food in the canteen was a bit expensive it was super convenient and good if you needed it. It was a bit farther from the center of old town then some might like, but there was one tram line immediately in front of it and another one about a 5-10 min. walk. It was also a 10 min. walk from cute restaurants, a few shops, a good grocery store and one tram ride from the museum district.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel for a city break.”
Reviews.Author: db8s
Reviews.Content: it looks like these guys have found the perfect combination for a designer hotel that doesn't cost an arm and a leg. Me and my girlfriend booked a room here for two nights and we are still missing the wonderful 2m x 2m bed... The room was spotlessly clean, and despite its small size, it had all the comfort that you need for a short stay: rainfall shower, TV, free wifi, and a huge comfortable bed! Everything in the hotel is very well designed, and if you have a soft spot for nice furniture, you will definitely love the big lobby on the ground floor. Even if it is located 15mins away from the town centre, the closest tube stop is just 2 mins away, as well as the train station where you can get the train that in 6 mins will get you to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great little quirky hotel”
Reviews.Author: Njamurphy
Reviews.Content: Hotel with a different approach to rooms, service and amenities. Although the rooms were a little small, the concept is so unusual you can forgive this. The moodpad is great fun and the beds are really comfortable. Also the in room movies are free. However the rooms don't have a lot of privacy, (check the hotel's web page to see the room layout), so if you're planning sharing with a friend or your Mum, it might not be for you! Also the hotel is not right in the middle of Amsterdam, but there is a tram stop right outside and the journey time into the centre is about 20 minutes, which makes popping back during the middle of the day a bit of a pain. The hotel foyer is also totally different to a traditional hotel with loads of room to sit in really comfortable, modern chairs and sofas to chill out, have a drink or simply watch the TV. They also provide free of charge WiFi, as well as Apple macs - also FOC - to check the internet. I If you want a traditional hotel with everything that brings, this is not for you, however if you want something a little different with top service and friendly staff then this should be right up your street!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: leahbx
Reviews.Content: Most amazing hotel I have ever stayed in, unbelievably modern and staff were second to none! Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone! Will be returning soon! Amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Fun, funky, great service, easy for town”
Reviews.Author: Andreasbonney
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The technology is enjoyable and works, the rooms are small but well organised and the bed could sleep 4 (I imagine that would be extra!), breakfast was decent, and there was a huge range of good free movies. The safe was useful. Bar area great to look at, Macs handy for web access (free), and the minor down-side of being a little out of town is well compensated by the quiet location (slept really well here) and the ease of getting into town on the number 5 tram. Hint: when arriving at Schipol airport don't get a taxi (about 35 euros), as the Station Zuid is one quick stop down the line with a 6 euro ticket. From there the hotel is a 5-minute walk - go out of the main exit, straight on under the tram, 2nd right. When in Station Zuid get a tram travelcard, eg 72-hour pass gives you unlimited use of all trams for 15.50 euros. The clock doesn't start ticking til your first journey so you can still buy it the day before you start using it. Stay here - if you have a sense of humour and youth then you'll like it.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot fault this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ejwri
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed here for my birthday and had the most wonderful time. The whole hotel is funky and very well designed. The rooms are small but perfectly formed. The bathroom in the room adds to it rather than being an issue. I have never slept in such a large comfortable bed and the mood pad meant I spent little time out of it! The range of free films was vast and extensive with something for anyone, there were also free calls (but I was told this won't last forever!) The staff were incredibly helpful and the iMacs in the lobby free to use was a nice touch. The shop in the lobby was a little pricey but really wells stocked and helpful if you are peckish at 3am! People have said the location is a little far from the city, and it is about a 20min tram ride, but the tram stops just outside the hotel and departs regularly from the city. The hotel isn't in the middle of nowhere, it is situated in what looked like the business district with the world trade centre and a few restaurants and a supermarket round the corner. I am waiting for CitizenM to open more locations so I can stay in other places!

Reviews.Title: “Accommodation Highlight of our Trip”
Reviews.Author: fmct01
Reviews.Content: Just a fantastic hotel for tech savvy younger travelers. I loved almost everything about this hotel. The staff as you first walked in were unbelievably friendly and the rooms while being small were perfectly comfy with a king size bed and the cool showers and toilets. This hotel seemed like it genuinely got the younger generation and im sure will be very successful. The only comment i would make that takes this place away from being perfect was that in the 24 hour cafe section in the lobby it seemed they kept some of their pastrys there a little long while not being covered with little flies hanging around. Very minor, but something a small piece of netting wouldn't fix very easily. All in all i would score this hotel 95%, absolutely loved it and would definitely go back if in Amsterdam again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Very good budget-oriented design hotel”
Reviews.Author: thesaint01
Reviews.Content: I have on may occasions stayed at the CitizenM at Schiphol so decided to also try the Amsterdam City location when I had a business meeting close to it. the hotel is located around 5 minutes walk from the station Amsterdam Zuid (and tram number 5, and possible a few other trams). Fairly easy to find and the location is fairly ok (less than 10 minutes to Schiphol and around 15minutes to the city centre by public transport). The concept is the same as all CitizenM hotels; fairly ok rates, automated check-in, small but functional rooms and good technical features. The rooms are small with large and very comfortable beds. Storage space is limited but for one or two nights it is sufficient. There is a remote control (pad) that can control TV, light (color as well as brightness), blinds, heat etc. The rooms do feature free on demand movies as well as wifi. There are also computers as well as a printer available downstairs (all free of charge). The rooms do miss some space to sit and work but if the bed or small chair provided are not sufficient there is space to work at ground floor. The least favorite part of the hotel is the expensive and not very good food -eat and drink elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Easy access to centre with public transport...”
Reviews.Author: sarah1060
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just returned from a two night stay at CitizenM hotel in Amsterdam City. The hotel provided everything you needed for a citybreak - it was clean, had a super comfortable bed, had quiet surroundings and simple access to the city centre (the number 5 tram stop was literally 50 metres from the hotel entrance). The shower and toilet took a bit of getting used to - but the shower was amazing.... Staff were all friendly and happy to help and we even managed to check in early, which was great, given the times of our flights... Key tip would be if you're flying in from Schipol get the train to Zuid rather than Central...it's 5 minutes walk from Zuid station which in itself is under 10 mins from Schipol....(if you're using the yellow ticket machines at the airport it's Amsterdam Zuid you look for....2.60euro for a single each). All in all a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “good value but a little impersonal”
Reviews.Author: Myrtyl
Reviews.Content: CitizenM Amsterdam City is a five minute walk from Station Zuid mainline and metro and right next to the number 5 tram stop - so you're looking at about 20 minutes to get right into the centre. The hotel is also on the night bus route so no problems getting back late at night. Get a travel pass from one of the machines at Station Zuid - valid on trams, metro and buses including the night bus service. Hotel was easy to find and as I was on an early incoming flight it was great that I could check in straight away at 10.30am. Check in is all self service, there was a member of staff there to help but she was helping someone else so I didn't get a greeting at all or any contact with the staff The funny thing about check in was the option of 'garden view' or 'city view' ... the first being directly into the block of flats on one side, the other the street ... throughout the hotel, there are lots of quirky and humourous statements and I'm not sure whether this was meant to be one of them ... The rooms are all the same - quirky and small ... They are great if you are on your own and staying for only a couple of days. I didn't find the mood system as exciting as some other reviewers ... it was fun for a few minutes, but quickly became a little annoying as often it was unresponsive The rooms are small, no other word for it. But they serve their purpose. Storage space is VERY poor - a tiny rack with 3 hangers on it - this was just about enough for me for 2 days, but any longer and with two people in a room it wouldnt have been enough. The only other storage is the big drawer under the bed where I ended up having to throw everything Standard European hotel so there was no kettle in room (there would have been nowhere for it anyway!). Toilet and shower are just in the middle of the room ... frosted pull round doors on toilet and clear on shower ... so if you are sharing, make sure you know the person really well or it could be a little uncomfortable .. As per other reviews, if you want to do any work in your room, there is nowhere to do this other that laying on the bed I had a look in the cafe/bar downstairs - a reasonable selection of sandwiches and other snacks but very overpriced and the quality was distinctly average. I ordered a coffee to take away and that was â‚¬3.50 ! Given that the room rates are good, they seem to be trying to get this back by charging far too much downstairs There are restaurants and cafes and a few small shops on the area - head back to Station Zuid and go through to the other side. Take note that as this is a business area, a lot of places are closed there at weekends (this also includes the transport office) Wifi in the hotel is excellent - free, connects first time and good strong signal. There are also four free terminals in the lobby with a printer that actually works and was also free (other hotels take note - wifi is not an oportunity to make money !!) All in all a good hotel if you can secure a good room rate. It's not overly central so one to avoid if you don't want to spend a lot of time on public transport. A lot of effort has gone into the hotel design and when I visited, it still looked clean and fresh. Less effort seems to have gone on staff interaction - apart from ordering a coffee, I hardly had any acknowledgement from the staff although there were plenty of them around.

Reviews.Title: “Light and shadow”
Reviews.Author: metatraveller
Reviews.Content: The citizenM is a stylish hotel with some drawbacks, you have to know. On the positive site, very friendly staff and clean hotel, with modern furniture in the huge lobby. In the room you find one of the greatest hotel beds, I've ever slept in. And in addition, free wi-fi in the hotel. On the negative site, in the stylish hotel room you will miss some known features, like a closet for your stuff, a room telephone or a mini bar. But the most unusual feature are the toilets and showers in the middle of the room, which are only separated by glass walls. So, for sure, you have to know the partner, you share the room with, very well. If you take a shower, and someone opens the door to the hotel room, everybody can see you from the outside. Another drawback is the typical Amsterdam parking situation. There are now hotel parking lots available, instead you have to pay 21 EUR in coins for the parking outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Shower-room with a bed in the corner”
Reviews.Author: gibsonsarah261171
Reviews.Content: As a "boutique" hotel the expection of no door on the loo was met. Having to walk through the shower area to get to the bed was odd. The bed is hard against the window, so had a second person been staying they would have to climb over me for nightime loo trips. The hotel has free wi-fi, which was fast and excellent, but with no desk in the room I had to work in the public area - not ideal for noise and privacy. There were UK and European style plug sockets in the room - great, but not set any where useful. The safe held a pc, but only on its end, so likely to fall to floor on door opening. There was no proper place to store the hairdrier - even the place housekeeping forced it, I couldn't make it go, so had to leave it on the floor. There were mirror lights, but no magnifier for shaving or make-up. I was leaving after 2 nights, before I found a full length mirror. Only one small shelf for storage and the bedside tables are dominated by lamps making them useless. The hotel has no restaurant or information about local eating places - not good when arriving tired, hungry and with an early start.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, wish every city had a citizen m!!”
Reviews.Author: lexyandbexy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights with my husband and we loved it! Yes the rooms are small but that is the point! The bed is huge and comfy to lie and watch all the free movies on (around 20 some very recent releases), the mood pad is fun, the shower is amazing! My only gripe would be the "air filtration system", you can set the mood pad temperature to 23 degrees but the wind chill factor with the air system makes it more like 12 degrees! I was a little over 3 months pregnant when we stayed and anyone who has been pregnant knows that your core temp is higher than normal, even given this my hands and nose were frozen from the constant draft!! My husband went to reception 4 times before a maintenance man came and turned the system down from a cupboard in the hall, you can't have it off completely due to the lack of ventilation. It was perfect after that, thanks god! The reception area is peaceful and lovely to relax in. The hot food on offer was not to my taste and a little expensive for what it was but the variety of teas/coffee/crisps /fruit etc was very handy! Overall I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone on a city break and at the end of the day you just want a big clean comfy bed and a good shower and CitizenM ticks all those boxes with style!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: glg2580
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the opening weekend (quite a while ago), the hotel was very very clean and the rooms are great for a city break. The changing mood settings and the ability to change lighting across room was fun and a little addictive. The rain showers are also good and the staff where excellent; happy, friendly and informative. its not far at all from the centre of Amsterdam, a 10 min tram ride to the central station. We also walked this and it really isnt too far at all (maybe with stops for icecream and food) two hours. The only downside was that, as expected when staying at any city during the weekend, there are many people coming in and out of there rooms most of the night... although guests made no noise at all, the doors for the rooms are rather loud when they shut. A pedantic, not even worth stating criticism as I would stay here again. If you get the chance to go.... go! great for a different type of hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Great bang for buck, easy on/off trains, free computers, great service.”
Reviews.Author: Goog_and_Pooh
Reviews.Content: I'm just now going back to all our vacations from 2010 and doing some reviewing. This place particularly stuck out (a) $$ lower than comparable hotels and a new boutique so probably strove to impress (b) Location seemed right--easy to get to from airport and close to major trains/buses (Ams Zuid sta. is 5 min walk; locals right across street) but not in heart of city which would have been loud; and (c) wifi/computers and availability to print tickets or directions was very useful, all made it sound appealing. We were there from June 27th to July 3rd, 2010. Checked in no problem pretty early (1100a) after flight from MSP and took 2 hr nap. Rooms are exactly as advertised--really clean, 'boxy', trendy, but not a place you'll hang if the weather turns sour (downstairs bar isn't bad though). Underbed storage was plenty as Pooh and I both stowed our roll-a-boards under there with room to spare--little light on hangars though if you've got 'traveling' clothes. Loo has fogged/opaque glass so there is some modicum of privacy--warning, I don't remember a fan though!!!; the shower not so much--glass and exposed, but it's a great waterfalll shower [or you could option the wand] and didn't seem to run out of hot water. Ask for more towels--even with the funky drain system you tend to get water on the floor outside the cylinder. Remote pad took a little getting used to [specifically for the window shades] and since I didn't play with it ad nauseum and put it back in its cradle, I didn't really have an issue with low battery often noted. Check out was equally a snap, took < 5minutes at 0500 in the morning. Always seem to be plenty of [young, mind you] staff (even late at night about 3 milling around) so any complaints (I had one about heater--fixed; one about 'critter'--sorta fixed) are usually dealt with fairly quickly. Friends from PHX also got three rooms and they seems to like it as well (3 adults, 1 teen, one preteen--heads up on those latter two, for the adult channels gratis in room). Didn't option the breakfast but the a la carte munchies weren't too expensive...beer on tap flows until any time of the night. Really no complaints and got what we expected/was reviewed--probably stay at the one in Scotland when we go there as I see it's now opened. The only 'wish' for this would be either two twins or slightly bigger 'similar' rooms that hold more than two folks--be nice to travel with Dad or brother or friend and be able to have two non-partners in same room for slightly larger charge. For just leisure travelers with no kids and not needed a bunch of the business-related stuff found at many hotels, this is a great alternative... Next up for review: Hotel Opera, Madrid (Nov 2010)

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and cosy hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sjurlie
Reviews.Content: We really liked the hotel. The rooms are small but cosy and clean with a large bed. The loby is very colorful and cosy too. Friendly staff. Good value for price. Near the center of Amsterdam, you can reach the center very quick. The only thing I missed is some more space for my cloths. Do not travel by car! Carparking is very, very expensive also arround the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool hotel. Perfect for a quick sightseeing tour.”
Reviews.Author: Peartree1
Reviews.Content: CitizenM is a very nice hotel a little bit south of the city centre. The hotel is well priced and the rooms themselves are very interesting. The rooms are extremely clean and, while being a bit on the small side they, incorporate everything you need (toilet, shower) in individual space saving pods within the room, so a bit of advice: you probably want to feel comfortable with whoever you are travelling with as there is little privacy. Other aspects of the room are controlled with the funky "Moodpad" remote with which you can change the colour of the lights, put the blinds up and down, alter the temperature, set a wake up call and control the entertainment. The beds take up one side of the room and are very large and quite comfortable, we all had a great nights sleep. The hotel is a little bit out of the way, its quite a long walk to the main centre of the city. The best way to get about is using the excellent tram system, which stops right outside the hotel. The hotel is also a single stop on the train from the airport. Making it very easy to get to. There are also a handful of restaurants within 10 minutes walk. If you want a snack the lobby bar serves a nice selection of snack food and has a well stocked bar. Overall a really interesting stay, and i would defintley stay there again when visiting Amsterdam. One bit of advice, take a look at the photo of the hotel by the lifts in the lobby. Some "interesting" things are going on in each room.

Reviews.Title: “What a fun experience”
Reviews.Author: TripReviewer88
Reviews.Content: The only downside, which isn't really a downside at all, is that Citizen M is not in the very center of Amsterdam activity. But, it is only steps away from a tram that takes you right to all of the big Amsterdam sites. From reserving the room to returning home, this hotel was just fun. During the reservation process I was able to select what type of music I wanted to have playing in the room, what color the lights would be, what the temperature was, and if I wanted the shades up, down or somewhere in between. Once in the room, we could change all that if we wanted to. The bed was huge. The body wash smelled delicious. The movies on the tv were all free. I didn't want to leave. Free internet on macs in the lobby. The room was small. Very small, but the set up was logical that it was impossible to wish for a larger rom

Reviews.Title: “Different hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: FilipFromLeuven
Reviews.Content: For someone who is looking to have "another" hotel stay, he/she must have been to CitizenM: everything is diffrent from an ordinary hotel, from the moment you pass the entrance door until you check-out. I want to stay more at a CitizenM hotel. The only too strange experience was that all personel was talking English, even to French or, like me, dutch speaking people.

Reviews.Title: “Unquestionably odd but great value”
Reviews.Author: Leedsboy38
Reviews.Content: Business trip with a focus in budget. Rooms are small and the lack of separate room for toilet and shower is strange (both have 'pods' in the bedroom). But the rooms are comfortable and well thought out. There are nice touches like a UK plug socket. With wifi and movies being free the hotel is excellent value. No desk for work in the bedroom but the lounge area downstairs is ideal. Have already rebooked.

Reviews.Title: “Any city with a CitizenM, I'll be staying there.”
Reviews.Author: Traveling-Illini4
Reviews.Content: CitizenM states on their website that they are expanding their locations to other European cities and even some American ones in the future. If I am traveling to a city that has a CitizenM hotel, I will without a doubt be staying there. I have never stayed at a hotel in this price range with such a high level of quality, services provided, comfort, cleanliness, location... the list goes on. I found the neighborhood to be great. It was quiet but still had restaurants if we felt like staying out of the city center. The tram, one of the main lines, runs right by and it was very easy to make it to the places we wanted to go. It was also a brief walk from the train from the airport. Very easy! The lobby was huge, clean and very comfortable. The room was large enough for what my wife and I needed. Our huge American Tourister luggage fit in the drawer under the bed, a nice way to keep it out of sight and declutter the room. The bed was AMAZING! It was the best hotel mattress I've ever slept on. It was also very large, especially by European hotel standards. I really appreciated the free English tv movies (and two free channels of porn!) as a way to end the day/night. The shower was great, as was the entire list of bathroom amenities. No need for plug converters, there is a US one built into the vanity. The one "complaint" I've heard about the shower is the lack of privacy. This was not an issue for my wife and I, we've seen each other in the buff before. I think this is more of a concern for the natural "prudeness" of us Americans. If you are traveling with someone you'd rather not see nude, a short trip down to the lobby would be more than acceptable. There are plenty of TVs to watch down there, food to enjoy in the canteen (Heineken Extra Cold on draught, how I miss thee), or even using the complimentary iMacs. I found the staff to also be great. Of course CitizenM lacks the charm of a B&B or even a small family run hotel. But, the staff really does a great job of helping with anything we had asked (suggestions, checking in our luggage, phrases, directions). And as an American who speaks bad German, their English was as good/better than my own. My wife loved our time in Amsterdam, and CitizenM has a role in that. I'd imagine one would have to spend over four times as much money in Amsterdam for a better hotel than CitizenM.

Reviews.Title: “Modern marvel”
Reviews.Author: Anna_Sarah
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel after being impressed withit's sister hotel by the airport. It's just as impressive, modern and friendly like the other CitizenM. Rooms are small but super functional and modern. Check in/out process is streamlined to perfection. Staff is the most friendly and helpful I have seen in anywhere. Genuinely helpful, not just polite. Great stocked canteen with anything from sandwich to sushi. Located very short ride from the airport and close to city center (not the best for the historic part of town, though). One note: it's absolutely perfect for a short stay of 1-2 days, when you do not need to unpack. Not good for a longer stay because there is no shelf space of any kind.

Reviews.Title: “No frills - definitely!”
Reviews.Author: BusTrav106
Reviews.Content: This is one of the strangest hotels I have ever stayed at. The rooms are no bigger than sleeping berths on a train - the bed is attached to the wall. My biggest problem was dead bugs in the room - many all over the floor - I complained to the front desk and they just nodded. They were cleaned up when I returned at the end of the day but it was disgusting. Trying to shut the shower doors required one to be of super human strength and quite honestly was not clean upon return at the end of the day. They promote themselves as luxury budget - budget yes, luxury no. It is a convenient location to many attractions but I would not recommend staying here if you are claustrophobic

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, value for money, but not for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: krityur
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night because of the high reviews this hotel received. While I would agree that it does give you value for money, it was a bit difficult for a business traveler. First there was no writing desk in the room. While wifi is free, you either need to dress up and go down to the lobby or type away on your bed. Second, the location's a bit far from the center, so if you have a meeting somewhere, you need to take a 15-20 minute tram ride. The gadgets are really fun to play with, but lose their novelty after some time. But I did have a problem with the heating. It's so modern that they don't have those good ol' fashioned radiators near the window. Since the windows are so huge, it got very very cold and the modern remote control wasn't helping any! However, I did appreciate the cleanliness, easy check in, and the FREE movie on demand! I would recommend this to young leisure travelers who want value for their money.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and funky design, location is 15 minutes from center”
Reviews.Author: rfuturo
Reviews.Content: I don't have much to add to the other great reviews. This is a great hotel at a good price. The cherry on the cake was the service including the fact I left my eye glasses in my room and they found them, kept them and helped me arrange to have them shipped back to me. The food offering downstairs is also quite good and 24 hours! We made use of that for late snacks which was great! Only negative point is that is localted south of center but AMS is tiny! Very friendly staff and great service

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, designer hotel at affordable price”
Reviews.Author: Adele49
Reviews.Content: My husband and 2 teenagers loved the concept of this very trendy hotel. The bed was amazing and even though the hotel is a short tram ride into the heart of the city it didn't detract one moment from a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, but oh so comfortable”
Reviews.Author: cchan_au
Reviews.Content: This hotel oozes cool. The rooms are futuristic and stylish. They are small, but fits everything you need. We loved the design of the room. The king bed was so comfortable. It was heaven lying in bed and watching TV at night. Am so tempted to redesign my bedroom to something similar. The staff are all young, friendly and eager to assist. The hotel though is not close to the city centre on foot. You are therefore dependent on the tram and night bus. CitizenM does not offer free coffee and tea in their rooms. You therefore have to purchase your tea and coffee in the cafe downstairs. Also, wish that CitizenM installs coin operated laundromats in the future. Overall, one of our favorite hotels during our trip.

Reviews.Title: “A concept hotel which doesn't charge an arm and a leg”
Reviews.Author: Erikareta
Reviews.Content: Recently back from the Amsterdam City CitizenM and I have to say the hotel lives up to the hype. If you like your hotels fuss free, modern and comfortable this is for you. My partner and I booked a trip to Amsterdam for my birthday. I was looking for a cheap comfortable hotel and this was by far the cheapest I could find and I was surprised to see how popular and so modern it was. The hotel is placed a convenient 15mins from the main central station in Amsterdam on tram line 5 and handily the tram stop is a few yards from the hotel. On arrival we were greeted by an ambassador on taken through the self check in which only took a few mins. Once we did that we headed to our room on the third floor. The rooms are so well designed, they are small but totally functional. The bed takes up the entire width of the room and is at the far end under the window. You are supplied with very comfy large pillows (with 2 more in the drawer under the bed) and a very soft large duvet all linen is white and clean. The large window has venetian blinds built in and for total darkness a black out blind comes down from the ceiling. The flat screen tv on the wall, provides music (although a bit generic and lift like) also BBC channels and free movies - and there is quite a selection, we watched a movie each night. The tv is set up when you walk in the room to take you through the room features via the 'mood pad' which looks like a remote and controls the lighting, tv , temperature and blinds. There is a VOIP/ Skype phone in the room which I used to call home and I can confirm it was free! Initially a little dubious of the shower 'pod' as it had no frosting on the glass I soon forgot about it, but I would advise that if you are shy or sharing with someone you are not happy stripping off in front of then this could be a problem! There is a curtain by the bed which pulls accross but it is fairly transparent. It is a large shower, definitely big enough for two and the water comes out directly above you. Shower gel is provided. The toilet is a pod did have frosted glass but little in the way of sound proofing! Turn the tv up...! There is a full length mirror this turns round and on the other side is another mirror which has a built in hairdryer (better than usual hotel hairdryers) and both a european and uk plug socket - genius! The sink is separate freestanding and next to the mirror unit and soap is provided. Underneath is a bin tissues spare loo roll and a couple of plastic cups. Also in the room in a very stylish chair, small bed side tables attached to the bed. The is a very small area by the door for hanging clothes, only 3 hangers the main place to keep clothes is under the bed in a drawer - it will take a case. By the door is a room safe operated by code which you set yourself. Towels were changed everyday and the bedclothes changed on our 2nd day (we stayed 3 nights) I was surprised how quiet it was on our floor, I expected to hear lots of noise from ajoining rooms but apart from the odd creak now and then nothing kept me awake. The communal area downstairs is straight out of a design magazine, lots of little social areas for sitting, with books and TV's around. There are also Mac's for going online - free of course. The Bar/cafe is well stocked, slightly pricey in my opinion - especially alcohol but the coffee is completely awesome so I didn't mind paying for the quality. You can pay in cash or charge it to your room. It's open 24hrs. Check out is 11am and completely painless, with staff on hand if you have any queries, you also get to keep your room key for future use as a luggage tag! If you are wanting an inexpensive quality hotel conveniently located you'd be daft not to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “One of a kind experience!”
Reviews.Author: Costasxlv
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, very modern and great design! Ideal for couples because of the shower and the bathroom being in the same space in the room. The room could be bigger, but that doesn't bother a lot, unless you have a lot of stuff. We didn't tried breakfast, as we thought it was pricey. Also, free internet connection, cheap telephone calls, and free TV movies (late releases too !)

Reviews.Title: “Fancy, cool and trendy”
Reviews.Author: Bobcat81
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for a weekend in January. 2 nights stay, arriving friday and leaving Sunday. The hotel lobby was cool and trendy with a nice bar located centrally. Finding the hotel from the airport was no problem at all, a train from the airport for a few mins to the very first stop amsterdam zuid, hten literally a 2 min walk and you are at the hotel. We arrived too early to check in but you could pay a 20 euro early check in fee and could check in early. We didnt do this as felt it a little cheeky. A room was obviously ready if we could pay to go to it and we felt having already paid for the room, this should not be the case. However thats about the only bad thing I can say about this place. It was excellent. The staff were brilliant, always friendly, always helpful. The room was great. Small enough for girls maybe who might want to do make up and all the rest as there is just a stand alone wall mounted sink and not really places for whatever make up and that girls normally have around the place. But the room is plenty sizeable for two people. No problem at all with the size. The mood pad is cool and not only does it change the mood colour but you can also use it as tv control or indeed to play music on the tv with a selection of themed music stations (pop, VIP area, dance hits etc.). The bed is the best thing about the room - huge and so comfortable. The duvets are soft and keep you warm - the bed was amazing. Shower a little weird given the glass is not frosted around it like it is around the toilet - but as was just me and gf it was ok - she seen it all before!!! But might be something to consider if travelling with a friend or brother or something. The location is a little outside the centre but there is a tram stop right outside for the number 5 tram which brings you into the heart of the ity in 10, 15 mins and also has stops at the mueseums and main shopping areas. Bar is a little pricey and breakfast is grand - nothing too special. The food here may be the least attractive thing about the hotel for me. But all in all, a great time had and this place is totally recomended.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel ive stayed in yet”
Reviews.Author: citychick87
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved this hotel. Getting there: Took the train from schipol airport to Zuid station, took around 8 mins i think. Then its a few minutes walk to hotel. Cost of train 2eur each. Felt safe enough walking from station. From Centraal take tram 5. Check-in: Done on self-service machine, took a couple of minutes. Staff there to assist if needed. You can pick city or garden view at check-in and was able to add an extra person for free if you booked room for 1, also able to add breakfast or late checkout at this point.Check out was done in the same manner. Rooms:I absolutely loved the rooms. The room isnt huge but there was more floor space than in other european hotels i've been in. The bed is huge and duvets and pillows were all soft and clean. Extra pillows were under the bed alongside extra towels. the underbed storage space could be used for luggage and there was a few hangers above the safe for coats. There was shampoo and shower gel in the rooms which smelled gorgeous. We requested toothbrushes at reception were given them for free alongside toothpaste. There is a hairdryer in the room which is attached the a mirror with lights attatched. The mirror can be flipped, with a full size mirror at the other side. The toilet is in the room, inside a "pod", the glass was frosted and there is also a kind of privacy curtain which can be used to split the room. The shower is in another pod, without frosted glass. It can be used normally or in rain shower mode. It is very spacious and fantatsic in rain shower in. Both the shower and toilet had lighting above them, which can be controlled using the mood pad. The mood pad, is used to control the temperature, lighting, tv etc. The tv had loads of channels including bbc, cnn. there was loads of free on-demand movies and was quite up to date with films like shutter island, shrek 4 etc. There were also adult movies, which you can block if you like.The TV was a wall mounted plasma. The alarm on our mood pad was unreliable, but we had been warned about that. There was also a phone in the room which we didnt use. The temperature was fine and easy to control/change.There was an electronic safe. The rooms had free WI-FI access. We felt the rooms were great and couldnt fault them. Hotel lobby: The hotel lobby was made upof several "living rooms" which looked like IKEA showrooms. There were several TV's throughout the lobby. There was also iMac computers which were free to use.You could also buy everything from magazines, socks to condoms and "personal massagers" in the lobby. CanteenM: Was open 24hrs a day. It was reasoanbly priced for drinks 2.50 euros for soft drinks and also served food like sushi and curry which was a bit pricier. Breakfast was great, you could get a grab and go bag for 9.95 eur which i didnt buy. There was a choice of coffees, teas, fruit, pastries, rolls, cheese, yoghurt etc. The bar was also great, serving huge measures. Location: The hotel is next to Zuid station/ WTC. It is about 10 mins from Leidesplein by tram and about 15-20 mins to Centraal. Trams are really regular, several an hour and you can get nightbus 358 from Centraal to hotel too. A 72hr GVB pass cost 15.50eur so its cheap to get about. Would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Good cheaper option”
Reviews.Author: foodie3112
Reviews.Content: Our stay at CitizenM was good. Although slightly further from the centre of Amsterdam than we anticipated it is accessable by tram for about 7 euros a day. The rooms however were fantastic, although small the beds are HUGE and the mood pad to change the colour of lights etc is a novelty and the extensive selection of films is great (it would be afab hotel if you are on business) Staff are scarce as it is quite high tech so you check in and check out on a computer. There is however a 24 hour bar which is useful. Overall a positive stay.

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed in worse...”
Reviews.Author: elizabethellis
Reviews.Content: In the sticks but super-high tech & clean. Bad points, the food was horrible (& not many places to eat locally) & there was no kettle in the room. Also heating was erratic, tho it was v cold. Shower was lush however and WiFi was good. Not sure I'll stay next time, though.

Reviews.Title: “Love the hotel but don't love the location”
Reviews.Author: noisui
Reviews.Content: There have been alot of very positive reviews of the hotel and I find myself agreeing that it is stylish, that the rooms are intriguing and that the bed is one of the most comfortable that I have ever slept in. The one downside to the hotel and it is one that would stop me using this particular one again in the future, is the location. It is very easy to get to from Schipol airport and is only 5 minutres easy walk from the Amsterdam Zuid station. But it is a long way out of the city centre and the immediate area is souless and is short of amenities. The hotel is well serviced by the number 5 tram line, with two stations (Zuid and Princess Irenstraat only being 5 minutes away. But then it is about 20 minutes to Dam Square (actually just at the back of the Palace). 20 minutes doesn't sound very long, but considering that you have to wait perhaps 10 minutes for a tram and then we found that the trams were full and quite often standing room only, it does detract from a short stay. Don't take me wrong, I really enjoyed the hotel and it is great value. But I prefer a hotel where you can walk into the city and enjoy the architecture, the window shopping along with the bars and cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Love Citizenm!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kfizzo
Reviews.Content: As we stayed in Glasgow Citizenm, there was no question where we were going to stay in Amsterdam. The rooms are fantastic, aswell as the staff. I love that you can get food anytime of the day, these hotels really are designed for the mobile ciziten. The hotel is a little bit out of the heart of amsterdam, but the tram is right outside the hotel and the train station is a 5-10 minute walk. The feature I thought was fantastic about this hotel, is you can select your language on the television, so therefore at night when we were back at the hotel, we had something to watch. Majority of hotels I have stayed at in Europe only have two english speaking channels, BBC or CNN. You also get free wifi and free movies. And it goes without saying, the best beds you will find in any hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Smashing!”
Reviews.Author: LuxuryLap
Reviews.Content: Only had one night here unfortunately, but planning to go back already. Easy to get to on the tram. Check-in and out was seamless, staff really friendly and helpful. Room was just perfect (fab, comfy bed and super shower, simple but so well planned). Only paid about Â£70 for two of us, and certainly better than some we've stayed in for more! And of course, Amsterdam is just fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Surprising!”
Reviews.Author: Joao R
Reviews.Content: Value for money with design and comfort, easy access to city center!

Reviews.Title: “Computer glitch”
Reviews.Author: midway4581
Reviews.Content: Services in room such as door lock, lights, tv and blinds are controlled by computer. When this went wrong, it was very hard to find an actual member of staff to assist with problems. Locked out of room for over one hour due to computer malfunction and manageress broke door trying to get me back in. Thereafter, only the hotel master key would open door and so every time I left the room a member of staff had to escort me back to let me in again. Asked for another room but was told that hotel full due to marathon weekend. Finally got allocated another room with working door lock next day. No plans to return to this hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “Unique hotel”
Reviews.Author: zqz321
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a short walk from the first train stop (5 min) away from Schipol Airport. Just head north from the train station and there will be signs to the hotel once you reach a small park. The hotel is in trendy with bright colours and funky furniture and artwork. Only a couple of people were at the hotel as check-in and check-out is self service. We were quite shocked when we stepped into our trendy room at the CitizenM hotel. The room is very small especially when the doors for the toilet and the shower are closed, but the bed is large and you have access to many free channels. Going to the washroom with your partner only a few feet away is quite uncomfortable. The shower was a little confusing to use at first too. The rooms are fairly quiet and the bed is very comfortable. Another benefit is that there is a storage room for luggage once you check out. Tram #5 is across the street and takes you to most of the main attractions in Amsterdam. However, be careful of the weekend schedules as the trams do not come as often and don't start until about 6:30am.

Reviews.Title: “Wacky at first but excellent model”
Reviews.Author: crbpad
Reviews.Content: The citizenM model is unusual at first however it does have all the things that you need for a hotel stay. Hotel room well designed and comfortable. Breakfast selection ample and good fast service. I did have problems in my room with heating and the remote control which were annoying. Staff did try to help and heating was improved although the music was never fixed. Good wifi throughout which is free and also use of Apple MAcs and printers. I would certainly stay in a citizenM hotel again if that was an option.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: macmel1971
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a 3 night break and had a fantastic time. The rooms are very modern and the mood lighting brings a modern funky element to the hotel. The bed is one of the comfiest I have ever slept in. The staff are friendly and the lobby has a homely feel with plenty of space for lots of guests. The hotel is only a few stops from the centre and the tram stop is metres away from the hotel. The journey from the airport was easy and the public transport system is regular and cheap. I would definitely recommend this hotel and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Paton61
Reviews.Content: Great location for the airport and east metro link into the city. Funky hotel that delivers what it promises. Friendly helpful staff. Great value for money. I'd go back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great concept for city breaks”
Reviews.Author: chear_up
Reviews.Content: Great contemporary hotel for the city weekend break. The rooms are small but very stylish and comfortable. It has amazing built in shower which imitates rain, fantastic large bed and free wifi. The location is slightly off centre so you would need to take a tram for a couple of stops.

Reviews.Title: “Lounging and City trippers”
Reviews.Author: Anglo1Belge
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in CitizenM Amsterdam beginning of November. The hotel is an ideal base for people wanting to explore Amsterdam and surrounding area. The hotel is located in the Zuid neighbourhood of Amsterdam, Close to the World Trade Centre (underground) and has a tram stop almost in front of the hotel that goes via Museumplein (Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum) straight to Centraal Station (via Leidseplein). A quite location about 10 mins by public transport to city centre. As we travelled by car, we made use of the P+R parking in the Arena (Bijlmer), this is 6 Euros per day per car and includes return tickets for all passengers (1 hour tickets) to anywhere you want. Arena is about 10 mins by underground to Zuid (WTC) where the hotel is located. The hotel itself caters for the more adventures traveller, lobbies and rooms are sleek and uses every inch of space possible. The rooms are small but have all mod coms with a modern twist, basically all you need for a good night's rest. The lounges are made to feel like living rooms, lounging all around. I would only recommend to have breakfast, snacks and coffee/tea at the hotel, breakfast is pretty much continental. You can pre-order breakfast when checking-in for just under a tenner. We did opt to get Breakfast direct at the bar, which came to the same price but at least you can have what you want. Snacks seem to be Japanese based (sushi, green teas, sashimi,....) The only minor point (if you want to call this a minor point) is that this is an in-personal place, don't go here if you like a talk/chat with hotel manager, room service, concierge, etc.... This is a self-service hotel. If you like gadgets, timeless pieces of art/furniture, lounging, podding, wifi-ing, staying incognito with all mod coms you can thing of than this hotel is for you. We definitely had a fantastic time and will stay again when visiting Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Apart the location, it is a good option to stay”
Reviews.Author: Elisabm
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good choice if you are on a budget, if you don't care about frills of any kind, if you like a good night of sleep and don't mind spending 20 minutes to get to the main attractions. The room is small and lacks a bit of privacy. But the great bed and comfy pillows make up for it. Also the shower is very potent. There is a 24/7 canteen and you can either buy your pack for breakfast or combine the itens old (that's what I did). The food is not exactly cheap but you don't have many options nearby. We did not experience any problems with the moodpad as related in the previous reviews. Staff was very nice and always willing to help. I think that the only minus about the hotel is its location. While very conveniently located to get to from Schipol airport (only a train stop), it is a bit far from the mais attractions. Yes, there is a tram stop just around the corner. But if you want to go to a restaurant at night, I suggest you do not get back to the hotel to go out later or you might get a bit lazy just thinking that your ride back town would take another 20 minutes. So enjoy your day and night to the fullest before going back. Let me just stress that the neighbourhood did not seem dangerous at all. In fact, it is located between the WTC and a residencial area. Would I stay there again? Probably yes, since the positive aspects surmounted the location.

Reviews.Title: “Just pefect”
Reviews.Author: Jarry52
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a business trip and stayed at CitizenM hotel for 3 nights. Its very funky with lots of straight lines and no frilly curtains in sight. Staff were helpful and very polite. The rooms are great but with no privacy so be warned if you like to enjoy your morning constitutional in private! Perfect is you are travelling on your own. Loved the shower and the bed and TV were excellent. Easy to get into Central Amsterdam too on the no 5 tram right outside the front door.

Reviews.Title: “High Tech and great sleep”
Reviews.Author: bbon98
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews we decided to stay at this hotel for the high tech aspect. My fiancee and I love high tech and found that citizenM did no disappoint. Internet access in the room was fabulous and the available movies were varied. The bed was to die for, super comfortable and huge, the best sleep ever. We were aware of the distance of the hotel from the downtown area and decided that it would still be a good idea to stay at citizenM. There is a 24 hour bar with some food selections that can be reheated. There are several restaurants and a market just a short walk away. The tram is just outside the door and it takes about 15 minutes to get to the centre. The tram passes by the Van Gogh Museum and Rijksmuseum. Overall the stay was good, the cost was low, and we love the high tech, however I don't think I will be staying there again since it was just a tad too far from the core. This hotel is for those who are more independent.

Reviews.Title: “very convenient”
Reviews.Author: daisywater
Reviews.Content: we spent 3 nights in the hotel. Upon arrival u will be recieved by a helpful young face who will guide u through your check in, so don't worry.The staff are all nice and helpful.as for the rooms they are just of the right size. However I would rather have more place to hang some clothes, mybe they can add a shelf or some shelf boxes.You can be assured that when u use the toilette no one can see or smell anything, however when you are taking a shower that is a different story. it is a see thru event. However some might feel a bit claustrophobic on the toilette. the bed is comfy and so r the pillows although my friend did not agree with me regrding the pillows.He would rather have a thinner pillow. Maybe it would be a good idea to add two pillows of a less thickness. I was not impressed with the color themes, it seemed a lot of trouble. the coffee in the morning was delicious though not the cappucino, it was cold and the cup was hald full. you have free access to the computors which is really great and . The tram station is just across the street and tram 5 will take you to leideplein, and there is a train station 3 minutes away from the hotel which will take you to schipol airport for 2.5euros.you can always walk to leidsplein and it takes around 45 minutes!!! one last thing don't take the 9 .9 euros breakfast. it's not a good deal. We ate 2 croissants, one egg, 2 pcs of cheese , one juice and 2 coffees in the hotel for around 11 euros. so buy each item that you need separately. would I go there again: definately, its clean and convenient, and the staff are friendly

Reviews.Title: “Amazing & Affordale hotel especially for the budget traveller”
Reviews.Author: theals
Reviews.Content: My wife and I found out about citizenM when it was voted as one of the trendiest hotels of 2010. We stayed here in August 2010 for our honeymoon. We were on a budget after the wedding ceremony and didn't want to spend too much for a room. This was the perfect choice and I wouldn't have changed it even if I had the extra money to spend. We walked into the hotel and I knew that this was my kind of hotel. Self check in was awesome and very user friendly. The staff were also very nice and informative. Once we step foot into our room, we knew that there was something unique about this hotel. The toilet and shower were in the middle of the room, and the bed was at the far end. The remote control brought a big smile to my face since it controlled pretty much everything!! Awesome hotel and would be my only choice if I were to come back to Amsterdam. :)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: yogadoug
Reviews.Content: Incredibly interesting hotel .. Romantic and very hip. Rooms are small but extremely well thought out! Lots of technical gadgets and benefits. Great great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: member1000
Reviews.Content: Great beds, very comfortable. Location ok- but very close to tram/metro so easy to get around. EURO 35 in taxi back to airport. Pretty close to Olympic stadium which we needed for marathon. Breakfast at EURO 9.95 not great- don't book it upon check-in just buy what you want from canteen in morning. Great coffee though. Staff helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great fun”
Reviews.Author: emmaco
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fresh and interesting, with lots of great design elements in the room and the lobby area (an area that actually had people using it, it was so nice). The first day, when there was water, I loved the rain shower. The rooms were very quiet with an extremely comfortable bed. Although it was 20-25 mins from the city by tram, the trams were easy to use and ran late. The neighbourhood was nice, with some good cafes and shops a tram stop or two away (and it's always nice to see non-tourist areas of a city). I like the idea of food being available 24/7 to purchase (especially when there are no shops within short walking distance). However, it fell down on value for money. At 114 euro a night I wouldn't call it a budget hotel, especially when it is so far out of the city. In other cities this usually indicates cheaper prices. A non-cooked breakfast of 9.99 euro is extremely high. Other things were more reminiscent of a budget hotel rather than the price, such as the water (handbasin as well as shower!) not working on a Sunday morning for at least half an hour as everyone was apparently showering - not acceptable in a hotel of that price in my opinion, and the staff member I spoke to didn't sound suprised about it - they really should book less people in or buy a larger water tank. If I could get a cheaper price I'd stay again as overall the experience was good.

Reviews.Title: “Hopefully the future of budget hotels”
Reviews.Author: canadiansteve1982
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night in this hotel and as mentioned in other posts, that's the perfect amount of nights for this hotel. Loved: free wifi plus 4 iMacs available to use. Movies on demand. Mood lighting. Rain showers Didn't like: lack of storage space and proximity of toilet. Would definitely recommend for a weekend break as it's modern, contemporary an close to the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, average location”
Reviews.Author: benn77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Citizen M for a weekend break to Amsterdam. The location is good for an airport stop over as it is a 10 minute train ride from Schipol. However it is a bit out of the centre for a weekend break (20 minute tram ride into town). The rooms are funky, modern etc with all the electrics and lighting operated off a single device. However if there are two of you staying they can feel a little cramped and there is no hanging space for clothes, so pack light! On the plus side the sound proofing is really good so despite the rooms being crammed in your sure of a good nights sleep. Overall a good value, quirky hotel, but one I'd say is best suited for solo travellers staying for one night.

Reviews.Title: “A one-night thing”
Reviews.Author: DmitriPortland_OR
Reviews.Content: This is a great and inexpensive new toy, everything can be controlled from a display: you can choose your lighting with a controlled mood lighting system, send an email, watch TV, etc.. The design of the room is contemporary. There is no check-in lines, just a bunch of computers and imposingly nice staff that does their utmost best to the point of making yo feel slightly uncomfortable. Everything says: we are new, we are young, and we are cool. A little bit of homey comfort would be nice. Beds are perfect and it is fun to be in your room, albeit the small size of it. Cafeteria is very expensive and I did not care much for the pre-ordered breakfast. Great location just a short tram ride to the center of Amsterdam and 7 minutes walk to a train station with 8 minutes ride to the airport. Skype telephone rates if you call from your room. We paid about 8 cents for 5 calls to the US and Russia.

Reviews.Title: “TriPAdvisor Award Winner ? GIve me a break !”
Reviews.Author: sundar1811
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel for my recent 4 day trip to Amsterdam based on its being awarded a TripAdvisor award for 2010. And to say I was disappointed will also be eligible for an award - the understatement of the year 2010 ! To the point, the following were my issues and they started from check in and ended at check out: 1) the hotel had check in time of 0200PM and check out of 1100AM (with extra costs for extensions) ! I dont know if that is general business practice, but I sure felt short changed. So if one stayed for just 1 night, one would be getting just 21 hours against the 24 hours they paid for (12.5% less) 2) the hotel had crammed the most rooms into the real estate it had available(which was not much), with the result, each room was just a rectangle of 12'X8'. Since there was not enough space for a separate bathroom, they did the "design innovation" of having circular glass bath and toilet cubicles and an open wash basin 3) the circular wash basin was just 14 inches in diameter and worse was out in the open, with the result, even washing one's face was impossible without getting half the room wet 4) there was no space for keeping one's luggage at all...except for a pull out draw under the bed. No shelves for keeping one's clothes etc...with the result that one had to operate out of the suitcase, literally. And how the hotel expected the guest to do that in a pull-out-draw-under-the-bed scenario is beyond me ! 5) the shower in the circular bath cubicle wouldnt work unless the cubicle is closed shut by sliding the doors. Now, we all know when we open the shower, atleast 2 litres of ICE COLD water will come out even if we have turned the shower setting to hot water, as this is the water in the plumbing pipelines that gets expelled first. I am sure the hotel enjoys hearing all the 'ooh's and 'ouch'es when guests enter the shower and get dumped with ice cold water before they can get hot water running 6) the bed was wall to wall, with three sides closed out and only the fourth available to get off and get on from. So if its two of you, one has to climb over the other to get off/on. 7) I am not sure if the fire escape is as per standards....as it was steps that were quite narrow and steep..... thank god there was no need for me to use the same when I was there 8) apart from shampoo and a soap (changed once in 3 days), there was no other cosmetics offered. 9) the much advertised moodpad that I had in my room was simply showing "Wait...connecting to room XXX" for about 90% of my time in the room Compared to where I had stayed just the previous day(sorry, can't help comparing - Hotel Pearl, Frankfurt), the difference is as between heaven and hell. The hotel has plastered a lot of "CitizenM says......" all over the property...well, I couldn't help thinking, it sure says a lot more than it does..... I wish I had taken a few photos to substantiate my review, but alas that is not to be. To any other wannabe guest here, I would say, forewarned is forearmed....

Reviews.Title: “Futuristic and fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Reviewer003
Reviews.Content: I managed to find this hotel by total chance when searching for somewhere to stay in amsterdam that was clean but affordable and I was not disappointed. I was even more impressed by this hotel on arrival. Check in was easy with self service check in points or desk with receptionists available should you need assistance. After an error of 3 rooms booked instead of the 2 required, one for myself and my partner and the other for our friend , the manager was very kind and without any fuss assured me I would be refunded which was much appreciated after my panic once the booking had been made. The room was fantastic and value for money. Spotlessly clean, modern, funky and quiet. The mood pad was an excellent feature and my partner was happy messing around with it changing light colours, blinds etc whenever we were in our room. As others have mentioned it is a bit compact on space and any longer than a week here could get claustrophic and also as mentioned it is not for couples who have just met or the easily embarrased as privacy is limited with the pods for the toilet and shower even if the glass is frosted. Location wise I would say was perfect, far enough from any noise but near enough for a short taxi ride into the popular areas such as Leidseplein. A nice small bar in the lobby was perfect for a wind down before bed or a quick croissant and a juice of a morning. All in all definately value for money. The only negatives I would say were apart from the manager, the reception staff were slightly rude and unhelpful and when asked a question or a request gave a bit of a huff and puff but don't let that put you off, maybe this is the dutch way. If I visit Amsterdam again this will definately be my 1st choice for a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a couple of nights”
Reviews.Author: cheapskate1959
Reviews.Content: If you need to drop your bags, and spend a day or two at meetings in Amsterdam this place is great. The rooms are small but well designed, the 24 hour canteen is a blessing if your time clock is not synched with the local time zone, service is friendly and efficient. The few unhappy reviews on here tend to be from people who stayed there for more than a night or two or three. For a long stay this is clearly not meant to be the place (unless your company is broke -- for the price this is the best option out there.....)

Reviews.Title: “An experience”
Reviews.Author: Druopera
Reviews.Content: Took me an hour to 'get' this hotel. However, it made perfect sense to me when I eventually did. Will definitely be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great fun hotel with easy access to central Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Jenny81London
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel for a weekend break and both thought it was absolutely spot on. The rooms are small, granted, but a testament to excellent and creative design. We've stayed in plenty of high-end hotels and I don't think we've enjoyed any of those any more than we did Citizen M. The gadgets were great fun and the bed astonishingly comfy. I'd definitely visit again. In terms of tourist practicalities, it's only 10 mins on the (very frequent) tram to the centre, which stops practically outside the front door of the hotel. And if you're staying out late (trams stop at around midnight) we negotiated EUR10 for taxi rides home. Which illustrates that it's not prohibitively far out. I'd definitely recommend a visit - not least because the hotel's great fun!

Reviews.Title: “Good for near the airport but not in the city”
Reviews.Author: NWtd
Reviews.Content: I spend two nights in this hotel. The pictures and the movies on you tube looks good but what they forget to mention that you don't have any space (where to put the suitcase?!). Also bathroom near your bed wasn't a succes for me. Gadgets where very cool. Hotel is good to spend some hours near the airport but not for leisure or business. Better use a hotel in the centre of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and original”
Reviews.Author: gsza
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for five nights and overall it was a pleasant experience. Location: halfway between the airport and the center. One stop by train from the airport (about ten minutes). Tram will take you in less than 15 minutes to every central location. It is highly recommended for those who wish to stay near all attractions but want to stay away from the noisy center of Amsterdam. Breakfast: We had breakfast every morning in a prepackaged bag that contained: croissant, fruit, jam, butter, yoghurt, juice and coffee from the bar. Full and healthy but still not much freedom of choice. However, it is well worth the 9 euros since Amsterdam does not really have much to offer other than junk food for that price. Rooms: The concept of the rooms is futuristic. They have managed to fit many things and keep it very functional at the same time. It is not particularly spacious though. The bed is very comfortable (a third of the room is the bed) and the TV offers a wide variety of free on-demand movies (and music as well). The fact that you can customize the lighting and the music to the mood is very fun. Staff: the staff is amazing, definitely the strongest advantage for this hotel. Young and enthusiastic, from various locations around the world, they are willing to offer the best service possible. They gave us great tips about the city. A big thank you to all. Services: The hotel has an excellent bar with some cold dishes (some microwaveable as well). Also available is a great lounge (very stylish as the rest of the hotel) with many TVs and books. Free wifi is provided within the hotel premises and 4 Imacs are always available for the public, free of charge. The overall experience we got from this hotel was very pleasing and we would gladly return for another stay. The only problem I have to mention is that on the first night, our room's temperature control was malfunctioning. Although we set it to 23, the room was very chilly. Unfortunately the hotel was fully booked and it was too late at night to repair. Given that it is a closed environment (windows dont open), it was hard to do anything else but use extra bankets. However, the next day we were moved to another room and were offered free breakfast for the rest of our stay. The staff was very helpful and they did the best they could under the circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, affordable hotel with easy access to central Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Oliebollen
Reviews.Content: I'm a big fan of slightly unusual hotels, and this one fitted the bill perfectly when I was researching a 1-night city break to Amsterdam. The check-in process was a simple case of using one of the self-service touchscreen terminals and programming your own room key(s). From there it was up to the room. Wow! I knew it was going to be compact, but it was exactly as I had imagined - small but practical, funky and modern. We were impressed and had a good play with the remote control mood lighting, window blind etc. The free WiFi and movies (including porn) was a nice touch - not something I've experienced before (even in more expensive hotels - I never understand why they can't include free Internet!). The bed was superb - very large and incredibly comfortable. The bed linnen was simple and elegant, and ensured a good night's sleep after a long day exploring the City. The communial areas of the hotel were very nicely styled with comfy seating areas and TVs to watch etc. Free-to-use Apple iMacs for Internet browsing. The 24h bar/restaurant was a nice touch, although we didn't really use it - preferring to eat out for our meals. There is a tram stop almost immediately outside the hotel - we used it several times to get back into the centre. A number 5 tram took around 15-20 mins to get to Central Station, and we had an All-in-One travel ticket which made this easy (just swipe on, swipe off etc). For the money, this hotel was superb value and highly recommended to anyone visiting Amsterdam for a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: chuckster2
Reviews.Content: The CitizenM in Amsterdam is on the cutting edge. The #5 tram from the train station delivered us right next to the hotel. The staff was very helpful and advised us that we could leave our bags or wait 15 minutes to check-in. We appreciated the tip! The Hotel self-service restaurant/grocery was reasonable. Our room was very clean and trendy. The bed was one of the most comfortable beds that I have ever slept in. CitizenM is a fun experience and a good value. Give it a try!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: youbettertreatmegood
Reviews.Content: This is possibly the best Hotel experience I've ever had in my life. Very little I've found so cole to my needs. I am a person that travels abroad every week and of very practical needs. I don't care about unnecessary and overpriced facilities in a hotel. I got all I wanted: - Fast and Fun self check in with computers at the entrance as well as burn your own hotel card - Special on Foursqure with a drink on the house - Wifi, Macs, plugs, Flat TVs eveywhere and actual tables where you can work on in the lobby - Themed lights in the room plus amazing choice of free movies - amazing and relaxing shower - possibly one of the most comfortable beds I've slept on. - one of the best coffees I've had in a hotel. Plus great 24/7 food avaiability Things I would improve: - my spouse tells me some level of room service would be nice - Air con needs some tweaking. It can be cold at night - Some sauna/gym would be great - just saying Communication, design and personality of the hotel are among the most entertaining. Better than HardRock Hotel or Disneyland Resorts when you are a kid. If you care for being in the centre of the city (pretty much useless in a city where you can be everywhere in 15 mins), better navigate in other hotels. My top spot for business/leisure travel in Europe and best value for money alternative

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for single traveller, but cold”
Reviews.Author: lexi131313
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently whilst at a conference at the RAI. Great location for RAI, nice room but would be small for two people. Very clean, great big comfortable bed, and very quiet, slept very soundly. The shower is good, and quite cool being in the middle of the room. Great selection of TV/movies on demand if you have any spare time. Easy tram ride into the city centre, but keep you out of the hussel and bustle of the touristy areas unless you want to be there. A few problems, needed more hangers for clothes and room was too cold even at max temp. High tech touch pad could be a little temperamental and no way to over ride it if not working, so had a shower in darkness one morning. But overall would recommend this as a very good hotel and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel and best bed on our trip!”
Reviews.Author: Quassie24
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 7 beds in 2 weeks, and this was by far the best! Possibly even better than ours at home. It was perfect for us. Very cool hotel! We do wish it was a tad bit closer to the the city central, but enjoyed seeing the outside of the city to see get a better feel of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “good choice if you have to stay near the airport”
Reviews.Author: tobag0
Reviews.Content: Very nice design hotel just next to airport. Clean well decorated and funny rooms and friendly staff. Breakfast is served in a paper bag and it cost 9 euros. It's a suprise bag with a bottle of juice, one apple, baguette and some yoghurt. Nice lobby bar where you can buy some food and drinks, free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for business or vacation with a lot of style”
Reviews.Author: kgersen
Reviews.Content: Good value rooms with everything controlled by computer, and all in a stylish post-modern environment. Minor compaints about the in-room software (can't keep the clock on when the TV is off), and could do with a few more coat hooks, but would definitely stay again. Enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “It's a "design" hotel for geeks!”
Reviews.Author: Najmeh
Reviews.Content: I loved the experience; just because it was cool to have been to a hotel that had a shower in a plexiglass cylinder in the middle of the bedroom. Oh the toilet too was right in the middle fo the bedroom; in a different cylinder! Don't expect privacy if you are travelling with a friend. It's just good for a "cool" and "geeky" university applicant (but then it is a little expensive); not an old professor's venue :) I recommend it to people < 30-years of age; who want to try a hi-tech pricy hostel!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish”
Reviews.Author: G7M4B3
Reviews.Content: Love the big bed and the moodpad. The lobby is filled with design pieces. Room too small for a long stay. Easy reach to the city center by tram nr. 5. As they say travel light and always wear a smile!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely yes... but once in a lifetime”
Reviews.Author: davide_84
