Reviews.Content: It is a very interesting concept: hyper hi-tech and design at a affordable price. It definitely worth a stay for the first time. The real problem is the toilet, in room but the complete absence of privacy due to the design of the room, become very annoying after a few days.

Reviews.Title: “OK with flaws”
Reviews.Author: getafiz
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a night at CitizenM and had a mixed experience. Pros: Super Clean, Simple check-in experience, Great comfortable bed, cool trendy shower enclosure. - Easy to get to from Schipol. Take train to the Amsterdam Zuid station and the hotel is a 5 min walk. Cons: Far from Amsterdam Centraal. Take the #5 tram and get off at Princes IreneStraat. It took about 15-20 minutes to get there from Centraal. The walk from the tram station is less than a minute. - Some basic hotel amenities are missing here like a clothes Iron. I called the front desk and they told me that I had to take my clothes to the room/place where they iron clothes and use the hotel iron to iron my clothes! I dont see myself walking down the corridor with my clothes, taking the elevator and going to a laundry room to iron my clothes after paying 150 Euros for the room. - No glasses to drink water in the room. No coffee/tea options in the room. - The concept of a space age glass enclosure for the shower is great, but it would not close completely and the shower kept turning off when it the enclosure opened up by itself. - The toilet is also another glass bubble/enclosure in the room with very little privacy. It is frosted glass, but no sound proofing :) - Room layout is not optimal because of the glass bubbles/enclosures for shower and toilet being placed around the room. When you wake up in the night, you have to make sure that you dont bump into the clear glass shower or the basin before you get to the toilet enclosure.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, fun and cosy!”
Reviews.Author: browneyedgirl80
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend surprised me with a trip to Amsterdam for my 30th and, after much research, chose CitizenM. Brilliant choice! The rooms were so well designed - the mood pad (we had lots of fun changing the colours on the ceiling while the other one was showering!), gigantic bed and pods for the shower and toilet were all very well thought out. The only comment I would make is not to stay in this hotel unless you are very comfortable with your roommate! There's not a lot of privacy!! The location is great with the tram stop right outside, too. I'd highly recommend this hotel and hope to visit again one day.

Reviews.Title: “Best nights sleep ever”
Reviews.Author: MissBree
Reviews.Content: Loved this Hotel! Perfect for any traveler who likes luxury without intimacy. Sometimes boutique hotels are a little boutique and you have to do all the chit chat. Not here. If you want to you could manage to check in and check out without talking to a single soul. Its right across from the tram stop 10 minutes from the city centre. the rooms are practical, amazing showers, the beds are heavenly with free wifi, loads of free films on demand, and cool bar / cafe open throughout the night, where you can get anything from sushi to prosecco. Lots of lovely people hanging about. I could live at CitizenM.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, Funky, Funny Hotel rooms!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hollandafter37years
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight, before we returned back to Canada, this past June. It was the MOST interesting place we had ever stayed in. I found this place on the internet and was glad we decided to stay here. The whole place was extremely clean, quiet and we had a great over-night stay. We had traveled for a month throughout Europe with our 9-y-o son and this was our last night, as we had to check in early for our flight the next morning. The rooms are extremely small, but then they are meant only for sleeping, right? There was a king sized bed, big enough for 3 to sleep comfortably and two carts with our luggage just fit. They even had bed-buddies for young children!. Our son had fun playing witgh the mood pad and trying to figure out how everything worked. He really liked the changing colors in the toilet stall and shower stall. We were less than a 10-minute walk to the airport in the morning with our two luggage carts, which was very convenient. We would definetely stay here again and recommend it to anyone wanting to stay close to the airport!

Reviews.Title: “Space Age Design and Hotel Concept”
Reviews.Author: Supergrannieisgreat
Reviews.Content: A hotel with a difference but we loved it. Not too near the centre but easy to get to - worth the travelling in my opinion. The ambassadors were lovely and very helpful. The rooms and beds were stunning - really good fun design. The only thing I would not bother with again is the breakfast which was okay but next time I would just get a coffee then head off to a cafe.

Reviews.Title: “only suitable for one night,one person,no luggage”
Reviews.Author: dieuwke
Reviews.Content: we choose this hotel for its location and the nice futuristic look. we (2 mature couples)stayed for 2 nights,and being on a long trip, arrived with a lot of luggage. The room is a converted container,and although very cleverly converted,there is no space to move or even open your suitcase. The biggest problem was the dust and a smell of fungus.Being there on very rainy days ,the humidity stayed in the room . there was no ventilation whatsoever .no possibilty to open a window . The 4 of us all suffered from allergies (sneezing and coughing ) . After complaining to the housekeeping they really tried to help by cleaning the deckbed and changing the molton, alas without much success. There is one more problem although not directly related to the Hotel . It is very difficult to find a parking space, because on all streets you have to pay ( about Euro 3.- per hr between 9am-9pm) and most of the coin automats are out of order !!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: dunkah
Reviews.Content: We had booked and pre paid (non flexible) for four nights. As our plans had changed a few days before we travelled they were kind enough, even though it was against policy, to change our dates by a day for the stay, charging us only the difference in room rate, rather than writing off one of the days as the website states they will. As a first time booker with them I thought this was exceptionally helpful. I can only imagine that they had the space available to help us and were able to be generous, but nevertheless, we were really impressed that they were so accommodating. The hotel is great. We're not the most conventional people so the little touches like the mood pad, the "tubes" in which you shower and toilet, and the Macs available on reception, to the art book collections (and the saucy poster by the lifts - don't view if you're a prude!) and the really high end free shower gel/shampoo all made us feel that we were somewhere that understood the kind of travellers we are. The staff in the hotel were exceptionally helpful and friendly, and nice to chat to. The room was lovely, with the bed so comfortable that we spent one whole day not moving from it, watching the range of free high end movies. To add to earlier comments, we didn't stumble over any "adult" content, although others seem to have found it freely accessible. However on the first page for the movies you have an option to block so that couldn't be easier. The other thing I'd mention is that yes, you can see each other on the loo, but you have a curtain to pull across from the bed to shield the rest of the room, and if you really want a bit more privacy, the lobby loos are the cleanest and nicest smelling public loos I've ever encountered. I would be back there in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Exciting design features with classic modern furnishings and quirky touches.”
Reviews.Author: Gail004
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel, but my husband thought it was too much form over function (i.e. he couldn't get the TV to work and missed the football). The bedroom is very small, but the bed is very comfortable (and huge). There is no disturbance from outside noise. The shower is good, but if you like a bit of privacy, the in room pod toilet might be a bit dodgy. The public areas have beautiful classic design furnishings by Ray and Charles Eames. The staff are very friendly and helpful. It is very easy to get to from Schipol and it's a nice walk to the centre of the city in about 40mins.

Reviews.Title: “Looks nice - not practical!”
Reviews.Author: LizSharp82
Reviews.Content: On first glance the room looked modern and quirky with "pod" toilet and shower. Another 5 mins and you realise the room is extremely small (the width of the bed in fact) with no wardrobe space, a safe you could just about fit a credit card in & a clothes rack with space for 2 hangers. Rooms advertised as twin are in fact doubles with a see-through shower so only share with v close mates! Facilities were minimal, no room service or ironing board available. The view was onto another building. Rooms were poorly lit. It took about 1.5 hours to receive 5 drinks ordered at the bar. Nevertheless the rooms were clean and functional. You can see what they're trying to achieve and the concept is great but they haven't made it work yet.

Reviews.Title: “Great room with a fun concept.”
Reviews.Author: Adventurer201008
Reviews.Content: Compact room with everything you need for a short stay. Very close to rail station and within easy reach of Airport. Tram to city or train. Taxi a bit expensive from Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice”
Reviews.Author: Michael7forest
Reviews.Content: I used trip adviser to make my decision on this hotel. SPOT ON. Great location. Funky modern room. Big bed and great shower. Room bit small but well laid out.Quiet(very important to me) and great view from room. Friendly staff. No brainer,wish every city had a Citizen M.

Reviews.Title: “The most unique hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Vic0724
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very modern and I loved everything about it! I will recommend it to anyone and I will definitely stay there again. I am looking forward to CitizenM expanding to other European destinations!!

Reviews.Title: “modern hotel @ the airport”
Reviews.Author: LoveGelati
Reviews.Content: if you are looking for an airport hotel a stone's throw away, citizen m is the hotel. it is clean and comfortable. hotel is furnished in clean design lines. bed is excellent. shower is very clean and works as it should. pricing is misleading as the total cost came up to another 10Euros more than published rates.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is fantastic! We would have been happy to stay in the hotel for our entire holiday!!”
Reviews.Author: BexBiggar
Reviews.Content: The photos on the internet looked amazing and we were worried that the hotel might not live up to the expectations we had but it did in every way. The room was brilliant - the huge bed and bedsheets provided some of the most comfortable nights sleeps I have ever had. The lights, music, temperature, blinds etc were controlled with an electronic control panel, with different mood lights. The shower was awesome. The communal area in the lobby was great to hang out in with TVs, loads of books and computers to surf the net. Though we mainly came to explore the city, we were also having a short break without our young child and having such a lovely hotel to stay in was just what we needed to properly relax. It is easy to get to from the centre of Amsterdam, just hop on a No. 5 tram to Princes Irenestraat which takes only 10 minutes. I would much rather have a great hotel and a little distance to travel than stay in the centre in a dodgy hotel that is noisy all night long. I cant think of anything negative to say about this hotel. We will definitely come back here if we visit Amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but not great - I think there are better”
Reviews.Author: JamesR202
Reviews.Content: Right - to start with this hotel is very much a question of personal taste. For me it does not work and I will tell you why: When I stay in a hotel I want service and there is very little of that. There is not room service, no phone in the room, limited staff in the hotel and in the mornings and afternoon they are always far too understaffed for the number of people they have checking out or just wanting to ask a question. The Bar is nice and I like the atmosphere around it but the food that they sell in there is a low quality version of Pret a Manger and very much over priced. They have a microwave to heat your food up!!! Is that not what you find in a petrol station on the motorway?? Surely it can not be too hard to install a small kitchen and offer a small selection of dishes? Anyway be careful of the food on offer as it is expensive and does not fill you up so you end up spending a small fortune on rubbish. The rooms - well these are cool if you were on your own but for 2 people they are very cramped and there is no where to put your luggage so when there is 2 of you the room just looks a tip the whole time. The remote control for everything in the room is a bit too fiddly for my liking. You can not open the window to get any fresh air in the room so you would hope that the air con would work but it hardly puts any air in the room so it is just airless - you have no desire to be in the room any longer than you have to and I think that is a shame. Even if you are there for travel or business there is always a time when just lying on the bed for 30 mins reading or watching TV is nice to relax but in these rooms which as I think about it are like futuristic prison cells you just feel trapped. I am sorry Citizen M, I know some people think you are great but for me it is a no and I am going to stick to the traditional model of hotel room. BTW before you think I am an old fuddy duddy, I am 30 years old and a Man, I have traveled around the world and stayed in many good and bad hotels. You are not bad by any means but you just do not fit what I am looking for. I would say you are great at airports, but not on holiday or business. Would I stay again - only at an airport hotel if I was waiting for a flight or something but still think then I would look at the others as well.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Unique, some quibbles...”
Reviews.Author: itchyfeettravels
Reviews.Content: CitizenM is a concept that I truly hope spreads! The lobby was amazing....and amsterdams transit system is so good that you can be downtown (with the #5 tram) within 10-15 mins. While it isn't to central, the area is pleasant and gives you a nice taste of residential amsterdam! A grocery store is 2 tram stops away, and there is a bunch of cafes and a bakery all around the Zuid Train/Metro Stn, a 3 min walk away. The rooms are small, but do you really need a huge room? I didn't. Storage is a little tight...no wardrobe...just a few hangers by the door and a large pull out drawer under the bed. If you look at pics you can see that the washroom is just two glass pods and a stand-alone sink. The toilet is frosted glass encased, good. The shower is clear glass, and issue for some. There is a "curtain"....but it's shear.....that's my biggest complaint. Lovely hotel,good service...free computer/printing access in the lobby. Also if you need to make long distance calls from you room GO AHEAD. They charge skype rates.... our long distance bill at the end of our stay (we only used the phone twice though...) was 17 cents! Also the cafeteria is quite over priced! The breakfast is okay...juice+choc. croissant+babybel cheese+ yoghurt was about 7-8 euros...but meals are pricey 10 euros for sushi...... I would stay here no doubt next time i am in amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “If you want to stay in a specimen jar, this is the place for you.”
Reviews.Author: SkaterWisconsin
Reviews.Content: The only time I would recommend this hotel is if someone needs to grab a few hours of sleep before catching a flight the next day. The bed is comfortable, but that is about it. After spending our time in Switzerland in beautiful chateau-style hotels, the Citizen M came as quite a shock. From checking in at a kiosk, walking down a sterile white hall with sterile white metal doors, to entering a room with white walls and glass doors around the shower and toilet, I felt like a bug in a specimen jar. Quite depressing and a horrible ending to a wonderful trip.

Reviews.Title: “Chiu”
Reviews.Author: Chiu13
Reviews.Content: Great location! Great bed! Great style! Great Lobby,full of design masterpieces. The most important thing is great great value! Really like the Eames Lounge Chair, Definitely will come back again,and again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, all the basics and excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: BagLadyAtl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is within walking distance from a large train station and very close to a tram line. The rooms are very basic but they have everything you need, yes the toilet is enclosed in glass but you can get over that pretty quickly. There is limited storage in the room - we had 3 suitcases and it was okay, a little tight but we managed. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, chic, quirky, a must!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Michael_Melissa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived mid-July for a 5 night stay. To get to the hotel from Schipol Airport was a matter of locating the train station in the airport and from there finding the right platform, the local staff team were happy to help, at the time this was platform 3. Please note that the ticketing machines do not accept UK credit and debit cards, requiring cash or to purchase the tickets from the ticket booth. Finding Zuid Station was relatively straight forward and roughly 8mins ride from the airport, from there head right to a small grassy square right outside the station and head right again past a nursery on the right and a modern church on your left, the Citizen M is at the end of this street and approx. 200m from the square. On arriving at the Citizen M it is obvious that this is not an ordinary, generic hotel, especially for the monetary cost of staying here. As soon as entering the initial very red entrance area, it is obvious that this hotel is very, very different. The check-in area is a bank of touch screen terminals to check in or out with a staff member close by to help out if required. The hotel itself is vibrant, quirky, interesting and above all a feast for the senses. The design a mixture of contemporary/modern, kitsch and design classics through out the spacious reception area, with many volumes of design, fashion and photography literature. There is a small cafe/bar area where small snacks/breakfast items as well as drinks can be purchased and close by there are several Apple Macs for guest usage. The room is the ultimate compact design with a blend of technological gadgetary and minimal chic. The mood lighting above the shower and toilet pods, adding to the ambience. While the remote control blinds is just plain cool! The storage space is very tight but manageable for a short stay. The bed occupies a major part of the room from wall to wall and is truly luxurious offering one of the most peaceful hotel sleeps I had ever encountered. All in all incredibly comfortable... The hotel itself has a tram stop 50m (Princes Irene Straat) from it and from here to the centre of town is a 20min ride. Tram line 5 is very, very regular and approximately every 10mins a tram stops here. This service lasts till midnight with a taxi costing around 14 euros. Value for money, good location for getting to all the main sights (despite being a small distance from the city centre), trendy and chic, a hub of busy vibrant travellers and an amazing hotel experience. This is one hotel not to be missed! My wife and I cannot wait to stay again. Top marks for all round experience.

Reviews.Title: “Uber modern from the lobby to the...”
Reviews.Author: C_and_MH
Reviews.Content: Uber modern from the lobby to the bathroom sink. Vitra furniture dripping everywhere. Great location near the main train station. Friendly, young employees. Choose a room with a king bed.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tonylover
Reviews.Content: Couldn't have asked for more. Great hotel,clean, amazing bed, room fantastic and very reasonable rates. Location no problem, no 5 tram takes you directly into Central station,Dam square etc.

Reviews.Title: “no sleep”
Reviews.Author: dankadea
Reviews.Content: the temperature in the room is very very low and you cannot turn air conditioning off which is awful because the cold air keeps on blowing above your bed all the time so you can't get a good night sleep. (we have changed a few rooms while we were there, hoping we could find a room where we wouldn't freeze) also, there is no space for your stuff so we couldn't unpack and had to keep everything in our suitcases, which is pretty uncomfortable if you are staying longer then a day. using moodpad was fun, but it didn't always work very well. free movies and wifi were nice. we wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good things come in small packages”
Reviews.Author: debscky
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from our second stay at citizenm exactly 1 year apart when we decided we were going to go on a last minute break i knew exactly where i wanted to go how i missed those beds.... i think secretly this more than amsterdam itself. Second time around we really knew what we were doing traveling from the airport we got in early so we had breakfast in the centre then caught the 5 tram straight to the hotel, unlike last year where we walked from central station for the scenic route :) getting checked in very quick and fun easy to follow and help is at hand although i secretly like doing this myself as i love the independence of it. our room was already good to go at 1 an hour early. so off we went ready for weekend we got upto our room and opened it up to what we knew was there a perfectly sized room for a couple, fantastic rain shower and the bed like i said we knew what we were doing i went straight to the underbed draw fort the extra 2 pillows and put them on the bed too, you may think its a lot to go on about the bed but there are no words to describe the best sleeps in years! The moodpad keeps us entertained whilst we get ready for going out tv on in the background. My boyfriend nipped downstairs to get some drinks which are a little pricey yes even the staff will tell you this but they are good and during the night seem to be biggger measures :) Getting a quick bite if sushi off we go into town no more than 5 minutes away on the 5 tram. We really do enjoy staying in this hotel its super clean comfy lovely lounge area with fantastic book selection at least 6 macs to use to get online for free, just a general feel to the place. i have told so many people about this hotel and just urge anyone wanting somethng different to just go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool, modern, swish, clean, budget hotel. Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: Lynzy86
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be a breath of fresh air compared to others we have stayed in, we thought it was very cool! I cant say much that hasnt already been said in other reviews, but would definately recommend it !!! Very clean hotel, modern design, simple check in and out via computer, friendly and helpful staff, FREE wifi and movies and all for a fabulous budget price. We also found the room moodpag quite glitchy, but it did what we needed it to - changing the lighting, tv controls, colours and blind control without a problem. Location isnt perfect but Amsterdams VERY efficient tram system makes up for it. Grab a citizenM map and jump on the number 5 tram and youll be into the city in 20-30 mins, easy. We went to Amsterdam for a 3 night break and bought the 'I Amsterdam' card for 72 hours, this got us unlimited free tram travel for our stay (beep on and off chipkaart system) and free entry/25% disocunt on many places that we visited. Id recommend checking that out too, we bought ours from the airport tourist info desk. Anyway, Go to CitizenM , IT IS COOL! I might have to take a trip to Glasgow for a weekend to check out the newest CitizenM soon!

Reviews.Title: “Seriously cool and comfy, a perfect treat for resting in between travels.”
Reviews.Author: SamanaFan
Reviews.Content: I was halfway through a Euro trip, and traveling solo for a couple of days. After doing some intense biking on some of Holland's islands, I was returning to Amsterdam pretty late at night, had had enough of the nightlife and just needed a place to regroup. I would normally never recommend staying outside of the city centre, but like I said, my purpose was purely to veg out, get a good night's sleep before flying out the next day. Being solo, this totally funky and privacy-less room was PERFECT. Loved the bed, loved the shower, loved the movies. Next day, had some extra time after checking out, and loved the lobby with computers and internet!

Reviews.Title: “excellent with minor cons”
Reviews.Author: abzinth
Reviews.Content: Great room with fantastic bed. I loved the free ondemand movies. We could have stayed in the room all day. The shower is perfect but the toilet area is a bit "public" and small. Love the general idea of the room. I'm hooked on the concept. We stayed two nights and the second was a saturday and a bit noisy. The walls creeks and makes disturbing sounds. We came by car and the parking situation around the hotel was bad. You have to pay with coins or "chioknip" (a holland thing?).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Free WiFi!!!”
Reviews.Author: poshaggie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. I want to advise those who are planning to stay there to take the #5 tram from Centraal Station to the Prinses Irenestraat stop. The hotel is on the right about a quarter of a block away! Simple to get to. We had to take a taxi because it was not within walking distance and paid 22 euro. Take the tram, it's cheap 7 euro per person for 24hrs. Anyhow, the hotel was GREAT! Check-in was a breeze. The rooms are extremely quiet and wonderful! I would most definitely stay there again. For the price, it couldn't be beat! The bed was a king-size comfy bed with a down cover and plenty of pillows. I would advise against bringing large suitcases due to the small amount (but smart use of) space. My husband and I each had a backpack and it was nice to tuck it under the bed in a drawer. A carry on or two would also fit. It's a great place and we were definitely spoiled by staying here...the rest of the hotels in Europe have a lot to live up to! I just wish it was a tad closer to everything else, but the (ever efficient) tram takes care of that!

Reviews.Title: “Chic&Cheap”
Reviews.Author: robtco75
Reviews.Content: For the price, the hotel is unbeatable. Pros: Amazing design, bluetooth remote controls 100 different features in the room. Free on-demand movies. Excellent service Cons: A little outside the city center, rooms may be too small for some people's taste. Tip: Use the Olympic Stadium Park and Ride near the hotel. For 6 euro per day you get parking plus either (2) free public transport day passes or free bike rental for 2.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience but need to be aware of the concept”
Reviews.Author: Wall100
Reviews.Content: Overall I enjoyed staying in this hotel but not sure if I would go back. Main reason we picked the hotel was because we were a group of 4 women travelling and we wanted our own rooms so the CitizenM was good value for this as city centre hotels were much more expensive for single occupancy. We are late 30s with kids and value having some privacy and our own space. The rooms were nice and fine if you are on your own. I'm not sure I would stay here sharing with anyone due to the lack of space and privacy. Fine for one person with one suitcase for under the bed. The hotel rooms are almost too high - tech and when the mood board doesn't work it can be very annoying. On the first night I struggled to turn off all the lights; somepeople had problems opening and closing the blinds, when you increased the temp in your room the walls all creaked as they expanded and contracted and the heating seems to be in the walls. Nice things included the bed, the TV and free movies, very cheap phone calls, free wifi, ability to buy snacks and coffee downstairs; very clean rooms and plenty of towels, good hairdryer, and mirrors. In terms of location, easy to get into town on the tram and get the train to Schipol airport but like any hotel not in the city centre not convenvient if you want to go back for an hour in the evening due to the trip in and out of town, Very nice neighbourhood and a few nice coffee shops and restaurants, easy walk to the Museums - around 20 minutes .

Reviews.Title: “Clean, big, comfy bed in a small, but fun room with quirky shower/toilet and a big screen TV.”
Reviews.Author: Lizzz1
Reviews.Content: Was a little further out of the city centre than expected, but onced we sussed out the tram system it was pretty easy to get around from the hotel. Also found out that the train goes direct to the airport from the station 5 minutes away. Clean, comfortable and quirky room. Not a lot of space for storing clothes, but managed. Great to have the safe to leave passports etc in. Enjoyed playing with the lighting system. Didn't eat there so can't comment on food. Staff were always available to help and were very friendly. Would be quite happy to stay again. Thank you. Liz and Mick

Reviews.Title: “What a dumpplace”
Reviews.Author: newest0008
Reviews.Content: This hotels management sucks. They clearly do not understand how to run a hotel and how to handle their guests needs. Part of the staff itself does their best, but it all gets ruined by the poor management quality. They do not swiftly and clearly come with solutions and are not available when needed by the guests. Food prices are clearly too high for the quality it provides. I prepaid for the breakfast and at the check out i had to pay it again!!! If I dod not have questioned that then I had to pay for it twice. Fire alarms go off repeatedly and unneededly during the night. Once and never again. I will go to a real hotel. The internet computer in the lobby takes forever to go to a page, but...... it is for free.

Reviews.Title: “A thorough review”
Reviews.Author: mac_tina
Reviews.Content: Because we liked the citizenM so much, and because there are so many good reviews, I've decided to detail what I didn't like about the hotel. Not to deter anyone from staying there, but to be thorough in my review. Because of the unique design of the round glass toilet enclosure, "sounds" echo quite loudly inside, and out, and although there is privacy glass, you can still sort of see in. You must be comfortable with your room-mate! The universal control for the blinds, temperature, tv, etc is a little slow to react to your input, and once in a while didn't respond at all for changing the colours of the mood lights. The breakfast is served with all "single serving" portions, and creates a lot of waste from the packaging (eg. plastic yogurt package, single glass jar for jam, plastic knives and forks, etc.). Hopefully citizenM recycles all of this packaging thoroughly, and composts un-eaten portions of the apples, etc (because we noticed that compared to Germany for example, Amsterdam does not appear to have as good a recycling program in place). ...really, other than this, we LOVED our stay. Again, please know that I only wish to be thorough with my review, and since so many people have already said the many possitive things that I would also say about the citizenM, I think that certain people inquiring may find this information more useful. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Huge bed - fantastic sleep!”
Reviews.Author: NH_80_LGW
Reviews.Content: The hotel design is very trendy. Interesting room layout! Here is a summary of our experience at CitizenM. Location: Far from the city, but very close to public transport. You can take the train from Schipol Airport and it takes only 6-8 minutes to get to the nearest station. The hotel is a 5 min walk from the station. Trams into the city stop just around the corner. The lady at reception we spoke to had very little info about transport costs etc. If you are not renting a bike then get a day pass valid for 24 hours which will cost 7 euros (buy it from station Zuid). If not, you can buy a 1 hour pass from the driver for 2.60. It takes 8-10 minutes to get into the city center on the tram. Hotel and Room: Fantastic hotel. Very interesting room. The mood pad worked fine in general. Music wan't working which was quite annoying and they were not able to fix it during our stay of 4 days. Staff were helpful in general. Huge bed and no noise results in fantastic sleep! The room was very clean when we checked in. Marvin (the soft toy) was missing so we called reception and they brought us one (you will be charged at check-out if this toy is missing). Free internet access in the lobby was very helpful and you can also print maps/flight details etc for free.

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for a modern hotel, stunning rooms and a short journey to the city centre then this htel is for you!”
Reviews.Author: geezyfbaby
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Citizen M in June 2010 and were pleasently surprised when we arrived. From the outside you would not think it was a new modern hotel as it looks very much like an apartment block, but when you enter you are greeted by a modern, fashionable hotel. The decor is very uptodate with inventive designs in each room. The Mood pad is great! This enables you to change the mood lighting in the room, amend music, TV and even close your blinds without having to get up off the luxurious King Size Bed. If you are a little shy then be aware of the toilet and shower. They are intergrated within the rooms as glass cyclinders which are frosted but you can still see the outline of the person showering or going to the toilet. The room was always clean and they even have a handy safe in the room for storing valuable items while you are away from your room. The staff were very friendly and were always happy to help us. The food however was a little limited and we found alot of Sushi in the fridges so if you dont like raw fish you are better off going out to eat as we did. The tram to the city centre is just across the road and Tram 5 takes you to the centre of town within 10 minutes for only 2.60 euros. Beware the trams can get full and can even break down as we unfortunately discovered! :-( Overall the hotel was great to stay in as we prefered being a little out of the city centre as it was much quieter but still had a good location as the Zuid Train station was just a 2 minute walk away and there was even a nice quiet canal nearby which we sat by and watched the world go by. The hotel is good value for money, very clean, polite staff and we loved the privacy of the rooms and modern furnishings....it reminded me of Ikea mixed with the Big Brother house lol. We will definitely be staying there again on our travels to Amsterdam....excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The funkiest hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: KrystynaZE
Reviews.Content: You should stay at CitizenM hotel just for the experience, it is awesome, the rooms are so cool, and the bed is magnificently large and doubles as your sofa. We stayed here the night before we flew out from Amsterdam, as it is nice and close to the airport. We stayed somewhere else while we were sightseeing around the city as CitizenM is not that close to the city - but in saying that there are not many good places to stay right in the centre of Amsterdam and if we could do it over again we would have stayed at CitizenM for our whole trip - its fantastic and the staff are second to none. Thanks CitizenM - you should bring your hotels to every major city in the world!

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: indodutch
Reviews.Content: It started with the reservation booked a room for 1.5 euro per nite which they refused to honor than in middle of night fire alarm people smoke in room ok i understand it is amsterdam, they only fined them 150 euro but than 3 times more false alarm, the guy in loblly panic in his eyes as he say system is broken we called technician so sorry so sorry stayed here as I had to wake up at 7 as i had an early flight should have stayed on street would have been better loved the citizenM before but today was a disaster

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but a little far from the city”
Reviews.Author: Tarun_N
Reviews.Content: To all people, planning to travel to Amsterdam... CitizenM is a brilliant hotel.. Loved the bed specially n the mood pad they have.. However, the idea of havong the wash basin almost next to my bed was not too pleasing.. Especially in the mornings.. All in all, an impressive layout.. It deserves to be called as the Trendiest Hotel for the use of technology in every sphere possible. Last point - The place is based outside the main city of Amsterdam.. Though, this should not discourage those who seek ambience.. As the place is very accesible through trams.. So it is well connected.. Hope this review helps you.. I had a great time and considered it important to pass on the word..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, top quality service”
Reviews.Author: dj59
Reviews.Content: Rooms are smallish but well designed and equipped, clean and comfortable. Very good lobby / lounge area for relaxing or working. Brilliant service from friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel! such a great staff and such a great feeling !”
Reviews.Author: oranzie
Reviews.Content: i`v been to the CitizenM hotel for 3 days, its been a wonderfull expirience, the Tram #5 to DAM Square is less then a minute walk. the room itself has AC which is very important, and the showers are simply cool and funny, i had a great time, the staff was very kind and very polite, giving us a true home feeling. i defently recommend this hotel by all means. do notice the room is kinda small (but very fullfilling) and theres a "secret" compartment under the bed you can store 2 large suitcases.

Reviews.Title: “Funky”
Reviews.Author: Brissie-Student
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel as it was very close to the airport. I was just looking for somewhere to spend one night before my early morning flight the next day. I was also at the end of my travels, sick, and all I wanted to do was stay in my room all day. After I had checked in, I entered my hotel room and was just blown away. This is one funky hotel room! A king sized bed!! A remote control to adjust the blinds (view of the runway wasn't that great), the coloured mood lighting, and of course, the TV (with heaps of movies to choose from!). Down at the lobby was a bar/snack area with light food (mainly japanese style) and drinks. Definitely a great place to unwind before embarking on a long-haul flight.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!!”
Reviews.Author: Innocent_Criminal
Reviews.Content: Such a COOL hotel. Small rooms would be the only drawback but everything else is just amazing. very clean, good location, free films on demand, most comfortable bed, awesome shower and best of all a great budget (79euros per night). Not to mention the whole branding of the hotel is just cool and hip. I stayed in this hotel after the very satisfying stay in CitizenM Amsterdam Airport Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, ultra-modern, largely satisfying but not for technophobes.”
Reviews.Author: lancashireexile
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three very hot nights whilst visiting relatives. We were bowled over by first impressions from the self-service check in through to the distinctly different room. We even came to terms with the glass tubes containing the shower and the loo, the latter, perhaps with a nod in the direction of convention, being discreetly cloaked in frosted glass. The bed was spectacular in taking up one end of the entire room and in addition tp offering space it was comfortable. The mechanics of the room were operated via a 'mood' console which unfortunately for us was defective and this created a problem when it came to turning off the flat screen above the bed; so two nights disrupted sleep which particuarly agitated my wife. The staff were helpful but the first attempt at rectifying the problem was unsuccessfully done at a distance by computer and the second night attempt at contacting the service staff was unsuccessful. So although we were generally very impressed and the staff we dealt with were very helpful, we were left questioning the immediacy of the service. Facilities at the hotel were fine and very much consistent with its general ambience; that is there were plenty of free access macs, a slightly plastic self-service buffet and quite generous sitting areas. The location isn't quaint as you might expect within the canal ring but it is relatively covenient being within walking distance of the Zuid station[one stop from Schipol] and on the 5 tram route which goes into the centre. It is at the end of the upmarket Beethoven Straat which has plenty of bars and restaurants and about a 30 minute walk from the Leidseplein and the museums, not much further to Dam Square and the area around the Central Station. So a generally positive experience but do be prepared to battle with the technology and don't be too startled by its idiosyncracies.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in heaven”
Reviews.Author: Filipe1
Reviews.Content: Me and Sandra stayed at this hotel this week.We would like to recommend it. The staff was very helpful the room was amazing and comfortable. In 2 minutes walk you will grab the tram,metro or the bus to center Amsterdam(this will take 10-12 minutes).You have a very affordable car park at Olimpic staydium that is very near by,ask in reception for discount rate. The quality of the room and the hotel is value for money! We will come back ! Enjoy Amsterdam :)

Reviews.Title: “Funky but flawed”
Reviews.Author: s99_steve
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that is more about style than substance - a bit of an experiance that is ok for one night but would wear thin pretty quickly. Main gripe is lack of parking and staff who gave erroneous information on where to park - expect to pay Â£30 a day on parking and you will need that in change to feed the meter. There is cheap parking at the olympic stadium - 10 minute tram ride away however this was full when we tried. Second gripe is the food on offer which is a total joke - we're talking cheap US motel standard here. Save your money and walk down the main road for five minutes and get something real to eat. Third gripe is the air conditioning which does not have a night setting - windows do not open so you have no choice but to use it. The cold air blasts out over the bed so you have a choice of either trying to sleep in a breeze or turn it off and cook. The room and hotel was clean (apart from the stained mattress, which shone through the single sheet) and the decor is funky and along with the shower pods in the rooms make it worth a visit - this could be a good hotel but let down by the details.

Reviews.Title: “amazing!”
Reviews.Author: lynda_uk2
Reviews.Content: me and my partner went here with 2 of our friends, it was perfect for what we needed it for, it was one stop away from shiphol airport and litterally round the corner from the station, there was a tram stop pretty much outside the hotel to take you into the center, which you saw so much of the city traveling in and out. the very good selection of movies were perfect for the evening in a big comfty bed with a stunning view that looks out over the horizon. as weird as it seems with the toilet and shower being see through, as long as you know the person your staying with, i saw no problem. theres a curtain to pull across and if you dont want to use them toilets theres always in the lobby. I can't fault this it was young friendly and the staff were great. it was perfect for what we wanted it for and the expericance will ALWAYS remain in my mind as it was fab!

Reviews.Title: “Design over comfort - admire your room, don't stay in it...”
Reviews.Author: ihatescreennames_10
Reviews.Content: CitizenM likes you to travel light. Your room has a hanger for your coat and a small shelf for your toothbrush - and that's it. Too bad if you brought suitcases, went shopping or want to hang your clothes somewhere - the only place is the floor. No wardrobe. There's a drawer under your bed - but that contains spare bedlinen so now you have even more stuff to put on the floor. One guest hung a towel on some lights in desperation and burned half his room down. Citizens, apparently, did not need privacy. The shower cublicle is transparent and the toilet opaque. Every move or noise you make will be heard by your roommate. How romantic! The window cannot be opened - so you depend on the in-room climate control. We froze for two days and gasped for air on the third, when it wasn't working. So grumbles only? Not quite, public areas are spiffing and staff was very friendly. The bed is excellent. I guess it's a great place for single travellers - or for people who have neither luggage nor bathroom inhibitions.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: sammy1234018
Reviews.Content: went with a large group and perfect for our one night stay in Amsterdam, approx 10 - 15 minutes from the aiport - one train ride and then a 5 minute walk, straight outside the hotel the tram stops taking you into the city centre. Unfortunately one of our party was ill whilst we were out there, but the satff were very very helpful and couldnt do enough!. would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy palce to stay for a short break”
Reviews.Author: Cuskie
Reviews.Content: Technology starts as soon as you walk in the door with the diy computer screen check-in. The room electrics, which are all operated by a single remote control pad, include mood lighting, blinds and TV. Its all very clever but the remote can be a bit slow to react and also does not last long unplugged from its charger. You will have to be good chums to cope with the shower / toilet arrangements but then as you will be sharing the great bed one would hope you already are. One good thing that I did not realise until I'd paid the bill is that international calls are peanuts which makes a pleasant change. It is a trendy hotel but only for a few days, I think you would get fed up with the room layout if you stayed any longer. The trendiest hotel in the world ??? I think the Hoxton in London does it better

Reviews.Title: “Very cool design... Sometimes at the expense of function.”
Reviews.Author: Hammy_Teare
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel. It was very different from many of the other hotels we stayed at; very modern! The lobby and lounge area are great with free Internet, a great selection of books and a cool bar/cafeteria with well priced drinks and eats. The rooms were interesting. Cool to see, but lacked a bit in function. Pretty small and intimate for two... There will be no bathroom secrets between you and your bunkmate as the washrooms are very open. There is also no room for luggage. Upside is the amazing bed, free movies and novelty fun factor. I will also add that someting scuried through our room on our last night.... I am a realist and mice happen but it did freak me a bit. I noticed the next day that all the other doors on our floor had a thing blocking the bottom of their doors and since that was how our friend exited I would guess that if you have the door block thing you are safe! Overall it was a fun stay and I would still recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Fun but...”
Reviews.Author: bosco111
Reviews.Content: If you like modern design and don't mind spending a few bucks to be surrounded by it, this is the place. The shower and toilet are encased in glass cylinders (shy people need not apply) in the main living space, which leaves the room a bit cramped. Everything else is ultramodern as well. Some of it didn't work so well, such as the 'moodpad' device for controlling the TV, lights, and blinds. A manual override for some of these functions would have helped. So would a desk. The hotel isn't very well situated for seeing the major sights in Amsterdam, being a relatively long tram ride out. But for the roughly $160/night we paid, it was a decent value relative to centrally located hotels with equivalent amenities, where $300 is the rule.

Reviews.Title: “Dormitory”
Reviews.Author: OttomanCitizen
Reviews.Content: The hotel is like a dormitory-full of young people, small rooms but enough, energetic and different. It is a good choice to experience it for a short stay. For long stays, I guess it can be tiring. Amazing lobby and decoration. Rooms are original but there is no place to put your luggage and not enough hangers. There was a hair on the toilet so that was disgusting. Check in and out was much easier than I thought. Location is very convenient for train station and Schipol but it is far wawy from the city center. It is a must stay hotel if you are young and you are in Amsterdam for a short visit.

Reviews.Title: “M is for Magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: DocNZ
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Citizen M. We had originally hoped to stay at a B&B in Amsterdam, but were unfortunately unable to find one that we liked that still had some availability. Tip #1: BOOK EARLY! However, via TripAdvisor we came across Citizen M and decided to give it a go. We were very glad that we did. For the price, it is a great option in Amsterdam and we would definitely recommend it to others. It is a little out of the central city (12-15 mins via tram), but - like many have said before - the trams run very regularly and stop right outside the hotel. We bought 'I AMsterdam' cards which gave us unlimited travel around the city. We arrived a little earlier than the stated check-in time, but thankfully were able to access our room. There was a young lady assisting guests at the check-in/out stations who was friendly and helpful. The rooms were exactly as we expected - which was great! As we were only there for a weekend and therefore only had 2 backpacks between us, we had ample luggage storage space. Yes, the rooms are small, but not uncomfortably so. In this city, you won't want to spend too much time hanging around at your hotel anyway! The shower and toilet cubicles offer neither visual nor auditory privacy, but you just deal with that. We enjoyed the am/pm shower gels! The bed is supremely comfortable and we both enjoyed 2 wonderful nights of restful sleep. We also really enjoyed being able to access free wifi and the opportunity to relax with unlimited free movies in our room in the evenings. Bonus! We did not experience any issues with excessive noise during our stay. We didn't order the breakfast, but instead just grabbed single croissants / coffee on the run. Both were reasonably priced (by Amsterdam standards) and tasty! The staff in the cafe were always attentive and very friendly. As we had a late evening flight, we were able to store our luggage at the hotel while we explored the sights during the day. It was wonderful to be able to relax in the uber cool lounge and watch the football for an hour upon our return before heading to the airport at the end of a busy day. I especially enjoyed the great range of 'coffee table' books available. It is very easy to get to /from the hotel from the airport - just get off at Amsterdam Zuid (1st stop) and it is right around the corner. Keep in mind that some of the ticket machines at the stations don't accept coins (and most don't accept notes), so you may need to pay with your credit card, which costs an extra euro. Overall, we found the hotel to be comfortable, very trendy, friendly, convenient, fun and great value for money. As you can see from earlier reviews, many agree! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Standard high-design with comfort problems”
Reviews.Author: DC_Dennis
Reviews.Content: You walk into this room and laugh a little. There are two Star Trek-like columns, round areas with glass doors that slide open and closed. One is the toilet, the other the shower. That takes up the first half of the room. The second half is too small side tables and a big bed with drawers. As is often the case in these spiffy hotels: * There is no place to rest your luggage * There is little space to place your toiletries (though there is a narrow rack next to the sink) * There is no closet * There are few hangers There _is_ a large drawer under the bed, but you still have no convenient place to leave your suitcase, and you still feel too tightly enclosed when you sit on the toilet. At least those doors are frosted; you'll be giving a show if you share the room and shower, though since the bed is a huge mattress at the back, you'll be sharing it with an intimate in any event. The croissant with breakfast was terrible and the yogurt was commercial, not the delicious yogurt with granola and fruit I had at another Dutch hotel earlier, so I would certainly not eat here. I really found I liked the neighborhood just a little closer to downtown from this place, so I didn't find the tram ride a disadvantage, in fact I was glad to have the chance to see the nicely designed apartment buildings and pleasant residential district to counteract the sense of cramped craziness that Amsterdam has that often feels excessive. You see parts of the city that are not only interesting, but possible to consider contemporary and livable.

Reviews.Title: “Different Experience”
Reviews.Author: Sinohe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is totally different from other hotels at least I've experienced. The first thing to remember is it is a BUDGET HOTEL, and the second it is "trendy". That means while it has many things that other hotels don't like super cheap calls to other countries (using VOIP system), theme lighting, free movies, free wifi, computer check-in/out, beautiful lounge, reasonably priced cafe, etc., it doesn't have things that other hotels offer such as lotions, wash clothes, cottons, pens and papers, etc. The rooms are super super small and that made it uncomfortable to walk around but it was uniquely designed. Ah, there is no privacy if you happen to be in this room with your friend because they can see you when you go to bathroom or take shower. There is a curtain, but I just don't suggest going to this hotel with someone you are not so comfortable with! Otherwise, worth to try it, it is cheap and completely different.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place: Great Value for Money...”
Reviews.Author: amitmani
Reviews.Content: Initially the place looked small but when I started to Move around in the room, it looked OK. Neat and Clean Place with very comfortable Bed and Mood Pad. Nice and helpful staff, great connectivity.....Absolute Value for Money. Must Stay... I would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Unique”
Reviews.Author: jessta7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of a kind. There is nothing else like this place. The room was great, I loved the mood pad and all the different options that were available to us. The bar and store were great to have so you didn't have to leave the hotel after a long day of walking around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, practical and well thought out for the city traveller”
Reviews.Author: TerandAnd
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well thought out for those who simply want somewhere to rest their head and sleep whilst on a short break (as we were) The rooms are functional and packed with technology and space saving design to allow for a comfortable stay. The quirky shower and toilet designs are unusual but add to the experience. Everything can be done through the easy to use computers at reception. Parking in the streets nearby is expensive. The Olympic Stadium nearby (about a mile) offers underground parking and two 1 hour tickets (for up to 2) for the tram into amsterdam. This allows you to get into the city and out again on the 16 or 24 tram. Cost is 6 euros per day, well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “It's really the trendiest!”
Reviews.Author: Kejt007
Reviews.Content: We spend in CitizenM 4 days. It was really wonderful time. Location of the hotel is very good. In the quiet area, close to the park. Tram nr 5 will take you to the Dam square or to the museums. Transport from the airport takes 8 minutes (to Zuid Station). Rooms are rather small (there's no place for the clothes) but comfortable. The huge bed, shower and toilet in the fluorescent tubes. No privacy in the room so you have to go there with person who you know really good :) You have to use the pilot if you want to switch on or switch off tv, light, or to curtain. Free wifi, lots of films in the room, tasty breakfast, young, cheerful and helpful service and you don't need more. Well design and friendly hotel!!! The best choice in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic bed!”
Reviews.Author: Beaver2010
Reviews.Content: Seriously, the bed IS fantastic!! LOVE the bed. Best sleep ever, which was sorely needed for those long days and nights out in Amsterdam. Very cool hotel experience with the cool pod like rooms with the pod shower and the pod toilet - all of which, very clean. Also watched a bunch of free movies from a pretty extensive list of movies late at night. Huge selection of tv channels (english or otherwise). Moodpad was kind of fun to play around, with the color lights, but the idea gets old pretty quickly. Still, it does the job of being able to control everything in the room pretty much from one control. Free wifi in the rooms, as well as the free computers in the lobby when I needed to print things out. Staff was helpful but not in your face, and the lobby has all sorts of cool designer chairs and furniture and a lot of designer books should you ever get bored in Amsterdam (which is doubtful, but just in case, I guess!) Location is a bit further away, but very easy access to the tram or the bus or the metro (or if you rent a bike, you could bike it). But also good, because it's pretty quiet as well. For the price it's pretty great compared with some other hotels in Amsterdam that may be closer to the city centre, but would be much smaller. And nothing beats that huge bed. All in all, exactly what it appears to be - a very cool designy looking hotel. So, not for those who are looking for a homey personal hotel experience, because it is rather impersonal, but a great comfortable hotel otherwise. One con: the Moodpad seems to need constant recharging. I leave it out for 10 minutes, it already is a little low on battery and has trouble connecting to the room, so I need to return it to the dock to use it. Quite annoying when you're using it as a remote for the TV and having to use it from the dock.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: dublin17lad
Reviews.Content: stayed here in june 2010 with my gf for a couple of nights the rooms were very comfortable with king size beds and very nice interior every room gets a moodpad to control heating and lightin, tv etc the staff were very helpful the location isnt close to the red light but you can get a no5 tram tat brings you up in a few mins overall id recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “The future?”
Reviews.Author: cheapskate1959
Reviews.Content: When I first walked into my room I though Yiikes this is compact. I quickly got used to the size however, and the creature comforts are all there. The "moonpad" which controls all the features of your room from blinds to temperature to mood lighting is in itself an amazing feature. This is not a room to camp out in and read books, but it is still most relaxing, with a massive 2 meter square bed. The pillows are great too. the staff are all young and enthusiastic, and the canteen serves whatever you want 24/7. I suspect this type of hotel will become more normal in the future. We are running out of space and as ostentation becomes less chic these comfortable pod hotels will be the way to go. My only negative is that I would not bring young kids here if you are sensitve to sensuality -- there are many suggestive nude pictures about the hotel, and the adult tv channels (free, like most everything else!) must be proactively suppressed. I would also say the for the elderly and physically challenged the beds might be a bit high, and difficult to approach. FOr everyone else, have fun. It is perfect, good value, good service, and fun!

Reviews.Title: “Something different!”
Reviews.Author: liljuhvit
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a weekend trip with my boyfriend. The room was small, but convenient. The bed was one of (or maybe the) most comfortable bed I've ever slept in. The design of the rooms (as well as of the rest of the hotel, especially the lobby) is very fashionable, but still comfy and warm - although the arrangement of shower and toilet in the middle of the room needs a little getting used to. We booked breakfast with our room, which was rather sparse (no coffee/tea included) - I would rather get breakfast somewhere outside the hotel next time. The location is not that central, but there are many possibilities to get into the city. I will definitely choose CitizenM on my next trip to Amsterdam (or to any other city that they will have hotels in)!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!”
Reviews.Author: Majestic_89
Reviews.Content: CitizenM hotel is a great hotel for travelers who want luxury in a good price. The staff was very kind and helpful especially in an incident that we had with our check-in [Eva thank u so much we were very lucky to meet you!!]. Every day we had new clean towels, soap and the bed was made. The room was very nice and stylish, great for a young couple and left us with the best memories.The location was a little bit far by foot but the public transportation was really great even in the late hours and the area is safe and clean. Only 2 minutes away from the tram and bus station!!

Reviews.Title: “Well thought concept, worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: PhotoJoy
Reviews.Content: Interesting and different experience in the affordable alternative for expensive hotels. Worth a visit! Well thought concepts and clever marketing. Mid-range pricing =screening out trouble-makers. Location is alright. Tick all Kotler's 4Ps boxes I like the sense of humour of this hotel from its website, quotation on the doors and even the finish touch on the invoice "because you're not the Queen of England, our rooms don't cost a fortune (if you are the Queen, you're welcome too)" Love the massive comfy Bed with power rain shower in the middle of the room. The bed is bigger than 2X2m. There is also a blind that block all the light for a long sleep. After the stay, I've got an email from them saying "If your own bed now feels a little small compared to the one in your citizenM room, we wish to offer our sincere apologies." haha We enjoyed using Phillips moodpad from the blinds to the lights, shower and TV. Free Movies on-demand are excellent! We watched Up in The Air and It's Complicated there so they are very recent for DVDs. Because it's in business area (WTC) There are not many restaurants around the hotel especially after 8pm or weekends (Albert Heijin to Go and restaurants around there are closed on weekends). Only Burger King at the Amsterdam Zuid station or some food e.g. Sushi, Salad at the hotel. Would recommend to a friend who wants to stay for a few nights but they need to set the right expectation of this hotel. And the fact that it's not in the heart of Amsterdam. The 20 mins journey to the central station wasn't too bad. Plus you get to see other part of Amsterdam. All in all enjoyable experience and I would love to see this kind of hotel in other cities.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: MandMNz
Reviews.Content: Hotel was absolutely fantastic - clean, modern, friendly staff always happy to answer questions. Location was fine - a quick 10min tram ride from the city centre (2.60euro) and the tram stop was right outside. Would definitely stay here again. Free movies, free internet, free printing were a treat!

Reviews.Title: “recommended!”
Reviews.Author: x-nana
Reviews.Content: We stayed during the weekend in amsterdam, and although the hotel is not situated in the heart of the city , it was nice to escape the confusion at the end of day. Tram nr. 5 stops right next to the hotel , this area is also served by night buses, it doesn't take longer than 10/15 min to get to the city centre. The rooms are small but very comfortable an fashionable, a good night's sleep is guaranteed. The staff is friendly and the bar is very nice

Reviews.Title: “Quite different but very very good”
Reviews.Author: RaquelGouveia
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not in the city center but the location is very good. First is just 5 minutes walking from the Amsterdam Zuid train station, that have direct trains to the Schipol aiport (less than 10 minutes). So take around 20 minutes to arrive to the hotel from the airport. Second, there is a direct tram (number 5) from the hotel to the city center. The hotel staff is very helpful and nice. The hotel amenities are amazing and with very good quality and design sofas and furniture. The hotel have free internet, free computers and free prints!! They have a coffee area with snacks and drinks that is a little bit expensive but is good to have a service like that. The rooms are something completly different of all hotels that I stayed. Not big rooms but the bed is confortable and big! The shower is... different and I think that the pictures on the hotel website are very accurate of the rooms and all the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Fun Hotel for a Short Vacation”
Reviews.Author: mrbryan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three nights in May, 2010. If you're coming from the airport, it's a five minute train trip followed by a five minute walk to get into the hotel. Make sure you take the right train, though. The check-in process was easy and quick, and we were inside the room only a few minutes after walking in the door. The room itself is very tiny, and there is not separate bathroom. Rather, it is integrated into the room. The sink is next to the bed, the shower in a tube near one wall, the toilet in a tube near the other wall. The large and comfortable bed sits beneath the large window, and there is a chair next to the bed. A flatscreen TV hangs above the bed. That's about it in terms of furnishings. Everything was clean and in good shape. The room controls are accessed through a "mood pad" which lets you turn off and on the lights and the tv, opens and shuts the blinds, and controls the temperature. Well, I know it does the lights, the TV, and the blinds. The temperature conrols on the mood pad did not seem to affect the room much at all. The room was neatly made up each day, and it was extremely quiet. There were no disturbances. The only points to consider with this hotel are the following: - it is not the hotel to go to with children. There is no space for an additional bed for them, and if they wake up early in your bed, they will have nowhere to go. - It is not the hotel to go to with someone you don't intend to know well. You will be sharing the bed, you will watch each other shower, and despite the frosted glass, you will be aware of each others movements in the toilet. The tram stops right outside the hotel and goes directly into the downtown. There is also a metro stop in the Station Zuid which runs right into the center of the city. Definitely consider purchasing a transportation pass (they are very cheap, somethink like 12 euro for three days) and they are sold at the Station Zuid. In a city in which hotels are quite expensive, this is an excellent deal.

Reviews.Title: “Unique lodging, perfect location, good value - what more could you ask for?”
Reviews.Author: halfofvamh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the CitizenM-Amsterdam City for 2 nights in May 2010. Check-in was a breeze, we took advantage of the early check-in option (for 20 euro). We took the train one-stop from the airport (to the Zuid station) and walked the short distance to the hotel. The #5 and #24 trams which run through the museum district up to Central station stop nearby. They have a convenient snack/drink bar which had everything from beer to sushi to fresh fruit. Also available is a full bar and full espresso. The modern decor was throughout the lobby and into the rooms. The rooms are very small, but perfect for a couple with a reasonable amount of luggage. Everything is state-of-the-art, with 'mood' settings changing the light color, shade/blind configuration, and music.

Reviews.Title: “not quite business class hotel”
Reviews.Author: hchiutx
Reviews.Content: 4 day trip to Amsterdam for a tradeshow at the RAI. Pros - this location cannot be beat. It is a short 10 minute stroll from the hotel directly across the park to the RAI conference/tradeshow center. I bought a 4-day unlimited tram/bus/metro pass so travel to the city center is not a problem. Quiet neighborhood but within walking distance to the WTC and the RAI. Free internet and movies. Cons - no iron/ironing board makes it very inconvenient; shirts stay semi wrinkled in my travel pouch. No coffee maker in the room but I can live with that. Check-in/check-out line manned with at most 2 persons and it's a zoo out there during busy hours. They could have designed this a lot better. Laser printer does not work at business center. Otherwise the staff is friendly

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, great service, super modern, great location!”
Reviews.Author: bolton20077
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had a long layover in Amsterdam and booked a room for one night here. Fabulous experience! The rooms are small, but super mod and unique. The bed was a dream, and we enjoyed the free on-demand movies. Great breakfast in the morning, incredibly convenient location, and a fabulous helpful staff. Great spot for a romantic getaway. We wished we would have had more time to hang at the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Cool place”
Reviews.Author: MinistryOfTravel
Reviews.Content: This place was a very nice surprise to us. The rooms are small, but they have everything you need. Would only stay there shortterm, for a weekend trip or something, but it is very cool. There is a Wagamama and Burger King close by, at the Amsterdam Zuid station. If you want to dine anywhere else, you will have to take the metro or tram to city centre. Transportation to and from the hotel is very easy. We liked it, and would definitely consider staying at other CItizenM hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Love the concept!”
Reviews.Author: zandsaway
Reviews.Content: Great bed, fresh idea and fantastic lobby. Rooms are small, but functional with lots of light. Its not as close to the city as you would hope (30 minute bike ride). Parking is not as easy as they tell you it is. Be prepared to pay the 21 euros per day to park on the street. (Except Sundays which are free.) Great hotel on the whole, and would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel as they should be”
Reviews.Author: Charleslabaule
Reviews.Content: Hotel delivering efficient and easy services. Peace of mind allowing you to respect your own pace. Perfect for a quick visit in AMsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Very Funky and clean rooms. A fantastic sleep”
Reviews.Author: The_Fatts
Reviews.Content: As soon as you walk through the Citizen M building, you know this place is going to be an interesting one. It's one surprise after another and it's all good. The foyer areas is very modern and social. The staff is friendly, though most of the stay is quite self service. Everything is automated that interaction with any staff is not really necessary. The room is amazing. The bed is big and comfy. and the bathrooms are so out of this world. We loved everything about this hotel. It's a little removed from the central city, but the tram outside the hotel takes you to the centre in about 15mins. Very reasonably priced and clean. LOVE IT!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: AKP63
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel in May, we had a great time as we mostly spent the weekend in bed. The bed is massive and we liked the layout of the room. The shower is big, but would have liked the toilet to be a bit more closed off and be a little bit sound proof. The room has a Moonpad which controls everything like lights to set for different moods, controls the TV and Blinds. Where the hotel is situated is quiet but the main city centre is only 10-15 mins by tram, so not that much of a problem. As we love Sushi did not have a problem with food but you are limited as most items pre-packed. Staff are helpful, but there . Great place to stay for a dirty weekend with free porn on demand, what more could we ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Cool and eclectic. All design!!! Excelent”
Reviews.Author: Txiquitin
Reviews.Content: Love the hotel , rooms, and the design. A bit far from the center, but the price was good. Only problem is that the shower is in the middle of the room and the toilet too...with little or no privacy...in case you travel with a friend. The bed is humongous!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worth a trip just to stay at Citizen M”
Reviews.Author: KEB63
Reviews.Content: I went back to Amsterdam for tulip season just to stay at Citizen M after a serendipitous layover last December due to snow-caused flight delay. My second, extended stay did not disappoint. Coolest hotel ever! Bright, comfortable, affordable accommodation with a friendly staff. Location convenient to both city center and one train stop from Schiphol airport. Best design I've ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Effortless cool,contemporary chic,the future of hotels is here!!”
Reviews.Author: Cooney70
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel,small but perfectly formed.The decor is like a cross between Ikea and an apple store. Staff are very attentive and always willing to help. This hotel is best suited to couples or individuals as it's two to a room max. Gadget freaks will love the touchscreen moodpad in the room which controls the free movies (inc adult !) the lights,blinds,room temp,music etc. The pod like rooms are small but well thought out with no space wasted and yet everything you need like a safe and hairdryer. No iron in room but they are available free from housekeeping as well as an ironing board. Downstairs they have a well stocked bar but it is pricey (9 euros for a vodka and red bull !!!) so buying alcohol here is not advised. Foodwise it is mostly sandwiches,sushi, and cold snacks if you are peckish and want something on the go. I was a bit concerned about it's location but getting here from Schipol was easy being 1 stop on the train to Zuid station. Likewise getting into town is very easy as the number 5 tram stops just around the corner from the hotel and will take you into the town centre in 15 mins. Buy a 1,2 or 3 day pass which covers trams,metro and buses (3 day cost 15 euro) which is well worth it. All in all this hotel is excellent value compared to good hotels in the centre which would cost twice as much with the only negative being the cost of food and drink. I will come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel with all you need!”
Reviews.Author: Roli-on-tour
Reviews.Content: + Fancy rooms with very modern design. You can choose the atmosphere by turning on different light scenes / colours. Video on demand for free, great! + Huge bed: easily large enough to stay with a friend witout getting to close. Just have to order a 2nd blanket, no problem. + Late check out: well appreciated and not too expensive (EUR 20.- per room to stay until 3pm instead of 11am) + Bar / Reception area. Very modern, cool wall pictures - 'Restaurant': Don't expect too much. Small snacks, some sushi, but nothing that really fills the stomach. +/- Location: fine during the day with tram line in front of the hotel and very close to train station. Safe and quiet area at night, but a bit far to walk back from the city and taxis can be expensive at night depending on demand (paid betw. EUR 15 and 30 from center)

Reviews.Title: “The Coolest place to stay in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: eliztist
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for convenience, style and value for money - this is it. CitizenM is packed with cool features..i loved the mood pad in the room and how everything was automated like the room blinds, the lights. Though the rooms were small, the rooms was well laid out and detail oriented. The shower is great! Also we had free movies to watch all night and free wifi. The library downstairs is great too, i stayed quite a few hours looking through their awesome collection of design and photography books!! We drove there from Paris and it was really easy to find, just off the highway into Amsterdam and 2 roads down. Check in was computer automated so no queues or wait! Also breakfast is good, the croissant and coffee is great and you can ask for a takeaway too! Though the hotel was not in the city centre, it was just a short tram ride away. Really convenient also if you use bikes. Loved this place will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect for us!”
Reviews.Author: mrswaves
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Amsterdam and we only stayed 3 nights. We decided to keep the cost a little less than our last trip so we booked the CitizenM. What a cool hotel!! My husband is very tech-savvy and neither of us had any issues with checking in, operating the mood pad, or anything else here. Now, it's not by the canal so if you're here for romance/a nice view you won't get it at CitizenM. I can see this hotel being perfect for business/short stays/people who can get around on their own easily. Our taxi arrived at the hotel, we checked in via the kiosks right out front (paid for very early check-in and it was SO worth it!!). Within 2 minutes we were in the elevators and walking to our room. There are "ambassadors" standing by to help whenever needed and provide all sorts of information if you should require/desire it. The bed was everything we had been looking forward to-gigantic! I wish I had one like it at home. Tram/Train/Bus all VERY close to hotel. We bought 24 hour passes and rode the tram all over the city. We referred to maps quite often but got the hang of it pretty quick. Coffee bar was just the thing I needed in the mornings. Fresh, strong cafe lattes. You can pick up all sorts of things to eat/drink at the little shop/coffee area in the lobby. Free movies!!! We stopped at a delicious pastry shop and stayed up watching free movies till all hours of the night. Everything is just as it should be and very well appointed for the small room. The rate was outstanding and so was the hotel. I wouldn't stay here for more than 3 nights most likely and you should really go with someone you're comfortable with (bathrooms are not very private in the room). Free wi-fi that worked pretty darn fast compared to many other places we've been. Easy to connect (no passwords/invisible networks) We highly enjoyed CitzenM and recommend it for travelers who aren't afraid of something different and like fun stuff :)

Reviews.Title: “Funky, trendy crash pad for great city break”
Reviews.Author: traci2k6
Reviews.Content: This place was fab. It is eaily accessible by tram from the Central Station - tram line 5 and it took 10 mins and stopped right outside the hotel.
