On the face of it, the hotel appears to be in a residential area on a main road but a 10 min walk or 1stop on the tram finds you in a lovely street of small shops and restaurants. This place is funky beyond belief. Fair enough, the idea of the shower and toilet in the middle of the room is perhaps only for the closest of people, and it did make the room small, but aside from that it was great. The bed was an amazing, HUGE white leather bed, wall to wall, and the msot comfortable we have ever slept in. Add that to a (remote controlled) black out blind and it made for the best sleep ever after a night of partying. I would agree with other travellers that this is probably a couples place rather than for families but I would definately recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Usually hotel is just a place to spend a night. This one was a real experience :)”
Reviews.Author: Mehis
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect - train and tram nearby and beautiful beatrixpark for chilling :) Room was very interesting, really modern and comfortable. I think this was one of the best hotel rooms I have ever been to. usually they all look the same, but CitizenM has done a really great design job there. It does not seem to be designed for traveling with small children, but I had no issues with my 1yo son - extra sheets were offered etc. Next time I'll visit Amsterdam i will take the same hotel. About cons, fee was charged for early check-in and water temperature was a bit varying in the shower, but this is pretty much pecking already :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: randywood1981
Reviews.Content: Loved loved loved this place. Everything was very very clean. The staff were very friendly and very helpful. The bed was huge and very very comfortable. The rain shower was thoroughly enjoyable. Free movies, free adult movies, free Wifi and ridiculously cheap calling rates from the room phone was a first to have combined in one hotel. Location was so easy, the number 5 tram comes right outside and you're downtown in 10 minutes, at the red light district in 15. 10 minute ride from the hotel to the airport using Zuid station. The only complaint one could have is that the rooms are on the smaller side, but my girlfriend and I had no problem with this as we spent most of our time in the room on the large king size, incredibly comfortable bed. Also, make sure you're comfortable with whomever you're staying with. The shower doors are see through and the frosted glass around the toilet does not hide much and is not...how do I say this...soundproof. This place was so cool with it's very trendy design, it's location so great, it's price unbeatable for the quality you're getting, those complaints made no difference whatsoever. Loved it here, would definitely stay again. Definitely deserves it high ranking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Very Impressive”
Reviews.Author: sheldoncm
Reviews.Content: Hotel is great. I've stayed in 3 other hotels in Amstedam and this is by far the nicest. The Bed is the BEST! The only problem is the rates as at times during some part of the week it could go rather high. I would certainly return back to stay with them!

Reviews.Title: “citizenM lived up to all expectations”
Reviews.Author: ciciNorfolk_Uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 night for a city break. The hotel is in a great location for tourists, -only 1 train stop direct from the airport, and then hotel is a 2 minute walk from train station. The number 5 tram stops right outside the hotel and goes direct to the town centre very frequently (we never waited longer than 10 minutes for one to arrive). It takes 10-15 minutes to get into the main town by tram. I imagine it's also a good location for business travellers as it's right by the world trade centre. The area around the hotel is up-market residential and business buildings. It feels very safe and is quiet in the evenings. The WTC business area (2 minute walk) has some bars/cafes and a Wagamama, but these seemed to shut around 9pm. The hotel itself is very stylish and clean. The downstairs area is open plan, with a bar and eating area, access to free internet, lounge areas and TVs and tables/desks for business use. All the furniture is modern and eye-catching. Background music was good and not intrusive. You check in by computer, but staff are available to assist and were very friendly. We arrived early but were able to check in straight away. During our stay, others arriving early were able to store their luggage until their rooms became ready. You can pre-book breakfast, but we just bought a pastry and coffee each morning. Small meals are available which you can heat up, along with salads/sandwiches etc. There's a very good range of hot/cold/alcoholic drinks available. The food we ate there was very nice, I'd say probably a little on the expensive side though (partly influenced by the poor exchange rate for British at present!). The room was fantastic, spotlessly clean, modern and very cleverly designed to use the space to it's best. The bed was huge and very very comfortable with great pillows/duvet. There's a massive storage drawer under the bed which we kept our 2 cases plus other bags in. There is only a small hanging area with a couple of hangers only, this could have been improved on by adding another rail above or elsewhere in the room. There is a safe which would probably fit a laptop in it. The moodpad is a fancy remote which controls the room, you can put the blackout blind up/turn tv on/control lights etc on it. The lights above the shower and loo change colour. The shower was great, despite being in the middle of the room, the doors worked well and the rest of the room didn't end up wet after you get out. The showergels provided were also nice. The loo was fine, as others have said the cubicle-arrangement is probably not for those who are bashful about their ablutions, although you can't see through the frosted glass, for some it may feel a bit revealing, - you also have a curtain which can be pulled across to separate the bed area from the rest of the room which can improve the feeling of privacy if you want. We loved this hotel, made even better by the fact it is really very good value for money. I think they're planning to expand to other countries, and if so we would definitely plan on trying them out.

Reviews.Title: “It Was Just Like Being At Home...”
Reviews.Author: casseygan
Reviews.Content: This is truly a home away from home for me. Comfortable yet stylish, simple yet functional. This is how a contemporary hotel should work! Extremely friendly staff in a rather down to earth environment. The lobby is ever so lively and inviting. Great use of space and as a whole, extremely well design. I'm very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel ! Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: ivanaZagreb_Croatia
Reviews.Content: Hotel is on the great location for visiting the city.City center is about 10 minutes by tram nr 5.Tram stop is in the front of the hotel.Rooms are beautiful and bed and the shower are great but it was a bit cold in the room and there was no place to put the shoes.Staff were friendly and helpful and there were a lot of young people in the hotel.Price is also great and would absolutelly reccomend it to all of my friends.We would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “A fresh rethink of how a hotel should work - and it does work.”
Reviews.Author: Andras67
Reviews.Content: Really thought-through concept - designed around what you want from your hotel when on a few-days stay. It actually works, and the whole design is really fresh. Very comfortable, huge beds. Very small but completely usable rooms with minimal "noise pollution" either from outside or from the guests. Staff very helpful. Great location - airport and city center only 10 minutes by tram.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for a night”
Reviews.Author: marijke1974
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the CitizenM hotel. The location is extremely convenient for an early flight. Bed is big en very comfortable and the shower is great. Loved the runway view. All the gadets our fun to play with but our remote had a bad battery so we ended up charging it every 5 minutes. Fast check in and check out are a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: fower_pot
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I couldnâ€™t wait to see our hotel room after all of the reviews, and we were pleasantly surprised when we got there! I wouldnâ€™t say Iâ€™m a fussy traveller, but I do tend to pick faults with hotels...but I can honestly say this place was everything I expected, if not better! The rooms were lovely and clean, exceptionally modern and uber funky. Yes, as the other reviews state, the shower and toilet are glass pods in the middle of the room....but we were aware of that and had no issues with the lack of privacy ;-)...however, the toilet pod is frosted, and there is a curtain you could pull if youâ€™re a little shy...plus thereâ€™s always the toilets in the lobby area if youâ€™d prefer! The bed is massive and is ridiculously comfortable â€“ should you have a late night (as we did!) the black out blinds and cosy bed make for a sleepless night and in our case afternoon!! The shower was also stunning....and the Citizen M shower gel was better than the stuff I brought myself! No there is not much space for hanging stuff (thereâ€™s a small rail with about 5 hangers on it) but for a weekend stay who really needs to unpack their entire suitcase?! The make-up mirror came with loads of shelves plus a hairdryer, so getting ready for a night out was no problem for the ladies! The self check-in and check-out was fast and simple, and there were staff on hand should you need them, all of which seemed very friendly and helpful. The boyfriend LOVED the moodpad, changing all the colours in the room and switching on the free adult movies! (Thankfully the novelty soon wore off and we watched Mamma Mia before going to bed!!). From the airport you just need to get a train to Station Zuid (South Station) which costs a couple of Euroâ€™s and takes less than 10 minutes, and itâ€™s a five minute walk from there to the hotel. The number 5 tram across the road takes you to Centraal Station (which takes about 15-20 minutes) and also stops by the Van Gogh museum, the Dam, and various other places. All in all I would have to say it was the most hassle free holiday ever! I loved the hotel and canâ€™t wait to go again...would happily just stay in that room for the entire stay!!! Fantastic idea for a hotel.....hereâ€™s hoping for plenty more!! ï�Š

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Experience, Good Value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Bosinguas
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in Citizen M city centre and did meet my expectations. The design of the Hotel and rooms matches with the rest of your experience in amsterdam. After leaving the pubs and coffee shops in Amsterdam city centre you will feel happy to go back to the Hotel :) It's an amazing room experience with the moodpad (remote control) that makes the room as cosy as you wish. The bed and bed linens are probably one of the best i experienced...Not even Starwood or Four Seasons have such a confortable bed and pillow...Just had an issue with the hot water, and unfortunately the Hotel Staff couldn't fix it immediately and i needed to move to another room. Sometimes the moodpad doenst work which can be inconvenient since you cant set up the alarm properly/turn on, off the TV/control the lights mood, etc. Anyway, apart from these inconveniences and the location, yet next to amsterdam south station and tram stop, i would recommend this hotel to everyone, special to couples.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!!!”
Reviews.Author: Robie59
Reviews.Content: Cool room with cool shower and very cool bed. Nice international atmosphere. Next time again!

Reviews.Title: “Interesting design with clean rooms and very helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Thee11
Reviews.Content: +Great hotel! Me and my boyfriend stayed there two nights and it was very clean and had very interesting rooms when it came to the design. It was very cool with the lights that could change color and the shower was in the middle of the room with just glas around it. Great staff! Close to the subway/metro which only took about 10-15 minutes to the city. -On the downside it might not be suitable for those who are friends or maybe people who have recently started dating, because going to the toilet or taking a shower can feel awkward if you don't know each other well. Due to the fact that every sound you make on the toilet is really easy to hear for the ones outside :P And even though the glas for the toilet is not entirely see-though one can still see the siluette of the person in there. The shower is completely see-though and also in the middle of the room, there is a curtain one can pull in front of the shower but it's very thin and white so not the best curtain!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience”
Reviews.Author: Ayanmaj
Reviews.Content: Even though we stayed for a night, we found this hotel value for money. With all modern facilities, unique room layout, touchpad facilities for all functions; this was an unique and enjoyable experience

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't feel like a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: wattsfamilyBristol
Reviews.Content: Very stylish hotel, room is very different but quite good, had some really good sleep. Loved the free wifi and movies. Drinks from bar a little expensive. Only problem we had was our shower flooded on the last day, soaking all our clothes, lucky we were going home!

Reviews.Title: “Multiple Unique Selling Points”
Reviews.Author: MaximillianAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: I've stayed several times in the Citizenm City Hotel. First of all I have to say that the pricelevel is very good, the prices vary between 80 and 100 euros excluding breakfast, altough during peektimes prices can rise till 140 euro. For the location, cleanliness and rooms this is absolute value for money. The hotel is located in the South of Amsterdam approx. 20 minutes by tram from the real city center, a tramstop is just a few steps away. Hotelstaff is friendly but in my opinion their skills fluctuate, some staffmembers are very hospitable and friendly while others are unpolite and not trained enough to do their job. Ofcourse this is my personal opinion but with over 120 hotelnights a year and a job in hospitality I know a bit of the hotelworld. The rooms are all the same, equipt with a very large bed with soft bedsheets, a small table and chair is provided. The shower is supposed to be a rainshower but at Citizenm the showers are always a suprise. Housekeeping should know that they have to decalcify the stuffed waterpipes, in some rooms the shower just provides a very very little amount of water that sprays in all different directions due to the stuffed waterpipes, in other words it's almost impossible to take a decent shower. So two options; make sure there's enough waterpressure or use a normal shower! At groundlevel guests can use 4 pc's with free internetconnection and enjoy food or drinks in the Citizenm Canteen. The pricelevel in the canteen is in my opinion to high, 0.25 l applejuice, â‚¬ 3.25, simple Beefsandwich in carton â‚¬ 5.50...... prices are like the pricelevel you can find at foodoutlets at Schiphol Airport. Last point of unsatisfaction: Housekeeping please change the toiletpaper after every guest, I don't want to have a few sheets as a leftover from the guest before!! As a conclusion, why choose for CitizenM? Good pricelevel, Free Wifi, Free movies, Great Bed en Good Location. Service and performance can be better, but CitizenM is doing better then most 4-star hotels in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels ever!”
Reviews.Author: DagmarZ
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I ever stayed in. The only thing missing was a place to put your luggage in/on. So all my stuff was lying on the ground. But that is seriously the only negative issue, that wasn't even that big of a deal. You can not work in your room, but there is (confertable) space enough downstairs. Wireless internet was easy and fast. Shower was like heaven.

Reviews.Title: “Great place with a few things to iron out. Otherwise awesome.”
Reviews.Author: tima
Reviews.Content: A really innovative way to create a positive impression from a small guest space. It should be a massive success. The Italian craftsmanship is evident in the shower trays â€“ the coating is peeling off â€“ and if Iâ€™m being honest, the moodpad wants binning for a standard telly remote control and a static room control mounted to the wall somewhere in the room. The way it needs to â€œreconnect to the roomâ€� every time you want to change volume on the telly is a right ballache. The bed is ace, the showers lovely and for short stays it works a treat. The breakfast in a bag doesnâ€™t seem to achieve anything but the nice chilled seating areas and mac workstations are very useful. .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, funky, friendly”
Reviews.Author: sazzled
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, very high tech and funky with comfortable bed although if you are travelling with someone make sure you know each other well. Great communal areas with staff who were extremely helpful and friendly. A very 'inclusive' and pleasant place to stay within easy tram ride distance of the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “21st Century Funky!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: foxy218
Reviews.Content: 1 Stop from Schipol Airport is Zuid Station. Citizen M is about a 2 min walk from the station (Cost about 3 Euro). The check in is a fast self service system assisted by very good English spoken amdassadors. We arrived late evening and the lack of queuing and fuss gave us a quick turn around. About 2 mins walk is the clean and very efficient tram system which gets you to Dam in 15 mins. The hotel rooms are awesome. Everything from the free movies (including 2 cheeky channels!) to the blinds and mood lights are contolled by a remote. The hotel had a reasonable priced 24 hour self service eatery. We had two large teas and croissants for about 8 euros (took it back to the room for breakfast in bed). Communal areas are clean, funky and comfortable. Big tip, take the tram (5) get off at Spui (1 stop short of Dam) opposite the stop is Humphreys restaurant. 22 euro set menu contemporary food, a fusion of euro-oriental..... it was bloody gorgeous!

Reviews.Title: “great geeky hotel”
Reviews.Author: global_jetsetter23
Reviews.Content: In general, I loved this hotel, especially as it was something a bit different. Everything was very easy, but technophobes should stay well away! Location excellent, 5 mins walk from Station Zuid and very easy to find if you follow the directions given on the hotel site (the previous reviewer was clearly clueless!). 5 mins walk from Wagamama's and other restaurants around the WTC, and felt very safe walking around the area at night (plenty of people around, but watch out for being run over by bicycles!). Room was great, but I never found it warm despite having the thermostat turned right the way up to the top. Plenty of TV channels, excellent free Wifi, lovely bed. Downsides were no proper work desk (laptop only just fit on the tiny bedside table), no storage for clothes (apart from 3 hangers on a tiny rail), no drawers to put other clothes in, or even tables to put your bits and bobs on apart from the 2 tiny bedside tables. Perfect for 1 person, but awkward for a couple - WC is in the room with only a see through glass panel around it, and with 2 people in the bed you'd have to climb over the other person to get in and out. Breakfast was a bit odd - you can prebook breakfast which comes in a little bag, for 9 euros, but which contained lots of things i didn't want, so I opted for my own mix and match. Which was OK but the whole experience felt a bit like being in an airport. Staff are very friendly and helpful, but the atmosphere is a little clinical. Great for one or two nights, but after that you probably want something a little more homely.

Reviews.Title: “A design geek's dream!”
Reviews.Author: subversive
Reviews.Content: I'm a bit of a design freak, so when we entered the hotel lobby, I nearly fainted from joy. Everywhere I turned, there was Vitra furniture. The staff greeted us upon arrival and the automated check-in system was a breeze. Our room on the 5th floor was spectacular. The bed was enormous and the shower/bathroom pods and mood lighting were very cool. Given the layout of the room, I think this hotel best suits couples or very close friends. You do feel a little bit on display in the toilet since it's right in the middle of the room, but the frosted glass and privacy curtain made it less awkward than otherwise. Although a bit far out of the city centre, the location next to Amsterdam Zuid made getting around very easy. The number 5 tram stops right in front of the hotel and takes you nearly everywhere you could wish to go in the city (museums, shopping, central train station). I still cannot believe how reasonably priced the hotel was for the quality - in London where I live, a similar hotel would have easily cost three times the price. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A very special experience”
Reviews.Author: GrizzledStudent
Reviews.Content: I liked everything about CitizenM: the whole atmosphere, the futuristic yet comfortable design of the rooms, the friendly staff. The rooms are small yet so intelligently designed that you never notice it. The bed is great, the rooms' sound insulation is the best I have ever experienced in a hotel (I am a light sleeper, so consider that very important). The price is very reasonable, and (really) high speed internet is free. If you want a hint of the future but comfort too, you should definitely consider this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great, new hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Erich070
Reviews.Content: good: - easy handling of booking, check-in, etc. - great rooms (includes everything you really need) - exciting use of technology without missing out the "pesonal touch" bad: - poor F&B-offer in close proximity of hotel (at least during the weekend) - high prices of in-house F&B do not really fit the overall hotel concept

Reviews.Title: “V trendy but comfortable hotel, great base for a weekend away”
Reviews.Author: linsays
Reviews.Content: I've read a few reviews which state CitizenM as good and I have to say, it's better, it's great! When you walk through the front doors, you feel that your part of a contemporary and modern hotel, an experience in its own right. From experience that normally is at the sacrifice of comfort. I must say however that the beds are SO comfortable and the room while compact was really clever and good fun. I went with a friend so we loved the playful room with our "mood pad" which was fab. I've read some reviews which mention that the hotel is slightly out of town but the number 5 tram takes no time at all to get into the centre. This really shouldn't put you off as the quality of the hotel (I imagine) is far superior to the central budget hotels. I can honestly say I had an amazing nights sleep. In Feb, it rains in Amsterdam. It was great to be able to grab a coffee and chill in the massive, trendy, cool lobby reading their 'coffee table' books in their designer chairs. Personally I think that this is a revolutionary hotel which I'd welcome in any European city where on the whole accomodation is both expensive and sub-standard. Added bonus: free Wifi, macs AND printing. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Go there and come back! :-)”
Reviews.Author: vondobbelstein
Reviews.Content: Good things: compact and super-comfy room, high-tech Phillips facilities including chromotherapy showers and light/mood pads, large beds with v. comfy mattresses, free films and quite a choice of them ;-), nice lounges downstairs and a good selection of foodstuffs to compose your breakfast (or brunch), free internet and close to RAI expo area and Beatrix park for jogging; one direct tram to downtown A'dam; no fuss about check-in or check-out: you do it all on your own and spare some valuable time. Bad things: only few but the hotel might take it into consideration to be a true and real excellence: room doors make a lot of noise and clutter when shutting and also: a little fresh room temperature even when the pad thermometer set on max. Also, nice and young stuff, good price and an overall very pleasant experience. We will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Good but a few bad things.”
Reviews.Author: UkBigrich
Reviews.Content: Ok lets say that 1st the citizenm is my favourite hotel but this stay i wasnt that happy.1st i had to pay for early check in which was 19 euro.I was a little upset with this but i paid.Room was very cold 1st night and the mood pad did not do anything.Also the shower wasnt as hot as the airport and didnt enjoy the shower like last time at the airport.I probaly woudnt stay at the city hotel again.Mainly through paying for early checkin.MY last hotel let me in my room at 10am for free they was happy to.If my travel brings me to the city before check in time i wont stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Groovy!”
Reviews.Author: TheParisExpert
Reviews.Content: This "Apple meets IKEA" hotel is ideal for a weekend escapade with your significant other to Amsterdam. This is a FUN hotel, not a place for business travellers AT ALL and it is mainly desgined for the YOUNG or YOUNG AT HEART crowd. This is NO place to come with kids or lots of luggage either. It is desgined for a two night stay max with light luggage, after that, the novelty will start to fade and you'll start feeling a little cramped in the small (but extremely well designed) room. Only bring someone you really know here, don't bring someone you just met, since sharing this room will be a VERY intimate experience.There is a transluscent retractable curtain that separates te bed area from the bathroom area but still, you'll be able to constantly see the other person's body shape behind it. If you don't use the curtain you'll have full view of the other person while showering. You'll also see his/her shape while at the toilet (toilet has frosted glass and NO soundproofing). The bed is 2 x 2 meters and it is VERY VERY confortable. The "moodpad" remote control is a fantastic thing, you can control everything with it: lights, music, shades, TV, music, etc. I found it easy to manipulate. PLENTY of free movies (even porn that you can block if you want). Self service check-in took about 10 seconds and check-out took 5, there is always someone right next to the 6 check-in booths shall you need help. I didn't have breakfast here, but I did see that is was offered in a paper bag (I didn't like this much, I'd prefer a tray). The food area layout is pretty cool, it is mainly self service with a bar in the middle. You can get plenty of different light and mainly cold dishes day and night (even sushi or champagne to take to your room). Lounge is very inviting and different from the usual hotel. Free iMacs with Internet are a nice touch. The only little annoying thign I noticed was some constant cracking noise when our above neighbours walked on the room, it didn't last much though and, luckily, did not affect my sleep or overall experience. Tram # 5 passes right outside the hotel and will take you to Amsterdam Cesntral Station in about 20 minutes, nice ride. If coming by car I would recommend you check in first and then leave your car at the Park and Ride under the Olympic Stadium not far away. If you park right outside the hotel on the street you'll pay 25â‚¬ (free on Sundays) per day and at the P+R at the stadium you'll pay 6â‚¬ plus you'll get return tickets on the tram for free (you can even get free bikes there too but you have to arrive early). Overall a fantastic different hotel experience, will go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunately Not a Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Rather-B-travelling
Reviews.Content: Firstly if you need or want a full service hotel (eg. concierge, room service, baggage handling) don't stay here. To be honest both my wife and I thought CitizenM was average. Yes its different and quirky (which can be a nice change), however it lacks in a lot of other areas. The main of these being customer service (by some staff), I didn't expect a great deal of service but when asking what method of transport best to use to get to the central station I didn't expect the answer being .."have a look at the websites", and when their printer wasn't working the girl had no idea and walked of and ignored the situation. Luckily someone else staying at the hotel had the same problem and had spent time solving it before. After checking in on a late arrival (the system had issues because it said I owed $0.01??) we where told there was no hot water for showers but they where working on it. My wife nearly killed me for booking this place. By the second day we did have the hot water back, but no offer of anything not even a drink for the inconvience of having cold showers. I would hope however that the loss of hot water is a one off thing and we where just unlucky. The shower itself is a plastic tube in the middle of the room, so if your shy in front of your guest don't stay here. The toilet also is a plastic tube but at least with a frosted finish. Not a great fan of the electronic mood pad, a bit finicky and over rated, had to keep re-setting it to work properly. Not a lot of storage space, yes a draw under the bed for luggage but when your traveling on a 5 week European tour for two, not enough space. The other thing is the free CitizenM tourist map we where given did not have the hotel on it (outside the map borders) which we realised late at night trying to get back from the city. So we called the number on their map, but discovered it was no longer in use!! We finally did make it back, and I notified them of this problem, he said .."oh yes, that number dosen't work"??? (CitizenM please update your map) The best thing about the rooom is the large selection of movies for free. The distance to Amsterdam city and the main shopping district is a good 25min tram ride. If you don't mind this trvel time it is a pleasent trip and easy trip and the tram stops almost directly outside CitizenM. I think a solo or business traveller, who is not too concerned being right in the city, isn't staying longer than 3 days, wants something different and likes to be more independant would enjoy this hotel. I'm probably sounding a little harsh, but honestly it is not a terrible place, they just need to address some issues and it would be fine. Until then I think I will look at other hotels in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, trendy ultra modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: rachxx1xx
Reviews.Content: Ultra modern decor, everything in the room is controlled by a Phillips moodpad from the blinds to the lights, shower, TV, air con, everything! Comfyest bed ever, its huge with lots of pillows and extra duvet if you want, theres an electronic safe in the room, free movies, lots of English channels on TV, hairdryer, also free designer shampoos which smell gorgeous! Only drawback is that theres not much room to put your stuff and not much privacy as the shower and toilet are in glass cubicles! I'd say more for a dirty weekend than for older couples or families. Free internet/printing downstairs too which is handy in case you need to print boarding passes or anything. Only drawback is the location is a bit out of the way you have to get tram 5 into the centre which can take a while if its busy, but it is easy to get to from the airport via the Zuid station. Oh and the staff are fantastic, really helpful and all speak good English.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and experience all by itself”
Reviews.Author: unaontour
Reviews.Content: Loved it ... citizenM amsterdam city is a great hotel with a very unusual bedroom. The largest bed I have ever seen, multi coloured lighting, and a flat screen tv. Free on demand movies, and porm (if that's what you're into). It's also on the #5 tramline so is convienent for the main museums and nightlife. Would definately recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect weekend break hotel for couples”
Reviews.Author: NightOwl210
Reviews.Content: Big on design, Big on aesthetic, Big on Comfort, Small on room size, and importantly very cheap on price. Part of the new wave of "Pod" hotels, Citizen M Amsterdam City is excellent value for money, with top rate design features (to rival that of a modern 5 star), and excellent sleeping conditions. Ideal for a short break with a lover or partner. Downsides are that the room is small, the location requires a 10-20 minute tram ride into central amsterdam, and there is no hot food served at the hotel. However, in return you get an extremely cheap price (cheaper than the B&B's), 5 star design, bed, linen, shower, lighting and movie choices. Definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “This is the best and quirkiest hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: tomden_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the CitizenM City Amsterdam Hotel on Feb 6th. I had read the reviews on Tripadvisor and seen that it won 'Trendiest Hotel in the World' award in 2010. All I can say is that it is brilliant and well worth a visit to Amsterdam just to stay there. It is also very good value. The hotel's location is in the south of Amsterdam, at the junction of Prinses Irene straat and Beethoven straat and close to the World Trade Centre. There is a tram stop close by. The number 5 tram takes you right through the city, all the way to Centraal station. There are stops on the way for Museaumplein and Leidesplein. To get to the hotel from Schipol Airport, get the train to Amsterdam Zuid station and it is a short walk from there. The hotel is very modern and stylish. It has been decked out with very expensive furniture in the lobby and has some really nice communal areas. There is a really cool bar with complimentary nuts and olives and serves cold beer. The rooms are very small but amazing inside. The theme seems to be based around intimacy. They are very modern and Japanese-style. Everything is of a futuristic concept. I wouldn't recommend going unless you are with a lover... the shower is see through and the toilet doesn't offer much privacy! I went with my girlfriend and we loved it. The bed is amazing, really big and spacious with nice linen. The staff at the hotel were great. The women at the bar recommended where to go for restaurants etc. My only complaint was that the cleaner repeatedly knocked on our door AND TURNED ON THE LIGHTS (?!?!) at 10.30am on the morning that we were due to check out. We weren't due to check out until 11am and we were asleep so I thought that was outrageous. I complained when we checked out and the staff ensured that they would speak to the cleaner and that it wouldn't happen again. I'm sure it was a one off and that it wont happen again. The cleaner probably got fired. Oops. I must say that the incident was the only indication that I was staying in a Â£79 hotel and not a Â£200 hotel. Otherwise, it feels very luxuious. However more expensive hotels might have better attention to detail. I've stayed in some 5 star hotels with my job and none of them rival this place. It's really interesting and for the money, it is amazing value. It's totally different from your standard 5 star luxury and it's a really memorable experience. I look forward to going back there. It's very romantic and you don't get the usual 'Brits Abroad' like you might find in other hotels in Amsterdam because it is very couple-orientated.

Reviews.Title: “great design”
Reviews.Author: elinasia
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel very much. Tiny room is extremely comfortable and stylish. Check in check out is a breeze. The whole hotel is very practical, clean, chick. Makes you feel great. It takes sometime to travel to downtown but there are several traveling options. Train (fastest), metro and tram (closest). During my last visit to Amsterdam we stayed at an awful downtown hotel, which was more expensive and dumpy. Staying at a modern, stylish place adds to the experience. People who work there are very helpful and competent. We are very happy with our choice and definitely go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: LB75
Reviews.Content: I was a little dubious about this hotel after seeing photos of it on the hotel's website. However I didn't have much choice as my boyfriend was staying here for work and I was tagging along. My expectations were exceeded - the room was great, everything you needed and everything cleverly had it's own place. Very comfortable bed and pillows. Best of all was the service - the staff were very friendly, very helpful and very welcoming. I was also a little unsure about the location, however the tram was easy to catch (buy strip tickets rather than single journeys as they work out so much cheaper) and close to the hotel. It's also perfectly located for the airport and when it costs â‚¬35 in a cab it's better to pay the â‚¬2.60 train - its quick and convenient. The only downside is I found the food on offer a bit overpriced and there wasn't a restaurant on site - just snakky foods (sandwiches, sushi...) However a few tram stops away there are lots of great places to eat, also there is a Wagamamas just before the Station Zuid if you need something quick and easy. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel, although if you went with a mate you'd need to be fairly good friends as the shower/loo arrangements are quite 'intimate'! But for couples or singles, it is just perfect. I'd stay again! Other tips - Heineken Experience is worth a visit - very interactive and entertaining - costs â‚¬15 but worth it. Meal at Khorat Top Thai (2e Const. Huygensstraat) was divine, tastiest Thai Green Curry I've had. Indonesian meal at Puri Mas (Lange Leisedwarstraat) was delicious - had the vege/fish rijsttafels (like Indonesian tapas) and it was delicious - friendly and knowledgeable staff. Great latte's at De Tuin (2e Tuindwarsstraat).

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not the best location”
Reviews.Author: Coastalrider
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at the CitizenM in central Amsterdam, and central is what this hotel is NOT, at least if your travel is about getting to central Amsterdam. Its a 25 minute ride by tram to the Central Station, 10 to the museum area and 15 to entertainment area Leidseplain. Set in pretty dull location, the benefit is that its quiet. Quality of the hotel is good (new 2009) and staff was attending and nice. The downside with the hotel is that the TOILET is set in the middle of the room (yes - without doors, its all an open space) - so dont do a heavy mexican dinner if you will try to impress your new date. Plus for high speed internet, numerous TV channels, room ambience and lighting, and a bunch of movies on demand - INCLUDED in the price. Why dont all hotels do this. On the other hand it gets a pretty higt score since it after all is in Amsterdam, a fantastic city whatever you are after

Reviews.Title: “A Quirky Modern Hotel with Plenty of Character”
Reviews.Author: brownbearLeeds
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel in The Sunday Times' travel section as it was voted one of the top 10 boutique hotels in Europe and we were not disappointed. We accidentally took the wrong train from the airport (our stupid fault!) and ended up at the central station in Amsterdam. From there we took the tram to the hotel which took approximately 15 minutes. The tram stops right outside the hotel which was very convenient. The hotel appears to be situated in a quiet suburb of Amsterdam, however at the other side of this is the trade centre. Check in is done by yourself on a touch screen computer on arrival and staff are available to help if needed. The rooms are something totally different to anything we've ever stayed in! Compact is the best way of describing them, with the bed filling the whole width and depth of the end of the room. The shower and the toilet are partitioned off from the room with sliding glass doors and aren't very sound proof. If you're comfortable with your travelling companion then you'll be fine, however if you like privacy, you may have an issue! The room, including a large plasma screen TV, is controlled on a Phillips mood pad, which controls the lights (which can be set to your mood), TV, blinds etc. All very funky and easy to use. Storage is minimal however for a weekend break there is plenty. No food or drink is provided with the room, however things can be bought 24 hours a day downstairs in the shop. This is a little pricey though, so it is probably to buy something from a shop in Amsterdam and eat in your room. The location is approximately 2 miles, or 30 mins walk from Dam Square which may seem far, however you can take the tram. If you walk, you pass through Museumplein where the Van Gogh museum and Reiksmuseum are, and there are some nice bakeries on the way too! Check out was easy and all your details are stored in case you visit again. All in all a nice modern hotel, which is only 10 minutes train ride from the airport from the WTC.

Reviews.Title: “you or better...you and your partner will love it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Villy_gr
Reviews.Content: Just like in the pictures...or even better!!!Romantic, comfortable, with free internet access in the lobby...like a heaven in the cold city of Amsterdam!!!However, since there is always a but: Don't go there if you are not feeling comfortable with your partner (the curtain in the bathroom does almost nothing), don't stay in the same room with someone that is not your partner and be careful: try to get out of the hotel - it's hard to leave your huge bed- ..the city of Amsterdam is also great!!! and a small tip: choose the "hottest" as a temperature when you are asked for it...it's not hot...it's just ok when you are visiting Amsterdam during the wintertime!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant, modern and affordable hotel”
Reviews.Author: winkywong
Reviews.Content: I really like the concept of citizenM hotel: a small but luxury room, canteenM for a quick snack or drink, and several lounges. Free internet, and very nice personel. I would really recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect backpacker's choice”
Reviews.Author: Charlix5
Reviews.Content: I stayed together with my girlfriend, and we loved the place. The concept is cool and the decoration is outstanding. This place is perfect if you would like to stay in a non-conventional hotel or if you are a backpacker but hate hostels. This place has the charm of a hostel without being one. The rooms are fun, and the powerful shower is exactly what you need after a long walk in Amsterdam. The only inconvenience is the distance to the main touristic attractions, however a good choice for business travelers since it is right next to the World Trade Center and one main train station. The staff is young and very friendly and always willing to assist you. Very good choice, we highly recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary bliss”
Reviews.Author: tessathornton
Reviews.Content: Actually my review is for the Citizen M hotel at Schipol Airport in Amsterdam. I have not stayed at the one in central Amsterdam but just read a review on this hotel on Trip Advisor. The guest described the staff as "similar to Macdonalds". This is so contrary to my experience at Schipol Citizen M that I can hardly believe it. The staff were fantastic .... especially a girl with red framed glasses who shared my enthusiasm with design, was so knowledgeable and design savvy and loaded me with so much info on the interior design and architects responsible for this exceptional hotel. I was blown away by all the design elements, state of the art Vitra furniture and lighting, the most amazing books I've ever seen - could happily have holed up there for a while and not even gone into Amsterdam. Unfortunately it was a one night stopover, my flight was leaving early morning. Next time in Amsterdam I plan to stay at both Citizen M hotels based on my experience at the Schipol one.

Reviews.Title: “In a nutshell ... AWESOME concept - rubbish staff !”
Reviews.Author: Japanista
Reviews.Content: I am not going to write much about the hotel or the rooms - it is just a fantastic. Other reviews go into details about the HUGE comfortable bed, gadgets, rain shower ... and strange toilet arrangements ... I was with my sister and we really didnt care about this - infact we had a really good laugh!! I travelled with my sister for a 3 night 'budget airline' break during half term. The room was 55 Euros a night - a breath of fresh air in a very expensive city. Check in at the self check in desks is really easy - but I am part of the 'computer generation' I did see lots of other visitors struggling. There is a 'citizen' to help you if you need it - and that brings me to my only bone about this place. The staff are rubbish, in a nut shell, totally awful! Imagine a hotel being run by the same teenagers who serve you a Big Mac - with about the same enthusiasm. My sister left her mobile phone on the coffee kiosk, we went outside for a cigarette (absolutely no smoking inside the building) and when we returned it had gone. The staff on duty were not at all interested and told us what did we expect in a public area? We enquired about contacting the Police and the staff member told us theft was very high in Amsterdam and they would probably not be interested. Secondly on our final night another guest had been smoking in their room and set off the fire alarms in the hotel - we evacuated 3 times over the night as the staff did not know how to reset the alarm. Eventually a member of staff from the CitizenM at Amsterdam Airport arrived to show them how to do it - as you can imagine most residents were not in the best of spirits ... we were offered no apology - not even a cup of coffee to keep us warm while standing in the late October Amsterdam frost. I guess in a way the awesome rooms and inexpensive rate took the edge off this experience and we can look back and laugh as 2 young travellers, but I cant imagine the guests with families were so forgiving. I would certainly visit the CitizenM again, and really hope the concept grows to other large cities across the globe - as long as you don't need any help - and you can be a self sufficient 'citizen' you will LOVE it !

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic funky hotel - a breath of fresh air!”
Reviews.Author: WeekenderLeeds
Reviews.Content: This hotel introduces a whole new concept to the idea of a hotel stay, and is a highly-recommended must-visit. Everything from the check-in (a really simple do-it-yourself job at computer terminals) to the rooms (funky shower and WC pods, and huge bed) and communal area (free wi-fi computer terminals) was different from the norm. It is really pleasant to find a hotel that does not try to squeeze more money out of you for wi-fi access and bedroom movies, both of which are free. The only one small downside is that the hotel is a good 20 minute walk from the city centre, but there is a tram stop right outside and so this is not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: signorinaangelina
Reviews.Content: I cannot give enough praise for this hotel. Every bit of my stay was perfect. It was hip, funky, friendly and comfortable. I will stay here again next time I'm in the city.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place For A City Break/New Years Eve”
Reviews.Author: KaiserSozeManchester
Reviews.Content: A train here from Amsterdam airport costs a few Euros and is within walking distance from the hotel. Situated near to the Museum district, the tram stop is just around the corner. The city centre is just 20 min away. Room really does bring affordable luxury. I was here at the same time as the person who left a poor review. We had one cool shower during our 3 night stay for New Years Eve. Technology in room was fine too. One thing worth mentioning about Amsterdam, public transpost stops at 8pm on New Years Eve. Taxis are extortionate! Plan your evening wisely and don't waste money on a ticket you can't use. Would stay here again and hope they biuld more in other cities.

Reviews.Title: “Uber Modern and very friendly”
Reviews.Author: 377alexis
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Amsterdam for New Years Eve and stayed one night at the Citizen M hotel. The Hotel is about 20 mins train/drive away from Airport and the Centre. The best way to get around is on tram which is a couple of euro. We arrived around 10.30am after an early morning flight. The hotel has a self check in service, which is fantastic and really easy to use. There is also the option to check in early (normal check in is 14.00) for 19.95 euros. But be aware there is a 5% city tax fee added onto your bill when you check in (whichever time). The rooms are....different..! The toilet and shower is in the middle of the room in a glass tube looking thing. The shower was lovely, one of those 'rain' showers, and turns on/off when you close/open the doors. The toilet - if your a new couple, I wouln't recommend as you can hear everything and pretty much see whoever is sat on the loo too, not very romantic! The shower however is quite nice!! There are loos in the foyer downstairs though so make use of those maybe! The bed is AMAZING, I had the best nights sleep haviong the extra room with my partner and had the worst nights sleep when I got home! The rooms have different lighting sequences which you can alter depending on what your up to ;-) There is also electric blinds and black out blinds which can be operated via switch on the wall or through the 'room' remote control. The room remote control covers lights, temperature and the tv with lots of channels to scan through, even free adult films which my boyfriend found very quickly....The room temperature - it takes a while for the temperature to adjust from hot to cold and vice versa. Depending on time of year I would wack the heating up before you go out and turn down to halfway when you get back so it's nice and warm when you get back and you won't wake up during the night with a mouth like the desert! The room does make a lot or 'cracking' noises though when it's heating up, think this is just the plastic/wood expanding but it woke me up! There is shampoo, conditioner and soap provided along with a hairdryer and towels. All in all a great little hotel with very friendly staff and a canteen downstairs stacked with every food and drink you can think of. There is also free internet and printing which came in handy for us printing off our boarding cards for the flight back home (online check in).

Reviews.Title: “You'll love it or hate it”
Reviews.Author: Belgo43
Reviews.Content: The CitizenM concept works well for an airport hotel, where you only stay for 1 night and don't unpack your bags. It works less well as a city hotel though. The Amsterdam city CitizenM is far from the centre (though with good transport links), rooms are tiny and with no wardrobe for clothes, no tea or coffee in the room, and breakfast is a joke. It's not for older people or for children, but if you are a young trendy single person or couple, and not staying too long, you could love it. Positive points are the massive choice of free films, free WiFi in rooms and computers in the lobby, cheap international phone calls (VOIP rates), computerised check-in and check-out, and the wonderful lobby area (best I've ever seen in a hotel, bar none). When in the rooms, you basically have to live on the bed, and when one person has a shower the other one cannot help seeing (clearly aimed at hot young couples). The novelty of the high-tech gadgetry wears off after one day (or when it fails to work, whichever is the earlier). Rooms are basically washrooms with a bed in, very cleverly saving space to pack more rooms into the hotel. For chilling out you have to go to the lobby, with very comfortable sofas and 2 or 3 TVs. I liked my stay, but now I've been there, done that, and I'll stay somewhere more central in A'dam next time (unless I'm with someone I particularly want to watch in the shower ;-).

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay. Funky, unique and quiet.”
Reviews.Author: kaznles
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fab New Year break to Amsterdam. We loved the hotel and personally would stay there again. We had no prblems at all. Yes the rooms are compact but when you book you are well aware of this!! ( lady from Germany!). The pods are a great idea and my husband loved the gadgets to control the lights, mood etc. The bed is huge and fantastic, we had 3 great nights sleep. The hotel is in a great location for transport into the city - tram 5 right outside the door and 24 / 16 drop you further down the road. We didnt realise that we could take a 5 minute train journey from Schipol to the area across from the hotel (this would have saved us going into the city on day one). The station is called Amsterdam Zuid. We also found a coffee shop and Wagammama restaurant in this area beside the train station ( ask at the hoterl for directions). The hotel is a great find and so easy to get in/out of the city. We walked a few times and it took about 40 minutes. Definitely going back.

Reviews.Title: “An unpleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: TheRealMiL
Reviews.Content: The technology exists, but doesn't really work. From arrival my room was plagued by problems, requiring the staff to reboot the system several times. Television wouldn't work, then window controls, temperatures plummet, lights would go on and off at will. The room temperature would drop considerably, especially at night, but nothing could be done since the staff informed me the room sensors indicated the room was warm despite the cold wind blowing across the bed. The touch pad controls were finicky and tempermental, and top the whole thing off with 4 days of NO hot water, despite assurances from the staff each day the problem had been fixed. Some of the staff tries hard, others seemed tired and indifferent, the location is terrific and the bed is spacious, but there were far too many problems for me to recommend the hotel. I had looked forward to this stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing....”
Reviews.Author: Inga27
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a four day trip to Amsterdam, where we stayed at the CitizenM Amsterdam City. The hotel is conveniently located at the tram station. You can easily reach the city center within 15 minutes. The hotel itself is very stylish and new, nevertheless this innovative hotel concept had several drawbacks. The room itself is rather compact with the toilet and shower within the room. Shower and Toilet can be closed by glass doors. The glass surrounding the toilet is frosted, nevertheless you can see through it. There is also a curtain to separate the bathroom part of the room from the rest of the room, which is basically a very good idea, but for some reason this was also see-through. You got to be aware that thereâ€™s absolutely no privacy when choosing this hotel. I was traveling with my husband, so this was not at all a problem, but travelling as friends under these circumstances might be weird. Iâ€™d suggest adding a nontransparent curtain to the room. The overall design of the hotel was very nice and modern. The bed was very comfortable. However we were very disappointed about the cleanliness. The room was not at all spotless. Especially the bathroom areas were not very clean (pictures attached). Another major drawback was the temperature within the room. When we arrived the room temperature was only 17 Â°C. We didnâ€™t know why, but the temperature in the hallways of the hotel was much higher. After complaining to the reception we got one more blanket. They also told us, that we were the only ones complaining about the room temperature. Stepping out of the room and chatting with other guests in the hallway, this turned out to be untrue. Fortunately the room got a bit warmer at nights. Nevertheless during daytime the temperature was always significantly under 20 Â°C. It turned out that the hotel had a problem with the water/energy supplier leading to the cold room temperature and cold water in the shower. Not very funny, since the outside temperature was below 0 Â°C. We are aware that it was not the hotels fault but I have to say that the ambassadors were not very apologetic. Offering a hot coffee is not very generous taking into consideration that a cold room and the lack of hot water are seriously affecting the stay. The mood pad is a nice feature, but sometimes it took very long for connecting, which was a bit annoying. It also kept flashing all night through which was disturbing too. Taken together we have to admit that we were pretty disappointed. Maybe it was bad luck. The concept is great but the dirty room, cold room/shower and the lack of courtesy were not acceptable. I hope that there will be some improvement soon.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay for either business or leisure”
Reviews.Author: DOD_Dublin
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at the CitizenM at the end of September 2009 with two colleagues at the start of a 6 week assignment in Amsterdam. We kept coming back week after week. Later when my assigment was extended for a further 6 weeks, I kept coming back too. What kept us coming back week after week? Was it the free wireless internet, the quirky designer decor, the free movies, the - initally free but still very cheap - skpe phone calls? No, it was mainly the comfort of the hotel rooms and above all the staff. Week after week they made us feel welcome and were always extremely helpful, cheerful and kind. If I am back in Amsterdam in 2010 - either for business or leisure - first stop will definitely be CitizenM.

Reviews.Title: “great stay to stay out of the snow”
Reviews.Author: zandj
Reviews.Content: we arrived on a very snowy cold day, it was too cold to just leave our luggage and wander around for 4 hours before checkin time therefore we had to pay an early check-in fee of 20 euros, but to be out of the cold it was worth it. the room was great, lovely and spacious, the mood pad was a little technological but my partner took control. We had to swap rooms because our television didn't work but staff were very apolagetic offering free cocktails. The location is about a twenty minute tram ride away from the centre, or about a five minute tram ride to the leidseplein, where there are lovely shops and resteraunts. We had a problem with the water in our shower being cold, however an apolagetic letter was sent out and posted under our hotel door, and as it turned out it was a problem everyone was experiencing but it got fixed quickly. You wouldnt want to be a new couple in this hotel as the bathroom door is see through, as is the shower, so not recommended for those who are a bit too new to be that close for comfort. The bed is massive, you could sleep both ways and we were grateful for the blackout blind. The free on demand movies were great, when we came back from the cold we spent the evening watching films and got through many. The only downside is that the food and drink in the lobby is very expensive so we tended to buy our own bottle of wine and food and eat it in our room instead. other than that it was a great hotel and definatly a fun stay.

Reviews.Title: “Already planning our next stay in CitizenM!!!”
Reviews.Author: harmem
Reviews.Content: What a place indeed!! When we decided to visit Holland I was in a rather bad mood and nothing about this trip seemed to cheer me up. My husbad was maing really noticeable efforts to make me enthusiatic about it,but nothing worked. He then suggested visiting the website of our hotel in order to get an idea of our trip. I'll be honest and say that when this web page downloaded I was deeply disappointed. Nothing about CitizenM ressembled what I have in mind about a "decent" hotel. It was way too modern for my taste. The design was too extreme and the photos I saw on their site were supporting this idea of modern,minimal style. Anyway,having no alternative since we had already made the reservation, we arrived on Citizen M on Nov 23rd. The site ofthe hotel was yet another surprise for me. It's located near...every means of transprt you can name: tram,bus,subway, train, they are all there to facilitate your transportation.This,however doesn't mean that it's noisy or uncomfortable because of that,on the contrary: this very fact is one of it's major advantages! Anyway, the minute I etered CitizenM I knew it was a love at first sight situation! The staff was excellent! They were helpful and smiling whatever we asked them for. The bed of the room is the reason I didn't want to leave!! The only reason why I rated the room with 4 stars is beacause it was a bit small. But then again,which room isn't in the entire Holland? However, every function in this room is controlled by a panel.And I mean EVERY function: the density of the lights,the color of the lights, the temperature of the room,the operation of the huge,flat TV, the "curtains", everything.So,if you are not really a gadget freak, you'll either have fun pressing all these buttons and finding out what they do or you'll be frustrated having to call the reception every few minutes!! In a nutshell, this hotel made the entire trip unforgettable! It was a real jewel in Amsterdam Zuid!! Plus it really is a value-for-money place to stay. Hope you enjoy your stay there as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Uber-funky”
Reviews.Author: tj_mct
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very comfy. I travelled solo so it was very spacious. If sharing you would need to know the other person very well considering the pod setup of showers and toilet. I found the heating took a long time to make the room warm but I am sure in summer it would be fine. Fast, free internet access or easy to use hotel iMacs. Food and drink are available 24hrs / day but it is pre packed like a cafeteria so I'm not sure about use by dates. Having said that I had some of the food there and it was fine. The only down side about the location is that in winter it is very cold travelling in and out of town on the tram (15-20mins) and that can discourage you from staying out after 6pm. Keep in mind the tram system is really efficient and the tram (#5) is on a line that goes past everywhere a tourist wants to go - museums, Flowermarket, (near) Anne Frank huis and Dam Square etc. Buy the Amsterdam card to use on public transport and museums as you get value for money after 3 museums and the transport card makes it easy to get around once you leave the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary Luxury That Feels Like Home”
Reviews.Author: DiM79Athens
Reviews.Content: Perfect for design seekers, monocle readers, budget wise yet cosmopolitan people.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't mind a very small room and the 'pod' loo/shower but want a really great bed to sleep in at a budget price.”
Reviews.Author: PennyPurples
Reviews.Content: A group of 10 of us stayed at the CitizenM Amsterdam City for a Fri & Sat night in Dec 09. We arrived around 9pm Fri evening and found the computerised check-in was very easy and there were staff readily available and offering to help. The staff member that helped us check in also looked up the street where our restaurant was booked and booked a taxi to collect us soon after our arrival. Throughout our stay we found the hotel staff in the lobby to be very helpful and efficient. As other reviewers say, the rooms are very small but the bed is very large. I would say they are ideal for a single person or for a couple that doesnâ€™t mind being seen by the other in the shower or heard in the loo! There is very little floor space but there is a big drawer under the bed that would fit a small case or overnight bag easily, so not everything has to be out using up space. Most importantly for me, the bed was huge and very comfortable with good quality pillows and duvet. I had two excellent nightâ€™s sleep. The rooms are also surprisingly quiet â€“ we heard nothing from any neighbouring rooms â€“ and lovely and dark with black-out blind. The location of the hotel is convenient, although not centrally in the city as the name might suggest. The No 5 tram, for which the stop is 1 minute walk from the hotel â€“ takes about 20+ mins to get into Dam Square / central station. For those that are not aware, you buy your ticket from the driver or attendant in a booth on the train and you can get 1 hour and 1 day tickets that are like Oyster Cards so you tap in and out within that time for unlimited use. The last tram leaves the city around midnight. There is loads of space in the ground floor of the hotel with funky furniture, TVs etc. We gathered there as a group at the end of both our evenings and had a great time sitting and chatting â€“ the bar remained open so long as there were people there â€“ until we were ready to go to bed. They even didnâ€™t mind that we bought in some of our own booze and supplied us glasses to drink it from! If I was going back to Amsterdam and was on a budget-conscious break then I probably would consider using the hotel again as I think itâ€™s good value for money for what you get, so long as you donâ€™t mind the very small room size and â€˜podâ€™ loo & shower. Some of our party I know definitely wouldnâ€™t return as they found these aspects of the stay unacceptable to them.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back again for sure!”
Reviews.Author: NaylaA
Reviews.Content: CitizenM was amazing! One of the trendiest, most comfortable hotels I've stayed in. The bed was huge and so comfortable, just what one needs after a long flight. The pods with shower and toilet were very interesting and functional. the mood pad was great, you could change the temperature, lights, tv, music , all from one little device. What most hotels will be like in the near future. the location was perfect, right at the Airport, next to the train and tram. The common areas were big and very comfortable. There was a lounge area with coffee and food opened 24/7. My favorite part was the welcoming and helpful staff who made my stay memorable. Claudia, Arnold, Redzhep, Sidique, Julia, Juliana and Matthew, a BIG thank you for a super job!

Reviews.Title: “Great...as i was imagine..!!”
Reviews.Author: Rika7
Reviews.Content: If u search for something fresh,modern,minimal,design,stylish and don't want to spend a fortune,u're in the right place....!!The staff is great,they're always there to help u,to give u tips for the city and they always have a smile on their faces..!The location is good,not in the center of the city,but the tram takes u there in 10 minutes.There is also the train station 2 minutes walk from the hotel.The rooms are not huge but the bed is giving u the best sleep of your life ever...!!!I would love to take it with me if i could...:P I suggest the Citizen M to all young people who want stylish accomodation in reasonable prices...THANK U CITIZEN M!!!!(Thank u Eva & George)!!

Reviews.Title: “i didnt see before something like this”
Reviews.Author: espanottoman
Reviews.Content: perfect hotel,i dont know what to write also,just imagine what is perfect,and then feel something more then that imagination,thats CitizenM Amsterdam CityHotel

Reviews.Title: “A design hotel AND confortable too!”
Reviews.Author: Kubrika
Reviews.Content: This place was amazing!! The bed was huge and really confortable, the room was clean and it was fun to take a shower and choose the color of the light atmosphere. I would have like to have a place to plug my ipod, because the musical choice was not that great, but it is my only concern. Well, a bit expensive, but I assume those are the prices in Amsterdam. It is a bit far from the center, but it is easily accessible by tram. You can access internet on mac computers in the hall, and in the contrary of things I've read about the staff, they were all really nice!

Reviews.Title: “I have seen the future and I dont like it.”
Reviews.Author: JohnDesmond46
Reviews.Content: This hotel is expensive impersonal full of litle phrases from CitizenM which enrage you given that there is no charm, little service and lots of attempts to extract extra sums of money. When you check in if you are there an hour or so before 2 pm they ask you for 20 euros for early check in. In a normal hotel if a room is ready they give it to you! The toilet and shower is in the middle of the room. The bed is a platform which would be impractical for two people. Only the tv and the internet were up to standard. If it was cheap it might be an amusing place to spend a night. One last thing you pay in advance!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it Loved it missing it already”
Reviews.Author: kerz_yeah
Reviews.Content: We have got back from Amsterdam today and it was absoluty brilliant- the hotel was the best and made our holiday. Before travelling i was a little worried about the location but its fine - you get to see other parts of amsterdam which we proberly wouldnt have seen if staying in the centre. The free tram service is brilliant - the tram stops just to left of the hotel which come passed every 10 mins . The shower, bed, pillows,hairdryer,T.V,lights,coffee andP.C's are all absoluty brilliant i wanna go back to Amsterdam tomorrow and if i did i would def stay at this hotel again !!!! I do not no how anyone can moan about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: egnisz
Reviews.Content: this is the best hotel i've stayed so far. the bed is very comfortable and big, the shower is great. the rooms are stylish but very functional. the atmosphere in the lounge is just great. food downstairs is a bit expensive but very nice. just LOVED it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: essenkampioen
Reviews.Content: Had a great time in this hotel. Ideal to visit Amsterdam. One drawback: no parking! I recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “my new favorite hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cocoten
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at citizenM and our first trip to Amsterdam. Everything about the hotel was great and exceeded our expectations! CitizenM Amsterdam City isn't in the center of tourist attractions, but it's only steps away from trams 2 and 5, which are only minutes away from any place you'll visit. It's also next to the World Trade Center and Station Zuid, which means it's great for business travelers or those needing easy access to the airport. The check-in process was super easy, and check-out was just as efficient. Our room was super hip but also very comfortable. The giant bed with comfortable pillows and a soft down duvet was perfect, and the room was very quiet and well appointed. Despite its small size, there was plenty of space next to the sink for our hygiene items, and a huge drawer under the bed to fit our bags. The "moodpad" control was fun and easy to use, and we loved the variety of lighting combinations and "moods" for our room. The rain shower was super luxurious, and the citizenM bath products, developed by The Nose, were great. In addition to the great rooms, the hotel also has a comfortable lounge and a 24-hour cafe that is surprisingly well-stocked. We had breakfast there each day and a few snacks, and everything we tried was delicious and well-priced. I truly can't think of any negatives for this hotel. The entire experience was super and I can't wait to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “THEEEEE BEST HOTEL EVER”
Reviews.Author: wk747
Reviews.Content: stayed at Stay inn on September the location was ok away from the city BUT it is very close to the Nord station so any time u want u can just hop on the train and go anywhere u want. it is in a really calm and nice area the check in/check-out process was extra ordinary , u do it urself by checking in on the computer, u don't need to wait JUST check in , get ur key and head to ur cozy one of a kind room. the breakfast was semi free, due to the fact that u can only eat croissant and anything else u have to pay for, the room is such a great experience , one of a kind, u can not find anything like it any where else

Reviews.Title: “After two nights at CitzienM I fell ill with the flu...”
Reviews.Author: styleberry
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because of the good reviews on Trip Advisor. And yes, it's a cool budget design hotel. It's very clean and modern and this is just the type of place that I wanted for my two day business stay. I didn't care that the hotel wasn't in the city center but a 20 minutes tram ride away. Don't stay here if you want to enjoy Amsterdam on leisure. Despite some of the staff being very friendly and helpful, I had the worst stay at this hotel and I will not return. According to the manager there was a problem with the air conditioning. Unfortunately, when I asked a member of the hotel after my first night to turn up the heat in my room (it was freezing, I had to turn on hot shower to get some warm air in the room) and turn off the extremely strong and ice cold draft when lying in bed, I was told that this will be taken care of. When I came back to my room late at night nothing had changed and after spending the second night with this ice cold draft blowing directly on me, I fell ill with the flu for 7 days. My business trip turned into a nightmare. In all fairness, the manager tried to make it up to me and they gave me a hot tea the second morning when I complained, he even wrote me an email but the fact remains that he knew about issues with the air conditioning and this should not have happened in the first place. I also agree with some reviewers that the technology is ridiculous. I just want to take a shower or watch TV without having to read through the whole manual and click on a million buttons for 10 minutes before figuring it out. And I work for an online company, so technology doesn't scare me.

Reviews.Title: “Definetely a great hotel to stay!”
Reviews.Author: ElenP
Reviews.Content: A very trendy and stylish place to stay in Amsterdam. Its location is really convinient, near the train station and very near from the tram that takes you to the center.

Reviews.Title: “Crazy, functional design”
Reviews.Author: taconsta
Reviews.Content: Location: The hotel is really close (5, max. 10 minutes) from Amsterdam Zuid train station (first stop from the airport). Getting in the city is a 15min tram ride. The tram stop is 2 minutes away from the hotel and they run every 5 minutes until midnight, which is fabulous. A taxi ride from the Oude Kerk cost us midnight around 15EUR, which is also not expensive. Welcome, lobby: although it's supposed to be a "do it yourself" check-in, we were actually greeted by very friendly staff, who also did the check-in for us (no big deal, just punch in the reservation number, your name and decide whether you want the South or the North side). We chose the latter, with views over the World Trade Center. The lobby has a posh cafeteria. We would not recommend booking the breakfast as it's rather expensive (19EUR per person, if I recall correctly; you can have a much more varied breakfast for 10 EUR around Leidesplein). The rest of the lobby is, basically, a showroom for Vitra furniture (http://www.vitra.com): really cool and modern, but also very comfy. Highly recommended. The coolest thing in the lobby: there are two elevators. Waiting for them becomes way enjoyable if you browse through the supersized photo album about... sex. Quite R-rated, but seems like everyone liked it, judging by the fact that almost every time someone was browsing through it. The lobby also hosts about 4 or 6 Macs with free Internet, a printer and basic Office applications. Good if you want to book a ticket for a museum, your flight ticket, check your mail or update your all-too-important blog. Room: it's not very large, but not too small either. I'd dare to say that finishing is at par with a second-class yacht: the "wooden" floor and ceiling match perfectly, the bed is supersized and comfy, just a bit high. There's a drawer beneath it which can hold even two large suitcases (some 70-80L each of them), provided you get the extra pillow out. The solution with the shower and loo cabins are interesting. If you're a bit shy from your partner, there's also a courtain which acts as a divider and gives you a bit more privacy. But, definitely, it's not the kind of room you'd share with your boss, or even work colleague. All rooms are standard two-persons and given the way they are "furnished" there's no place for a crib. So not really for families with children, unless one parent shares the room with one child and the other parent gets a second room. The only real drawback of the setup is the fact that there are only three coat hangers (and there isn't really space for more than that). The shower cabin needs some improvements: the doors don't always close perfectly. If they leave a 2mm gap, you can sort of flood the room. If they decide they want to leave a 4-5mm gap, then the interlock stops your shower; can happen any time. There's also a selector between a hand shower and an overhead shower and "no water"; sometimes changing from "stop" to hand shower would let also the top one dripping on your head.; shower cap (not included in the toiletry) highly recommended! Also the selector is more a piece of design than of functionality: try rotating a polished, chromed knob, with a 5mm pin while having a soapy hand. The moodpad is everything Phillips used us to: fancy and unreliable: sometimes it would reset itself while working on it; once it failed to actually set the wake-up call; if you watch telly and want to turn down or up the TV, it may take as long as 15 seconds to re-establish the link with the room, which is annoying at best. Plenty of TV stations, including two channels for adults; but, hey, you're in Amsterdam, so go to the RLD instead! The rooms are quiet. I mean really quiet. The only quieter room we had was in Kempinski Heiligendamm. The doors are really thick (and heavy). And since each "container" has also a technical hatch, there's a 30cm gap between rooms, which, sure, helps with soundproofing. Bottom line: really cool experiment, really nice and very international staff. Location is good for getting to the airport and decent for getting in the city. Prices are unbeatable and, at least when we were there, they waived the EUR 0.02 worth of international phone conversationS (that's plural!).

Reviews.Title: “Wow - wish Citizen M Hotels were in every city”
Reviews.Author: Room_101_London
Reviews.Content: This is a great concept for an inexpensive city stay which is excecuted excellently. My room was very comfortable with every facility that I need, free wifi, good shower and freebies, nice TV, an in room safe, quiet and spacious enough. The lobby area is excellent with a good cafe with a Japanese-ish menu, good coffee and loads of space to sit , work, chat and meet. The staff were very helpful, especially as I had booked by mistake for one night rather than two - they just charmingly sorted it out for me with no fuss. Another staff member took great trouble to help me to find my way to another part of the city where I was meeting colleauges, found out the train and tram and asked when I returned if everything had gone fine. The hotel is in a nice area with plenty of local amenities, very close to the Amsterdam Zuid staton and just minutes from Schipol. It is a bit of a trek to the city center but well worthwhile for the quality of the hotel. I hope that the Citizen M concept spreads throughout Europe as I would book again if I were to find one in any location I go to on business.

Reviews.Title: “The most interesting hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: mejulie805
