Reviews.Content: When booking our holiday to Amsterdam, I chose to book CitizenM as it looked fun, exciting and different (and was affordable and you didnt have to share a bathroom which seemed difficult enough to come across in this city). We arrived at Central Station as we missed our stop in Zuid, and hopped straight into a taxi to bring us to the hotel. At first, I have to admit, it was a bit daunting as the journey took well over 1/2 an hour by car (I was panicking as I felt I had booked a hotel in the middle of nowhere!) When we arrived, it was only 9am, but I was so tired I wanted to see this HUGE bed ASAP. We paid a â‚¬19.95 early check in fee, checked in, and went up to the room. It was just like the pictures, so no surprises. I have been reading other reviews where guests said there was no luggage space, no tables and no chair. Well, there is luggage space under the bed, and quite a lot of it. There are 2 bedside tables with lamps. There is a chair (nice and comfy too). The bed is more comfortable than you could ever imagine, and is MASSIVE! (You can roll over 5 times!) And it has one of those duvets that just hug around you! The shower is loads of fun as you can use the handheld shower,or the rain shower, which is lovely (and surprisingly easy to not get your hair wet in). The two shower gels that the hotel supply are really nice (I was a fan of the PM gel). 1 bad thing though- when housekeeping came in and changed the towels, they always rolled one up and left it in the shower cubicle. This was never noticed until it was far too late and the towel was soaking. No problem really, just felt a bit bad to be leaving such wet towels for housekeeping every day! The selection of movies was great, and the moonpad was so much fun to use. We ended up keeping the coloured lights on random, and we could sleep all day if we wanted to by shutting the blackout blinds! (suprisingly the room only has 1 european socket! and we had 2 phones to charge, and a camera!) The hotel was not as far from the city as the taxi driver made it out to be. We used the Mac computers in the lobby to print out a map so we knew how to get to the city centre. It took about an hour (we got a bit lost), but when we arrived we rented bikes straight away. Cycling is the only way to travel in Amsterdam! It only then took us 10-15 mins to travel from the hotel to the city, and vice versa, We also chained our bikes to a pole beside the hotel, so we knew they were safe. One night we ordered cocktails at the bar- Mmmmm! I ordered the mobile martini (i think) - and it was purple! and the barman put a purple flower in it to float on top (and then told me it was edible- WOW!) We then bought a bottle of wine and were given wine glasses to bring up to the room. The hotel also allowed us to order a pizza,and even rang the room when it arrived. The door signs are funky (dont come in- there's someone naked in here!), the halls are brilliant, there is so many places to hang out. I loved it! Hmm, anything else? Oh the croissants are yummy and can be heated up. The wake up call adapted to the time change (daylight savings!), the hair dryer is good, the staff are super friendly, ehh.. yep! thats it!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at Citizem M”
Reviews.Author: onami_k
Reviews.Content: Citizen M was an excellent hotel and great value. The tram 5 stopped right outside and was a short ride into town. we walked into the centre too, which was about a 40 minute walk but with lots of shops and restaurants along the way and lots to see. The hotel for us was everything you could want from a city stay. As a designer, the look and feel of a place is very important to me, it looked great with every detail having been carefully considered. There was none of the usual rip off extras, even the phone rates are set similar to that of Skype rates, and with free internet access in rooms you can skype yourself if you have a skype enabled phone. Its also very handy to get to from Schipol, a 9 minute train ride to WTC Zuid and its just round the corner. All round a great experience. I would definatly stay here again and would recommend it to friends and family who are happy to travel a teeny it to gain a whole lot.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the room”
Reviews.Author: bbboontje
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife and 5-year old and really enjoyed the stay. The room and its "toys" are real fun. The living room lobbies and food\drink area were very comfortable and also offers spaces to work properly. Staff was friendly and helpful. We think that some people might not like the following: its location, however the tram is nearby (8km to central station); Food and drinks are somewhat expensive; no too much lugage space; no desk in the room (however the lobby offers sufficient). But again, we really enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “A very unique place to stay for a couple of nights”
Reviews.Author: cirrus5461jyCANADA
Reviews.Content: I would rate this hotel at 3 1/2 stars. The rooms are quite unique. They are very modern and clean. There is a big king size bed which is actually the width of the whole room. e. There is no place to put your luggage and no chair to sit on. There is a big flat screen TV mounted at the end of the bed with a remote to control the TV, the lights and blinds in the room. The toilet and shower are enclosed in circular pod-like glass doors. My teens enjoyed changing the colour of the lights in these 2 enclosures. We took tram #5 to get to the downtown area. The bus terminal is a 2 minute walk from the hotel. The staff will tell you where you can park your car for free all night (dropoff spot is a 10-15 minute walk from the hotel). There are many tourist sites and museums to visit. We especially enjoyed taking a bike tour through Mike's Bike Shop. Be prepared to do a lot of walking along the canals and neighboring streets and take lots of photos along the way!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - quirky, funky, fun, efficient”
Reviews.Author: sos100
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for work (a conference) in Amsterdam - was here for two nights. I like it - it was the kind of experience I wanted - a hotel that is a little bit "different". It's definitely "cool" - it has internet, 24 hr bar/snack area, nice communal areas in which to work or rest around the "lobby" and so on. Essentially it's a modern interpretation of a hotel, especially a hotel for mid-range business travellers. I liked it - clean, cool, functional.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for young people”
Reviews.Author: AntoineD83
Reviews.Content: The room is small but very neat ! You'll love the shower and the big king size bed !!! The multimedia remote control is a good game but sometimes doesn't work properly ! The first day, the AC was too strong and we were freezing, but they fixed it in 12 hours. A must to try during your next trip to Amsterdam !

Reviews.Title: “Great for the solo traveler...or a night or two with your partner”
Reviews.Author: Cayman40
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights on a weekend trip from Frankfurt. The self-check-in was easy, staff friendly and helpful, and room was clean, although we both mentioned the halls and room smelled a bit stale, possibly due to improper ventilation. BE FOREWARNED, the rooms are very, very small. That having been said, the bed was nice (and big), and the shower was very nice too. While most all room functions can be controlled by the remote control (lighting, TV, room temp., blinds, etc.) we did think the remote could have been more user friendly and in several languages instead of just symbols. The room temp. during the day was colder than we would have preferred and the remote was of no help (note: overheard another guest telling the front desk this too). We were glad to be checking out, but if you are a solo traveler or very much into togetherness this is not a bad place.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this comfortable, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: kyleracine
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. The rooms are super high tech, very clean, very comfortable. It's a hotel that really was designed with travelers in mind. We enjoyed our stay here immensely. It's a bit far from the city center, but I didn't mind because it was nice and quiet and there's also easy access to public transportation to get right into the city in less than 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a long weekend getaway!”
Reviews.Author: PetePirate
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a recent weekend away with friends. The location, while not in the city centre, in my opinion is nearly perfect. Just a few minutes from the train or tram (no. 5) into the centre (15 mins tram ride) and one stop from the airport, there was really no need to stay in the centre. The price was right, comparing more than favourably to equivalent hotels, saving significant euros for our going out budget! The room was funky and despite its small size, it felt quite roomy! The bed was as big and comfortable as we've ever experienced, despite having stayed in 5 star hotels in many different countries. The 'moodpod' is a cool concept but to be honest I found it temperamental (tv issues), but other than that we had no real complaints. Each room had free Wifi access with a very fast connection, free on-demand movies, games, English satellite TV, mood lighting etc plus there were also 4 Macs in the foyer for free internet for those without their own laptop. Breakfast and meals available downstairs was convenient but a little expensive. I'd recommend heading in to town. Overall I wouldn't hesitate in recommending the hotel to stay for a short trip to Amsterdam and really think it is a concept that will take off successfully elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “I love this place”
Reviews.Author: JonWS
Reviews.Content: If you want something a little out of the ordinary, this is the hotel for you! I've stayed at both the Amsterdam City and the Schipol hotels and they are both just as much fun. As a business traveller, I need service. You get this and a fresh approach too! My ONLY critisisms are 1) make sure you warm up the shower with the hand shower before turning on the main shower, unless you like a cold wake up! 2) waste water plumbing could do with a little refreshing (drains are a little smelly). Otherwise it's great fun and a good place for a relaxed business meeting.

Reviews.Title: “Suits perfect for a one or two nighter”
Reviews.Author: Dutch-Duo
Reviews.Content: This was our first experience with the CitizenM concept. All in all a pleasant one but wouldnt recommend it for more than two nights, with the room feeling so cramped and for the more claustrophobic persons. After a day or so we also got a bit tired of the conepty theme of the hotel, the concept coffee, concept pillow, concept lighting etc etc. Not to mention the pricy food and drinks. Fortunately the nearest supermarket is a mere 10 min walk away. The best thing about this hotel was that it gave us a chance to get to know Amsterdam from a different perspective. Avoid the obvious red light canal Amsterdam and get to know the Concertgebouwarea, Oud Zuid , t Vondelpark, theyre just lovely areas to stroll around on a sunny day. And maybe thats just about the best reason to book this hotel when visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming, funky, artistic and high tech”
Reviews.Author: missfisk
Reviews.Content: It is a very modern hotel, self-service and easybility. The lobby area is very cool, nice design and art. Social atmosphere in canteenM. Rooms are very comfortable and convenient thanks to the technology and clean design with focus on well-being.

Reviews.Title: “Very different and very nice too!”
Reviews.Author: Yann1
Reviews.Content: This is a new concept, but really clever one too. If you are on business this is ideal, and the ratio quality price is brilliant. The rooms are unique in their design, but ultra-efficient. You better check their website to get an idea, quite a lot to say if you want to describe it properly. But it's really good. They do have a restaurant, but it's more like a canteen where you help yourself and get a tray. There is ample space to sit down and relax, all very modern and cosy at the same time. I had breakfast, and it was OK, practical and sufficient. If you like alot of food in the morning you might be disappointed. It's a few minutes away from Amsterdam Zuid station, and there is a pedestrian access all the way to the station so you don't even have to walk near the busy road. Tram 5 is just outside, and that links up straight into central Amsterdam. Really great location, I have been struggling for years to find somewhere half decent in Amsterdam where you don't have to pay huge amount for peace and quiet, CitizenM Hotel really got it all. Definitely stay there again next time, better book well ahead as it was busy and just opened a few months ago. They will surely be fully book all the time before long.

Reviews.Title: “believe the reviews”
Reviews.Author: TrimleyBob
Reviews.Content: After reading the other reviews we were expecting something special, and we were not disappointed. The staff, sorry ambassadors, were there when needed, and were always willing to help. Provided that you are onboard with modern technology you will be at home in this hotel. At the electronic checkin we had a selection of rooms which were available to us and selected one on the 5th floor. The location of the hotel, although not within walking distance of the centre, is in a good area and is 50 yards from the tram, which run approx. every 6 minutes, and will will get you to Dam Square in 20 minutes. When in Amsterdam buy a 24/48/72 hour travel pass which will give you access to all trams, buses and Metro. Go to the hotel with an open mind and you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “an amazing hotel, got to be seen to be believed”
Reviews.Author: Nicki_Oliver
Reviews.Content: we arrived in Amsterdam for a weekend away with friends, both couples, not sure what to expect. We had booked this hotel in May with no reviews, so we was worried but looking forward to it. The hotel pictures looked very interesting. We was over the moon with the hotel. Rooms are not amazingly big but there is a place for everything and your not there to see the room, Amsterdam has so much to see. This is a very moderrn new hotel.The bed was really comfortable , shower perfect and the way that you can change the lighting by your little control panel just adds to the style of the place. It was very clean, clean towels each day, room cleaned, shower gel and shampoo supplied. Number 5 tram straight outside, takes about 20 mins to get to the red light district area, then 10 mins walk from thehotel to the train station back to the airport, we paid for a cab to the hotel but got a train back to the airport, a lot cheaper. The only down side about Amsterdam in geneal is the price of everything, really expensive. The food, service and drink is excellent but the prices are really bad on some things. But just be prepared to take some money with you, or do what we did and stock up at the airport before you get to the hotel. I would reccomend this hotel to any-one. We will be talking about this weekend for years to come i think.

Reviews.Title: “nice concept, better than F1 etc...”
Reviews.Author: fatboyslim21
Reviews.Content: Cheap and cheerful hotel with many + points. I would advice this hotel to anyone who is just staying for a night or two. Loved the star trek shower and toilet.

Reviews.Title: “very cool modern space with giant bed”
Reviews.Author: travelingbunny2
Reviews.Content: a small room for those traveling light... a bit of a walk to places, but right on the 5 tram line... and not a bad bike away from tourist stuff. Hotel was very cool, maybe the coolest place I have ever stayed.... the room is very intimate, with a very big bed, so nice. the shower is in the center of the room with clear glass around... I was with my husband and it was very romantic, but may be uncomfortable for someone who needs privacy from who they are traveling with... but I would still stay here, and just send them downstairs... Really wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Fun-loving couples will love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pashoshina
Reviews.Content: We simply loved this superb design hotel. It's true the rooms are more for couples or singles as too intimate otherwise but it's definitely a great deal and experience. We even looked for the same hotel elsewhere ... there will be more of them soon around Europe. The distance to the centre is about 20 min by tram so no prob. The hotel doesn't have its own parking but possible to park across the street and pay at the machine. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value,location and fun”
Reviews.Author: NellyCT52
Reviews.Content: UPSIDE: You can't get as nice a place in Amsterdam for the price.It is fun with the gadget that controls the room lighting (color and intensity),TV,shades,and temperature. I am not a techie and I figured out the system in a few minutes. The location is a 20 minute walk to the museum area and 30 to central Amsterdam- through a beautiful,safe neighborhood with many upscale stores and restaurants. The tram to downtown is steps away from the front door and the train to the airport is a 10 minute walk. After a day of touring we would walk back by the FIDELIO restaurant, have a great meal, then walk a further 10 minutes to the hotel,check our email (free access) and then climb into a most comfortable huge bed with a big screen TV over it. Just perfect. DOWNSIDE: There is little storage in the room so you need to live out of your suitcase. You need to be very neat as the rooms are really small. The shower was a bit annoying as it never got really, really hot and the "rainshower" is just useless. You need to start the shower by closing the door and coming back a minute later so the hot water is running well. Otherwise you get doused with cold water. The sliding curved doors for the shower and toilet "pods" are heavy and don't always glide easily. May be tough if you are not in shape or elderly. So some minor irritants. Some unavoidable artwork is typical in your face European (you are in Amsterdam) and may be sexually offensive to some and the coffee downstairs is very expensive- a problem if you like a few cups to get you going. ALL IN ALL: A nice hotel with helpful staff I would stay again without question. We paid about 86 Euros/night and you can't do better for what you get. Best for a single traveler but OK for two.

Reviews.Title: “Amasing design experience!”
Reviews.Author: aicpo
Reviews.Content: I was surprised with the overall experience: great location (just 5 min from the Amsterdam Zuig station) and 10 min from the city center by train/metro, you have a 24h buffet available (with great prices and very good quality), a multicultural and wellcoming staff and the rooms are amasing: very confortable, modern feeling and efficient! If you enjoy design, you need to experiment CitizenM Hotels, its a new concept that brings design, confort and quality together.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely cool and low rates”
Reviews.Author: mlddrss
Reviews.Content: The Citizenm at Amsterdam City is a design hotel at a very attractive price. Rooms are small but adequate. If you want a relatively chip hotel that is good looking and cool, this is the place to go. If you want a lot of personal service, this is not for you. There is a store downstairs that is open 24x7 (I think) and ahas coffee, some food and drinks, but it is quite expensive. Other than that there is no service. I did not miss it. What I missed was a pool, because a pool would have been nice in the (hot August) evenings. The only not so obvious minus point is that the Citizenm is not really in the city. You have to take the tram which takes about 15 minutes. But the tram station is just 50 meters from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great and sour points”
Reviews.Author: neofytos
Reviews.Content: Id say it JUST about gets 4 out of 5. Good bits: The bed was FANTASTIC and huge, the decor was all new, very very clean, snazy and comfortable, good choices on tv including BBC1/2/3 2 sports channels and free movies, free good working WiFi. The bad: I did not like the shower at all, its supposed to be a 'rain shower', its just like that, as if your standing in the rain the water is mostly missing you and spitting on you, you have to encase yourself in a glass chamber for the water to come out so if your clostraphoebic... you simply cannot have a shower. There is also no part of the cubicle that doesnt get a little water so you cant step away for a moment, when trying to turn off the taps you get squirted in the eye as you cant look up! Also, as you have to be in the shower with the door closed with nowhere to go before you get any water you test it on the hand shower first then flip to the main and bam... 2 seconds of HA HEH HA THATS COLD before it warms. The whole hotel theme is snazy and informal with a very hands off feel. This notices as your pre paid breakfast sits on a coat hanger waiting for you to pick it up (1 Croissant, pot of jam, nice coffee, 1 bottle of juice, packet of joghurt with those cereal pots on top) its all in a bag, costing 9.95euro, which i think is poor value. I would not opt for this option. You have to check yourself on a computer system, the entire bedroom is controlled by a hand console, which is not that easy to use and NOT for the technophobe. On the whole, this place suits one who doesnt like staff fussing over him, is ok with technology and an informal approach. The restaurant is all boxed sandwiches, sushi, heat your own microwave noodles! Theres no writing desk, 1 chair which you probably wont use.. if you read all the reviews, you get a feel for this place.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and Perfect Place”
Reviews.Author: SteveIrwin
Reviews.Content: We were there 1 night and wish for more, only 1 stop by train from Schippol Airport (buy your train ticket from counter with real people in it, if you use NS machine, it wont accept your Visa unless its Visa issued by Dutch Bank). Modern hotel and very convenient, Tram No 5 only a few step away and you are in the City already (buy a 24 Hour ticket), shower is excellent but if you are going with a new girlfriend, then the toilet would be an issue (haha) but there is a curtain for courtesy, shower is excellent (except the 'rain shower' wasn't as powerfull as expected though, a real pity). If you go with kids, be carefull using the TV as it has adult movies on it, so be sure you lock it, comfy bed, everything else is nice, even price is only 101 Euro, you can have a canal hotel (dingy) for more than that, so, its a good value at the moment, when people start to discover it, then price might gone up. Free wi-fi and plenty of iMac at the lobby. staff are excellent, we arrived at 11Am and allowed to check in early without fuss. Bravo CitizenM. Will come again and start recommended to friends already.

Reviews.Title: “Design and comfort...crazy place...”
Reviews.Author: Loop79
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was highly recommended by a colleague of mine. so i decided to stay there and...wow. This is amazing. the whole concept is so special, so new, it feels like you are entering the next century.... really. If this is the way Hotels will look like in the near future, well go for it, I am ready. Only some highlights: - No bathroom. you got two glastubes in every room, one is the shower (clear glas) the other one is the toilet (frosted glass). - Bed. itÂ´s huge. itÂ´s comfortabel. itÂ´s right in front of the window, which is as big as the bed and high as the room. - moods and themes. you can chosse the colour of the lights inside the room...moods or themes... by simply clicking on the touch screen remote control. pretty cool. lights change from blue to red to green...just anything you like. - Furniture. If you are into designer furniture... take this hotel.... whatever you wanna see, they got it... eams, jacobsen, le corbusier... they are all there and this is not like putting all this stuff together and make it look expensive... someone really thought about it and it just looks exactly the way it has to be. great. So...check it out.... this place rocks... ah... forgot something: Location.... pretty close to the RAI and the WTC and to the next train station, makes this hotel even a great place for Tourist and not only for business travellers... parking... enough parking space all around the hotel... Amsterdam offers a day parking ticket for 16â‚¬ which is alright... you can try to park at the RAI for free (if there is no exhibition going on) and take the Tram to get to the Hotel, but you have to be a lil bit smart when leaving the parking garage again... anyhow, guess you can make it...

Reviews.Title: “An excellent place to rest my head”
Reviews.Author: MarkReynolds
Reviews.Content: I stayed here by accident rather than design, but I'm very glad that I did. After flying into Amsterdam late one weekday evening, I found myself locked out of my accommodations by an overzealous painter. Needing somewhere to stay, and having heard about citizenM previously, I was impressed by managing to get a room for that night for under one hundred euro. Check-in was painless and self service, and a nice feature was that the system offered me a number of rooms to choose from. A "pod" concept had left me worried I'd be staying in a glorified broom-cupboard in a dingy youth hostel, but I was pleasantly surprised. Common areas were finished to a high standard and were clean, nicely designed and well kept. The room itself was of a good size: hanging area and safe inside the entrance, leading to a wet area with monsoon rainforest shower and lavatory in glass tubes with sliding doors (lavatory glass frosted), a large sink (shower and sink with complimentary toiletries), mirror with plugs, storage space and good lights, and a curtain that could be pulled over to separate washing areas from sleeping areas. The bed was absolutely huge and reached to the window, with a television on the wall over it. The entire pod was controlled from a single touch pad remote - mood lighting (including several pre-selected moods which controlled lights and background music), television, temperature and blinds. A wide range of television stations, on-demand and rolling films were also available for free. Peckish, I visited the ground floor bar and canteen. A range of sushi, snacks and salads were available for purchase - sterile and pre-packaged but, given the time of day, they served to fill a hungry stomach. The bed was exceptionally comfortable, and the shower brisk and refreshing. A nice touch in the morning was the choice of two shower-gels - one for the morning person and one for the more late-night among us. Check-out in the morning was equally painless and self-powered, and a nice touch was that the system emailed me my invoice to save on paper. In terms of location, it's something of an exaggeration to call this "Amsterdam city" - it's in the WTC business district and a 20 - 25 minute tram ride into the city centre. However, it's a nice neighbourhood and close to the Zuid/WTC train station with good connections to the airport and onward destinations as well as a range of bus and metro options. An excellent place to rest my head, I enjoyed my stay. I wouldn't necessarily recommend it to anyone in need of large amounts of wardrobe or stowage space, and the fact that the lavatory is in the room (albeit in its own frosted glass compartment) might put some off - for a brief stay, it was more than adequate for what I needed - comfortable, well designed, well serviced, but not overstuffed with unnecessary hotel services I wouldn't use or want to pay for. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A fun hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pim_RTD
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here for one night, but it was a very pleasant experience. The thing I like best is the lobby which is filled with great design furniture by Vitra. The lobby doubles as a great espresso bar and a iMac internet access point. The rooms are pleasant as well, having a very large bed, a big TV and nice, moody lightning. The cylinders with the shower and the toilet are cleverly made. Overall I think this really is a great concept.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth coming back!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kyralicious
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely experience at the citizen M. The interior decoration was absolutely gorgeous, very modern. The staff was very polite and friendly and the food was also very delicious, a little expensive, but what can you expect in a hotel like this. The room was very small but just stunning: the domotica was amazing, everything's remote controlled. The bed was exactly what we hoped it would be: BIG. And with the trams you are in the centre in about 5 to 10 minutes. Overall we loved our stay in the citizen M Amsterdam and the city was also wonderful of course.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: dcaeiro
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, clean and good design. Excelent vaue for money.

Reviews.Title: “This is a fun hotel, great for young couples”
Reviews.Author: BrickBikkit
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay online for â‚¬71 per night for three nights and had great fun, We loved the CitizenM concept, particularly the room remote, the themed wake-up alarms (the countryside theme was mellow), and free on-demand movies. I can't comment on the catering as we didnt try the food, preferring to go into town for a pancake! The bed is HUGE and comfy. If you are planning a romantic break, his hotel is a good choice. Transport tip - tram line 5 leaves every 10 mins(direction - 'centraal' to go into town, and 'A'veen Binnenhof' to get back to the hotel - the stop is called Princes Irenestraat) is outside the hotel. If you are coming by train from Schiphol Airport get off at $the Amsterdam Zuid station - the first stop, and take the tram - direction towards Centraal, its only one stop on but easier than walking with your case).

Reviews.Title: “Something Different”
Reviews.Author: purplecat1982
Reviews.Content: We really loved this hotel. The concept is excellent, and some of the small touches and attention to detail really made the hotel almost one of the highlights of our trip. Granted, there are a few downsides, but overall they were not that bad (given the length of our stay - 3 nights). The design elements of the hotel are great, the big bed was obviously really nice, as well as the gadgets in the bedroom (lights etc) all being centrally controlled. If i had to complain the only thing would be that the blinds were a bit tempremental, and the roller screen was very loud when operated. The communal areas of the hotel were really great though, usually one can feel uncomfortable hanging around in public areas in a hotel, but here we actually wanted to spend time in them. There is TV to watch and numerous books to flick though. The free internet downstairs was great too, although we didn't need it because of the free wireless in the room . The food available 24 hours a day wasn't that exciting, pretty standard sandwitch bar stuff, but the breakfasts were ok... if a little expensive, but the fact that it was available at 1am after a late arrival made up for it. In the rooms the lack of cupboard space was the only real downside, however only being there for 3 nights and on leisure it didn't really matter. We loved the unique touches, own brand toileteries, malik the party citizen on our bed, and the self service check in/out. Overall we really enjoyed staying here, it was something different from a standard hotel and we'll definitely be looking out for hotels that add something extra to a trip in the way that this one did.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive for the minimum service”
Reviews.Author: Viktor9090
Reviews.Content: Fun rooms (the width of a double bed), but not for more than one night. The high-tech room is fun, again for one night. I paid over 100.00 euro and find that overcharged for the minimum service that is being offered. It feels like staying in a high-tech youth hotel. But when you pay over 100.00 per night there are better options. Especially the restaurant is a huge bummer. All is pre-packed, you take what you want in the freezer, heath it up yourself if you want to, pay and sit on a bar stool that 's available. The food is too expensive for the quality that's being offered. And almost 5.00 euro for a coffee, that's just too much. No spaces what so ever where you can relax. All is located in the hall where the 'ambiance' is that of an expensive youth hostel. If I would have paid less than 80.00 euro, I could recommend this hotel. But it's just too expensive. Oh yes, no parking spots, so I paid over 20.00 euro for a parking spot right across the hotel. And since I had to buy a "chip-card" to do so, I had to pay it cash, it can't be put on the room. That adds up to the total of the hotel room. With the food (average sushi and coffee) and parking, I paid over 150.00 euro. And that's unacceptable for the high-tech youth hostel feel they offer.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money; innovative rooms; everything a city break hotel should have”
Reviews.Author: arvkan
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel with fantastically conceptualized rooms - air conditioned working perfectly well and easy to change, large windows, the best, largest and most comfortable bed that you can imagine, friendly staff who speak all languages possible - the guy serving me switched fluently from talking to me in english, to french, back to dutch and then german! my partner who is rather picky about hotel rooms could not find anything wrong :) its not in the city center - you just need to be aware of that but the location is extremely well connected by trams, metro, main trains and buses - what more could you want. oh btw, excellent coffee too...

Reviews.Title: “Style over substance, funky over functional”
Reviews.Author: MartandCathy
Reviews.Content: Some of this hotel's basic features are good. My room had a great large comfortable bed, the tv is good, the place is spotlessly clean, the staff are friendly and the hotel is cheap at â‚¬85 excluding breakfast. However there are also a number of things about this hotel that irritated me hugely so I will not be returning. The concept is sort of fun but once you get beneath the surface the fun turns into a very poor experience. I arrived late, about 10pm. I am tired so the last thing I want to do is faff around familiarising myself with a self-service check in, even when there is someone there to help. And especially when there are no queues anyway. If I want that personal touch, and make special requests - a certain kind of room, alarm call, then I have to speak to someone anyway. In the lift there is a notice about how the experience will lift your spirits. Once I am in the room the first thing I want to do is have a shower. I am looking forward to my rainshower. However the rainshower just spits little strands of water and is not true to the hotel's claim that it is like standing in warm summer rain. So I use the handheld shower instead. Once showered I have to go downstairs again to exchange a broken trouser hanger for a new one, and once I have done my ironing I go back to my room and prepare for bed. The bed is wonderful and big, very comfortable, and the tv is good. There is a lot of technology in the room, the operation of which is far from obvious, and again, when you arrive and it's late and you're tired, this is the last thing you need. Turning off the lights is no easy task because once the main lights are out the coloured lights around the shower and loo are still on, and finally (even more tired by this point) I work out that you have to press the dimmer again to turn all lights out. When I try to lower the electronically operated blackout curtain using the switch (why not have a manually operated one) I find it doesn't work. so I have to call down to reception who send someone (a nice friendly guy) to show me how to do it via the special technology console - which also operates everything else in the room - the tv, lights, wifi etc. Ok so I am ready for bed now. I place the console back in its charger and hit the sack. But a light on the console is still flashing so I have to place it in the big drawer in the bed for the night. The "pre-made rooms", as it describes them, have a problem. During the night I was woken by creaking, loud and frequent enough to create a disturbance. It sounded like the walls and kept me awake for the rest of the night. Breakfast. I prepaid for breakfast, saving me â‚¬2.55 over the standard price of â‚¬12.50. But: not great value. There is buffet, just some pre-selected items - yoghurt with granola, small juice, pre-packed waffles, croissant, a cheap apple, and even though I am seated at the bar it is served to me in a bag rather than on a plate. And get this: whoever heard of a breakfast package where you have to pay extra for the coffee? Excellent (large) coffee, but a whopping â‚¬4.75 for the privilege. If they have to charge, then half that price would have been fair in a hotel that claims to offer good value. There is also a 24-hour cafeteria with pre-packed items for purchase, but the pre-packed fruit, sandwiches etc had condensation inside the packaging - not a good sign. Some sandwiches had so much condensation I couldn't see what was inside. A couple more things about the room. There is space to store your suitcases - in the bed - but there is almost no space to store clothes, and I always like to hang my clothes up. A tiny hanging rail with three hangers - not much use if you are staying for a few days or if there are two of you. There is no space to rest a laptop unless you don't mind working on the bed. There are some wonderful big Macs downstairs, which you can use free of charge, great, but there are too few of them for the size of hotel. In some ways - location, cleanliness and comfortable bed - this hotel is great for the price. But it is let down by some poor detail. The construction is poor to the point of being ridiculous, the technology is too complicated and unreliable - to the point of being ridiculous - and the provision of food/drink is unimaginative and unprofessional. Maybe fun as a new holiday experience, but it doesn't work for the business traveller.

Reviews.Title: “A good design hotel for a reasonbale money in a good location”
Reviews.Author: navytr
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in August 2009. We really like the modern design and fancy lights of the rooms. The master control of Philip controlled everything from the colors of the lights to the TV set. But it sometimes needed ages to connect to the room. The wall to wall bed was big and very comfy for two adults. But the design of the rooms does not allow any additional bed. This is not a hotel for traveling with kids or for big families.. The lack of storage space was a little problem for heavy travelers like us. Although there are no windows that can be opened, the room got always dusty The hotel is not located in the central part of the city but we never had any problems to travel to and from it any time of the day. It takes about 20 minutes to the main train station on Tram 5. The lobby was nicely decorated and enjoyable place to spent time. You can get a decent breakfast for a reasonable amount of money.

Reviews.Title: “Some glitches need to be worked out.”
Reviews.Author: ronkfel
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location near the train station (Amsterdam Zuid) making it easy 10 min. trip from the airport. After viewing information online, we were ready to really enjoy our stay at CitizenM Amsterdam City. We liked the attitude, the concept (affordable luxury) and the whimsical approach to their marketing. Indeed, the youthful staff was attentive, friendly and dealt courteously and efficiently when issues arose - and they did arise. The lobby is wonderfully designed and has plenty of area to sit and use the IMac computers, read and watch television. We enjoyed the 24 hour food area and coffee/liquor bar. There was a nice variety of prepared food items available for snacks and light meals. The whimsy of the marketing extended to the amenities and decor with several rather interesting and provocative art and photography books available around the lobby area. (The hotel poster near the elevator is hilarious and a bit shocking). The small and rather narrow room reminded us of a cruise ship cabin and would be fine for a short stay (i.e., 3 days or so). For a week we found the lack of storage space and room to hang clothes rather limiting. The nice sized bed is very comfortable. The major issue was the plumbing. On the first morning we noticed a odor emanating from the shower drain. It was the smell of sewage. We called down to the front desk and staff arrived promptly and changed our room. Things seemed to be fine until day 3 when the water in the shower failed to drain. Due to the showerâ€™s modern design (flush with the floor) it was impossible to notice that water was seeping out and flooding the room floor. Again, the staff was summoned and the shower drain was dealt with and the 1/2 inch of water on the floor of the room had to be mopped up and our things dried off. We took â€œnavy showersâ€� (turn off water while soaping up and turn it on just to rinse) for the rest of the stay. The Philips master control that managed the lighting, TV, music and window shades was a fascinating novelty for about an hour. After that it became an annoyance. It constantly had to search for the signal to connect to the room and was a bit of a bother. We had a stubborn motor driven (loud) window shade that we would lower using the wall switch and it would immediately roll itself back up. Finally got it to stay down using a combination of the wall switch and the Philips electronic unit. The hotel is rather new, having been only open several months, and it appears they have some kinks to work out. They may wish to have some conversations with the plumbing contractor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel just outside the hart of the city”
Reviews.Author: pinkpanterVA
Reviews.Content: The Citizen M hotel is modern and has a relaxed atmosphere. The design rooms are a real experience. You can choose the colors of the light and the mood of the room. The staff is very helpfull and friendly. Checking in and out trough the computers is rapid and easily and there are always enough staff members to help if you have any questions. The room was very clean and the best of all was the excellent bed. The best bed I have ever slept on in a hotel ( and I have tried many). A great place to stay just outside the hart of the city in the business area of Amsterdam. You can reach it very easily and quick by public transport. The hotel only does not have it's owne carparking, you need to park your car in the public area what is expencieve. I recommened to park your car in a P+R near by.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful design hotel”
Reviews.Author: rakeli
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights in this hotel in vacation with my boyfriend. The hotel is a bit far from the center of the city, but there's a Tram just in front of the hotel that takes you to the center in 15 minutes. We liked the location because it was very quiet and calm place. The first day didn't start very well, the rooms were great and we loved the design, big bed, everything, but at night we started to get very cold and discovered that the air conditioning couldn't be turned off. The first time we complain to the staff, they said the air would turn off at night, so we waited, but it didn't happen, next time we complain to other member of the staff that went to the room, but did nothing to help too. Finally the third person we talked to - Miguel - the salvation of the night, finally discover the air conditioning was broke, and let us go to another room that was much better. Then the rest of the nights went very good. Although we would prefer on/off system for the air. We loved the iMacs with free internet and all the designer chairs and design books! The breakfast was simple but very good (see my photos) and you could eat it at any hour. Overall we liked the original and modern concept of this hotel, and the staff was nice in general, a special thanks to Miguel, that was so kind and helpful and really patient with our requests! Next time we must try your cocktails!

Reviews.Title: “21st century city chic”
Reviews.Author: DeMannie
Reviews.Content: Having been a year ago to the Citizen M at Schiphol Airport I decided to try this new one in the center as well, this time together with my wife. Have to say the concept is still truly amazing, and the beds are great for a fun night ... know what I mean, nudge nudge. Location is perfect, we went shopping in Beethovenstraat on foot and took the tramway to Bijenkorf, all within a hundred meters from the hotel. Great staff with lots of attention to detail. Will come again !

Reviews.Title: “Concept wins over practicalities”
Reviews.Author: CraighallMK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a triumph of concept over design and practicality. There are many good things about the hotel - most importantly it was very clean. Also, the bed was comfortable, there is food and drink on sale in the lobby all day and night, the staff were friendly, check in and out is automated (self-service) and there is a good work area in the Lobby with free internet access. However the rooms are small and lack some traditional basics such as wardrobe, drawers and desks. There is no space to unpack. If you are there on business you will need to work in the lobby - this is pleasant enough, but I would prefer to work in the privacy of my rooms. None of these issues are that difficult to cope with and you can find a way of adapting to manage around them. The biggest issue is the lack of a bathroom. The bedroom contains a shower cubicle that is clear glass - there is a curtain to stop anyone in bed seeing you, but is is fairly transparent and so if you are sharing the room you better not mind being looked at by them! Also, the toilet is in a similar cubicle but with frosted glass - again not quite opaque enough as you can still see what is going on in there. The hotel is very stylised ('Citizen M says Welcome home' as you use your key!) and will not appeal to everyone. I am suprised how many 4 and 5 star reviews have been written. I am afraid that the lack of traditional facilities (drawers, wardrobe, desk) along with the lack of a distinct bathroom would stop me recommending this to anyone. If you want to stay there, then please look at the photographs on the web - they are really quite acurate. You can decide if this is the hotel for you based on that.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here for four nights. Very nice time...”
Reviews.Author: glenncolrodosprings
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly loved this hotel. Everything about it. And for those who stay at hotels a great deal, you have NEVER stayed at a hotel like this one. Very cool, hip, clean and comfortable. And I found the staff very helpful. And the fact that they have food right there 24/7 is nice when you get back late at night are hungry. Tram stops right out front, taking you to anywhere. I loved it and would certainly stay again, and will encourage all my friends to.

Reviews.Title: “Unique and exactly what I want”
Reviews.Author: JWJWJWJW
Reviews.Content: CitizenM is totally the kind of hotel i want. I've been there the first time beginning of 2009. And after that I didn't boook any other hotel in Amsterdam. The self-service concept is what I want. THe rooms are super. Although I would like to have a table to make better use of the WiFi on my laptop it isn't a big issue as there are plenty of tables downstairs. Best value for money I've had since years!

Reviews.Title: “Please Stay there”
Reviews.Author: RMachado
Reviews.Content: Is not really on the center, but the transportations is very good you don't have any problem with that. The room are very nice, modern and functional and the staff is also very nice. I truly recommend this hotel, please stay there. RMachado

Reviews.Title: “Unique experience in a quiet environment”
Reviews.Author: b89cao
Reviews.Content: Interesting, innovating and unique concept, super friendly staff, quiet and very nice location. The biggest and most comfortable bed weâ€™ve ever had in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, well-priced hotel option on the edge of the city”
Reviews.Author: Ralome
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently stayed at the citizenM hotel in Amsterdam City for three nights. The location of the hotel is on a quiet street away from the city centre but is easily accessible via the number 5 tram, and shops and restaurants are a 5-10 minute walk away up Beethovenstraat. The hotel lobby includes a 24 hour canteen (although the food is quite expensive) and there are lots of seating areas in the lobby designed by Vitra, which includes some design classics. The hotel room was small but the bed was very comfortable and we enjoyed using the mood pad to control the lights, blinds, television etc. The toilet and shower are in pods and so do not offer much privacy! The hotel staff were friendly and helpful during our stay. Overall we enjoyed our stay here and would recommend it to those who don't mind, or prefer to be away from the central areas. There is also a very good restaurant, Restaurant As, which is a 5 minute walk from the hotel towards Beatrix Park.

Reviews.Title: “Had to try it based on the hype but wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: HerrDrProfessor
Reviews.Content: I'm into experimental architecture and citizenM sounded really interesting, mainly from reviews I read here. I decided to try it, if only because I knew I'd regret not doing so. I stayed for four nights. The lobby is beautiful and the simple 24 hour cafe is a huge plus for a business traveler. The lobby staff varied enormously in quality. One provided incorrect recommendations, e.g., wrong names, addresses, opening times for restaurants, etc. If this were a "serious" business hotel, I would have contacted management, but it feels more like an upscale youth hostel run by college-aged students. Some of the staff were very helpful, so it's fairly random. These are most certainly not, however, graduates of Cornell's Hotel Management Program. The room was the real problem. The neat looking tube shower leaked all over the floor. I regularly had 1/4" of water on the floor when I was done with fairly quick showers. (I even turned off the water when I was soaping up.) I immediately let management know; they promised to fix it but never did. Try getting dressed on a floor filled with water. Not fun. The remote control that runs the room barely worked. It constantly displayed "Connecting to room..." and could take up to 20 seconds to do so. When I asked them to fix this, they were immediately familiar with the problem and even finished my sentence for me describing the problem. But again, they never fixed it and I had trouble doing basic things like turning off the lights to go to sleep. And the remote's very bright blue LEDs flashed all night long as it was apparently constantly reconnecting to the room. That was beyond annoying. Also, the physical light switch to turn off the lights simply dimmed them. You must use the remove to get actual darkness. Very poorly designed. And while they claim the room's are "sound proof," that is with respect to the outside. You will literally here every person and conversation passing outside your room, all night long. I've never stayed in a hotel with such poor internal acoustic isolation. Finally, the air conditioning, which works fine during the day, apparently turns off at night. My room was incredibly uncomfortable with zero airflow whatsoever. And of course the windows don't open. In short, it's a cool design but even given how new this hotel is, the infrastructure seems to be falling apart already. (This phenomenon is quite common in experimental buildings.) I will say the bed was extremely comfortable. (I don't understand some of the complains here about that.) And the free wifi was slow but very welcome. I would certainly not recommend this hotel and would never stay here again. I suspect some future generation of these boutique mini-room hotels will be ready for prime time but citizenM is absolutely not. No doubt, the management will post some deep felt apology here, as they do with all negative reviews. I suggest they spend the effort fixing the flaws in the rooms, rather than arguing why their hotel is so wonderful. The fact of the matter is it is lacking in the most basic of ways. There are less expensive, far more comfortable alternatives available in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: terryth0mas
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel, easy to find and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The bed was very comfortable and the room was spotless. shower was fantastic and enjoyed the mood lighting. What a good nights sleep, I will be looking at staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel with Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: ria2009
Reviews.Content: I brought my husband to Amsterdam for his birthday and decided that it would be interesting to stay at a hotel with such a modern concept. The hotel itself is amazing. The bed was the most comfortable I think I have slept in and the room was lovely. On the first night, I was in the unfortunate position of having my handbag stolen from the city centre, but the staff were fantastic, allowing me to use the phone to try to organise an advance from my credit card and also to contact anyone necessary. They organised a cab to take me to Western Union and even found out for me where the nearest one was. All of the staff are extremely friendly and courteous from the minute you arrive to the minute you leave. I would recommend everyone to stay there and would love to see more rolled out throughout Europe. In one word, I would describe the hotel as "superb" P.S Many thanks to all the staff who assisted us and kept us smiling.

Reviews.Title: “superior ideas for a leisure stay”
Reviews.Author: Zhu12
Reviews.Content: An awesome hotel, although not very close to the center, but very good transportation services around. Futuristic design, good for 1 or 2 people who came to A-dam to party and have fun. Awesome ideas for light and furniture. Although the room is small, there is room for everything. But you'll have to forget about privacy. It's really cool!

Reviews.Title: “Ãœber Cool!”
Reviews.Author: philipIRL
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel with the best staff you'll meet. The room was great, a little section for everything. Tram line just outside the door, brings you into the City in 15Mins.

Reviews.Title: “Super”
Reviews.Author: Gandhi21
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay, cool Hotel, superfriendly staff, comfortable bed. I would not stay there for more than 2 nights because there is no cupboard in the rooms. Good location, tramstation around the corner and the Number 5 takes you downtown in a few minutes.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful, fun, unusual experience unlike any other!”
Reviews.Author: allart
Reviews.Content: Lots of fun & unusual amenities/decor design. Really liked the lobby furnishings & signage. Easy transportation to city center and all attractions but a good place to get away from the hustle and bustle. 24-hr cafe for food and snacks. Real warmth, responsiveness, and friendliness from the staff. Remote control for everything in the room was fun particularly the lighting controls, the themes, & great music programming. Free internet & movies were appreciated after hotels where they charge you for every little thing. The shower stall leaked and caused a small flood in the whole room due to its unusual configuration. (Yes it is in the middle of the room but there is now a curtain that can give you privacy if you need it). It needs better seals & a solution to design flaws. Is probably a frequent problem that they're working on. Temperature controls in room don't work when they turn off the air at night which is probably not a problem at other times of the year.

Reviews.Title: “I AM CitizenM”
Reviews.Author: Vad1m
Reviews.Content: In a few words: style, sophistication, futurism, practicality, no BS. All things a contemporary, young, technology oriented, novelty embracing person needs, put together in a compact package. When my girlfriend and I were planning our trip to Europe we werenâ€™t sure how many days we would stay in Amsterdam. So I decided to make a reservation for 2 nights. I called the hotel to make sure we can pay in cash if we decide to prolong our stay and I was told that only credit card is accepted as a payment method. As a matter of fact, internet is the only way to make a reservation there. I opted for a flexible rate which is obviously higher but then a reservation can be canceled up until 18:00 on the day of the arrival. From Schiphol airport you take a train and get off at the first stop ( Amsterdam Zuid ). The hotel is within walking distance from the station ( 5 minutes walk). So, when you walk in you see a couple of stations with a touch screen display right in front of you. To check in, all you need to do is to enter your last name to identify yourself, swipe the credit card, pick up one of the card keys from the stack (or pick up two if you spouse needs one), wave the key in front of the card reader and once itâ€™s programmed you will be given your room number .Thatâ€™s it! There is always somebody from the hotel staff (ambassadors as they call themselves) behind the front desk. They are very friendly and will be happy to assist you. Thereâ€™s a canteen on the right â€“snacks, sandwiches, drinks, etc.(everything is seriously overpriced there) . A giant catalogue of David LaChapelleâ€™s photographs next to the elevators (which I regret I havenâ€™t had the time to flip through) :) The room: The room is cool. It is compact. As people who designed it though to themselves : â€œOk, how do we provide a maximum comfort and functionality in a minimal spaceâ€�. And they succeeded. There a toilet and a shower literally in the room. While the frosted glass of the toilet will give you some sense of privacy, when taking a shower you will be perfectly visible from every corner of the room. There is a semi-transparent curtain separating the bed from the rest of the room thought. A wall to wall king size bed. A relatively big LCD TV with free TV channels, movies, and adult films. A safe deposit box (which is wide enough to put a laptop in, but too shallow for my Canon 450D cameras). Air conditioning. Thereâ€™s a touch screen remote control ( mood pad as they call it ) which controls lighting , TV , AC and jalousie. It comes with a pre-programmed activity modes you can choose from. For instance when you want to go to sleep, you select Activities->Sleep and all the lights and TV are turned off. Note that thereâ€™s no smoking in the room and the window cannot be opened. Connectivity: Thereâ€™s a FREE WiFi in the hotel which is awesome. There is a couple of mac computers in the lobby ( all hooked up to the net) . The staff: The staff is really friendly. On one occasion I asked them for a screwdriver ( my laptop charger comes with a type P plug which they donâ€™t have a socket for, so I decided to remove the extra blade ) and they provided me with a toolbox full of screwdrivers :). On another occasion, when I made a second reservation to prolong our stay, I received two different confirmation numbers, and it turned out that somehow two reservations were made in their system, while I made just one. The problem was that I made a pre-paid reservation (which means that the credit card is charged on the spot and thereâ€™s no cancelation option). I explained the situation to the receptionist. They told me not to worry, that they will contact their head office to resolve the problem and get back to me. And indeed, when we came back at night, there was a little note from the front desk informing me that the extra reservation was canceled and my credit card was refunded. Additionally I received an email from their head office to confirm that the problem was resolved. Location: The hotel is NOT in the city centre. It is in the business district of Amsterdam ( WTC can be seen from the window ). All public transportation is within walking distance ( tram, metro, train ) . To get to the city centre you take tram #5. Itâ€™ll take around 10 minutes to get to Dam Square. To get to Schiphol airport you take a train. 5 minutes and you are there. The hotel is located in a very quiet place, so if you donâ€™t care for a 10 minute tram ride to the city centre, it will be perfect for you. Thereâ€™s a small supermarket nearby the train station which comes in handy. CONCLUSIONS : PROS: 1. King size 2x2 bed â€“ Very comfortable ! 2. Rain shower. 3. Big LCD TV with free movies ( including porno ) 4. Safe deposit box is big enough for a laptop. 5. Free WiFi. 6. Computers in the lobby 7. Close to public transportation. 8. 5 minutes away from the airport. 9. Very quiet environment. CONS: 1. Not located in the city centre. 2. Small rooms. 3. No smoking in the room. 4. Windows cannot be opened. 5. No bar or restaurant. 6. Stuff in the canteen is ridiculously overpriced. So, if you will enjoy the stay in this hotel, as much as I did, you can say to yourself: â€œI AM CitizenMâ€�

Reviews.Title: “cool, well designed, confortable”
Reviews.Author: JoJoJoWarsaw
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel. Lovely design (vitra). Free international calls!!!!!! Free WIFI, free films on demand. Superb bed (extra large). Don't stay in one room with somebody you are shy of - cos you are visible when you take a shower and use a toilet ; ) Strange: you pay for hotel in advance. Very expensive: food in hotel cantin.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: stonem
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic place! Room was great, decor in hotel was wonderfully different. We were a bit concerned that it seemed to be a long way from city centre, but this proved an advantage. Train from Schiphol to Amsterdam Suid station was easier than to Central station, and going home was easier as we left our bags in the (free) left luggage at hotel, explored some more Amsterdam, and picked them up on the way to Suid (2 mins walk). The walk to Amsterdam centre isn't long (follow number 5 tram tracks, 20-30 mins) and takes you past lots of good shopping areas that you probably wouldn't find if staying in the centre. We found a fantastic cafe close to the hotel called Fidelio's (try their Soto Iyam soup!). The staff were friendly and helpful. Wouldn't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “An experience filled with fabulousness!!! We did not want to leave.”
Reviews.Author: Melba1234
Reviews.Content: For the price it is so hard to believe it would be this impressive but its true! The only problem I see with this hotel is there are not more CitizenM hotels already! We both enjoyed the stay so much it would influence where to go on our next city break!!! On arrival the computerized check in is so quick and easy...The lobby area is as fabulous as it looks in the pictures and the rooms are fab very clean and comfy. Itâ€™s a Gadget boys dream, the mood pad lighting is fun and funky. Itâ€™s hard to say what the best parts of the hotel are but the bed is certainly up there - 2x2 meters and the comfiest pillows and quilts. Next is the shower, its in a pod and has two settings rain and normal both of which are equally sumptuous!! On the hotel spec it specifies free movies and Wifi.... all really good. You can even use the Apple Mac's and printer in the foyer for online check in. Me and my boyfriend actually chose to walk to the centre all the time...we really enjoyed this as Amsterdam is lovely (and you can also pass through a mile long market :) I know this wouldnâ€™t be for everyone but tram 5 stops near by and they seem extremely frequent and take you right to the centre. The area it is in is next to the World Trade Centre and residential, very well presented and safe. The design is fabulous, there are so many quirky thoughtful touches you are constantly noticing things. This paired with the fact its so comfy makes for a truly excellent place to stay - treat yourself! You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price and modern design hotel!”
Reviews.Author: maryyena
Reviews.Content: The hotel location can at first be a put off as it is outside the city, however this was a great advantage for us as we came by car and could park at a close by parking (only 6 euro overnight and they give you in exchange tickets for public transport or bikes to use). The hotel was great, we were there only for one night but loved it and would seriously consider going back! The staff was very friendly and helpful as to where to go in Amsterdam and resolving the small problems we had with the room. The room in itself is very functional and a little on the small side but the design and use of the moodpad control make up for it! We had a lot of fun using it in our room. There are no hidden extras for costs and it is exactly as it is said on the website. I can understand that for some there can be an issue for the toilet/shower being so open, but there is a curtain by the bed to give a little privacy and it is easy to have music on. Also, you know this when you book online as it is easy to check out the pics. We cannot wait for this hotel to open in other citys (esp. in Spain!!) so we can go and stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: koteee
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect(only 5-10min from Airport - Schiphol to Amsterdam Zuid Station and only 5min walk from railway station to hotel ). Friendly and helpful staff. Quiet area. Nice, modern and clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Don't lose the console!”
Reviews.Author: Plushgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in early June at this new concept hotel. We managed to get a nice discount price (80 euros/night) from the hotel's own website. Location: Not central, but with good transportation (metro, train and TRAM number 5). From the airport it takes about 15 minutes, plus 5 min. walking. Leave the station heading north (Burger King's side) and pass under the TRAM line. You'll see a small garden with a a bicycle trail on the right. Follow along and then turn right at the first cross. The hotel is located at the end of the street (quiet residencial area). Check-in / Rooms: After you self-check-in (with help available if you need) you'll find a confortable room with some gadgets. Everything is controlled by a small console: lights, blinds, TV, temperature, alarm clock... Very comfy, big bed. Nice shower with see-through panels. Though there's a curtain if you want more privacy. The toilet is surrounded by opaque glass. The shower has a rain forest-type effect, the water pressure varying throughout the day. The TV has games, music and some movie (adult movies included) channels. Bar: Open 24h. The prices are ok, according to Amsterdam's standards (example: Earl Grey tea- 1.95 euros) Internet: A few Macintosh computers in the lobby or you can take advantage of the free wifi (some rooms have difficulty in acquiring signal- in this case, go to a public area, let your laptop acquire the signal and then go back to your room).

Reviews.Title: “A Bad joke”
Reviews.Author: nickaraxnos
Reviews.Content: Although we were very excited finding this hotel we had too many problems in our 6 nights staying there. From where to begin? 1) First entry in the room and the cover of the blanket had stains. I saw o maid outside the room and she told she would change it. 4 hours later nothing happened so i had to go to the reception desk for complains 2) For six nights we hadn't had our sheets changed not even once! 3) Every day they were giving us two body-towels but only one head-towel!!! 4) There is no sound isolation in the toilet but the worst is that you can be seen from someone outside the cabinet. Same thing in the shower 5) Last day and we package our things when we realize that a pair of sleepers and a t-shirt (bought from Amsterdam) were missing although the rest of our staff were inside the bug. So it is unlikely to lost them somewhere outside For all of that (i made complains in the reception desk just before the check out) we only had an e-mail from the assistant(!) manager for apologies with the remark that next time we go they will have something good for us!!!!!! There is not going to be another time folks. In Amsterdam sertenly but not in thih hotel A bad joke that wat it was our staying there

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at great rates”
Reviews.Author: WatchHunter
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not for everyone. It is located outside the main Amsterdam areas, but with the rail station within walking distance and the tram stop just up the street, it was convenient enough for my stay. The rooms are small but I think very functional. It takes time to get used to the shower and toilet being in the room. Bed was comfortable and perfect for one person. I can't really see the room being great for a couple, as I do like a bit more privacy and room when traveling with my spouse. Some of the friendliest staff and their snack bar was great. There is no gym or pool. There is a nearby fitness club by the RAI station but didn't bother to check it out. The only thing that was strange was getting an iron and board to iron my shirt for meeting. I had to use a common one that was located in the back where the kitchen and staff were working. Kinda strange in that sense.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: HDs_mini_adventure
Reviews.Content: Staying here was a unique experience, with very friendly and helpful staff and clean, modern rooms. The bed and pillows were wonderful and it was impossible not to have a lie in. The canteen had lovely fresh food and no more expensive than other options in the city. The location was perfect, only a short (maybe 10min) tram ride to the central railway station, passing many of the tourist areas on route, such as Vondelpark, the museum district and Leidseplein entertainment area. The tram stop is pretty much outside the hotel (tram number 5). Lovely quiet area for the hotel as well. We would not stay anywhere else if we visit Amsterdam again. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: EcoleHolte
Reviews.Content: Fantastic atmosphere. Fantastic staff, fantastic room. Very refreshing Hotel concept.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience!”
Reviews.Author: hercoolgr
Reviews.Content: An excellent choice! Not far from the airport, just a few steps walk from the metro, Zuid Station and Tram and Bus stops, easy to reach, easy to travel to city center. Faboulous (although small) rooms, a perfect concept, absolutely great design . Easy to check in and out. Once in a lifetime experience! Excellent choice for young travelers (although I'm already 40!)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic concept, I loved it”
Reviews.Author: nuanced
Reviews.Content: Design of the hotel was brilliant, loved everything about the room esp. the huge bed and pillows. Rainfall shower was great, and I didn't have trouble preheating the water (as someone else posted on this page)-- simply let it heat whilst on the handset dial, then when warm enough, switch to rainfall mode and voila! Liked the wide range of tv channels and free movies on demand. My boyfriend was ill and couldn't go out sightseeing but at least the comfy bed and great tv made up for it a little. Also, the internet connection was fast and reliable. There are, however, a couple of drawbacks. It can be awkward if you're sharing the room with someone other than a partner or close friend, because the bed is shared and the shower curtain leaves little to the imagination! Also, canteenM is DREADFULLY overpriced-- one can find the same thing in central london for less. It's not a huge issue though, because it's easy to avoid having to eat there. I wasn't so lucky as I had to keep buying food for my ill boyfriend from canteenM and it burned a rather large hole in the pocket.

Reviews.Title: “Great couple hotel”
Reviews.Author: alfiec
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have said, the rooms are small but the bed is amazing and the gadgets and mod cons great fun. One warning, you do have a toilet and shower very much IN your small room, so you need to be comfortable with using both with the other person in the room! But a lovely hotel, great staff, free internet... All good.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely convenient”
Reviews.Author: UltimateRoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to the Schiphol departure hall, ideal for those who have an early flight. Affordable and hassle free this hotel meets the expectations of a business traveler. Checking in and out involves no staff. Free wifi and no surcharge for movies. Good facilities for work and for meetings. For example, there are free pc's in the lobby. I also noticed that the rooms are clean and quiet. Value for money too.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to see the future of hotel accommodation, this is it...”
Reviews.Content: This is not a hotel for hanging out; but then Amsterdam is a city worth seeing. So come to Citizen M for the great bed, shower and cafe/reception and high quality fittings throughout. Then instead of hanging around the hotel, go out an explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “More funny than practical. Nice location. Rude Maid.”
Reviews.Author: Karxala_Portugal
Reviews.Content: CitizeM is in a nice urban location within 15 minutes from the centre by tram (stop just in front of Hotel), 5 minutes walk to RAI Conference Centre and 1 minute from the World Trade Centre. Rooms are small but very modern and trendy with a huge bed. A remote will control lights, curtains, wake up call, etc which is funny for the gadget lovers (not very practical though). You also got free Wi-fi and mac computers in the lobby. Only bad experience: Maid was very rude. At 8am she will knock very hardly in your door and literally try to break into your room. Even if you hang your "do not disturb" sign in the door you'll still be frightened by the knocking signs down the corridor. And don't even try to talk to her... She's having a bad day (everyday).

Reviews.Title: “Big Complain! To Good!!”
Reviews.Author: JoJaDhara
Reviews.Content: Big complain this is a hotel to good. Great staff, Great concept! As a person part in developing Virtual Worlds this hotel was the best to stay in with our futuristic minds. It is also fun to see how people send reviews and adopt the future. I called them up to say I miss them ( and had a serious question to) but I do miss them. This hotel really is great to be reached from airport and a wonderfull trip to the city. I wish CitizenM with this concept!!

HotelInfo.Name: citizenM Amsterdam City
HotelInfo.Address: Prinses Irenestraat 30, Amsterdam 1077WX, The Netherlands
